668972966.name: Fascinating but not well organized
668972966.author: a TripAdvisor user
668972966.reviewBody: Just went with my family from other contry who came to visit, we read about facilities for elderly and young children, but end up waiting for 3 hrs under the sun for the one and only "teleferico" to take us up. You can get there walking but it\'s mostly a hiking situation and with the sun at 34 degrees no joke. \nInside we got good explanation on all the items and great experience just that the group was way too big for the tour guide to handle.\nPlace is great just not prepared for big crowds!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

667736963.name: Beautiful adventure
667736963.author: a TripAdvisor user
667736963.reviewBody: Definitely a must see and the photos don\'t do this place justice. There is a lot of up and down stairs throughout this cave, so not recommended if stairs are not your forte. Entrance fee including cable car up the mountain was 50 pesos each, sounder 5$... OR you can walk up the mountain and pay less for entrance, but i dont know why you\u2019re want to walk up the mountain :)  Probably not the best place for children under 10 years of age as there is a lot of walking, up and down stairs, and in some areas the lighting isnt the best and everyone in the group needs to be paying attention for eveyones\u2019 safety.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

648425437.name: A must see!
648425437.author: a TripAdvisor user
648425437.reviewBody: First above all else, bring comfy walking shoes. My husband and I were in complete awe of this place. The in\u2019s and outs of this place were stunning. And then the view outside,Unforgettable!

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

642545166.name: hiking inside a cave
642545166.author: a TripAdvisor user
642545166.reviewBody: Grutas de Garcia is that, a cave with lot of rock formations that let you feel conected with nature and the same time get a little excersise , its a great trip when you wanna get away from the noise of the city, bring your own lunch, water, insect repelent and considere some sunscreen

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

638961221.name: was mezmerizing, beautiful. you dont have to walk either they have horse carriages
638961221.author: a TripAdvisor user
638961221.reviewBody: The property was beautiful, they have kid horse rides, carraiage so you dont have  to walk. Food booth, also booth that you can shop.  you can bring your own ice chest and have a picnic if you like, it was a wonderful experience.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

633823618.name: Lots of family fun
633823618.author: a TripAdvisor user
633823618.reviewBody: Breathtaking views of natural cavern; the cable car ride to entrance is also full of nice views; the walk inside the cave is very entertaining with lots of areas that are amazing to see.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

626605043.name: This Place is Amazing
626605043.author: a TripAdvisor user
626605043.reviewBody: We took a weekend trip to Monterrey and had discovered this place before traveling. Rented a car from the airport and headed there right after landing. The tour guides are very knowledgeable and friendly. This view from atop the mountain is beautiful and the cable car experience is great even thought it\u2019s usually packed. The caves themselves are like nothing I\u2019ve ever seen. Mother Nature is amazing. This place is a must see if you ever find yourself in Monterrey, MX.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

624236032.name: Grutas de Garcia
624236032.author: a TripAdvisor user
624236032.reviewBody: We arrived at 9:30 am.  There was hardly anyone there.  It was the perfect time to arrive.  We were the first group to go upon the cable car.  Once we arrived to the top we were able to enjoy the beautiful view.  Then we went inside the mountain to the caves.  We had a tour guide who guided us through the entire walk. Beautiful walk through the caves.  I paid 7.45$ for one adult and one chil admission that included the cable car and the tour guide. Very well worth it.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

617715737.name: Good tour for kids
617715737.author: a TripAdvisor user
617715737.reviewBody: The caves are interesting but getting there is not easy , it\u2019s far , there is so much traffic to get out of the city in that area . The telef\u00e9rico does not always work , and honestly It\u2019s too much hassle to make the visit . The caves are fine but it\u2019s not like there are that many caves .

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

603600521.name: Interesting Formations
603600521.author: a TripAdvisor user
603600521.reviewBody: These caves are the perfect attraction if you love nature, long walks and mountains. Ideal for a family trip, not really far away from town (a bit less than an hour).

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

603433966.name: Great experience
603433966.author: a TripAdvisor user
603433966.reviewBody: Take the cable car or hike to get up there.  They are impressive and the tour is very well guided and explained

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

602476623.name: Cool off in these spectacular caves in a phenomenal mountain setting
602476623.author: a TripAdvisor user
602476623.reviewBody: The Grutas de Garcia are something visitors to the Monterrey area should make an effort to get out and visit.  Not only does the teleferico offer visitors stunning mountain vistas, but as soon as you enter the caves themselves, you\'re in for an unbelievable treat.  Incredibly colour displays as stalactites meet stalagmites to form columns, stalactites that  fuse to become like pleated skirts, plenty of geological formations that look like other things--the three-pronged finger, the camel, the head of the donkey and my favourite--el Gorila which actually does look an awful lot like Homer Simpson.  Incredible!!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

594738583.name: Caves with a christmas tree!
594738583.author: a TripAdvisor user
594738583.reviewBody:
Cable cart up the top, beautiful views. 

Caves; Caves are very interesting. Rock formations that are 'shaped' like things. An area with coloured changing lights. A rock formation with lights around it, to resemble a christmas tree....Interesting. Steps can be dangerous when wet. Live music outside.

At the bottom; Food around, not so good and small stalls.

Someone of the concepts, such as the 'lights show', is somewhat confusing/ feels unauthentic. Or, maybe someone was smoking a little too much wacky tobaccy when they discovered this.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

591031098.name: Grutas with a nice tour and short cable car ride
591031098.author: a TripAdvisor user
591031098.reviewBody: The grutas are not the biggest you\'ll ever see but they are still impressive. The tour guides give something really good information. Sometimes the lighting feels cheap and ruins the naturalness of the tour but overall it\'s a nice surprise close to the city. The cable car is not for the claustrophobic on a busy day. They like to pack it full but the ride is so short so it\'s ok.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

588484746.name: Something for everyone!
588484746.author: a TripAdvisor user
588484746.reviewBody: My 70 year old mother, my 2 Girls (age 4 and 5), and the wife and I went and we all did the steps with no issues. If you feel like you are running out of breath, you can slow down and let the tour guide go ahead and you take your time. We had an excellent time, it was nice to get out of the city for about three hours, The temperatures are usually 3 to 6\u00b0C cooler in the area than in Mty. The tour itself was really nice, a lot of history, and very friendly. \n\nThe drive there is about 20 minutes from Monterrey, the roads to the Grutas are very safe, lots of speed bumps on the main highway so drive slow! I met people from all over the world there so no need to worry about the dangers.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

586441062.name: Absolutely a must see when visiting Monterrey.
586441062.author: a TripAdvisor user
586441062.reviewBody: Pictures don\u2019t do this amazing place justice. You have to see it for yourself. This place is super spiritual and very education. Most of the museum is in both Spanish and English so it enjoyable for everyone. The caves are amazing to see...

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

583994630.name: Must See
583994630.author: a TripAdvisor user
583994630.reviewBody: The caves are spectacular. They are massive, they will really take your breath away. It doesnt look like much from the outside but it is totally worth it to take a tour.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

580518900.name: Great place
580518900.author: a TripAdvisor user
580518900.reviewBody:
If you are in town and you have a couple of spare hours you might consider to visit this places.

It is just 40 minutes away from downtown and it’s a pretty cool place to visit.

Something to take in consideration is that the grutas are close after 4pm  so you should go early in the morning.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

576656518.name: Awesome place
576656518.author: a TripAdvisor user
576656518.reviewBody: I really enjoyed visiting here the caves or Grutas are excellent it a very beautiful view at the top . You by cable car the guides are excellent . There are a lot of nice hand made goods to buy around there and home made food highly recommend it

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

574949406.name: Spectacular...!
574949406.author: a TripAdvisor user
574949406.reviewBody: Very interesting formation of caves. Indeed an awesome place. You are supposed to follow a guide but I took my time and let my group to get ahead in order to set my tripod and take some pictures. I was never bothered and never got told that I could not set my tripod which is a good thing. Highly recommended.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

566184363.name: Interesting presentation
566184363.author: a TripAdvisor user
566184363.reviewBody: These are really just stalactites, stalagmites and a lot of rock formations but they were able to make them interesting by setting up various showcase spots. Make sure you bring a good camera that can capture low light situations to get nice pictures.  I came in on a morning and on a weekday so the only other people there were a group of students. I did come in with my own tour guide as well so had no problems getting to the place and leaving, and I had him translate what the cave guide was saying.  Overall, the facility was very well maintained, clean (even the restrooms), did not smell  and was aptly lighted. If you have a half-day to spend and haven\'t been to any caves before or just love rock formations - then do visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

563040863.name: Worth the visit!
563040863.author: a TripAdvisor user
563040863.reviewBody:
The place opens at 9am, ride from our hotel near Galerías Monterrey took 53mins. I recommend you to rent a car or book a tour, because it’s hard to find an Uber there when coming back.

We arrived at 9:20 and took the first aerial tramway to the mountain at 10am (I suppose they wait to have enough people to fill each trip) there is also a walk path ($50 mxn without the tramway ride)

The ticket price is $80 mxn. It includes the tramway ride, the museum and a guided tour into the caves. The tour lasts aprox 45mins to 1hour and consists of ~600 steps (but it’s actually not hard) it’s also not cold inside the caves so you are good with shorts and tenis

At the entrance of the caves there is a small area to buy snacks or drinks but just the basic thinks (beer, popcorn, etc)

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

562023782.name: Call ahead to see if cable car is working
562023782.author: a TripAdvisor user
562023782.reviewBody: Took an hour Uber to get there only to find the cable car was broken. We paid 50 pesos to climb the path to the top. This is not a light trail and I don\u2019t recommend it if you are not used to hiking in the heat. The view was magnificent but unfortunately we didn\u2019t make it to the caves due to the difficulty of the trail. We could not get a signal to call Uber for pick up and the staff there refused to call us a cab. Thought we were going to be stuck but luckily after waiting an hour a Uber was dropping off someone else and we were able to get back to the city. This area is dangerous and travel on the roads outside the park should be avoided at night.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

559690625.name: Breath taking
559690625.author: a TripAdvisor user
559690625.reviewBody: A must in your visit to Monterrey, I\'ll be honest though, it\'s a one time trip. And while you\'re there, go to the Zoo. It\'s pretty neat and just next the Garcia entrance. Just a couple of minutes outside of Monterrey. Make sure to take the cable car up the mountain if you\'re not into hiking, or challenge yourself and walk almost an hour worth of walking until your reach the entrance of the cave. We were greeted by two older fellas singing and playing musics, there\'s snack and grab type of thing. Once inside you\'ll be guided trough an up and down stairs with an illustration. Pretty neat, but wouldn\'t go back again.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

555495363.name: Nice Place To Go and Walk
555495363.author: a TripAdvisor user
555495363.reviewBody:
It is a very nice location close to Monterrey, if you are up for a nice walk and some fresh air this is it.

The caves are amazing how ever is a long walk, 45 minutes to 60 minutes, ups and downs on stairs, If you are planing to go with toddlers just make sure that you are in a very good shape if you have to carry him.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

552618455.name: Incredible place
552618455.author: a TripAdvisor user
552618455.reviewBody: Excellent place to visit when in Monterrey. Not too far from the city. The caves are in the high part of a mountain, so you have to  take a cableway with amazing view to get to the entrance. Brace for a lot of stairs.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

551311957.name: Big interesting caves
551311957.author: a TripAdvisor user
551311957.reviewBody: At only a few minutes drive from Monterrey we visited this place. Caves were amazing! Stalactites and stalagmites all around with good lightning along the way.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

550155563.name: Awesome caves!
550155563.author: a TripAdvisor user
550155563.reviewBody: You can\'t miss these caves if you\'re nearby Monterrey - a must-see with incredible formations and beautiful views.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

548533204.name: Cave in mountain
548533204.author: a TripAdvisor user
548533204.reviewBody: A classic sight-seeing in the state of Nuevo Le\u00f3n. Amazing formations in the caves where you see stalactites and stalagmites created and preserved over thousands of years.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

545873313.name: Great creation of Nature
545873313.author: a TripAdvisor user
545873313.reviewBody:
I visited here seeing Nov 2017 along with colleges including a local friend. It is about an hour's drive from Monterrey. 
 
The place is quite good. The caves are at quite distance from parking area. They have a cable car ride to reach there. They charge some reasonable amount.

You can also climb steps if you have time and energy. But on sunny days you get exhausted.

We decided to take the ride. As it was Sunday there was bit crowd and the cable car was fully packed. It's bearable as it hardly takes few minutes, but becoz of crowd we had very limited chance take photos from cable car.

Inside caves there some natural formation of different shapes like Gorrila, Donkey, dinosaur...etc. The local guide explained them but all in Spanish. 

 It is quite dark inside caves although they have put lights that's enough to see and enjoy but you need good camera to get better pictures.
 Inside the cave lot of foot bridge steps...etc. one has to be mindfulness to watch steps and head.

They have only one eatery shop at cave with limited options. You can get more options at parking area down with lotof local dishes. We tried few Gorditos.

There are some handicraft items shops. Ee need bargain to get good deal. Later we found same item availability at Downtown market. With lesser price.

Overall good place to enjoy.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

544130497.name: Beautiful caves, tour was weird
544130497.author: a TripAdvisor user
544130497.reviewBody: We went on a Friday to the caves. It was about 45 minutes to drive from\nMonterrey city center. Getting there is beautiful as it\'s at the end of a gorgeous set of mountains. It was very quiet as it was Friday during the day, but that was a plus. We took the cable car up the mountain as the trail is pretty steep. The tour is included in the price but it\'s in Spanish. If I remember correctly it cost about 80-100 pesos for the ticket. The caves were impressive but easy to walk through. They did some great lighting which added an interesting dimension to the caves.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

543259094.name: Great experience!!!
543259094.author: a TripAdvisor user
543259094.reviewBody: A lil drive from the center of the city but worth it. I\'ve been to a few caves before and this is definitely a cool spot to visit and fun when traveling with kids and teenagers.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

539985579.name: AMAZING
539985579.author: a TripAdvisor user
539985579.reviewBody: This has to be a-must in your visit to Monterrey, is a Natural spectacular visit, even is a lots of stairs is not difficult the guide make it slow enough for everyone in the group to enjoy and take pictures.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

534484961.name: Exploring caves!
534484961.author: a TripAdvisor user
534484961.reviewBody: It was a good trip, we reached there pretty early to avoid lot of crowd on a Sunday. There is a trail that you can take to hike up or a cable car. It was too sunny to hike up then, but should be a good hike. The cable car ride is nice and you literally feel the sight below diminishing as you move up.. the view from the top is nice, pause and soak it in. The temp inside was low and pleasant, slightly chilly.. much sought relief from outside. The tour is in Spanish and will take an hour to complete, interpretations were ok.. after we finished, also dropped by xenpal.. it is very small but quite fun if with kids.. I went with a friend, Uber connectivity can be difficult.. better to book a cab for few hours.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

516497098.name: A cave in the desert with a dragon head
516497098.author: a TripAdvisor user
516497098.reviewBody:
Even though it is not officially present as the Games of Thrones dragon head, I can tell you I saw one, I even have a picture :) you can go with the cabin or walk. I took the sunny walk back, prepare for a hot walk and a bumpy road, make sure to have appropriate shoes.
The cave is amazing, chill, the guide will explain all the attractions and there is an english speaking guide also. Remember that the tour inside is like almost 2 km so be prepared.
There is a parking and the entrance and some shops for souvenirs and street food.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

515778968.name: Beautiful rock formations
515778968.author: a TripAdvisor user
515778968.reviewBody: What n amazing place - even to get there is an adventure as you have to take the cable car to get to the top, and then access the caves themselves. I have been to many limestone caves and these are some of  the best. Excellent pathways, gantries and boardwalks throughout.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

503605151.name: Beautiful attraction
503605151.author: a TripAdvisor user
503605151.reviewBody: Grutas de Garcia is maybe one of the top attractions in Monterrey. Located some 30Km from downtown, they offer guided visits. Even when Monyterrey is a very warm city, temperature inside the  cave is always fresh.\nYou can get to the grottoes in a cableway or by foot. You should consider that it means a long, steepy hike and that once you start is no easy to go back.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

497763037.name: Nice cave
497763037.author: a TripAdvisor user
497763037.reviewBody: It is a nice venue for tourists. About $80 pesos or$50 pesos if you prefer to hike it up the mountain without using trailcar. Inside of cave temperature is a little cooler but be warned there are al lot of stairs to walk throughout the tour. No English translation! Highly recommend if you have a vehicle as it is pretty far from city.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

496957187.name: Beautiful caves
496957187.author: a TripAdvisor user
496957187.reviewBody: I had not visited the caves in about 5 years. Ever since the park around them has been improved. But the inside of the caves is in need of attention.  It was shameful to see the Christmas tree ( somebody please do something about that). It takes a very long drive to get there. And if you are planning on having a meal in Garcia, don\'t plan too much because you are not finding any decent restaurants around. \n

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

496539603.name: Beautiful caves close to MTY
496539603.author: a TripAdvisor user
496539603.reviewBody: The caves are a bit far out but definitely worth a visit.The caves are very beautiful and special. They have lighted up several areas in the cave so you can see all the details of the special walls. There are a lot of paths through the caves and it is very easy to walk around so all ages can go. You have to follow a tour which I found a bit annoying since there was a lot of people and it took too long to walk through.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

496175678.name: Nice for one time
496175678.author: a TripAdvisor user
496175678.reviewBody:
It is very nice, beautiful and awe-inspiring.....the first time you visit. Second time it might be a bit boring. 
My suggestion is to take a guided tour, they are not expensive. 
You might take your lunch, or buy something outside the grutas, they sell chips, ice cream, hotdogs, etc. 
It takes about 45 minutes to get there from the city. Once you arrive, it is a very quiet area and there are tables outside where you can enjoy a lunch before or after going in. 
Before you go in, my suggestion would be to visit the small museum they have outside since there you will learn a lot about the natural formation you are about to explore. 

Inside, the temperature is always around 20ªC, and humid, so make sure you take a sweater with you. 
The tour inside takes about 30-45 minutes. 
Thus, the whole time you are walking and going up and down many many stairs in a completely close area, so take into consideration if you are taking babies, toddlers or older people.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

492072287.name: Caverns In Mexico Such Beauty!
492072287.author: a TripAdvisor user
492072287.reviewBody: You would think only in United States they had such beauty. These caverns are very beautiful. To get to the top of this entrance you would have to take an electric cable cart.This place is nice to take with family or just as a couple as they talk to you a little about the history of this cavern you can take pictures This visit is about an hour long depending on the line to get in, but it is worth exploring it. I love it.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

482735409.name: Beautiful and worth the treck
482735409.author: a TripAdvisor user
482735409.reviewBody: While the \'grutas\' may be bit far off, they are surely worth your time. Once there, you can either take a lift up the mountain or hike up the mountain along a zig-zap paved path which I was told can take up to an hour to walk up or if you are \'elite\' you can make it in 25 mins -- in scortching heat! Inside the caves expect towering vaults with immense stalactites and stalagnites walking up and down a series of metal stairways throughout the grutas (in case you are wondering, the total steps of these stairways are around 750 and I wouldn\'t recommend it for elderly folk that aren\'t active). All and all, a pretty good visit and quite recommendable.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

480271732.name: Huge Cave
480271732.author: a TripAdvisor user
480271732.reviewBody:
I went there with my wife and another family. We had a child and it was safe for us and for the child too.

First, we took uber, we didn't know that the road has taxes to pay to go to gracia, we paid 2 times each way, the first time was about 48 pesos, the second time was a more expensive but less than 100 pesos.

We took the cable car to go to the cave, there is a way to hike but it was closed.

The ticket to the cave was 80 pesos per person.

The cave is huge, really big, you are going to walk a lot, and there are a lot stairs too.

There is a guide who speaks in Spanish,  we didn't understand anything, but if you want information you can always Google it.

Get a good camera as there is not enough light in the cave (duh, it is a cave!), the cave is really natural, you are gonna get good photos.

There is a cafeteria at the beginning of the cave and there are some shops for gifts and snacks.

I recommend you to rent a car as you will finish everything early and you won't know what to do next, then you can visit the garcía village itself or go somewhere else.

Also, it was not easy to find uber back, we were lucky, we found one, but usually, you'll find no cars available for uber there.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

477125192.name: A must go...
477125192.author: a TripAdvisor user
477125192.reviewBody: The caves are gorgeous... a natural place with history. The guide is full of interesting information.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

476929761.name: Worth it!
476929761.author: a TripAdvisor user
476929761.reviewBody:
We took an Uber from Apodaca. The journey was about an hour and there were 2 road tolls along the way (paid about 200 pesos for the tolls). 

There were some stalls selling snacks,beverages and crafts near the ticket counter. The tickets to enter the Grutas via the cable ride cost 80 pesos for adults and 60 pesos for children (cheaper to hike up but hiking trail was closed on the day we went). 

Tour of the Grutas is inclusive and was given in Spanish. The tour took about an hour and the Grutas is very big with lots of stairs to climb up and down. It's still manageable though for a pregnant lady like me. 

The whole place is well taken care of, they have relatively clean  washrooms, and their guides are professional. What I like most is that there are no peddlers, which could be typically seen on tourist sites. 

We recommend that you schedule an Uber ride back since it took us awhile to get our ride.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

476152101.name: Nice cave
476152101.author: a TripAdvisor user
476152101.reviewBody: Well, what can I say. It\'s a cave. But I find it to be more interesting than many others. The view from the top of the cable car is amazing. Worth visit even for that. The cave itself is lit nicely and you can find some fossils in the stone. Possible also walk up the mountain. Not too far from Monterrey, ask your hotel for a ride.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

473468300.name: Breathtaking
473468300.author: a TripAdvisor user
473468300.reviewBody: Definitely worth the drive and really cheap to get in. We rented a car and parked with no problem, it was $80 pesos to take the cart up (they did stuff it with way too many people though). Once you get to the top (which you can also hike up to for $50 pesos) the views are amazing. Inside you have a guide that walks you through the various areas, the tour is about 45-1 hr long.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

473071531.name: Large caves
473071531.author: a TripAdvisor user
473071531.reviewBody: A scenic but short tram ride up the steep hill to the entrance of the cave. There\'s a path if you wish to walk up or down. The tour takes about 45 minutes, guides are helpful and personable. \nThe cave is easy to find, just west of Monterrey outside of Garcia - signs direct the way from town.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

466530593.name: Cave Visit
466530593.author: a TripAdvisor user
466530593.reviewBody: I swore I would never ride a gondola because I am afraid of heights, but this ride up to the cave entrance was not bad at all. This cave was amazing. I had read about caves prior to my visit, which was good because I could understand only a few of the words of the Spanish-speaking guide. It took about an hour to go through the cave. I am in my early 60\'s and it was a gradual, slow walk, which worked out fine.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

463602342.name: Windy
463602342.author: a TripAdvisor user
463602342.reviewBody: Very windy the day we visited.  So much so that they closed the gondola down.  It was a .9 mile hike with 1000 ft of elevation change - thanks to my Fitbit.  Many people were unprepared for the hike.  Wear sensible shoes as you may be walking down.  The tour was great and the caves were impressive.  We came via Uber but had no reception when we came back down.  Luckily there was one taxi that took turns ferrying us back to town.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

462585148.name: A must see when in the Monterrey region
462585148.author: a TripAdvisor user
462585148.reviewBody: The Caves of Garcia (Grutas de Garcia) are an amazing experience. They are about 45 minutes outside of Monterrey, and easy to reach by car. There is free parking, and then you ride a cable car (Teleferico) up the side of the mountain to the caves. The tour consists of a paved walkway two kn long, with a tour guide. The caves are very well lit, so any cell phone will take great pictures. Even for people not too keen on caves, this is still a must-see attraction.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

460076250.name: Impressive
460076250.author: a TripAdvisor user
460076250.reviewBody: Impressive the visit to the caves "grutas de Garcia". I totally recommend them, there is a ferry that takes you up to the mountain where the caves are and it is a wonderful ride, then the tour inside the caves is just magnificent.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

453658942.name: Nice experience
453658942.author: a TripAdvisor user
453658942.reviewBody:
Desertic area near Municipio de Garcia. It's far away the city soy it is good to arrange a round trip from the city. Don't rely on uber for your return.
Good fare for a taxi would be arround MEX$1100 and the driver it's going to wait for you there.
For a tour you have to arrange for it at least 24hs before.
Nice place to visit. You have a guided tour inside.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

452678915.name: An spectacular caverns in the north of the country
452678915.author: a TripAdvisor user
452678915.reviewBody: going up on the mono lift besides the mountain, after ten minute trip you start your walk inside the mountain, all over the natural caverns, you need to have good activity condition, you have to go through more than 700 stairs so be ware of the condition

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

448291781.name: Amazing natural wonder! A must while in Monterrey
448291781.author: a TripAdvisor user
448291781.reviewBody:
These caves have amazing marble formations with 50 meters tall columns and some strange figures that let your imagination fly. In my Top 5 in the world, I regret being so many times in Monterrey without visiting them.

This caves are located about 45 minutes from Monterrey/ San Pedro, most of the time the roads are good. Once you are in you pay $50 for the round trip ticket for the funicular or you can try yourself walking (not suggested). 

There are guides inside, the whole tour in the caverns is about 45 minutes, all the way has proper light, with stairs, some digged in the rock, others man done with hand rails. It's very clean, the temperature was very confortable, but we went in winter.

Please tip the inside guides, they do an excellent job and they keep well maintained all the facilities. 

You can find clean toilets near the cashier or when you reached the caves in the funicular, there is also a snack shop or you can eat after the tour in the local restaurants, the food is pretty good and with a great price, and you support the local economy.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

447189117.name: Exceeded our expectations
447189117.author: a TripAdvisor user
447189117.reviewBody: I\'ve been to many caves but these are really impressive and well maintained.  The tour is in Spanish but still worth going.  It takes about an hour and there are stairs to climb but my 70 year old mom was able to do it.  We road the lift up to the entrance and it was safe and well maintained.  It is a good tourist destination.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

444246994.name: Nice day
444246994.author: a TripAdvisor user
444246994.reviewBody: We visited with s group of friends. Very young and very old. It was a nice day. The cave is nice. For the younger folks the walk up is great. For the older ones the ride up is a good option.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

442903932.name: Wow! And the cable car ride is fun
442903932.author: a TripAdvisor user
442903932.reviewBody: These are stunning caves with a size that you won\'t believe. The cable car ride to the top is a nice experience - like skiing without snow. Having a guide is not optional - though he seemed most impressed with the animal or human shapes that the rocks formed, than really understanding the geology of the caves. When I asked him what the green stone embedded in the stalagtites was (in Spanish - so he knew what I asked), he responded that they formed a Bull shape and by the way, don\'t miss the "maaanos de las muertessssss" on the other side. For crying out loud...I\'m not in elementary school.\n\nOther than having absolutely no educational value, except what I could find online, the caves are a remarkable natural wonder.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

435966140.name: Must go attraction
435966140.author: a TripAdvisor user
435966140.reviewBody: If you visit Monterrey you must go Grutas, it ios about 40 minutes from Downtown but it worth go. Besides, you can visit a Zoo on the way

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

432400944.name: Perfect
432400944.author: a TripAdvisor user
432400944.reviewBody: The place is very well conserved and clean. Everyone is very polite and kind. The tour in the grutas is simply amazing and very well explained by the tour guides. VERY RECOMMENDED.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

417281562.name: Great place to explore caves!!!!
417281562.author: a TripAdvisor user
417281562.reviewBody: We visited here in 2007. I was unaware of Trip Advisor at that time. Very inexpensive and not located to far away from Monterey. Great place for kids and families. The cable car ride to the top of the mountain is awesome!!! Very beautiful and interesting caves!!! Great and informative tour!!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

412691679.name: Wonderful place
412691679.author: a TripAdvisor user
412691679.reviewBody: This is a  place to visit. It has amazing rock formations. You have to step in a lot of stairs but you dont feel tired a lot. The lights are beatiful.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

412061642.name: One of best attractions near monterrey
412061642.author: a TripAdvisor user
412061642.reviewBody:
First i was sceptical if i need to go to this place but i got my self ready on weekend and visited it.
Few things to note

-Dont rely on taxi / uber as your visit will be around 4 hours. Better book a cab ( shoukd be a fair price at 900 pesos). You dont get taxis for return there

- try to reach there by 10 am or it gets crowded
- take the cable car unless you are ok to trek all the way up. Cable car costs 80 pesos
- carry a bag to hold your stuff so that you can take nice photos of the caves
- you have very limited food options right out side the entrance but shoul satisfy your hunger
- if going with kids and elders please make a note you need to get on and get off around 700 stairs which are very narrow so be prepared
- rest rooms are available before getting i to cable car and out side of caves

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

406821300.name: Nice place, a joy for eyes
406821300.author: a TripAdvisor user
406821300.reviewBody: To get to those caves you can either walk or take a cable car - I\'d rather take the latter, particularly when with kids. Caves definitely worth seeing and taking pictures. Some snacks available after return (churros!) Generally speaking, when in Monterrey - worth going.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

401508681.name: Good experience
401508681.author: a TripAdvisor user
401508681.reviewBody: It was an amazing experience to visit the caverns. we had a wonderful tour guide. Cable ride was fun for the kids amd they enjoyed the different formations. Well organized and affordable entertainment.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

399030643.name: Nice visit, good workout ;)
399030643.author: a TripAdvisor user
399030643.reviewBody: We arrived around noon, it wasn\'t too packed but they do cram everyone in the teleferico up, luckily it only takes about 3 minutes to go up. I didn\'t pay so I don\'t recall the price but it\'s not expensive  maybe 40 to 50 pesos a person. There\'s alot of walking, up and down stairs, great workout lol worth the stop. Takes about an hour, also if you like to take pictures stay in the back part of your group. Wear good shoes as some areas are slippery. Very pretty inside, our guide was friendly took time to let us take pics and would stay behind some for those in the back to repeat things. The group was too large I think, would be nicer of maybe 15 to 20 but we were about 40+. Before you go up or come down be sure to head to the little museum in the very back after all the shops. Gives great explanation and a few mock ups in English. Restrooms in the furthest back by there were clean and no wait. Also play ground for kids. The snacks area is covered and nice but the snacks selection not so great. Only thing we liked was the lemonade. However by the parking area there is a stand with a few tables out that sells fajitas and they were good. It does not take all day to visit this site I recommend planning to visit  zoo and other local stops as well.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

397522124.name: Great and amazing caves
397522124.author: a TripAdvisor user
397522124.reviewBody: I\'ve visited the caves several times before, this time I want to show them to my kids and girlfriend, as usual the caves are very impressive for first timers; whole experience of cable car, caves, lights effects worth the trip which is very close to Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

397409315.name: Visit to Montain cave
397409315.author: a TripAdvisor user
397409315.reviewBody: An amazing cave, stunning rock formations.  A mus to visit, lovely place near to Monterrey city.  Arrive there early, at noon maximun to avoid rush.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

393572491.name: Simply Beautiful!
393572491.author: a TripAdvisor user
393572491.reviewBody:
I don't have much words to describe the caves. It's an amazing place. You can look a beautiful formations of stalagmites and stalactites. You can see the lion head, the cross, the Guadalupe Virgin, etc. 

The temperature inside is great. It's not difficult to walk. The organization is great. 

You can go at the top in gondola or walking. Both are great!. 

You need to visit this Grutas!.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

392739855.name: Beautiful cave
392739855.author: a TripAdvisor user
392739855.reviewBody: That\'s amazing cave with gorgeous stalactites and stalagmites in many different shapes. I really enjoyed about legendary stories about the cave & shapes inside!

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

391382034.name: "One of the best in the world"
391382034.author: a TripAdvisor user
391382034.reviewBody: Great caves with very interesting formations of stalactites and stalagmites.  Beautiful mountains and surroundings.  If you love nature, it\u00b4s a must...and if you don\u00b4t care much about nature, it\u00b4s a must, you will love them.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

390887438.name: Excellent place
390887438.author: a TripAdvisor user
390887438.reviewBody: We really enjoyed it. It have amazing things to see. We saw like the face of Christ looking down, the virgen, the Gloria and the Christmas tree.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

388227396.name: Fun trip
388227396.author: a TripAdvisor user
388227396.reviewBody: A very interesting place. I remember that my parents took me when I was a child, then I was in my teens and now I just take my son there. With the passing of the years the place has been improving, has improved facilities. The trip includes riding a cable car that is an experience that children love.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

387010902.name: Great natural location!!
387010902.author: a TripAdvisor user
387010902.reviewBody: One of my childhood memories was recovered and it was even greater while watching the kids be amazed by the geological results of nature passing years inside this great cave, finding figures created by stone, as well as walking through the maze-kind of stairs and self made corridors. Great place to experience nature, use a nice well cared cableway car to the top of the mountain!! Don\'t forget water... And enjoy a charcaol broiled corn-on-the-cob at the end of your walk in the little restaurants at the parking lot!!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

386226809.name: Grutas were excellent
386226809.author: a TripAdvisor user
386226809.reviewBody: it was a nice trip with my mom, i was  comfortable walking around and seen the nature, if you are near You should go.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

383562455.name: Beautiful place!
383562455.author: a TripAdvisor user
383562455.reviewBody: It is a must when visiting Monterrey, although it\'s 40-50 min away from the city. Had to take a driver and asked him to wait for me for the hour the tour took. It\'s a beautiful piece of art made by nature. Visitors need to be able to climb stairs since it\'s all there is.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

379264999.name: Stunning
379264999.author: a TripAdvisor user
379264999.reviewBody:
The caves where spectacular and the mountains were as impressive as the caves, if not more.

My advice is to visit this location on a cloudy day where you get to see the clouds clustering around the mountain tops. The view is surreal.

A word of caution to families: avoid entering the caves in case of accompanying babies, as there are very steep stairs which could also be a tad slippery.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

365880061.name: Totally Natural
365880061.author: a TripAdvisor user
365880061.reviewBody: This place is magnificent and natural they give you a detail tour in spanish, they also point out some weird looking stalactites and stalagmites also it is great for people who like nature or caves.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

361033511.name: Beautifully place!
361033511.author: a TripAdvisor user
361033511.reviewBody: Long time ago people was not wondering to keep natural beautiful place in good shape. Many things is destroyed on this grote but finally they make start learn to conservate natural things. Thanks to keep working to maintain this place.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

360345388.name: Majestic!
360345388.author: a TripAdvisor user
360345388.reviewBody: When you are into the cave, stalactites and stalagmites form very interesting shapes, so you can enjoy trying to compare the shapes with some shapes.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

345894769.name: Natural and Beautiful
345894769.author: a TripAdvisor user
345894769.reviewBody:
This place is amazing. From the local cosine on the bottom before heading up to the amazing churros and elote. This place is a natural beauty created by the earth. Went an hour before closing and the tour is about 40-50 minutes long and will walk you through the cave and various looking points.

There's two ways of going up if you go early you will be able to walk up through a walking path or if you want to get there fast you will be able to take the rail car up. You may also walk down the path if you wish as a group of four did when I went.

A most stop if you're in the area and want to see something natural and beautiful created by this planet of ours

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

343553082.name: Quick weekend adventure
343553082.author: a TripAdvisor user
343553082.reviewBody: The Grutas (caves) were absolute wonders to behold... the views inside and out were stunning, and the gondola ride was fun, as well.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

341569457.name: Natural wonders
341569457.author: a TripAdvisor user
341569457.reviewBody:
This is a nature wonder. 1 hr away from downtown(depending on traffic )

Its like 10 dollars to get inside and make the tour. Youre gonna have great views of the surrounding desert

You need to bring a hat water sunscreen and some snacks because its in the middle of nowhere

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

341046582.name: perfect for tourists
341046582.author: a TripAdvisor user
341046582.reviewBody: This caves were discovered 100 years ago and now you can visit them if you have a car. Please, don\'t eat in the small places outside the caves... My boyfriend got food poisoned :(

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

338507982.name: 45 mninutes from monterrey but worth it
338507982.author: a TripAdvisor user
338507982.reviewBody: Recommended to visit during the day since roads there can be lonely roads with potential crooks waiting for you to pass. Clean facilities and great views from the top, some refreshments sold there and clean restrooms.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

331913081.name: Must visit this place when you visit Monterrey
331913081.author: a TripAdvisor user
331913081.reviewBody: Great place, must be here on your trips to Monterrey, just avoid the vacation time, because the time to enter to the caves could be long.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

330006335.name: Huge cave, with color electric lights
330006335.author: a TripAdvisor user
330006335.reviewBody: Best time to enjoy would be early morning to avoid large crowds. If you bring a camera bring a flash, however if it is a pro-camera you may be fine using long exposures. Staying close to the guide is helpful, since he/she will point out the natural features. Bring shoes suited for humid rocky terrain.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

321449163.name: Grutas de Garcia are huge!
321449163.author: a TripAdvisor user
321449163.reviewBody: These are very big caves, with very big stalactites and stalagmites, walk to get inside is pleasant, cable to get down is cool. A lot of people on busy days, a lot of garbage on the food area...

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

319578970.name: Spectacular!
319578970.author: a TripAdvisor user
319578970.reviewBody: You take the cableway which smoothly climbs the steep Mountain and then you will witness some beautiful caves!

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

315792516.name: Impressive
315792516.author: a TripAdvisor user
315792516.reviewBody: If you\'re visiting Monterrey, these caves are a must see. Take a bus there from the central bus terminal in Monterrey (Saturdays and Sundays).

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

314076184.name: Great nature spot
314076184.author: a TripAdvisor user
314076184.reviewBody: It is nice to be in a place all formed by action of nature. It is like 30 minutes inside the cave, where you see a lot of nice formations that the tourist guide insist they resemble something else. Great if you have a free morning in Monterrey. Plus, you ride a cable car to the top.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

298777098.name: Natural Wonder
298777098.author: a TripAdvisor user
298777098.reviewBody: The Grutas de Garc\u00eda is an amazing natural wonder. In the middle of the desert there are this caverns that are hidden from the naked eye but that in the middle of a mountain have great rock formations, an incredible cool temperature and remains of a time when all that was under the sea. It is difficult to believe but true, at some point in time all this semi-desert area was full of water and even dinosaurs.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

298547502.name: World-class caves
298547502.author: a TripAdvisor user
298547502.reviewBody: I am not sure why the caves are not world known. I\u00b4ve visited several caves with formations all over the world and these are the best, bar-none. The Museum included with your entrance is not worth it, but if you need to kill time before your gondola time, there is really not much to do there. If you fill like a hike, instead of taking the gondola you can hike \u2013almost clime- to the caves.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

268534504.name: Nice caves
268534504.author: a TripAdvisor user
268534504.reviewBody: You must take a cable car to get all the way up to the mountain, but it is worth making the line. When you get in the caves you are amazed on the beauty of the stalactites and the shapes of the mountain. The view is nice, not beautiful, but worth the wait and the walk.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

260111061.name: A spectacular must-see location
260111061.author: a TripAdvisor user
260111061.reviewBody: The Grutas (Caves) de Garc\u00eda is a system of caves and caverns located within about 40 minutes from the city of Monterrey.  Gigantic stalactites and stalagmites, well lit with a variety of colored lights, make this a tour through an underground wonderland that looks like a set from "Journey to the Center of the Earth."  There are guided tours every half hour or so. The entrance to the caves is actually up on a mountainside, and is reached either by cable car or by a long hike. This is definitely a place to visit in the morning, especially if you plan on walking, as sometimes it closes mid-afternoon. Warning: lots of stairs are involved in the tour.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

259028925.name: Good Experience
259028925.author: a TripAdvisor user
259028925.reviewBody: Wife visited years ago, stated it was clean and well maintained, not sure about condition at the present time.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

254774579.name: GRUTAS DE GARC\u00cdA
254774579.author: a TripAdvisor user
254774579.reviewBody: !!\nOne of the most beautiful caves in north Am\u00e9rica, located in a rock mountain in a desertic area\nat less than one hour from downtown MONTERREY. It is serv\u00edced by a modern cable car, from where you can admire a breath taking panorama. The interior of the cave IS outstanding!!!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

242798588.name: Grutas de Garcia
242798588.author: a TripAdvisor user
242798588.reviewBody: The trip to Grutas de Garcia was amazing. The mountains are awe inspiring. No problems parking. The food from the vendors not too bad.  Had a mixture of corn chips with grated corn on the cob, cheese and jalapeno peppers served in the corn chip bag with a spoon. The wait time to take the lift to the mountain was like less than 10 minutes tops and that was on a Sunday afternoon.  Once you are on the left, try to make your way to the windows to take pictures. The view is awesome!  Once you reach the mouth of the cavern there is a short wait time to get in.  The narrator was very informative and funny. The duration of the trip is like 1 hour. Lots of steps to climb up and down. Cave formations were interesting. Some resemble a rat, others a camel, birds, etc.  The guide will be quick to point those out so you can snap a picture.  The theater area is great for pictures. Overall it was a worthwhile trip.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

227243974.name: good place to see
227243974.author: a TripAdvisor user
227243974.reviewBody: This place is Ok . Nothing too special . I have seen such caves in other countries as well. But if someone want to see the country side of Mexico then the journey from city to this place is good.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

219777247.name: MAJESTIC!
219777247.author: a TripAdvisor user
219777247.reviewBody: WOW!! Not any ordinary tour, the mountains are sooo awe inspiring.. the tour was excellent, my friends and I loved it!! Thoroughly  enjoyed the ride up as well... :)

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

218507506.name: Amazing caves!
218507506.author: a TripAdvisor user
218507506.reviewBody: This was the best place to visit for the family. My 4 year old niece and 6 year old nephew loved it. The inside of the cave had stairs where you descended and ascended. It was about a 35 minute tour. The tour guide was very knowledgeable about the history and told us stories about the cave. I recommend taking your own lunch because there are no stores along the road. They have picnic tables there. Also wear comfortable tennis shoes because there is a lot of walking to do. Enjoy your trip! -the amazing travelor

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

217068960.name: Great day trip from Monterrey
217068960.author: a TripAdvisor user
217068960.reviewBody: This is a worth while day trip from Monterrey, if you rent a car take the toll free highway toward Saltillo, about 30 minutes you\'ll see exit for Villa de Garcia and Grutas, follow the signs. The entrance to the caverns is up on a steep hill, buy your tickets and there is two ways of getting there, the easiest is the tram, a very modern installation, will take to the entrance, or for the more athletic take the walk path up. Inside the caverns the temperature is always nice. We took the self guided tour you can spend a good hour to hour and a half walking through it.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

206861678.name: A short drive out west of Monterrey to Garcia municipio
206861678.author: a TripAdvisor user
206861678.reviewBody: Previously a small town Garcia is growing. The site itself is a nice calm area with scenic surroundings. There are refreshments available, shady spots and a gift shop. Make sure to go to the ticket booth to purchase your pass to ride the cable car up to the caves on the mountainside. It is a steep ride to quite an elevation that is quickly over, don\'t fear.  Once everyone dis-boards the tour guides invite you through the entrance and you instantly feel the wind tunnel effect of cold damp air. The interior is low lit and much of the trail is composed of steps. You may lag behind or follow the guide to hear every explanation of the formations. Overall it is a great value and a change of scenery from the metro area.  Special note, wheel chairs will not be able to make the passage through the cave interior.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

205602969.name: LOve this place, bring a jacket.
205602969.author: a TripAdvisor user
205602969.reviewBody: This place has been renovated from the one I used to know, now it is more modern, it is cleaner and still cold when you walk into those wonderful caves, recommended to go and take the funicular when you go up but descend by the trails, it is fun and you can enjoy the wonderful views of the mountains around you, you cannot miss this trip.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

204465880.name: U can not miss the grutas
204465880.author: a TripAdvisor user
204465880.reviewBody: Amazing cave, with the right artificial light and comfortable steps. Thanks to the guide you will know a lot about the cave. A must have if u are in Monterrey, there are tour operators that can take you there in 40 minutes plus a tour of Garcia, a town nearby.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

186952303.name: Truly amazing
186952303.author: a TripAdvisor user
186952303.reviewBody: This is about a 30 Minuit ride from Santa Caterina where I am staying. The cable car ride alone  to the cave entrance is worth the ride. Wonderful views of the Serra Madre\'s. The cave takes about one hour to walk through and is overwhelming both in scope and size. So much to see. Be prepared for a lot of steps, this is little physical. The cable ride is so smooth I had no fear at all. I got some really good deals on at the market as well. I will be going back as there is more to see then a Day allowed for.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

185916694.name: natural wonder
185916694.author: a TripAdvisor user

We were like 40 + people squeezing in the small cable car. It was a bit dissapointed as I cannot enjoy the view since it was difficult even to breath in such crowded environment. There is a tour guide who explain us the attractions in the cave. It was clear and well explained but the group is too big and hardly can enjoy the view. Worth to visit but choose wisely the time to visit.

Inside of the cave the temperature is perfect, about 70-75 degrees.  Plenty of things to see inside and the guide does an excellent job of pointing them out.  There are A LOT of stairs as well so if you have an issue with that, then this might not be for you.  The tour inside is about 45 mins.  At the bottom of the mountain there are vendors selling various items and food available for purchase as well.  There is also a playground for children.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

470230.name: Great Family Outing
470230.author: a TripAdvisor user
470230.reviewBody:
Heading out toward Saltillo a small sign lets you know where to turn as you wander through small winding roads (mostly paved) into the back country and foothills of the Sierre Madre.  The route is adequately marked if you keep your eyes open, and since you can't go very fast that shouldn't be a problem.  The area has fairly decent accomodations including a little diner and gift shop.

The caves are located halfway up a steep rocky cliff and access is afforded by an authentic turn-of-the-centruy cable car which proves to be a thrill in and of itself.

The tour guide is well informed and friendly, but the spiel only comes in one language - Spanish.  However, you don't have to understand the guide to appreciate the fantastic caverns.  The paths are manicured, maintained and well lit and the various rock formations, stalactities, etc. are worth any rockhound's enthusiasm.

Tours start around 11 am and run about every 30 minutes until 4 pm on Saturday and Sunday.  With the trip out and back, the tour, lunch and a pitstop or two, plan on a 3 to 5 hour adventure.

address.streetAddress: Carretera 40 hacia Saltillo 40 Km de Monterrey

675994040.author: a TripAdvisor user
675994040.reviewBody: we took a drive up the mountain to see a great view of the city.  The haze was so bad that you really could not see much.  Along the way, we noticed some nice trails and park area so it seems like a great place to spend some time outdoors, maybe to have a hike or a picnic.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

672309521.name: Unexpected Treasure
672309521.author: a TripAdvisor user
672309521.reviewBody:
I lived in Monterrey, Mexico for more than a decade, and I visited Parque Ecologico Chipinque many times. You might be pleasantly surprised to experience one or more of the following just as I have: 
1) the overwhelming amount of raw nature
2) the pleasant change of climate from the city below
3) the breath-taking view of modern cityscape sprawled in and among the unique northernmost Sierra Madre mountains
4) the amazing flora and fauna of Northern Mexico 
5) the descent of the Cuati Mundi

Although the vast majority of Northern Mexico's rugged mountains are not tourist-friendly, this is one area where the whole family can enjoy the wild outdoors.

We climbed up through the trails and then walked down the road to the entrance. Great place to hike and explore, beautiful scenery and lots of wildlife.

651591220.name: Beautiful overlook for Monterrey, Mexico
651591220.author: a TripAdvisor user
651591220.reviewBody: For our free day tour, our group went to Chipinque for the afternoon.  It is a long winding road to the park with some interesting creature statues along the way.  Parking was a bit of an issue as it on a slope and was nearly full upon our arrival.  We managed to squeeze in near a large tree.  The hike to the entrance was a bit steep which presented a bit of a problem for one of our number who has had some problems with his knees and hips.  There is a hotel here along with a restaurant.  We strolled along the top of the restaurant patio to reach the overlook.  Fortunately the day was somewhat clear so we did I get a good view of the downtown area.  Quite the sight...well worth the trip!!!  Took several group pictures before heading back to the Centro Episcopal for the evening.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

641413437.name: Moderate & beautiful hike
641413437.author: a TripAdvisor user
641413437.reviewBody:
I’ve been going to this place since I was ~3 years old and love it. I come every time I visit and am surprised at how well it is kept up. 

Park: on the street near entrance for free and pay $20 pesos to enter walking or drive in and park at one of many small parking lots off the road. It’s $110 pesos to drive in your car which also covers everyone in it. CASH ONLY 

Bring water, fruit snacks, etc because you can easily spend several hours hiking the trails. You are more likely to see animals the higher you go up. I haven’t heard of bear attacks but black bears are native to the area. I’ve heard them on previous trips and even spotted one once so it’s probably not a bad idea to bring bear mace. 

The trails are not difficult it you’re not in terrible shape. When younger (20’s) and in excellent shape I would run/race my uncle to the top who would bike on the road. Nowadays I can easily walk up at a brisk pace and run down. This year I carried our infant son in one of those front carry baby packs, had a backpack with water, food and basic supplies and also carried our two year old daughter for most of the hike. The extra ~40 lbs wore me out and required me to sit down and take extra breaks. 

Some of my friends will think I’m crazy for taking such little ones on this trip but I’d say it’s perfect for most kids ages 5 and up and a little adventurous for anyone younger.

They also rent bikes and give guided tours. Be sure to have a map of the trails, and get informed (either with the park staff of asking other visitors) on the distances of the trails your taking. If you\'re lucky, you\'ll get to see the local fauna: squirrels, coatis, lots of birds, and even deer and bears! Chipinque is a must to visit while in Monterrey.

Either you can drive up the hill or can park at base and go hiking or biking. You can enjoy the flora and fauna of the mountains.

One thing to keep in mind they have only one cafeteria inside that to at the begging. That will close early in evening.

The approach road is good with lot of luxurious mantions and bunglows.

Do carry some snacks . Water and drinks if you need. Before going on hiking.

Just get there early as parking gets hard)er as the day goes by, more so on weekends. If you are hiking or biking, expect a workout as it can get steep in some sections

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

594528557.name: GREAT OUTDOORS
594528557.author: a TripAdvisor user
594528557.reviewBody: Chipinque is a wonderful park with lots of trails to go hiking, or on the mountain bike. It is very well kept and has areas for kids to play and also it is great for being out in the woods. It is within the city and still you have the tranquillity of being outdoors. You can sometimes stumble upon a few animals such as a bear, white tailed deer, lots of chimpmunks or some racoons. It is a wonderful place to visit!!\nPreferably use hiking shoes and clothing for hiking...

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

590380452.name: Oh what a trek!
590380452.author: a TripAdvisor user
590380452.reviewBody:
This nature park allows you to drive up all the way to the hotel for a significant fee, for a smaller fee it allows you to enter the park and leave your car on the lowermost area and trek all around the same. For an even lower fee you can ride your bike up the trails and highway that leads to the hotel. Or for next to nothing, you can enter by foot and go anywhere!
They do allow you to bring your own food, no fire is allowed, so forget the barbecue! Unless you talk to people in charge and they MIGHT let you bring a gas powered grill, just might! There is only drinks available for sale at the top of the trails and the restaurant,  but that in itself is a little pricey. 
   The place is so worth your visit! You'll fall in love with foresty-nature! At the end of "El Pinal" trail is the forest Ranger look-out, getting here is a challenge for the exercise handicapped. Speaking of which, some trails are not good idea for the physically challenged but once up at the top it's ok.

This nature-trek is a must-visit for anyone visiting town. It is the perfect get-away from the hustle and bustle of city life!

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

588682714.reviewBody: Best national park in Monterrey and surrounding areas.  This park sits on the eastern range of the Rocky Mountains (Sierra Madre Oriental).  It\u00b4s amazing to have such an extense variety of hiking and biking trails in a heavily forrested area, right in the middle of one of the largest industrial cities in Mexico.
