566579660.author: a TripAdvisor user
566579660.reviewBody: been going here for 25 years a touch of country in the city.  Great trails and hiking as well as mountain biking.  Great views

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

564103816.name: Amazing
564103816.author: a TripAdvisor user
564103816.reviewBody: Chipinque is located in San Pedro Garza Garcia. You have options to go there, by bike, walk or car. I used the car option and pay $120 mxp. I had my family of 5 in the car an all of us went to the park for that price. They take only CASH! Bring water,  hiking shoes, hat, sunscreen. Also they have picnic areas. Lots of creatures you will see.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

559689925.name: Fresh Air
559689925.author: a TripAdvisor user
559689925.reviewBody: Came out in mid June (in the max hot, yes I know) and it was a very nice experience. We got to drive through San Pedro in order to arrive. It\'s very productive since there were many people jogging and running must of been an event. Maybe? We arrived and started our journey on a mark trail uphill. In the mids of the way as you turn to see the view and take a deep breath, a scent of fresh pine and magnolia enriches and blooms inside you. Halfway we decided to cut through and see where we would end up. We started to panic a bit until we reached the top, where lies a park for kids and what I think could be a hotel or maybe an event hall. Definitely recommend.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

558156616.name: Very well maintained nature reserve. For the more daring the Copete de las Aguilas peak is an option.
558156616.author: a TripAdvisor user
558156616.reviewBody: Very well maintained nature reserve. For the more daring the Copete de las Aguilas peak is an option with a permit purchase in advance.\n\nGreat views of Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

551298964.name: Interesting and fun!
551298964.author: a TripAdvisor user
551298964.reviewBody: A beautiful park in the mountains above Monterrey Mexico. Stunning views, beautiful trails (and challenging). The coati, an animal native to this area, is plentiful and friendly. There are cozy (and romantic) cottages in the park, and an excellent restaurant. This park is great for 1 week getaway, or a 1 day excursion. Our party had small children, and everyone had a wonderful time. They also have a long smooth concrete slide that all ages enjoyed.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

548700247.name: A Natural paradise in the middle of the city
548700247.author: a TripAdvisor user
548700247.reviewBody:
Being a local I use to go almost every weekend to this park.  I love hiking and Chipinque is always a great option to disconnect from the bustle of the city.  The best time to go if you rather like a tranquil walk is early morning when most of the people go to make some exercise.  They have a free great yoga class sundays 9 AM.  During weekends after 10 AM its crowd change and it mix with regulars looking for a place to have a Sunday picnic and entrance and parking start to form lines.

Best of the place if you looking to hike is that you have different grades, from really easy slopes to controlled accents to the peaks of the park (la "M" and "Copete de las Aguilas", that requires a special permit and takes around 6 hrs round walk on grades of about 25%.

If you looking for a sunday with kids they have a really nice place on the top with some big concrete slides, an insectarium, some picinics area with different kid's playgrounds and where they can interact with squirrels and coaties that walk free around the place.

Chipinque had been doing really cool events to educate people about  nature and cultural events as well, like jazz nights and movie nights.

A great place to go to when in the city!

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

543267598.name: Great trails, well marked
543267598.author: a TripAdvisor user
543267598.reviewBody: This is close to city center. There seems to be only one trail from the bottom half of the park to the top half. I imagine that\'s why most pay 110 pesos to get to the top half and hike from there. (The hikes at the top are various. We did not dWe paid 60 pesos and took the trail. It was very nice. It\'d be important to be in ok shape. You certainly don\'t have to be in great condition but you are climbing a mountain. The trail was well attended and if you plan to return, the road provides great views but for all the switchbacks it makes a long walk. The fastest way back is the trail. There were nice bathrooms at some of the verandas and water fountains in various areas around the park.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

543249962.name: Amazing place in monterrey.
543249962.author: a TripAdvisor user
543249962.reviewBody: I regret not visiting Chipinque before. Now i come back everytime I am in Monterrey!! \nIt\'s a perfect spot to forget about the city, the place is great if you bring your own car and stop in the different views until the top of the hill. Very safe place, lots of families and security; but even with that, its very private and you can easily have a romantic/quiet picnic in one of the amazing benches surrounded by beautiful nature. There are some animals too, i have only seen raccoons. \nDon\'t miss visiting Chipinque ;)

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

542082195.name: Great place for a views of the city
542082195.author: a TripAdvisor user
542082195.reviewBody:
A great place to get a real sense of Monterrey and the amazing mountains around it. We came here on a locals recommendation from Tec de Monterrey to the park was about 25 minutes in a cab. The entrance fee was 20 pesos per person so really nominal and you pay at a gate. You can also into with your car and drive to the top but we elected to walk one in the exercise and the experience.

The hiking path is surprisingly steep it was a warm day but cool in the shade and the bottom section was quite busy with lots of families all the people as well as Fitness Junkies.

Once you never got this though it opens up and there are number of awesome places to take pictures of Monterrey.

A couple of easy tips take some water and snacks but also take a picture of the trail map if your Spanish is poor to help navigate on the way up the hill.

Highly recommend as a short half day trip to get out of the city at a sense of the mountains we left at about 9:30 will be back by 12:30 and really felt like we done something the locals in Monterrey do which was great.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

539085332.name: Great place for hiking, excellent city views
539085332.author: a TripAdvisor user
539085332.reviewBody: This is a typical place for hiking,very family friendly. You can take snacks and food. There are many trails, with different difficulty. Not all of them need guide personnel. There are playgrounds for children. And a hotel inside. You\'ll be experiencing nature at it\'s best. You can also encounter wildlife.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

538933706.name: Chipinque: Monterrey\'s backyard
538933706.author: a TripAdvisor user
538933706.reviewBody: Do you like biking (MTB, DH, RD,AT) hiking, walking, views, woods, birds, picnic  or nature? Well this is the place for you in Monterrey. Costly and need to came by car but, for sure,this is the place.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

536046989.name: Excellent place, with a great view.
536046989.author: a TripAdvisor user
536046989.reviewBody: Chipinque is one of the places that really challenge yourself, at the same time you could enjoy the nature, walking, jogging,  running,  cycling mountain or road bike if you wanted to do excersice,  but if you would prefer to enjoy a breakfast,  lunch or dinner, it\'s also a good option at the hotel that is at the end of the trip by car. Of course don\'t forget to enjoy the view the city since the mountains.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

531225944.name: Bike or Hike, one of the best places in Monterrey
531225944.author: a TripAdvisor user
531225944.reviewBody: I\'m a local and I have been going to Chipinque my whole life. The place is a very well preserved natural park within the city. It has plenty of trails that you can either hike or bike. There are many family areas with playgrounds and picnic tables. Admission varies depending if you drive all the way up or park near the entrance. Also there is a different price if you\'re biking. The park also has a hotel and a restaurant. The best part is definitely escaping the city into a beautiful forest, breathing fresh air and getting amazing views from the top. It is a must when visiting Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

529739567.name: A forest a few minutes away from the city
529739567.author: a TripAdvisor user
529739567.reviewBody: Chipinque is a hidden jewel and one of Monterrey\'s main natural attractions. Located 500 meters above the city and 1000 meters above the sea level it can easily be reached by car, mountain bike or hiking. The best time to visit is during the summer as it represent an escape from the city\'s summer heat. There\'s a small fee per car to access the State Park.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

529598956.name: Wooded urban trekking paradise
529598956.author: a TripAdvisor user
529598956.reviewBody: Chipinque, a beautiful wooded protected park overlooking the city of Monterrey, Mexico is a must for all who visit Mexico\'s most modern and progressive city. Especially those who enjoy the outdoors will fall in love with the pristine mountainside where children and adults are allowed to trek and climb through the many well-maintained trails. You will find easy trails as well as more challenging ones for those who are in good shape. You can drive up to the park entrance, park your car for a very moderate fee, and you will find yourself immersed in this beautiful Sierra Madre forest that you will not forget and will want to return to many times.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

529273101.name: Wonderful nature
529273101.author: a TripAdvisor user
529273101.reviewBody: If you come to Monterrey Mexico must visit Chipinque park located at the south of the city in the beatifull sierra madre ,\nYou can walk bike or use your car to admire all the wonderful nature.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

520613055.name: Perfect for the Adventurer
520613055.author: a TripAdvisor user
520613055.reviewBody: I enjoyed Chipinque! I was intimidated at first as a solo traveler but the park was easy to hike for the beginner and/or intermediate and there was always someone walking nearby. So I wasn\'t afraid of running into a black bear! Saw some interesting wild life, opossums, and coatis.\nMost fun was going down the stone slide..Beware, if you were spandex and have some weight you can go sliding down...with no control!!   Enjoyed the scenery and got some exercise in.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

520347239.name: Beautiful hiking!
520347239.author: a TripAdvisor user
520347239.reviewBody: Every time we go to Monterrey, Chipinque is a MUST GO, no exceptions! The view, the trails, you can hike for hours and hours. I love Chipinque!

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

518840672.name: Incredible Monterrey and vecinity views.
518840672.author: a TripAdvisor user
518840672.reviewBody: Chipinque is and amazing Nacional Forest very close from Monterrey (Mex) area, a real door to Nature

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

509113023.name: Well preserved nature park
509113023.author: a TripAdvisor user
509113023.reviewBody: Well maintained park, you can get a map and pick among dozens of trails according to your fitness level. You can also rent a bike if you want.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

501014713.name: Fun hike with georgeous (most of the time) scenary
501014713.author: a TripAdvisor user
501014713.reviewBody: Very enjoyable hike. You can either walk to several midpoints (\u201cLa Meseta\u201d for instance), which poses an easy to moderate challenge, or you can hike all the way to "La Eme", which is challenging. Throughout the way you will meet the local wildlife and enjoy the beautiful view. Unfortunately, Monterrey has become a really polluted city, and on that specific day our sight could not reach very far, which was a bummer. Nonetheless, the mountain itself offers many pretty sights.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

500062571.name: Gorgeous hike with trail options!
500062571.author: a TripAdvisor user
500062571.reviewBody: This is a MUST DO for Monterrey if you enjoy hiking. It\u2019s one of the easiest to get to/find, it\u2019s clean and there are trails throughout. You can choose to climb straight up the mountain by way of stairs, but my sister and I (on vacation for a week in Monterrey) chose to wind up the road with the cars. It was around 6am when we started (and when the park opens) so there were few cars and first light was around 6:30am so we enjoyed the breezy (though still slightly humid) morning. There is a nominal fee. After around 5 or 6 miles we reached the Meseta where a hotel sits. Throughout the climb there were a number of well-marked trails that we could have chosen to add on. At the top we chose the Pinal trail that turns into another trail (and is the longest loop). It was perhaps a 3-4 miles. We did not hike up to the famed \u201cLa Eme\u201d but we saw the turn-off to do so.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

495196432.name: Great views!!!!
495196432.author: a TripAdvisor user
495196432.reviewBody: Preaat well-protected nature park.\nI saw many wild animals...small and cute ones. Especially, the raccoon was so cute.\nSo it is a good place for fam.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

488541239.name: Another mystery of Mexico unlocked
488541239.author: a TripAdvisor user
488541239.reviewBody: This is the most amazing location to clear your mind and take in the stunning scenery. I was in awe the first time I visited. So much so that I had to return!

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

486903113.name: Amazing views
486903113.author: a TripAdvisor user
486903113.reviewBody: Great to see the perfect views of the city and perfect to go and excercise. Also great to fo and have a family picnic

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

479445666.name: The view
479445666.author: a TripAdvisor user
479445666.reviewBody: You need to get there earlier in the morning, well, it depends how high you want to go... and I mean high in the mountain...

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

478255177.name: Neatly preserved natural park
478255177.author: a TripAdvisor user
478255177.reviewBody:
Their access and maintenance policies have kept this park very neatly preserved. You will definitively experience a breath of fresh air and unmolested mountain atmosphere on your visit.

Great for biking, walking, exercising or just a good time with the loved ones.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

476374808.name: Amazing View
476374808.author: a TripAdvisor user
476374808.reviewBody: This was the first time that we go over there, just 20 pesos to enter (like 1 dollar) All green areas are amazing. Must Go place,  in Nuevo Le\u00f3n.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

474609492.name: For nature lovers, best place to go in Monterrey
474609492.author: a TripAdvisor user
474609492.reviewBody: With great, magnificent view when hiking, this natural park is probably the best place-to-be for nature lovers in Monterrey. Close to the city (almost immerse on it), always clean and well maintained, you can hike from 30 minutes to all day if you want with a chance to see wildlife like coati, black bear, deer, wild turkey and more. \n\nYou can also practice mountain biking or ride up in your car to enjoy the view.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

474377056.name: Pretty cool view
474377056.author: a TripAdvisor user
474377056.reviewBody: A local MUST! Surely the best views of the city and if you are lucky to go up on a breezy day you will be treated by a view of practically the entire city... Pretty good for bird watchers too!

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

470213387.name: Definitely not to be missed! The view on a good day is worth it!
470213387.author: a TripAdvisor user
470213387.reviewBody: The drive up Chipinque is quite beautiful and the road which snakes on the side of the mountain is very well taken care off.  Watch out for some blind curves as there are people who wallk or ride their bicycles all the way up!  Along the way you will find many areas to park and view the city from above.  Avoid going on cloudy/rainy days as you wont see anything from above.  You will be in the clouds once you get to any area where you can park and sight see.\n\nAt the top theres a hotel and also a small snack stand, depending on the time you go, they sell burgers, nachos and french fries.  Next to it theres also a souvenir shop.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

468274257.name: Great view
468274257.author: a TripAdvisor user
468274257.reviewBody: Chipinque is the most beautiful place that I visited in Monterrey, it has a great view of the whole city. The air at the top of Chipinque is super clean and fresh, and you can appreciate the mountain next to it.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

467910762.name: Beautiful view of the city
467910762.author: a TripAdvisor user
467910762.reviewBody: Chipinque is a nice park on tip of the Sierra Madre mountains where you can hike and/or bicycle.\nFull of trees. Because of its altitude the view of the city is very nice, specially at night.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

464173135.name: beautiful state park next to Monterrey
464173135.author: a TripAdvisor user
464173135.reviewBody: Only 15 minutes away from the city center of Monterrey is the nature of Chipinque with animals, hike tracks and much more.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

464074091.name: AWESOME
464074091.author: a TripAdvisor user
464074091.reviewBody: I had a quick stop in Monterrey going to Merida, my final destination. And i had the opportunity to see this wonderful place. It\'s unbelievable!! Highly recommended. I can only imaged at night. A must!

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

463602776.name: Great hiking
463602776.author: a TripAdvisor user
463602776.reviewBody: Lots to do and see here.  The drive up can be a bit much if you are prone to motion sickness.  Once up at the top you can hike all over the place as there are many miles of trails to explore.  Very scenic and expect to see some wildlife.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

460479136.name: perfect for a clear day
460479136.author: a TripAdvisor user
460479136.reviewBody: You can go and enjoy the view of Monterrey City and spend a fun time there is a huge playground and big slides where the kids can have a lot of fun, we recommend you to bring a big cloth like polyester to slide better

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

460380776.name: Speechless
460380776.author: a TripAdvisor user
460380776.reviewBody: This a must see-in Monterrey Mexico. The scenic drive is breathtaking and just beautiful. Once you are at the top of the mountain you get a beautiful view of the city of Monterrey. There are great places to walk, hike, bike ride, and a play/picnic area. Also at the top of the mountain there is a restaurant and hotel. Highly, highly recommend this breathtaking place!!!

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

459872824.name: A natural getaway within the city
459872824.author: a TripAdvisor user
459872824.reviewBody: One of the best places in Monterrey to breathe some fresh air and get away from the city, conveniently located some minutes "away" from the city!\nGreat views at day and night. Real nice park to be surrounded by nature. Might even get to see some bears, birds, and squirrels.\nThere is a snack bar at the entrance of the park, trails to walk, hike and bike, picnic areas, and at the top an area with slides and other kids\' stuff, snack area, and an outdoor "auditorium" in which small concerts and events happen from time to time. Also, there is a hotel and restaurant if you want to stay there a little longer.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

458466974.name: Beautiful views of the city and more
458466974.author: a TripAdvisor user
458466974.reviewBody: It is a great place to relax or workout on the weekends. If you want to relax, drive your car to the top and enjoy the beautiful views of the city. If you want to work out, leave your car at the bottom and choose how you want to ascend! You can walk, hike on the trails or use your mountain bike to ride up and down. I am a beginner biker and I can do part of the ascend, at least till I hit one of the trails (I haven\'t made it all the way to the too in my bike yet!).

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

457203461.name: Excellent
457203461.author: a TripAdvisor user
457203461.reviewBody: Nice option to spend your time in Monterrey. But I recommend to go there by taxi, they can ride you up to the moutain. There is a little value that must be payed to gp up by car, but is relatively cheap. The view in the sightseeing is aewsome!

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

456188978.name: Nicest park and mountains in Monterrey
456188978.author: a TripAdvisor user
456188978.reviewBody: This park is located in San Pedro in Monterrey. It is the closest park to the city and probably the one with the most beautiful views. You can practice mountain biking, hiking, running and pretty much all outdoor activities and even enjoy a picnic with the beautiful view of the mountains.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

455987609.name: Outstanding View!
455987609.author: a TripAdvisor user
455987609.reviewBody: Went for a little bit of walking in this park, the entry fees are very low, total captured in nature, some hiking tracks are a little bit rough but doable. Nice for the weekend. Once up you have a great View ober Monterrey!

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

454279984.name: Beautiful
454279984.author: a TripAdvisor user
454279984.reviewBody: It is a great place for a great variety of outdoors activities, it has some parks for small kids and several good hiking routes with gorgeous views on top of them, its a good place to exercise, run, bike and hike with either friends, family or couple and even alone, you can also see a lot of ecological diversity with animals and a lot of different plants which are explained throughout the route.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

447044085.name: A very good place for adventurous people
447044085.author: a TripAdvisor user
447044085.reviewBody: Natural place and that what makes it perfect. You can see animals if you\'re an animal lover, or you can stay away from them and they\'ll not harm you. \nA very good place to hike but you need to go there early because it takes time to go up and down. I read that if you want to go till the top " La M" you need to be up there before 10 am. Otherwise, or reach the top of the hiking but not the climbing, and also you need a permission to climb; an application that you can find online. Old place if you love hiking and climbing, you\'ll see amazing view up there but take some food with you, as the hotel and the restaurants are not open on all the days. Good luck!

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

445270959.name: Enjoyable
445270959.author: a TripAdvisor user
445270959.reviewBody: The concrete slides are great. If you have Dickie pants you will slide super fast. I climbed the mountain to the top. It is pretty hard and no trails but fun.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

443832612.name: Nice and safe family hiking, and pic-nic place
443832612.author: a TripAdvisor user
443832612.reviewBody: This is a must do in Monterrey specially if you come from a place with no mountains. It has beautiful trails and you get to see native birds, squirrels, maybe a black bear but i havent seen any. It is very important to take enough w\u00e1terand some food, specially in spring and summer days; it gets super hot.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

443804030.name: Chipinque, always gorgeous
443804030.author: a TripAdvisor user
443804030.reviewBody: Been there a few times, always gorgeous walks and views from the city . You can get lost thinking you are not even close to a city. Take a light jacket can be a bit fresh anytime of the year . \n

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

440749712.name: Beautiful - A must see!
440749712.author: a TripAdvisor user
440749712.reviewBody:
We stayed at the Krystal hotel. We took a cab and had him drop us off at the entrance to the park. There is a hotel at the top that you can go to but we wanted to start at the bottom. It was easy to get there. Getting back might be a problem. But I'll get to that. We spent 4.5 hours walking the winding street and trails up the mountain. It is a moderate hike. You start out below the clouds. We went for Thanksgiving and it was very humid but a comfortable temperature. Because of the humidity some of the rocks on the ground get slippery. I wore my basic athletic tennis shoes. There were some parts I would have liked to have my hiking shoes but I managed without them just fine. My shoes kept caking up with thick clay mud, then you come to a steep incline with smooth rocks. It was hard to get traction sometimes. But again, I managed. You hike and hike then you get stuck in the cloud coverage. You can't see the views at all but it is very green and pretty in that area. It is obvious there is regular high humidity cloud coverage at that altitude all the time because of how mossy and green EVERYTHING was. I joked that I felt like we were in Portland. Anyway, you walk in the fog and clouds for quite some time then when you start to get tired of walking you make it to the top above the cloud coverage. It is worth it. DO IT! And know that it will take up your morning and afternoon to explore. We walked and walked our way down back to the bottom where the entrance was with no idea how we were going to get back. Cabs are not allowed to actually pick you up in the park. We basically just exited the park and started walking away. About 10 minutes later a cab saw us and asked if we wanted a ride and we hopped in. If you bought international cell coverage and could use your phone for Uber or a cab it wouldn't be a problem but we didn't. So we just got lucky to have a cab go past us. I assume a lot of tourists go there so waiting for a cab probably isn't that big of a deal. $450 pesos for the cab ride from Chipuque to our hotel (Barrio Antiguo). 

You want to have good tennis shoes at least and or maybe trail shoes. I don't know that you need to go full out hiking boots. A light jacket is a good idea. It gets very cool at the top.

This was my favorite thing to do in Monterrey!

You cannot bring your dog.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

439496450.name: Excelent place for a weekend trip!
439496450.author: a TripAdvisor user
439496450.reviewBody: We have visited Chipinque park several times and, weather notwithstanding, it has always been a great place for a fun weekend. Walking up the mountain is not only a good bit of exercise, it\'s also relaxing after a week of hard work. If you enjoy the outdoors, nature and the occasional encounter with some friendly wildlife, this is the place for you!

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

433420489.name: Excellent park for adventure & outdoors lovers
433420489.author: a TripAdvisor user
433420489.reviewBody:
People who like adventure, outdoors, biking and trail hiking should not miss visiting Chipinque. Their visit will be rewarded with mountain atmosphere and the best views of Monterrey City.

They do have a cozy hotel at the top of the mountain. It's not the best hotel, but good if you want a getaway 15 minutes from the city that feels like you are hours away.

Highly recommended
Expect many visitors on weekends.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

431919857.name: A Great Place to Exercise
431919857.author: a TripAdvisor user
431919857.reviewBody: A place where you can walk, run or cycle.  There\u00b4s a paved street   that gets you  to the top ( about an hour walking- 15 mi. by car), and many trails that will also get you to the top.  There is a small fee at the entrance of the park  that you have to pay.  You can drive up to the central park  or walk all the way up.  There is enough place to park your car either at the entrance or  up in the park.  The park has some games for children and there is a hotel with a good restaurant where you can eat.  The view of the city is fantastic.  Once you get to the park, there are several trails that continue up the mountain. In addition to the fantastic view of the city,  you\u00b4ll be surrounded by a beautiful forest.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

429247542.name: Beautiful time with my kids!
429247542.author: a TripAdvisor user
429247542.reviewBody: The place is beautiful and if you are a sports lover or you like to jog or hike, this a great option for you. On the "meseta" you have this nice benches and playground. There are two big slides for older kids, or yourself! Lots of fun!\nDefinitely take food and water with you because up there there are no options and in the small cabin the food is really expensive.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

428696361.name: Something for everyone and super location with super views
428696361.author: a TripAdvisor user
428696361.reviewBody: My husband and I went to the park to go hiking one morning.  The installations at the park are top notch (many and clean bathrooms, shops, water fountains) and the trails are very well-maintained.  We had the opportunity to see a large buck during our hike as well as some coatis.  We hiked from the almost the entrance up to "la meseta" where there are so many things to do for families and couples.  We had a healthy breakfast of fruit and yogurt and a fresh orange juice - perfect after our 45 minutes hike!  I\'m already gearing up for next weekend when we can visit again.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

423566733.name: Amazing scenery ..
423566733.author: a TripAdvisor user
423566733.reviewBody: I visited with my friends family - it was beautiful and an amazing hike . I love the scenery in the mountains around Monterrey , most spectacular :-) it\'s worth taking a day to visit - saludos Mexico

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

419745976.name: Impressive view
419745976.author: a TripAdvisor user
419745976.reviewBody: The access is easy and there is plenty of space to park. The park is amazing with a lot of hiking trails. The best of all is the view from the different points of the trail.\n

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

419287223.name: Awesome park
419287223.author: a TripAdvisor user
419287223.reviewBody: The views from the top is spectacular it will take your breath away. You can of the surround city from there. It is pretty amazing.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

417280008.name: Excellent place to hike and spend the day!!!
417280008.author: a TripAdvisor user
417280008.reviewBody: I have been here multiple times since 2007. I was unaware of Trip Advisor at that time. Great and very inexpensive place to take the family on a Saturday hike or to just spend the day playing at the park. The views of Monterey and it\'s Metropolitan Area are amazing and beautiful. Very easy access from the city. Great for families of all ages. Beautiful views!!!

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

416273389.name: One of my favourite places in Monterrey
416273389.author: a TripAdvisor user
416273389.reviewBody: This park is only a few minutes away from the Monterrey. It offers interesting walks with great views of the city. There is a hotel and restaurant for those who need a drink after exercise.  The paths are generally easy though there are a great variety to choose from. You can also take you bike as the paths are wide enough from both walkers and bikers.\nIf you wish for something more strenuous there are walking routes up to the peaks but you are supposed to register with the park before attempting them. You can register using the parks website a couple of days in advance of your trip. The walk to "Copete del Aguila" is my favourite but the routes to the "M" and the "Ventana" are also worth doing. I believe guides are available. The routes to the top are moderately difficult.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

415907669.name: EXCELLENT VIEW OF THE CITY,
415907669.author: a TripAdvisor user
415907669.reviewBody: The park is visited for the locals to do trails walks and other by bike through the carpet road , you can drive to the top by car too , on top you will find the end of the road  and a  parking lot , there  is an a hotel too  with a bar inside of the hotel , there are some slide ramps to play for children and some adults get fun too, you will find a snacks place where you can buy chips and sandwiches  and drinks like water bottle and pop drinks, there is an spectacular view point to take pictures. You can watch birds, butterflies and squirrels.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

409997506.name: Great trails and views
409997506.author: a TripAdvisor user
409997506.reviewBody: Great walking, running and biking trails for all level of expertise. Breathtaking views. No pets allowed. Take your own water bottle just in case, there are water spots on the way but few and far between. The more expert trails require a guide. Beautiful place to exercise at all different levels. Minimum fee to enter. Try and go early in the morning because otherwise it is too hot. Your get to see all sorts of wildlife! In my 15 years in Monterey one of my favorite places without a doubt! Enjoy! I am sure you will! Especially if you like the outdoors and spectacular views!!

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

408010440.name: Great Place for Hiking
408010440.author: a TripAdvisor user
408010440.reviewBody: Great Trails for solo/friends/family hiking ... green blue and black trails ... If you are lucky you can spot coatis, beautiful birds and even bears ....

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

405093040.name: Best spot in Monterrey!
405093040.author: a TripAdvisor user
405093040.reviewBody: Excelent place to visit with family, to hike, to trekk, to run, to bike, to do lots of things!\nAmazing views, lots of trails with various difficulty levels...\nOnly thing is to avoid the most crowded days (i would say sat and sun afternoon)

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

404165332.name: Traditional family attraction.
404165332.author: a TripAdvisor user
404165332.reviewBody: My family and I enjoyed a very cold but sunny day in this ecological park. You must be prepared with your winter clothes, because it gets about 8-10 grades  lower than the city. Anyway there were a lot of people in January, enjoying running, working out, admiring the magnificent views of the city or the colorful birds flying around , children in the play zone etc.  We were very interested  in the comments the biologist gave us about insects, especially the monarc butterflies and other rare insects.  Several  places to buy snacks, tables, benches and barbecue grills. There is also a hotel up there, where they can have meetings or weddings. Entrance fee for a car was $100.00 pesos ( about 6 usd ), but is different fee if you go up there by bycicle, and there are several walking  ways to get up there. Recommended for everyone!

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

401454104.name: Excellent ..!!
401454104.author: a TripAdvisor user
401454104.reviewBody: It is an excellent place that neither you imagine within urbanity that has industrial city of Monterrey\n\nIt is a lung for the local community, has a hotel and restaurant at the top of the mountain, from where you can admire the landscape of the city of Monterrey; it is a place you should visit if you\'re business in Monterey

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

400449796.name: A Must do in Monterrey
400449796.author: a TripAdvisor user
400449796.reviewBody: Chipinque was one of the highlights of my trip to Monterrey.  The view is amazing from the top. Be sure and bring camera.   Although I didn\'t personally have a chance to hike, I was told by locals that the trails in Parque Chipinque are good, safe, and popular on the weekends.  This is truly an oasis in a very large city.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

399159464.name: Breathtaking
399159464.author: a TripAdvisor user
399159464.reviewBody: I visit this place almost everytime i come home. Gives you a first hand experience of how beautiful nature really use and get good exercise as well. I recommend this hike for those who are adventurous and can handle heights and medium physical endurance. The pay off is the scenery at the top. Don\'t recommend on a rainy or foggy day or very early in the morning as it gets pretty muddy.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

398037651.name: Beautiful scenery.
398037651.author: a TripAdvisor user
398037651.reviewBody: This ride is best appreciated if done on foot. It requires walking a distance of several kilometers to reach the top of this mountain, so it requires medium physical condition, or if you prefer you can go up by car.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

397732913.name: Nature in the city
397732913.author: a TripAdvisor user
397732913.reviewBody: Chipinque is a natural place within the city of Monterrey. Located in San Pedro Garza Garcia municipality. You can access by car, bike, walking (takes a little longer). The park has beautiful sights, trails, places to rest and eat something. It is very secure and clean. Sometimes you can see big animals like black bears (rarely, but they do not attack), deer, coati, chipmunks and many birds, insects and plant species. You can practice hiking, trekking, mountain bike and can climb the peaks with previous authorization. There is a private hotel at the plateau, and an open space with a playground and some tables so you can have a picnic. There are many beautiful spots and sights of the city and the mountain range you can see when walking on the trails. You can make a short visit or stay longer if you want to explore more than one trail. Better to bring comfortable walking shoes or boots, a camera, sunglasses and sunblock. \nI recommend it widely for all the family.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

397621978.name: Awesome view
397621978.author: a TripAdvisor user
397621978.reviewBody: Just breathtaking! Loved it all the way to the top covered with pine and oak trees. Very clean and safe. Although burning hot in the city up in Chipinque nice and cool.  Good place to enjoy with the family specially with kids. On the hiking side is more for mid-experienced hikers.  Want to get away from the city and yet be close? Choose Chipinque and Breathe!

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

396643110.name: Magic Mountain
396643110.author: a TripAdvisor user
396643110.reviewBody:
Chipinque is the crown jewel of Monterrey mountains. The city is surrounded by them. The city's elevation is around 2,000 ft., and Chipinque's highest peak, El Copete de las Aguilas or simply El Copete, stands at 7,300 ft. The Park (it is a National Park) is full of options, either for top athletes and as well as for the average person.

When you arrive at the Park there is a booth (2,900 ft.). You may either park outside and walking in is cheaper, or you can bring your car inside the Park. 50 yards after the checkpoint, to the left is the Visitor's Center (CAV), open from 9:00 to 6:00 daily, where you can snack and get info and maps. There is a 7 km very winding paved road that will take you to the Meseta (4,300 ft), next to the hotel entrance. The driving is scenic, with views of the city. The hotel is not part of the park but the views from there are very good.

If you rather walk or hike, there are plenty of options. You can simply walk up the paved road, carefully, because there is traffic. When taking trails, make sure you know where you are going. Get a map or ask the park people. Road signs are decent, but you can get lost. There are plenty of trails with different grades of difficulty, for hiking, biking or mountain biking. If you want to bike you have to bring your own bike and buy a license plate (around $10).

For regular hiking, my favorite is La Brecha del Chile trail, about a 1,000 ft hike over a mile long. Another option is driving up to Km. 5, what is called Canoas, and take Las Moras , a very flat, shady and somewhat longer trail. If you drive up to La Meseta, you have several very nice options. The road to El Pinar (5,000 ft), taken from here, is a 2 to 4 hour hike. El Tubo Enterrado is another good option. There are other shorter hikes. 

For serious hiking to the 3 main peaks: El Copete (7,500 ft, 6-8 hours), La Ventana ( 6,200 ft, 4-6 hours) or La M (6,660 ft, 5-7 hours) you need a permit (3-4 days in advance) and a guide (can be provided by the park). There is a stop before La Ventana called Las Antenas, which is a shorter option with the same spectacular view. You usually depart from La Meseta at 4,300 ft. The views of the Sierra Madre Oriental mountains is breathtaking. 

Another option is just finding a Picnic spot, of which there are several along the paved road and enjoying the view. Weather is several degrees cooler than in the city, so check before you go. There are snack stores in the CAV and in La Meseta.

There are plenty of squirrels, badgers and woodpeckers. Bears can be also seen at times. 

I live here and have been visiting this mountain for many years. It really is a magic mountain.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

392962411.name: A must visit in Monterrey
392962411.author: a TripAdvisor user
392962411.reviewBody: Monterrey doesn\'t have many touristic attractions, but this park located in the hill is a must for outdoor lovers and hikers as you can enjoy the forest and the views from the top are amazing.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

391191876.name: "Great for trekking and MTB"
391191876.author: a TripAdvisor user
391191876.reviewBody: Great place to do some trekking, going all the way up to the "M", "Copete de las Aguilas" (you need a guide), walk, nice MTB trails or route bike for 7 km. up.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

386803722.name: I live here!!
386803722.author: a TripAdvisor user
386803722.reviewBody: Chipinque is the best that is why I live here, mountin, forest, wildlife including bird seeing and the best tracks for jogging, mountain bike and climbing! 5 minutes away from the buzzing city it transports you into relaxation, best climate also!!

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

386237308.name: For the nature lover in all of us
386237308.author: a TripAdvisor user
386237308.reviewBody: Fresh air, sunshine, a beautiful place to hike or sit and picnic with friends. The views are amazing! You can see the entire city from the top of the park.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

386226135.name: Padrisimo
386226135.author: a TripAdvisor user
386226135.reviewBody: I like it so much.we went as a family it was foggy but it was a beautiful experience , i highly recommended, you should go.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

383561943.name: For nature lovers!
383561943.author: a TripAdvisor user
383561943.reviewBody: Not an easy hike but worth to see the city view, wether going through the road or the wood\'s path! You can go all the way up if you pay for the car, so even if you don\'t want to hike/walk up, you can still drive all the way up.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

382380741.name: Excellent outdoor activities \ud83c\udf32
382380741.author: a TripAdvisor user
382380741.reviewBody:
Either a good workout out or just some face to face time with mother nature, Chipinque is one of the places that you can go if you want a break from the city and have nice fresh air.
Good choice for picnics with friends or family (beware of the animals that are there, if you bring lunch you might as well get robbed by a squirrel or a bird, they are used to people.) There are checkpoints where you can drink water, places to rest (picnic tables with benches)  and games to bring your children. 

Won't recommended if it's raining season, or super hot weather. 

Best time to go 8:00 am and during the week to avoid too much people.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

380592300.name: View
380592300.author: a TripAdvisor user
380592300.reviewBody: Nice place to go for a hike or biking. Get a really nice view at the top. One of the nice place to see in Monterrey

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

374258968.name: Great get away
374258968.author: a TripAdvisor user
374258968.reviewBody: Only a few minutes drive from downtown San Pedro, it is definitely the best place to go to get away form the busy streets and hectic life of Monterrey. Offers a wide variety of walking/hiking trails for all ages and even cross-country and downhill biking. Stay at the hotel to extend your getaway.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

371187224.name: Sunday visit
371187224.author: a TripAdvisor user
371187224.reviewBody: We had some time to kill before heading to the airport and decided to take the short drive up the mountain. We weren\'t disappointed.   Lovely view.  There is also a restaurant at the top, so you can eat with a view.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

367621647.name: Intoxicating
367621647.author: a TripAdvisor user
367621647.reviewBody: Spent six hours hiking from the park entrance to El Pinar, parts of it in pouring rain, in cheap sandals, and I would definitely do it again. The views are incredible, and there are so many options for how to spend your time here: you can drive your car pretty far into the park, or walk, you can take more undulating trails, or go for more grueling routes. There are facilities and park guards, and on the Saturday that I went, hikers and runners and bikers- not so isolated that you worry about being lost for days. Make sure to take a picture of the trail map at the entrance, the maps that are along the paths were faded and illegible.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

367592373.name: For nature lovers
367592373.author: a TripAdvisor user
367592373.reviewBody: this is a unique place you can find on top a mountain but inside the city, if you want to breathe fresh air, enjoy a nice picnic or if you are a fan of working out, this is the place for you, it has a road or you can go up using the trail through the mountain, it\'s a protected area you can find wild animals like bears, deer, and squirrels, during the winter it\'s the perfect place to visit for snow and wonderful views.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

367277800.name: Not to be missed
367277800.author: a TripAdvisor user
367277800.reviewBody: Whether you are on a business trip or just visiting Monterrey as a tourist it is a \u201cmust\u201d to visit Chipinque if you have the time, you will have the opportunity to see Monterrey from the top and also to see the nature of the most important mountains of Nuevo Le\u00f3n.\nIt is consider a National park, it is very well preserved and secure, you have to pay a small fee at the entrance and you have opportunity to either drive to the top or even use the incredible trials on a mountain bike or walking it is worth it; If you do this in the afternoon you probably will have opportunity to see the sunset, it is amazing, when you get to the top where the restaurant is you can have one of the good Monterrey beers, restaurant is good, do not expect any fancy place but nice \nENJOY

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

365865202.name: Chipinque parque natural
365865202.author: a TripAdvisor user
365865202.reviewBody:
Beautiful park in the Sierra Madre at the edge of the city 
You can take a ride in your car all the way up to the hotel restaurant were you will have a fantastic panoramic of the city and the mountains.  

You can also walk thou the tracks and make it to the top in about an hour.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

365710421.name: Nice views
365710421.author: a TripAdvisor user
365710421.reviewBody: If you love eco park\u00b4s this is the one, you can walk at varius paths already marked. There is a nice hotel, restaurant, and playground for kid\u00b4s of all ages

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

362184777.name: Full Nature in the middle of the city
362184777.author: a TripAdvisor user
362184777.reviewBody: There are some places in the vicinity of Mty but none of them are as near to the city as Chipinque, part of the beautiful Sierra Madre Mountains, this park is spectacular, you can walk, bike run is up to you, I love going there, having that contact with nature, will recommend it to everyone.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

362170295.name: A must, best city views
362170295.author: a TripAdvisor user
362170295.reviewBody: Wonderful breath taking views, very careful and slow driving up or down, excellent exercise if you can walk it to the top, $100 pesos entrance about $6US dlls per car.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

355592363.name: A marvel of nature
355592363.author: a TripAdvisor user
355592363.reviewBody: watch the sunrise from a place like this has no comparison, see the city far away and forget all the problems for a moment..  it is always relaxing a reunion with the nature

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

353409926.name: Great trekking spot in Monterrey
353409926.author: a TripAdvisor user
353409926.reviewBody: Excellent place to trek if you are a nature lover. The park is being maintained very well and the signboards are really helpful. The trek has been divided into zones which helped to take rest and gain energy before continuing the next zone of trekking. As we went there on a Sunday, the park had lot of trekkers of varied age groups. \n\nAdvisable to carry water and may be some juices along with as there is just one convenience shop at the entry to the trekking.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

352199731.name: Amazing!
352199731.author: a TripAdvisor user
352199731.reviewBody: It is the most beautiful reserve that we have in Nuevo Leon Mexico. You can walk diverse types of trails. If you are lover to the Mountain Bike they have some trails to practices that. The view is amazing. I love to go on weekends. The temperature is different when you are in the city and when you are in Chipinque. They have a Hotel and restaurant. It is good, is not bad. It is not a luxury hotel but you can feel the experience!. I recommend a lot to visit this Park.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

345714516.name: We had so much fun!
345714516.author: a TripAdvisor user
345714516.reviewBody: If I lived closer to this location I would be on the trails almost every single day. Absolutely beautiful! Wildlife could be seen everywhere, and there were plenty of breathtaking views.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

341565923.name: Best outdoors place in town
341565923.author: a TripAdvisor user
341565923.reviewBody:
If your looking for outdoor activities like hiking or bike. This is the place to be.

The mountains are huge the trail its level one so anyone can do it. Once your in the top the views are incredibly.

You can also do it by car

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

341522835.name: Awesome views
341522835.author: a TripAdvisor user
341522835.reviewBody: We hiked using the high/difficult trails. Very tough hike but it was very awesome and totally worth it. the hard route not for the weak there is only trail no stairs up.. make sure you take the lighter route if you prefer stairs.. my legs are still sore from hike because ive never done it before and we took the wrong very hard trail on accident lol it was very tough but fun.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

340458931.name: Great afternoon - a close drive from the city
340458931.author: a TripAdvisor user
340458931.reviewBody: Having an extra day to explore Monterrey on a recent business trip, I drove to Chipinque to hike.  The drive is easy and close to the city.  I recommend you pay the higher park entrance (100$ MX) to drive all the way to the top.  I went on a hike that was quite challenging near the top and found the views and the landscape to be quite enjoyable.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

339753834.name: Recommended to go throught the pathways
339753834.author: a TripAdvisor user
339753834.reviewBody: This place is good to go on foot, steep pathways lead you to the top of the mountain where you can see the whole city on a clear day, unfortunately Monterrey is so polluted that those days don\'t come easy but worth the trip. Primitive place without handicap access and you better be on good shape. not recommended for senior citizens on foot however you can drive all the way to the top for a fee.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

330154643.name: Pinywoods and mountains
330154643.author: a TripAdvisor user
330154643.reviewBody: This place is great to exercise and spent time outdoors. Dress accordingly as the temperature will differ from that of the city. Its incredible to go from a densely populated city to a calm outdoors setting surrounded by pine trees and wildlife. Good place to observe birds and other small animals, if you keep still and quiet. There is an entrance fee, and behind the restaurant/bathrooms, you will find a rental for bicycles. Know your strengths and plan accordingly, it is an all uphill biking road. Or you could hike up. Paths are relatively well marked. Weekdays have the least visitors.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

328483430.name: Very nice park so close to the city
328483430.author: a TripAdvisor user
328483430.reviewBody: Great walking experience here, we went on a sunny day and didn\'t trek all the way up but it is a very peaceful environment so close to the city. If you go before 10am you can actually hike up the moountain along little trails that are also fun for kids

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

326106106.name: Incredible
326106106.author: a TripAdvisor user
326106106.reviewBody: Incredible to have such a mountaning paradise so close to the city and yet so full of natural wonders. I like to ride from home (7K to the park entrance), and then ride up the paved road (another 7K to the top). Also ride my MTB from home through the San Agustin single-track, then Deslavada, and all up to El Pinal; awesome ride, very challenging...  And that\'s only what I most often do. There are so many tracks to follow, either by foot or MTB.\nFor the family, the kids love to ride their MTBs on the Empalme, and then go back to the playgrounds, specially the big concrete slides.\nTotally recomended for everyone.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

323186549.name: Amazing!
323186549.author: a TripAdvisor user
323186549.reviewBody: This place is a must if you\'re exploring Monterrey/San Pedro. Photos can\'t describe the experience. It is great better what you see. The hiking took us about 5 hours overall (about 3 reaching the top), if you like to do hiking is perfect! I really enjoyed. Amazing views from the top. (In case you have sinusitis as I am it is a little difficult to feel the oxygen near the top as in any mountain but nothing to worry about)

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

314158504.name: Perfect for a jog and Mountain Bike!
314158504.author: a TripAdvisor user
314158504.reviewBody:
If you cant bring your MTB, just pack your cycling shoes (SPD) gloves and helmet, in the entrance you can rent mid level aluminum bikes (Shimano Deore equiped, both single and double suspension) to cross country and down hill. 

Pretty scenic for nature and sights of city. You can find in your way "coaties", possums, snakes, spiders, chipmunks, and sometimes bears that are more afraid of you (I don't blame them) than the fear you may experience with this kind of encounters. 

Most of the time there is a good amountof people trekking, jogging and cycling for both paved road to the top of mountain hotel and the trails as well.

You will never go wrong visiting this beauty.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

289338726.name: Monterrey with a View
289338726.author: a TripAdvisor user
289338726.reviewBody:
Chipinque was my first ever experience with regards to exploring g Monterrey. After I'd won my battle with the Jet-Lag, we office co-workers decided to visit chipinque on a Sunday late morning.
I was mesmerised by the parks location. Situated on a hilltop, it is perfect spot for various activities. 
We were interested in trekking and so started our 7k trek. The cloudy weather made the trekking easy. While trekking, you can get a beautiful bird's-eye view of MTY at numerous spots. There are some fitness machines placed at intervals for the enthusiasts to sweat it even further.

After you complete your trek or activity you can also get some refreshments from the cafe at the entrance of the park. Chipinque's beauty goes hand in hand with the flora and fauna that surrounds it. An "ecologico parque" is a very suitable name for this location. 
However, please make sure you've your return planned out as it is very difficult to get a taxi/cab here. 
Moreover, the ideal time to visit Chipinque would early morning.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

285935275.name: Escape the heat and head for Chipinque
285935275.author: a TripAdvisor user
285935275.reviewBody: This is a great place to hike and trails are available for people of all fitness levels. Lots of wildlife and sometimes even bears. To go to the top of the mtn in your car it cost around 90 pesos and is well worth it. You can pay less and park at the lower level and hike up. There are play areas for kids and restrooms as well. It is also a good place to mountain bike. It is particularly nice in the summer when Chipinque is 10-20 degrees cooler than Monterrey. If you want food I suggest you bring it as only vending machines are available. The park does not offer much in the way of handicap accessibility but there are a few spots where you can park and take in views of the city and mountains.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

285119584.name: Nice views from the hotel and restaurant
285119584.author: a TripAdvisor user
285119584.reviewBody: Just went to the hotel restaurant for a meal - and to get some good views of Monterrey. Definitely worth the trip.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

284982185.reviewBody: If you live in mty or just came to visit these one of the most, in your agenda.. if is your first time and don\'t have a lot of  condition you can go directly in car and admire all the view it really is beautiful at the end you will be arrive a redt area were is  concrete slide.. dosen\'t metter your age please get in!! at last if you loke hike you can do it !

284761890.reviewBody: Chipinque Ecological Park is a place with all the amenities of the big city in the middle of an alpine environment where you can stay, eat at a restaurant with veranda to the city or to the Sierra Madre !. You can perform various sports or leisure, for adults or children activities, you can go cycling or you can hike along marked paths, already in the emblematic place known as "La Eme" you can climbing and rappelling. In your visit to Monterrey let not knowing this incredible place!

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

273901084.name: My training spa
273901084.author: a TripAdvisor user
273901084.reviewBody: Chipinquen is where I trained for my expeditions to highermmountains. Even its not so high in altitude at least gives you the opportunity to walk, climb or run the entire area. Well preserved. Water fountains and really nice places to exercise yoga or meditation. For the 3 higher peaks I recommend taking a guide which is availed upon request. You can see wild life and fauna which is rare in a place so closed to the city. You won\'t be lost as many sign are all over marking distance in km from where you are. Love this place. Entrance fee is charge if entering with any can of car and depends how high you are going. There also a yearly payment to make it easier if you go very often. I just love this place.

258680441.name: A must for any runner
258680441.author: a TripAdvisor user
258680441.reviewBody: Ok. If you are a Runner or Cyclist and is training for any Marathon or Triathlon race forget any other place to train in Monterrey and come here for Long Runs or Cycling Force Trainings (with Mountain Bike). You can find around Kms and Kms of tracks including all kind of pavements. The loss and gain altimeter is amazing and you can get +1000m Positive in around 20kms easy ran. This is the best place I ever ran on my long training sessions. A must. Great park.

It has great views of Monterrey and a good place to escape the heat of the city in the summer. Especially beatiful in Spring: march to may or fall: sep to nov. Grab your tennis shoes and go!!!

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

249151308.name: views to die for
249151308.author: a TripAdvisor user
249151308.reviewBody:
The ride is long but worth it. The views from up there are simply amazing. Up there when you arrive there is a playground and a big giant slide nothing fancy but fun for the children. Restrooms are clean, take toilet paper just in case there's none. You are in complete contact with nature up there its beautiful. Do take a light jacket as it will probably be a lot fresher than in the city since you are high up in a mountain. Wear comfortable shoes. Do take snacks and drinks if you plan to stay a while since they don't sell anything up there everyday of the week. Also make sure your tank is full of gas because we didn't see any gas stations nearby and we almost ran out of it. 

Hope this helps

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

242652040.name: A fresh place (at least a few degrees cooler than downtown) never crowded in the middle of a 4 million people town
242652040.author: a TripAdvisor user
242652040.reviewBody: A lot of different options: park the car just after paying the fee and walk up the path one hour to the "meseta", or drive up to the "meseta" (15 min. mountain drive, plenty of parking along the way, but maybe not at the "meseta" near the kids games park on sunday noon and afternoon). Even on sunday, plenty of parking at the Chipinque Hotel were you can have a drink or lunch, before walking out back east on the path to the "puerto del aire", a flat dirt drive closed to motor vehicle (one hour), then you have 3 new options: 1) a 30 minutes steep path to the "Pinal" and back on the same way; or 2) a 30 minutes not so steep of the same dirt road to the "Mesa del Epazote", where you can take a goat track back to the "Casa del General Almazan", which you passed half way between the "meseta" and the "Puerto del aire". Arriving above the "Casa del General", you can follow the same goat path to the west and finish on a dirt drive down to the kids game area (surprisingly you will have to open a fence, surrounding the kids games, which you would not be allowed to pass in the other way without having a permit to climb to the "M"); or 3) another goat track down from the "puerto del aire" to the entry  (if you parked just after the entry). See the map on http://www.chipinque.org.mx. Lots of precious vegetation to see, et view points on the city; in the afternoon, you will be in the shade, with the city shining under the sun.

199452731.name: Overhyped
199452731.author: a TripAdvisor user
199452731.reviewBody: The trails are alright, but I expected a lot more from the place. A lackluster hiking spot, considering you have to pay to get in. There are free spots within an one-hour drive that make Chipinque seem insipid.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

190754659.name: Nice Views and Something for Everyone
190754659.author: a TripAdvisor user
190754659.reviewBody: My wife and I did the very short drive from Monterrey to the park for the first time this last Saturday. There is a fee to get into the park and another small fee to be able to drive to the end of the road (total for both was 85 pesos). It is a steep winding drive, but the views of the city and the nearby neighborhood  (which reportedly includes some of the most exclusive property in Latin America) are excellent. Monterrey is in a beautiful setting. The park was heavily used when we were there - full of walkers, cyclists, runners and families with the kids playing in the park playgrounds. To get the feel of an "ecological park" you have to get away from the crowds by getting onto one of the trails that branch off from the main road. Some of the trails allow bikes and some just hikers.  There is a small nature museum near the entrance which is informative and entertaining for the kids. We were looking for birds in the park and the two most active areas were in the busy playground picnic area at the end of the road (Mexican Jay, Hepatic Tanager and Black-crested Titmouse) and in the pine forest (including Pine Flycatcher) on one of the side trails. We saw several raptors, including Golden Eagle soaring over. Several species of butterflies were out, even though winter is not the best time for butterflies. We\'d like to return and try cycling or walking to the end of the road. An easy must-visit for the visitor as well as the resident of Monterrey. We were impressed at how friendly people were in the park also.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

185848361.name: Green Area in Busy City
185848361.author: a TripAdvisor user
185848361.reviewBody: This Park is a beautiful green area that nestles in the Sierra Madre Mountains in the southern part of the city, it has many trails to walk, hike, run or ride mountain bike. There is wildlife, like squirrels, whitetail deer, black bear and many birds, as well as reptiles and many insects. You can find a Hotel up there with all the commodities, as well as picnic areas and games for the children. They also have guided tours to the top of the mountain, but you need to be in shape and will take more than a half a day to get there and back. It has a fee to enter and you can park your car in many areas from the entrance all the way up to the hotel area. If you like the outdoors then you will like Chipinque.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

178487509.name: Beautiful Place
178487509.author: a TripAdvisor user
178487509.reviewBody: We came for an archery competition and even though it rained and was muddy we enjoyed the park. It makes me want to go back and hike.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

174229666.name: A mountain in the city
174229666.author: a TripAdvisor user
174229666.reviewBody: If you visit the busy city of Monterrey, Mexico and you have time for a good exercise in a healthy environment, try Chipinque. It has been adapted for every member of the family and it has both easy and difficult trails. And, for the mountain biking lover, there is no place like Chipinque. You have to try it.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

173919701.name: A very pleasant park.
173919701.author: a TripAdvisor user
173919701.reviewBody: The park is above the hustle and bustle of the city, and it is often a little bit cooler than down by  the river. There is a restaurant with views of the city and valley below. There is an olympic-sized swimming pool. I don\'t know the hours, since we have just driven up there to look and see what there is to do. I think there are some hiking trails, too.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

171532348.name: Awesome Place!
171532348.author: a TripAdvisor user
171532348.reviewBody: It is one of the most awesome natural places i\'ve visited in Nuevo Le\u00f3n. You can practice hiking, cycling and enjoy the wonderful view of the city.\n\nDuring any season of the year you can go to Chipinque and stay relaxed in the Nature.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

169654270.name: More cherished by outsiders
169654270.author: a TripAdvisor user
169654270.reviewBody: It happens frequently to locals: we take our mountains for granted. Then a visitor comes and we see them through their eyes; just then we rediscover how beautiful they are.  To call them, we use a word in Spanish that actually means "hill" (cerro) even though they\u00b4re real mountains. You need to be a skilled hiker to climb "Cerro de la Silla"/ Saddle Mountain (every other month a rescue team must retrieve an injured climber), but anyone can enjoy Chipinque, a plateau half way of "Cerro de la Eme"/Em Mountain.\nIn fact, the word Chipinque means plateau in a long forgotten local dialect. A very winding road will take you to several viewpoints. There\u00b4s even a nice restaurant and a cabins hotel in the plateau, mostly used for family gatherings, businessmen congresses and office team buildings. An experience driver can make 15 minutes form foothill to Chipinque, but novice should take double. But hiking and biking is the main attraction of this natural reserve park, either on the road or the trails. If you want to continue to the peak -the M- you will need a guide and notify the park keepers at the entrance. \nIt\u00b4s forbidden to light fires.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

167351785.name: Breezing ~
167351785.author: a TripAdvisor user
167351785.reviewBody: We were 12 person in the trip to Chipinque. It was awesome, the trail is good. You can either choose to take the hill step or the tar road. We had a simple picnic at the la meseta, it was breezing and I felt bit cold and foggy, its totally different weather in Monterrey. We had a slide there too, its been ages since my last slide when I was a kid. It was fantastic to play like a child again !!!

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

The view is beutiful of the area, there are roads for hiking and biking, we went to top and there are a rest area, we went on Monday and some atractions and restaurant was close :-(

You will love it, if you like natural views, and hiking/bikings

Go with close shoes, there are sharp stones on road, not wheelchair access.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

148201645.name: Beautiful views

I certainly plan to go back to explore hikes and trails during my next visit, but I would encourage people to go after sunset. By the way, the entry fee is refunded if one eats at the restaurant.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

It was a fantastic way to spend part do the day.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

136141935.reviewBody: I was surprised at how quickly we could be out of the city and up in the mountains.  You can either walk up the steep steps or drive up. address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

131978124.name: Great view from the top
131978124.author: a TripAdvisor user
131978124.reviewBody: National Park in Monterrey, About 1,500 mts high 1,000mts higher than Monterrey, so cool, you can see the vegetation change from dry scrub and cactus to Moctezuma pines. In the spring red bush, wild peach, squirrels and blue jays. If feeling energetic it is a tough healthy climb to the me seta where there is a hotel and restaurant. Otherwise take a car or taxi. In the hot months walking should be done very early morning. Once there look over the whole of the metropolis of Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

129131256.name: Hotel on top of the hill Chipinque
129131256.author: a TripAdvisor user
129131256.reviewBody: Went there on Sunday.  The hotel offers a buffet lunch.  Considering they are the only place on top of the hill for a lunch, the food was regular.  Some items were very good, stuffed chicken in mango sauce and the beef in wine sauce.  The desset menu could use a little more imagination as well as the drinks (it\'s mostly cool-aid).  The service is acceptable for a casual lunch.  A bit pricey for the quality.  The hotel could do with a lttle  paint and the gardens need a lot of care.  The coatis (cute long tailed racoon looking tree climbing animals) were in charge of entertainment.  Lovely nature and sights from downtown Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Camino a Meseta de Chipinque 12 Km. al sur de Monterrey

125668047.author: a TripAdvisor user

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

643665113.name: Calma
643665113.author: a TripAdvisor user
643665113.reviewBody:
Scenic man made river that starts from Parque Fundidora to Macroplaza. 

You can take a boat ride from Parque Fundidora/Museo Historia (near Macroplaza) that costs about 60 pesos. 

If you are from Parque Fundidora, the nearest entrance to the boats is at A1.  Make sure you type “Lanchas Del Paseo Santa Lucía” on Uber if you wanna go to the boats. Don’t put Paseo Santa Lucía only since you will be dropped off in the middle of the street.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

643611455.name: River Barge
643611455.author: a TripAdvisor user
643611455.reviewBody:
On a New Year’s trip with Go With Jo from Harlingen. TX, one of the included sites was the St. Lucia (Lucy) River barge ride. 
This attraction is in the steel mill foundry park or Parque Fundidora near downtown Monterrey.  The one-way, 25-minute ride goes from one end of the park to the other. The water looks like pool water but it comes from the underground San Lucia River. This attraction is well maintained. The barge driver explains the sites in English and Spanish. His English is heavily accented but understandable. 
The prices are more than reasonable. Adults are $3, Seniors and children 5-10 are $2, and children 4 and under are free. 
We were here on Dec. 31 in the early afternoon and the line was long but it moved fast. A barge comes by every 15 minutes. 
The San Lucia River barge ride is a must when you visit Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

641447117.name: Monterrey deserved this type of attraction
641447117.author: a TripAdvisor user
641447117.reviewBody: Not only the city of Monterrey rescued an area which had been abandoned for decades if not for centuries. It added a tourist attraction for visitors as well as for locals. Although San Antonio, TX river walk was first, Monterrey\u2019s is far larger. The boat ride is $60 pesos per adult and it includes a round trip with the opportunity to get out of the boat at the opposite end of the ride to tour the surroundings, either the Macroplaza or the Fundidora park. This river walk sits where it once was the bank of the Santa Luc\u00eda water wells where Monterrey was founded more than 400 years ago. Talk about a place with history.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro
