At the one end is the Museum of Mexican history where you can take in some history and cool off a bit. Very enjoyable and not too far from the bustle of the downtown area.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

559691941.reviewBody: Beautiful place to come out for a walk, an ice-cream, or even a ride on a bicycle. It connects to various activities and locations such as Plaza Sesamo, Fundidora, and the Steel Museum. A must if you want to get good pictures with the Cerro de la Silla on the background.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

558464579.name: Must go to Monterrey
558464579.author: a TripAdvisor user
558464579.reviewBody: Paseo Santa Lucia is a \u201ctourist area\u201d is very safe, nice, and clean with a rich history, has museums, restaurants, gondolas and pre historic inspired zip line park.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

558155687.name: Average at best. Restaurant scene mentioned in other reviews seems pretty dim.
558155687.author: a TripAdvisor user
558155687.reviewBody: Average at best. Restaurant scene mentioned in other reviews seems pretty dim.\n\nNot much to see along the river except some highways and buildings ... pretty artificial.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

557193214.name: Must see in Monterrey
557193214.author: a TripAdvisor user
557193214.reviewBody: The place is gorgeous you can walk next to the water or take a ride on a boat, also the restaurants along the \u201criver\u201d are delicious!

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

555429905.name: Tourist Area
555429905.author: a TripAdvisor user
555429905.reviewBody: Is a tourist area to visit while in Monterrey \nThere is a boat trip you can take\nAnd resteraunt around the artificial lake with live music

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

554988355.name: Very enjoyable
554988355.author: a TripAdvisor user
554988355.reviewBody: Paseo de Santa Lucia is beautiful and was great to walk along. There are not many restaurants or snack carts, it is more for enjoying the scenery of the area.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

553584447.name: A great place in downtown
553584447.author: a TripAdvisor user
553584447.reviewBody: Another must see site in the great city. Specially if you can bring the family (not my case, this was a long business trip)

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

553370140.name: Lovely but prepare for long lines
553370140.author: a TripAdvisor user
553370140.reviewBody: During my visit in August 2017, we took the boat from Parque Fundidora to MacroPlaza. The tour is very nice. We step off in Macroplaza and had a walk. But when we wanted to go back to Parque Fundidora, we had to wait for 1.5 hours on line to get to another boat. However, you have to do it at least one time or very or during weekdays. Sure you are going to enjoy it.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

552817749.name: Soo beautiful!
552817749.author: a TripAdvisor user
552817749.reviewBody: Adorable riverwalk with bridges and outside cafes, restaurants and lovely shops. Beautiful place to have dinner and unwind! Highly recommend it!

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

551378193.name: Beautiful family place
551378193.author: a TripAdvisor user
551378193.reviewBody: Beautiful place to take a walk even with a very hot weather. The trees keep you from the sun. You can get in some museums there or take a boat in the Santa Lucia River. You can rent a bicycle or take your skates. Very nice

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

551315147.name: Very nice ride, must-see in MTY
551315147.author: a TripAdvisor user
551315147.reviewBody: If you visit Monterrey, be sure to take a boat from the Museo del Noreste, to Parque Fundidora. That way you will see many of the must-see places in the city. It is a very nice ride. Also, make sure to eat at the restaurant in Santa Luc\u00eda.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

550404621.name: Great boat ride!
550404621.author: a TripAdvisor user
550404621.reviewBody: You can travel from Parque Fundidora to the city center nearby the Mexican History Museum on a very beautiful and funny boat ride.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

548532770.name: Nice boat mini-tour
548532770.author: a TripAdvisor user
548532770.reviewBody: See the center of Monterrey from a boat with a tourist guide that explains the sight-seeing. Worth the ride!

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

547962107.name: My cousin said I would love it.
547962107.author: a TripAdvisor user
547962107.reviewBody: Amazing.  The boat ride was great and it\u2019s the only way.  I was blown away with how clean. Every turn had something new to see.  I have to say I had a great time sitting on a boat.  I would do it again it was the best boat ride I have almost ever had.  \n\nAbsolutely a must do

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

544443860.name: Scenic Relaxing Oasis through Monterrey
544443860.author: a TripAdvisor user
544443860.reviewBody:
What a beautiful way to spend an hour while visiting Monterrey! We had the opportunity to take a round trip on one of the little canal boats through this man-made canal.

There trip is full of things to look at — arts works, mosaics, bridges and water features. The water is clean and clear to look at, and there are great views of the mountains as you travel along the route.

This has a similar feel to the SAN Antonio riverwalk and was a welcome respite from a busy trip. Definitely worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

544129930.name: Beautiful way to see a nice part of the city
544129930.author: a TripAdvisor user
544129930.reviewBody: We went on a Saturday around 3pm. Didn\'t have to wait long although I hear it\'s usually a long wait. It cost 60 pesos. This includes the return trip. We took the boat from parque fundidora to the macro plaza. We returned around 5pm to parque fundidora. I definitely recommend to take it back around sunset as the area is beautifully lit.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

543208784.name: Must do while in Monterrey
543208784.author: a TripAdvisor user
543208784.reviewBody: This was one of my favorite activies we did in Monterrey. I can\'t think of another city in Mexico were you can experience a trip like this. It was fun for me and for my teenage newphew.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

539557663.name: very well artifical river inside the city
539557663.author: a TripAdvisor user
539557663.reviewBody: It\u00b4s a very well built water channel that conects from main downtown thru Parque Fundidora, it\u00b4s a must if you are visiting Monterrey, a family ride of one mile long

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

534454304.name: A NICE ATTRACTION
534454304.author: a TripAdvisor user
534454304.reviewBody: A popular site for Monterrey locals and also for tourists.  It is a nice boat ride over a canal that begins at La Fundidora Park and ends its journey at the Museum of History (Center of Monterrey) or vice versa.  On the way, you can enjoy nice views of murals, green areas, fountains, etc.  It is well conserved, clean boats and  cristal clear water.  The rides are every half hour and in each boat can ride approximately 20 people.  Fee is about $3 per person.  Recommended!

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

528829273.name: You definitely have to do it!
528829273.author: a TripAdvisor user
528829273.reviewBody: Take it at evening to avoid the hot weather of Monterrey, you can go in the boat and come back walking, have a nice and refreshing beer or any beverage of your preference.\nEnjoy it!

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

525228217.name: Great river walk!
525228217.author: a TripAdvisor user
525228217.reviewBody: Spent a leisurely Saturday afternoon walking the riverwalk from start to finish.  From the Governor\'s palace to Fundidora part.  Remember to bring your sun screen!  There are some restaurants on the water and a boat taxi you can take.  Beware of the line!  So plan accordingly.  Fundidora part is wonderful and deserves a review on its own.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

524982249.name: Walk in the park
524982249.author: a TripAdvisor user
524982249.reviewBody: I really enjoyed the walk on the Riverwalk. It was very well-designed is extremely clean. I recommend visiting.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

521176252.name: Nice way to know the place
521176252.author: a TripAdvisor user
521176252.reviewBody: We had the guided tour on boat for $60 MXP ($3.20 USD) and don\'t regret it. The boat was comfortable and the guide told us stories and made it fun. The boat ride is about 25 minutes long and very entertaining, Recommended.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

520897940.name: Very entertaining!!
520897940.author: a TripAdvisor user
520897940.reviewBody: You can ride a boat every 20 minutes. You buy your tickets and just wait for the ride. The guide make it very entertaining and fun, you can see sculptures, fountains, paintings along the Paseo Santa Luc\u00eda while you enjoy the fresh air and nice views of Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

519089660.name: beautiful
519089660.author: a TripAdvisor user
519089660.reviewBody: first time went during the day, second time around, went at night, absolutely gorgeous. plan to spend quite a few hours here, well worth it. ,

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

518973183.name: Romantic walk along the river.
518973183.author: a TripAdvisor user
518973183.reviewBody: We love this walk from the history museum to Fundidora and back. Weekends and evenings are wonderful times to take this walk and enjoy the people, the kids playing in the water, stopping for a fresh churro and seeing the saddle mountain. We have also taken the tour boat too and enjoyed, although the walk back and forth is our favorite. You can get great street food all along the way. Take lots of pictures and enjoy your walk with your sweetheart.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

507060057.name: Worth ride
507060057.author: a TripAdvisor user
507060057.reviewBody: My friend in Monterrey suggested me to visit this place. You can spend good amount of time on the boat. The boatman explains the surrounding area while tour but it\'s in spanish.....\ud83d\ude22

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

496955895.name: Fun ride
496955895.author: a TripAdvisor user
496955895.reviewBody: The paseo is pretty new for the city. The boat ride is a welcome rest and a great way ti travel from the Macroplaza to Fundidora. We had a great capitan his name is Jesus Garcia and he was very informative and also so funny! He made us laugh the whole ride!

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

496173182.name: Relaxing and Nice Scenery
496173182.author: a TripAdvisor user
496173182.reviewBody: It is very nice to go for a walk, specially around the Festival Santa Lucia, which is a street performing arts festival. During this event you will get to enjoy many performances all along the riverwalk, from plays, to photo displays, storytellers, dancers, singers, etc. For me, that is the best time to visit since the walk is very long, about 40 minutes one way in a regular pace, so enjoying the performances makes it very enjoyable. Sadly, no animals allowed.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

492066073.name: Great spot
492066073.author: a TripAdvisor user
492066073.reviewBody: You have to try the ride to downtown in a boat through the canal, it is a little like san antonio\'s river walk, at the stop in downtown step down and try the museums or just explore the city.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

489387372.name: Spectacular
489387372.author: a TripAdvisor user
489387372.reviewBody: Paseo Santa Lucia was a great park! Very big, We took the boat ride and we got a cool breeze. It was to hot and the lines we too long but moving quick.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

486683285.name: Spectacular riverfront
486683285.author: a TripAdvisor user
486683285.reviewBody: Walk the whole river front or take a scenic boat ride to see the waterfalls, landscaping and even museums! Beautiful and well maintained! One word of caution is to bring your own tissue or toilet paper to the restrooms as it is not provided.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

481831427.name: Nice but nothing especial
481831427.author: a TripAdvisor user
481831427.reviewBody: Well I had seen a lot of pictures and it looked to me like a place where you could go and have a nice time with friends and beers, or a romantic date. However, it is really not for that. We went to Monterrey for a concert and decided to go an explore paseo santa lucia, but the only attraction really is the boat ride because of the boat and river itself. I mean the view is nice but is nothing special, and there is only 1 restaurant or more like a bar in the whole place... So in conclusion is nice, kind of relaxing but thats it.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

479394609.name: Great ride - beautiful scenery
479394609.author: a TripAdvisor user
479394609.reviewBody: This was a great tour. About 20\' long. We took it from MacroPlaza to Fundidora Park but you can do it the other way around. The ticket price (60 pesos or about $4 dollars) per adult includes return ticket. The scenery is beautiful. I recommend trying to seat towards the front of the boat for better views. On Saturday first boat was out at 10am. Then every 20\' or so. Highly recommended

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

478254411.name: Tourist or local: a must visit not just once, but multiple times.
478254411.author: a TripAdvisor user
478254411.reviewBody:
Paseo Santa Lucía is a river walk in the heart of Monterrey city.
To me, it's somewhat unexpected to have this kind of water path in the middle of the city so well designed, and presented.

Surrounded by gardens, benches and scattered park attractions for kids, this is a great option for a romantic walk, fun with family and great pictures.

Free to the public. Most parking lots are paid ones.

Look for weekdays visiting if you don't like crowds.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

473964425.name: A  RIVERWALK IN MONTERREY.
473964425.author: a TripAdvisor user
473964425.reviewBody: Paseo  Santa  Lucia  is a nice walk along a man-made river.  It starts (or ends) in The Museo de Historia Mexicana which has two very good permanent expositions. Next to this museum  there is another museum I can\u00b4t tell you much about  because I haven\u00b4t visited it.  Along the paseo you will find some good restaurants where you can eat  ( this is only near the museums, after that, you won\u00b4t find many places to eat). You can take a boat ride;  I believe it lasts 45 minutes.  It will take you through the grounds of an old steel mill which is now Parque Fundidora.  Near the other end of the river, there  are also some museums. One of them is el Horno Tres. This museum is part  of the original steel mill. There is a good restaurant inside the museum with a great view to the park  A wax m.useum \n is also found nearby.. I visited it when it was new, about two years ago.. . It is a small, but interesting museum.  Sunday is a good day to visit Paseo Santa Lucia, as there are music bands and shows in the park. This is a place I love to visit.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

469496372.name: 20 min Cruise
469496372.author: a TripAdvisor user
469496372.reviewBody: Not much to see but inexpensive way(60 peso) to either get into the downtown area(from park) or to the park(from downtown). It would have been nice if tour was in both English & Spanish(only Spanish spoken). Also would be convenient if they offered a one way ticket...regardless, you can get off at either end of ride. One way walk back is about 40 mins.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

468964038.name: Great little artificial river
468964038.author: a TripAdvisor user
468964038.reviewBody: The river is a great place to come for a small walk. it is not too long only 2.5 km and there are lots of beautiful flower decorations on both sides. it goes from Fundidora to the Macro Plaza. You can also go on one of the tourists boats - Never tried it since I always prefer to walk.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

467126098.name: Great place to visit with family and friends
467126098.author: a TripAdvisor user
467126098.reviewBody: It is a nice,  clean and one of the most famous places to visit if you go to Monterrey. They have a river that goes through the downtown! It reminds me at San Antonio Tx., but also this place has a lot of fun things to do, you can go for a walk, ride your bike or roller skating. They also have many events almost every day and a few good restaurants nearby.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

463746216.name: Amazing artificial lake with picturistique backdrop
463746216.author: a TripAdvisor user
463746216.reviewBody:
Santa lucia = Two things Photos, leisure walking

A nice artifical lake with sculptures and mountain backdrop.it has got many attractions 

A) Boat ride
B) jurrasic world ( robotic dinosaur park)

And the best part its right adjacent to fundidora. If you can make it to fundidora by noon you can end your trip with santa lucia by evening. Its free and no entrance fee. At times we see events happening here. Its clean and worth visiting. Cycles are also available for rent if you are lazy to walk.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

458731790.name: It\'s a Most in Monterrey
458731790.author: a TripAdvisor user
458731790.reviewBody:
If you came to Monterrey and never visit the Paseo de Santa Lucía, is like you never came at all.

It a wonderful experience, very romantic if you want it to be, but is for all the family to enjoy.

There are many activities to do at both ends of the river. In one end, you have the Fundidora Park, just the best park in the city, many open space activities to do, also beautiful Aviary, exposition rooms, and an ice rink.

In the other end you will find four main museum of the City: Museo del Noreste, Museo de Historia Mexicana, Museo del Palacio de Gobierno and Museo de Arte Contemporáneo (MARCO). Many things to enjoy.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

458467899.name: Beautiful walk or ride in a boat
458467899.author: a TripAdvisor user
458467899.reviewBody: Great place to take the family, either to walk on the side of the river or to ride a boat in it. If you are walking consider some of the restaurants along the way to stop, eat and relax

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

457203125.name: Very beautiful
457203125.author: a TripAdvisor user
457203125.reviewBody: Excellent option to spend your time with quality in Monterrey! It is cheap and very beautiful. The trip ends up in the city centre, where you can visit other nice places!

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

456980551.name: Nice to see and that\'s pretty much it
456980551.author: a TripAdvisor user
456980551.reviewBody: Don\'t get me wrong, if you ARE in the park, you might want to stop by. It\'s a pretty cool landmark and the story behind it is nice too. It won\'t take you long to see it though...maybe 10-15 minutes if you stop by and take a picture near the yellow square (there\'s always a line). If you take the boat ride, you cannot miss it. It\'s at the end of the tour.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

453492882.name: Paseo Santa Lucia
453492882.author: a TripAdvisor user
453492882.reviewBody: $60 pesos for a round trip. Only two stops, one in parque fundici\u00f3n and the other one at the macro plaza. It takes you 20\' and you have a little explanation (only in Spanish in my case) of the different things around the canal. It\'s a 100%artificial canal. Nice to do, however not my best experience. I prefer natural sightsees.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

453466376.name: One of the parks
453466376.author: a TripAdvisor user
453466376.reviewBody: It\'s really great for walking. It\'s clean. With lots of walks. And few things to see. I was surprised. Could spend there hours.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

449466979.name: Just lovely place to visit
449466979.author: a TripAdvisor user
449466979.reviewBody:
So many lovely areas to sit and relax, also a lot of places to eat along the path next to the waterway. The national history museum is housed in the area as well, this museum has the largest collection of antique religious art in "marfil" ivory in the world. 

Along the man made waterway where you can take a tour boat there are restaurants with lovely patios and great food as well. 

Beautiful place to take in the sites, lots of tourists but not overly crowded. Go at night for the full experience - maybe hit the museum during the afternoon and plan for an evening stroll, dinner by the water afterward. Highly recommend

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

447615627.name: ...a lot cleaner than San Antonio Riverwalk...
447615627.author: a TripAdvisor user
447615627.reviewBody: I love it better than San Antonio\'s Riverwalk.  The water is CLEAN & does not SMELL.  There are restaurants & the views of the Cerro de la Silla are beautiful.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

446152431.name: Relaxing tour in the downtown
446152431.author: a TripAdvisor user
446152431.reviewBody: This is a very funny tour in the middle of the Monterrey\'s downtown, is very new but now it became a must in the city; you will find a mix of history, legends, landscapes and the relationship between the industry and the city, is a very pleasant tour, it worth to spend also some time in Fundidora park

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

445847293.name: Very nice for a quiet walk
445847293.author: a TripAdvisor user
445847293.reviewBody: This is a very nice location for a walk. It follows what appears to be an artificial river, you can also ride a ferry with a guide, the walk is long if you want to see it all. My advise, walk then go back in the boat.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

444318812.name: Nice river walk near the heart of the city
444318812.author: a TripAdvisor user
444318812.reviewBody: Many of the attraction places in Monterrey are on the outer part of the city such as the Cola de Caballo and Grutas de Garcia, however Paseo Santa Lucia is near the heart of Monterrey close to all the Plazas and Hotels. Boats are far from being gondolas but they\'re comfortable. As you travel the river walk you hear of a lot of the history of fundidora (steel mill) and Monterrey itself. All the green areas around paseo Santa Lucia are well maintain and there are many monuments and sculptures to see. Enjoy a wonderful Paseo and experience the origins of Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

444248063.name: Evening
444248063.author: a TripAdvisor user
444248063.reviewBody: This is a nice walk and you can also take a boat ride. There are lots of places to eat and things to see. I have lived in Mexico for 23 years. This is a great evening outing for a couple or a family.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

441254659.name: Sunday Afternoon Escape
441254659.author: a TripAdvisor user
441254659.reviewBody: This is a "River Walk" that is worth taking, you have great view and good exercise. Along the way you will find different activities for families.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

440476840.name: Very nice
440476840.author: a TripAdvisor user
440476840.reviewBody: It is actually not a separate attraction, it is part of the parque fundidora, which is indeed a great park to go in Monterrey, with many sculptures like this - which were left from the steel company.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

434140105.name: Monterrey\'s riverwalk
434140105.author: a TripAdvisor user
434140105.reviewBody: They did a nice job with this riverwalk and all the fountains along the way. At the end of the trip they tell you that you may unboard and return with the same ticket stub. If you do unboard you will find yourself a walking distance from downtown and it\'s cathedral. Lacking are more restaurants since there were only two. I recommend this activity later on in the day when the weather is not so hot and when they begin to turn on the lights providing a wonderful view of the hills.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

433428311.name: Lovely ride.
433428311.author: a TripAdvisor user
433428311.reviewBody: 30 very quiet minutes, nothing more to do than sit down, relax and enjoy the view. 2.6 km of navigating with a 40 person boat, lots of scenic views so make sure to have your camera out. Great option to ge between Macroplaza and Fundidora Park.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

433189733.name: Gorgeous stroll don\'t miss it!
433189733.author: a TripAdvisor user
433189733.reviewBody: Took me my third visit to Monterrey to see this park and boy am I glad I did. From one end (at Parque Fundidora) to the other where had dinner, it was a splendid 30 minute sunset stroll along a "river". Beautifully landscaped and dotted with creative water features, the broad walkways were full of families and joggers and other strollers. Delightful and gives San Antonio river walk a run for its money

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

430679132.name: Beautiful and relaxing!
430679132.author: a TripAdvisor user
430679132.reviewBody: You can ride in the boat, or you can walk on the riverside, is beautiful, and you can drink a beverage in the coffee shops near of the river, this is not a natural river is an artifical river 1.5 miles long adn 4 feet deep, it connects two great atraction in Monterrey, the "macroplaza"and "parque fundidora" two beautiful places too, an advice before wal or take the ride, please use sunscreen, the sun is really hot and the temperature in summer are above 100F some days. if you go to Monterrey, you can\'t miss this visit.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

430140334.name: Amazing views, you should not miss this!
430140334.author: a TripAdvisor user
430140334.reviewBody: We ride a free tour around the lake, the driver didnt evea ask for a tip, he was very kind and explainig the places around with excellent information. You can walk around.  You can take the best pictures in this place.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

429724610.name: Good way to know part of the city
429724610.author: a TripAdvisor user
429724610.reviewBody: I made the tour in the middle of the day, the tourist guide said he recommends it at night, I think the last boat leaves at 9pm. You can take it in parque fundidora, the ticket costs 60 pesos.\n

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

429497495.name: Boat ride is worth it.
429497495.author: a TripAdvisor user
429497495.reviewBody: Even tough I grew up in this city, visiting it as a tourist gives a whole new perspective. I took the boat tide with my 14mo and 9mo while making time for an attraction at Parque Fundidora, and honestly it was more than I expected. Everyone was extremely attentive and helpful with me and the kids, and the ride was soothing for the kids and relaxing for me. The operator was really funny and made us all have a nice time.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

429078820.name: paseo santa lucia
429078820.author: a TripAdvisor user
429078820.reviewBody: Nice walking and river tour.\nYou must take the boat that cross all santa lucia river. Walkng to the park is very nice. Dont forget to take dinner at the top of the fundition tower restaurant.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

423701483.name: Lovely
423701483.author: a TripAdvisor user
423701483.reviewBody: Nice and short boat ride on a man made river that takes you through a famous park in Monterrey lined by restaurants and hotels. It is best to experience when the sun goes down, but certainly both day and night are good to visit.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

419747107.name: Spectacular at night
419747107.author: a TripAdvisor user
419747107.reviewBody: With the sun and the hot weather in summer, Paseo Santa Luc\u00eda is best at night. The light show is beautiful.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

418221032.name: It is a MUST in your checklist.
418221032.author: a TripAdvisor user
418221032.reviewBody: If it is your first time in Monterrey, you must go to this attraction. You can take the a motorboat in the morning and/or also in the Night. The advantage to take this tour at night is that you will see this place full of beautiful lights.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

417279347.name: Very Beautiful and Fun!!!
417279347.author: a TripAdvisor user
417279347.reviewBody: Nice place to walk around or catch a boat cruise. Nice Riverwalk with restaurants and beautiful scenery. The food there is good and priced accordingly. It gets a nice crowd everyday. Very good place to cool off in the shade of the tunnels while walking the Riverwalk or riding the tour boat. I have been here multiple times from 2008 and beyond. I was not aware of Trip Advisor at that time.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

409055533.name: Awesome to hang out and enjoy the channel tour
409055533.author: a TripAdvisor user
409055533.reviewBody: If you happen to have a day off at work and are passing by Mty I strongly suggest you pay a visit to one of the nearest, relaxing and most amazing places in all the city.\n\nAt Paseo Santa Luc\u00eda you can enjoy a nice, relaxing walk or get into the boat tour through the artificial canal. You will definitely have a great time with family and/or friends.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

409036479.name: very nice walk in the hart of monterry
409036479.author: a TripAdvisor user
409036479.reviewBody: very nice place. to walk with family or love one. very safe and friendly. there are some restaurants close to de museum.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

405498238.name: Pretty cool!
405498238.author: a TripAdvisor user
405498238.reviewBody: We needed to get out and relax ... And this was a pretty nice and different thing to do! We arrived at the Fundidora Park, walked over to the staging area and... Just enjoyed the serene boating (covered and for about 20 people at a time) up and down the Sta Lucia which is  round trip of around 40-45 mins during which the guide shares interesting highlights of Monterrey. A pretty cool combination of relaxation and education!

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

402190233.name: Flash Trip - Monterrey NL Mexico March 04 to March 07 2016
402190233.author: a TripAdvisor user
402190233.reviewBody: The front desk personnel in City Express Plus Monterrey Nuevo Sur (Ave Revolucion 2703, Monterrey, NL, 64830 Mexico was very kind and helped us in the coordination of a taxi to go to the Santa Lucia river enjoying a boat ride in this attraction  during the only night free . The Santa Luc\u00eda river area is nearby to the Museo de Historia Mexicana (the History Mexican Museum) and many restaurants. This was an amazing, relaxing and beautiful adventure. The views during the ride were very beautiful for us . Also as part of the boat ride ,the history of this attraction it was narrated .  Therefore it was also a cultural visit in there. In addition, in Santa Luc\u00eda river  we bought the famous \u201cChurros\u201d with cinnamon and sugar to taste  , those are very delicious. Also, I stopped in a store \u201cel Museo del Dulce\u201d (Candy Museum) to buy typical candies from Monterrey like the \u201cLas Glorias\u201d, Marzipan-\u201cMazapan\u201d and Chocolates. I bought some toys souvenirs for my nephews and family.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

401911105.name: VERY ENJOYABLE 25 MINUTE RIDE
401911105.author: a TripAdvisor user
401911105.reviewBody: For only $3 you can get a quick tour of beautiful building, water features and gardens.  It\'s a "mini San Antonio" and a must do while in Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

401516508.name: enjoyable
401516508.author: a TripAdvisor user
401516508.reviewBody: The boat ride was enjoyable. the is much to do at the park. Wear comfortable clothes and shoes. plenty to keep the children entertained with.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

401455649.name: Goody
401455649.author: a TripAdvisor user
401455649.reviewBody:
It's a good place to stroll and enjoy a rich boat ride through part of the city of Monterrey

You can also enjoy restaurants, paintings by local artists and especially many regional festivals

It is a ride that you should take if you find yourself in the City

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

401351207.name: Modern town of Monterrey
401351207.author: a TripAdvisor user
401351207.reviewBody: This area really lifts The modern city life to be found in Mexico. It is a beautiful walk but and like always water is peacemaking. We Walked through in The evening and I ran The next day through. It is getting worn Down and needs a Living hand. It is a pity to see The use of plastic look a like Wood instead of raw materials.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

Loved the outdoor "cuenta un cuento" tell a tale... very well performed by the young lady. Kids where really attentive and we decided to sit down eat mexican ice cream and listen to the story. Very relaxing a day well spent.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

394134396.name: Lovely place
394134396.author: a TripAdvisor user
394134396.reviewBody: Friends went to paseo de santa. It was very exciting. But you need to wait in the queue. But worth waiting.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

Onboard!!!!!!!.......

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

388568523.name: Very nice for a romantic walk
388568523.author: a TripAdvisor user

387004469.name: excelent to walk, at sunset.
387004469.author: a TripAdvisor user

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

386226578.name: a walk with familyy
386226578.author: a TripAdvisor user
386226578.reviewBody: ita was ok very crowded because it was in december and they had this christmas village and concerts, so we went with my nieces of 4 and 3 years old, but need it to keep an eye on them all the time, its nice of viewing but stressing since i am not a people person that much, i like tranquility and none stressful places.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

383561430.name: Lovely views!
383561430.author: a TripAdvisor user
383561430.reviewBody: I stayed in a hotel next to this \'Paseo\' and I would do my running through it every day, so green, so clean, way better than just running the tracks in Fundidora Park. It felt safe and it\'s very charming specially at night, for which I took the boat ride and enjoy the view.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

378818906.name: Nice walk from Monterrey Center to Fundidora Park
378818906.author: a TripAdvisor user
378818906.reviewBody: The walk is about two kilometers long, or you can take a trip in a boat.  We did the second and the price for the a two way trip is 60 pesos.  The captain of the boat make jokes an is really funny, in his explanations of the origin and different parts that conform the river tour.  You can also walk through this confined park, in which the landscape has been cared and there are different areas in which you can seat and rest.  \nIf you begin the tour in Parque Fundidora you will arrive to the Museum of Mexican History which is in the center of Monterrey at the Macroplaza.\nIf you have the time, this is a nice tour to make.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

378626972.name: Place without maintenance
378626972.author: a TripAdvisor user
378626972.reviewBody: It a family place and it is good place for family just consider the temperature in Monterrey is high at summer also the boats are working without maintenance and at Fundidora Park is a walking place. Bring with you some water and caps also use sun blocker.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

378599650.name: Nice!!!
378599650.author: a TripAdvisor user
378599650.reviewBody: I did half of this walk because it was at night, they offer a boat ride but we did not have time so we walked about have way, passed a restaurant where they have live music like very romantic they even have little tables with rose petals on them for a romantic dinner very nice! Would have liked to have done the boat ride but maybe next time anyway very nice kids will love it!

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

374684556.name: Relaxing
374684556.author: a TripAdvisor user
374684556.reviewBody: If this is your first time in Monterrey, you must not miss this place: you must see this to. It\'s walking along a canalized River, which is naturally born right in the center of monterrey and continues towards the fundidora Park where it has beautiful landscapes. Will be a great activity if you have kids, I\'m sure that they fun on the way.\nReturning to the macroplaza, you probably very hungry, and you can enjoy the variety of restaurants to eat beside this river.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

374549520.name: Wonderful Place, you can take a walkthrough
374549520.author: a TripAdvisor user
374549520.reviewBody: In this Place you can Take a walkthrough, preferable in the afternoon beofre sunrise, and after go to some Museum here in the surroundings, like Santa Lucia or Marco, also there are a lot of restaurants for to get some refreshing drink.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

373104914.name: Awesome
373104914.author: a TripAdvisor user
373104914.reviewBody: Not only a great place to walk by, but with a good restaurant and very nice landscape (when arriving at Fundidora Park).\n

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

371906871.name: Great for Morning Jogging
371906871.author: a TripAdvisor user
371906871.reviewBody: Last Saturday I planned to run in Parque Fundidora because I had to wait nearby in the morning. I started there but then saw some people that came running from the Paseo Santa Lucia. The car racing track in Fundidora is good for jogging but nothing special so I decided to give it a try and run along the Paseo Santa Lucia.\nWhat a great decision it was. The paths from Fundidora to the museums is beautiful, all green and full of birds, very well maintained with a lot of security and clean. Jogging alongside the water canal was energizing, there is low volume music and several nice fountains and sightseeing points in the approximately 2.5 kilometers of travel.\nNow I think I am going to do this path more often, I think it is a great option if you are staying in the Fundidora area or the Macro Plaza area. Great for an early morning run, while the temperature is not too high. Actually for walking or jogging I will recommend visiting the Paseo Santa Lucia early in the morning or at sunset to enjoy the place. In the museum end side of the canal there are restaurants and places for a drink or appetizer.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

369479557.name: Good views
369479557.author: a TripAdvisor user
369479557.reviewBody:
I was not a massive fan of the tour but it was ok. It was good to see the different areas and to hear a bit of history plus the view to the mountains is amazing. 
I guess is something you have to do once.
We did enjoy the park more once we walked it.
To be fair the tour is quite cheap so give it a go.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

362170795.name: A walk full of history
362170795.author: a TripAdvisor user
362170795.reviewBody: Paseo Santa Lucia is very, safe, nice and clean with a rich history, has museums, restaurants, gondolas and a pre historic inspired zip line park.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

359862788.name: beautiful
359862788.author: a TripAdvisor user
359862788.reviewBody: nice boat ride, learned about a lot of things on the little tour, lasted about 40 minutes , it took longer because there was a long line because the easter weekend vacations

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

358180733.name: Nice place to walk
358180733.author: a TripAdvisor user
358180733.reviewBody: A great way to connect the Park (Fundidora) to the city. A nice easy 2K walk (there is also a barge service). All very well kept up and clean. Very relaxing.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

357956056.name: New place for me, but a nice spot for everyone
357956056.author: a TripAdvisor user
357956056.reviewBody: We walk all over from Parque Fundidora to Downtown throug the Paseo Santa Lucia, different places to eat, attractions and safe for all,you shuld try it if you are with family, specially with teens or young kids

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

356372515.name: perfect for every ocasion!!
356372515.author: a TripAdvisor user
356372515.reviewBody: been there so many times that I found it perfect for anything!... if you like to exercize, jugging, or walking, or if you want to chill out, our hang out with friends, if you like boat tours is one of the greatest (the great one is Xochimilco in DF), at night it has a great romantic scenery.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

353196150.name: Fun stroll and boat ride
353196150.author: a TripAdvisor user
353196150.reviewBody: The walk is very nice, but can be a bit far with young kids on a very hot day.  The boat ride is very pleasant.  If you want to buy popsicles, get them at the cafe along the walk, not at the store near the candy museum, which charges 10 pesos more for the exact same product with less friendly service.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

352857153.name: Great for an evening in Monterrey
352857153.author: a TripAdvisor user
352857153.reviewBody: It was a little difficult to find, but I am glad we did. The scenery along the waterway was excellent. We stopped at the restaurant we passed earlier, and had some great margritas.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

349286657.name: Perfect walking experience
349286657.author: a TripAdvisor user

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

348677124.name: Very Nice
348677124.author: a TripAdvisor user
348677124.reviewBody: Very nice place in Monterrey, the best place for walk and see sight and have a great view for all the river, I recommended for one afternoon, you spend 3-4 hr minimum and take the boat is very nice.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

348614279.name: A walking in the Paseo de Santa Lucia

348614279.reviewBody: It is very nice take a trip by ship and cross part of the downtown city in Monterrey, N.L. Mexico, see the old colonial city, and mix with other kink of constructions, it is worth it to do it. after you can go and visit some of the restaurants, they have near the water.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

346337150.name: Relaxing
346337150.author: a TripAdvisor user

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

346152863.name: Nice place
346152863.author: a TripAdvisor user
346152863.reviewBody: this is part of the city, is a very nice trip and the place is very clean, very safe and has all of thing to see and has very good restaurants there

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

345714616.name: Don\'t pass this up
345714616.author: a TripAdvisor user
345714616.reviewBody: I\'m sure my stay in Mexico would not have been complete without having experienced this! Loved the peaceful, slow ride on the water.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

341748003.name: nice river
341748003.author: a TripAdvisor user
341748003.reviewBody: Its a neat little boat ride from one side of the park to the other. Very clean, and they let you get back on within a certain time frame to go back to the otherside. I enjoiyed it.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

341429358.name: Definitely a must do
341429358.author: a TripAdvisor user
341429358.reviewBody: The 2.5km boat ride takes you through the heart of the city, from one touristic location (the three must-see museums and Macroplaza) to another (Parque Fundidora). It is cheap ($5 US round trip). It is poorly narrated in Spanish but who cares?!

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

339018273.name: Terrible customer service
339018273.author: a TripAdvisor user
339018273.reviewBody: We stood in line for the ride on the boat that takes you to the Macroplaza in downtown.  There were 17 people in our group. We were denied boarding because we had a foldable cart for he kids. They man in charge of loading the boat said it was the policy to not let people bring anything on board that has wheels. We were not interested in the return trip since that would consume too much time out of our day. We had very limited time in the city and wanted to get off downtown and keep going. The guy refused to even let us buy a seat for the cart so we were very disappointed and asked for our money back. Thankfully they did return all of our money and had to go a different route. So beware if you have children, these people do not let on board any kind of carts except wheelchairs. There is a space next to the line where people park their strollers and get them on the way back. This is so outrageous since the fundidora park is so big, if you have small children you want to have a stroller. So stroller=no boat ride or be prepared for spending the whole day here if you bring it.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

338880527.name: Very Impressed
338880527.author: a TripAdvisor user
338880527.reviewBody: Very nice park and well maintained/cleaned.  My family enjoyed the walk and sightseeing.  The boat tour was reasonably priced and worth it.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

338506252.name: Wonderful on week days before dark
338506252.author: a TripAdvisor user
338506252.reviewBody: This place is to take a long walk and see the nice painted houses around the sidewalks, recommended ONLY before dark, it kind of looked very different after dark like no safe place to be at. Lots of police on weekends but thru the weekdays police is non existent.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

336674258.name: Beautiful, romantic
336674258.author: a TripAdvisor user
336674258.reviewBody: We took this ride at night and during the holiday season there were many Christmas lights the park looked beautiful. and \nThe guide told us the stories and history behind every sculpture and artwork. It was a slow ride about 40 minutes but very enjoable.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

333421905.name: Good family walk
333421905.author: a TripAdvisor user

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

332877706.name: Impressive
332877706.author: a TripAdvisor user
332877706.reviewBody: This place is impressive and peaceful if you want to relax and have a time for yourself ot with your boy/girlfriend.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

332306517.name: Great riverwalk addition to Fundidora Park
332306517.author: a TripAdvisor user
332306517.reviewBody: This man made river is a great addition to the Fundidora Park. Recently built, it has become an icon to the City.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

332186688.name: Perfectly beautiful
332186688.author: a TripAdvisor user
332186688.reviewBody: If you are expecting a regular channel to ride a boat, it is not so. This is just beautiful. The cleanest and clearest water I have ever rode on. The most beautiful waterway, you almost want to get off and swimm, and the beautiful architecture and decoration, leaves San Antonio tx\'s river far behind. A fairly priced, this long ride is perfect for children as well.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

331722253.name: Wonderful place in the middle of the city
331722253.author: a TripAdvisor user
331722253.reviewBody: This is a great boat ride or even pleasure walk if the weather is nice in Monterrey. There are lots of statues and art along the way, plus people watching is great!

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

328483652.name: Nice walk along a waterway

328483652.reviewBody: It\'s a good walk from the Fundidora along this waterway to downtown, where the museum of national history is. Worthwhile on a pretty day, not much to see but the water is very relaxing

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

327241024.name: Amazing
327241024.author: a TripAdvisor user
327241024.reviewBody: Amazing place for a walk, a run, or a boat ride!  Beautifully maintained gardens along the cannal, with washrooms, and beautiful metal historic features.  A must-do in Monterrey, especially if your hotel is next to Parque Fundidora.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

326015129.name: Nice little walk
326015129.author: a TripAdvisor user
326015129.reviewBody: Paseo Santa Lucia offers a pleasant walk through a 2.5km long artificial river, along with restaurants, bars, snacks, typical food, etc. It\'s nice to enjoy a sunny afternoon and sightsee. You can also rent a rowing boat or ride a communal boat with a tour guide.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

322713669.name: Row row row your boat
322713669.author: a TripAdvisor user
322713669.reviewBody: A nice thing to do in the city, its about half an hour from side to side, and it gives you a great view and explanation of the park, it is a great deal for your money

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

315266972.name: A stroll along the river

315266972.reviewBody: I went to the Paseo de Santa Lucia because or its proximity to Barrio Antiguo. I was there in the late morning. It was a pleasant walk with many opportunities for photos near the man made water features.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

310740786.name: Pleasant way to ride
310740786.author: a TripAdvisor user
310740786.reviewBody: It was quite hot the day I was in Monterrey. This was a nice way to get to the Parque Fundidora. Lovely manmade river with waterfalls and gardens along the way. Even an inukshuk for this Canadian.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

310008892.name: Beautiful place
310008892.author: a TripAdvisor user
310008892.reviewBody: Man made canal where boat carrier tourist from Mexican history Musial to muse ode horns and vice versa. You can take boat or just walk beside canal. We walked and enjoyed nice view and its good place to workout.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

308761317.name: enjoy the restaurants and the river walk
308761317.author: a TripAdvisor user
308761317.reviewBody: Start with the three museums, then dinner in one of the many restaurants options and end with a walk, better in autum, there is also the barrio antiguo next to it

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

305830842.name: Beatiful !!!
305830842.author: a TripAdvisor user
305830842.reviewBody: Beautiful and large park! Best for walking, ride a bike, with kids or your couple. Best for couples at night.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

303019883.name: Pleasant Ride
303019883.author: a TripAdvisor user
303019883.reviewBody: I\'ve gone once a year since 2013 and hasn\'t got old! The tour guides tend to be pleasantly funny yet give great information along the boat ride.  You can either walk or ride to enjoy the restaurants, stores and ice cream shops along the way.  It\'s lovely during the day or night.  It also served as transportation from Fundidora to Macroplaza for only $60 pesos each (under 3 or 4 y/o ride free).

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

298461680.name: nice walk
298461680.author: a TripAdvisor user
298461680.reviewBody: Nice walk, I went with a friend that was visiting from puerto rico, he loved the place, there are some restaurants and ice cream places, use sunblock.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

298143133.name: A very nice ride on a boat
298143133.author: a TripAdvisor user
298143133.reviewBody:
I took my two kids (10 , 6) to this ride an they really enjoyed. We loved to see the  River Walk it is clean, safe and with a great views. This ride is about 2 kilometers long and it takes you from Monterrey Downtown (Museo de Historia Mexicana) to Cintermex.  You have the option to get down at Cintermex and explore the area or stay in the boat and go back to Down Town.  We took the first option and visit Cintermex, but be careful and keep your tickets safe or you have to pay again to ride the boat.  The ride takes about 20 minutes.

Some recommendations:

1.-If you want to save some money go to the ticket boot which is at the bottom of the stairs at the Museo de Historia Mexicana plaza  (Mexican History Museum) next to the Museo del Dulce.  The ride cost $60.00 mexican pesos per adult, $40.00 mexican pesos per child.

2.-If you are visiting this attraction during the summer bring some water, you will need it.

3.- No strollers allow in the boat.

4.- The guide only speaks spanish.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

297945610.name: very beautiful place to visit..
297945610.author: a TripAdvisor user
297945610.reviewBody: this place is a very good way to walk and take a little boat to enjoy the river (kinda like san antonio river boats)

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

294431502.name: Fun on a hot day!
294431502.author: a TripAdvisor user
294431502.reviewBody: Nice and cool on a hot day, the trip is relaxing and pretty.  It\'s not cheap if there are a lot of you and you may need to wait for a few boats to get a place.  However, it\'s fun and worth it.\n

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

293034212.name: The thing to do in Monterey
293034212.author: a TripAdvisor user
293034212.reviewBody: You dont need to book a tour, so save the 100 USD that tripadvisor suggests, just start walking next to the river and follow your steps back to the starting point, either the Museo de Historia Mexicana or the Fundidora Park, its a very long walk and if you feel lazy there are boats that do the trip for 4 USD. Stop in the restaurants near the Museo de Historia Mexicana for a drink. Avoid midday in summer it get veeeery hot and wear sunscreen and bring water.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

292893264.name: Downtown river
292893264.author: a TripAdvisor user
292893264.reviewBody: After spending hours at the Museo de Historia Mexicana it was nice to walked on this street with the river slingering next to you.\n\nYou can either walk or take a boat tour. I like to walk since you have the opportunity to stop and one of the many coff\u00e9 places for a relaxing break. Be aware that this is a quite busy place.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

291881424.name: Great place for a picnic
291881424.author: a TripAdvisor user
291881424.reviewBody: Awesome place, I wish we could of gone in the evening because they have light shows, my kids really enjoyed the boat ride!

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

289719715.name: Have a walk with the family
289719715.author: a TripAdvisor user
289719715.reviewBody:
Nice and relaxing place to walk and to ride a boat.
If you are visiting Monterrey for the first time, this is a great way to see what Monterrey has to offer.
Visit also the fundidora museum and some of the best restaurants in the city.
Bring your friends, your mother, relax and enjoy the ride.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

289384738.name: Man-Made Beauty
289384738.author: a TripAdvisor user
289384738.reviewBody: Beautiful waterway in the city: the trail begins in the macro plaza and ends at Parque  Fundidora. There is a water taxi, but I recommend walking up and taxing back. What\'s weird is that this entire waterway is artificial: the water looks like pool water and the pathway it so perfect it never feels natural, but it can be beautiful if you just walk and relax.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

287126453.name: Clean and pretty
287126453.author: a TripAdvisor user
287126453.reviewBody: This man made canal is an excellent site for just talking a long walk or finding a scenic location for a meal..  Everything is nice and clean along the canal.. they also have boat rides for those that cannot walk that far..

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

279613468.name: Monterreys Riverwalk!
279613468.author: a TripAdvisor user
279613468.reviewBody: The Riverwalk excursion lead us to take the boats on a tour from downtown to the Fundidora. You can tell that the city has actually put a lot of work and effort into making this a true beautiful recreational area for its citizens and visitors alike.A round-trip ticket is highly recommended as the boats fill up quickly getting around the area you can either walk or take the boats but I highly recommend spending time andtaking some pictures of the beautiful areas and scenery. Highly recommend this tour as a family trip or even a romantic getaway they offer several different options and it is a great place to bring Friends or family while visiting the city.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

277978662.name: A really nice walk!!
277978662.author: a TripAdvisor user
277978662.reviewBody: If you\'re in Monterrey, consider going to zona Centro and take the boat rides in Paseo Santa Lucia. It should be totally safe on daylight :)

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

275370889.name: Uncomparable
275370889.author: a TripAdvisor user
275370889.reviewBody: Paseo de Santa Lucia an amazing place, I went on a boat that costs 60 MXN the round trip which takes you back and forth to the other side of the river. The river gives a beautiful view of downtown Monterrey. Also, I recommend you to go to a restaurant located on the way, it is called Tenerias. If you are on a romantic trip, this is a must

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

273211202.name: Romantic setting
273211202.author: a TripAdvisor user
273211202.reviewBody: If you\'re looking for the perfect date here is the best idea. Walking and dinning across the Santa Lucia river is the perfect setting for a romantic date. Overall the place is beautiful and besides the great company and place a marriage proposal came across the perfect date. Perfect!

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

273197797.name: This place is amazing
273197797.author: a TripAdvisor user
273197797.reviewBody: This attraction is great and you can ride a boat in MTY.\n\nThe tour is done with a guide that speaks about the monuments and history of MTY.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

273194424.name: Great Place to visit in Monterrey but only in Gondola
273194424.author: a TripAdvisor user
273194424.reviewBody: The river walk along the Santa Lucia river is a nice place to visit, its clean, and have a great viewpoints in the center od the Monterrey; I strongly recommend to "walk" it on the gondola that you can find near the macroplaza Below Mexican history museum, because the walk is quite long, but its worth it; at the end you will find yourself in Fundidora Park , that is an artificial park that you can visit; lots of cultural places in the park that you can visit; Summarizing it, Pasea de Santa Lucia is a "must" in Monterrey to visit.\n

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

271433732.name: Santa Lucia riverwalk
271433732.author: a TripAdvisor user
271433732.reviewBody: Tha Old Town of Monterrey was renovated  the 80\'s. The macroplaza which is the world\'s fourth largest plaza was constructed in that decade. 27 years later Paseo Santa Lucia was finished in the year 2007. This amusement connects the Macroplaza all the way to parque fundidora.In the Paseo you can take a river boat through the1.5 miles artificial river. This river has cristal clear water, has water fountains and light effects. You also have the option of walking without crossing any streets. I recommend this for family trips it has good views of Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

268532950.name: Nice saturday walk
268532950.author: a TripAdvisor user
268532950.reviewBody: This is a real nice place to walk with kids. You can either walk from downtown Monterrey to Fundidora or take a small w\u00e1ter boat. There are fountains and restaurants on you way and back. My kids really enjoyed and wanted to stay longer.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

264584762.name: Very clean, beautiful landscape.
264584762.author: a TripAdvisor user
264584762.reviewBody: I live in Monterrey and it was a nice surprise finding a great and clean place to enjoy the day with the family.\nIf you come to Monterrey, don\'t miss it !!

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

262676825.name: Boat Rided Spoils A Good Walk
262676825.author: a TripAdvisor user
262676825.reviewBody: 120 Pesos for two people, for a short ride and really nothing to see. Driver of the boat said nothing the whole trip. Better off walking and enjoying the fresh air.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

260975325.name: enjoyable.
260975325.author: a TripAdvisor user
260975325.reviewBody: the boats were clean, the guide was well informed about the surroundings, but I found the tickets pretty expensive for the short ride and the waiting for get in also a pain with the sun in our face.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

259980615.name: Nice place to visit with family.
259980615.author: a TripAdvisor user
259980615.reviewBody: It is a nice ride.  Now, sometimes the waiting time to be able to get in one of the boats to go thru the official canal tour is very long, but you can always walk the canal, no issues.  If you have little kids, don\'t forget your stroller.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

258683656.name: Nice way to know the track
258683656.author: a TripAdvisor user
258683656.reviewBody: This trip is pretty nice since you can get into downtown from Fundidora very easily. The guide in the boat goes all the way explaining (in Spanish) too. You can also walk all the way, there are some restaurants in the path. If you have time to spend and is visiting Fundidora, take it.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

258488562.name: Overall a dump
258488562.author: a TripAdvisor user
258488562.reviewBody: What can I say?  Nasty crowd, not much selection of restaurants (and the ones that exist are local tourist traps), a pitiful boat cruise, and just an overall aire of depression that lingers as you walk down the paseo.  Nonetheless, the positive thing is that you can walk!  A rare feature of life in Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

257912035.name: A must for the tourist
257912035.author: a TripAdvisor user
257912035.reviewBody: With a walking river, this tour is a must for a visitor that has never been in this town. During the day and with hot weather, the water and the fountains are a very refreshing option. If you keep walking, eat elotes or any street food. It\'s very local, yummy and not for weak metabolisms!

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

256436650.name: Fountains and Art
256436650.author: a TripAdvisor user
256436650.reviewBody: An amazing escape in the middle of Monterrey. You can take a boat ride along the roughly 2km man -made river or you can walk along the edge (either side). The boat ride includes informative commentary (in Spanish). The place is spotless and there are lots of fountains, murals, and sculptures. Definitely worth a visit even if you aren\'t into art.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

255249034.name: Beautiful Park
255249034.author: a TripAdvisor user
255249034.reviewBody: This is one of the best parks in Monterrey.  Excellent to go with kids and take a picnic. The Parque de los loros is great and the boat ride.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

255136427.name: This is a very good place to go with your family
255136427.author: a TripAdvisor user
255136427.reviewBody: December in Monterrey is cool but this year had an expectacular show at paseo santa lucia Luminaria. You can walk, or take a little tour in a boat and hear part of the history of the city. There was a Santa Clause vilage also. There are good restaurants too

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

255109353.name: Very much worth the visit
255109353.author: a TripAdvisor user
255109353.reviewBody: The Paseo Santa Lucia is a walking path and canal that leads from the Macro Plaza in the center of Monterrey to Parque Fundidora - connecting the historical center of the city, with its museums, open spaces, and government buildings, to the a very large and well-maintained park and center of activities. The Paseo has been very clean every time I have visited, and includes fountains, sculptures, and murals by local artists. You can walk it or take one of the boats that travel regularly from one end of the canal to the other.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

254927326.name: an excelent escape from the hustle and bustle of the city
254927326.author: a TripAdvisor user
254927326.reviewBody: Rent a bike in the park and go see some free museums there.Also there are boat rides and some industrial history as well.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

254781810.name: Very nice visit
254781810.author: a TripAdvisor user
254781810.reviewBody: The place is beautiful and the park is kept very nice. I went for a bike and had a great time. Also the museum is great!

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

254771861.name: The best place in town
254771861.author: a TripAdvisor user
254771861.reviewBody: You have entertaining, you have history, you can do excercise. You have a lot of green space. You have museums, good food, great views of the "cerro de la silla". I really like it, its a plus in this city

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

253663835.name: Excellent reclamation . . .
253663835.author: a TripAdvisor user
253663835.reviewBody: . . . of an old steel mill, industrial site.  Man-made riverwalk. The boat ride is fun, and some of the modern architecture along the way is impressive.  It makes a great public space.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

248082043.name: Magical
248082043.author: a TripAdvisor user
248082043.reviewBody: As I said on the title, this place is just magical weather you get on a boat or go walking. During day it looks really awesome, but it is during night where the magic beggins. Lights, fountains, restaurants, such a romantic place, but you can go with friends and have some fun. Like I said that place is magical! And if you go in summer you will fully enjoy it.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

244965234.name: Great time at Paseo de Lucia
244965234.author: a TripAdvisor user
244965234.reviewBody: There is nothing to hate about this place.  Great place to walk, bike, and just plane admire the view.  Must ride the ferris wheel as you can see the park and Monterrey from top and take great pictures.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

239433543.name: Nice ride
239433543.author: a TripAdvisor user
239433543.reviewBody: You can go from the Parque Fundidora to Monterrey donwtown (or vice versa), the boat station is right below the museum of mexican history. The Paseo Santa Lucia is an impressive engineering construction. It\'s worth the ride!

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

238788956.name: great walk
238788956.author: a TripAdvisor user
238788956.reviewBody: great place to visit and walk along, beautiful waterway with many attractions on the way, lots of places for kids to play

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

238336025.name: It\u00b4s nice.
238336025.author: a TripAdvisor user
238336025.reviewBody:
It all depends on several factors, but you can have a great day or an average one, depending on the amount of  visitors too.

The place itself is nice, Monterrey is striving to make it look and feel like the San Antonio Riverwalk, and they have invested some money in it to do so. The walk itself is nice, when the fountains are all on, it´s pretty, sometimes they are not all working, so that´s a bummer. There is not enough variety of snack places along the way, but you can stop at the restaurants if they´re open.
All in all, it´s alright, the concept behind it is cool, so it all depends on your point of view. At the beginning of the attraction you will find two museums,the Mexican History and the Northeastern History Museums, they all have fees except on Wednesdays and Sundays, I believe. 
If you start the walk at the museum, you can ride the flat bottom boats (for a fee)  and get off at the other end of the ride. When you finish the first museum run you end up at the Fundidora Park which is also nice. You can picnic or spend the day with your family or friends, strolling the gardens or riding your bike, skates or strollers. Once there, a couple of attractions are available there too.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

236634532.name: Nice way to spend afternoon
236634532.author: a TripAdvisor user
236634532.reviewBody: The boat rides are nice and inexpensive if you feel like riding, but I prefer walking along and checking out all the art and people watching. The best day for lots of people is Sunday afternoon. The tour is in Spanish, but so if you don\'t speak the language that may be a little difficult for you. I wouldn\'t do this in the summer time, but the rest of the year it is very pleasant.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

231837653.name: A nice walk inside the city.
231837653.author: a TripAdvisor user
231837653.reviewBody: Great for an early run together with the grand Prix race track at Cintermex. Nice sight seeing on your walk, you can take a boat tour if you wish. At summer it gets very hot thru the day.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

225980565.name: It is like San Antonio\u00b4s River Drive Walk but mexican way!
225980565.author: a TripAdvisor user
225980565.reviewBody: Since its opening, it was a success! It goes from below Mexican Museum of History to Parque Fundidora in a roundtrip on a boat. The boat driver is telling every important place, specially where there were war scenes or legends from past times. All is clean and beautiful, whith gardens on the sidewalk. Water is clean and have beautiful Koi fish that swim around boat. This is a must to visit if you go to Monterrey,M\u00e9xico!

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

221464916.name: Kudos to whomever dreamed this up
221464916.author: a TripAdvisor user
221464916.reviewBody: A beautiful addition to Monterrey! Take a 20 minute boat ride through the city in this swimming pool class water .. there are waterfalls, some restaurants, some paintings .. it\'s relaxing and beautiful, and so very Monterrey -- man-made by people who specialize in contruction and business. It\'s 60 pesos roundtrip, from Fundidora to downtown (the Museum of Mexican History).

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

220453831.name: Very well done!
220453831.author: a TripAdvisor user
220453831.reviewBody: This is a boat ride on a man made waterway from Parque Fundidora to the Macroplaza. There are walkways on either side for the entire length as well. The ticket is good for a round trip and the boats run every 20 minutes or so. I can\'t say enought about how well run and maintained this riverwalk is. The water is clear like a swimming pool and all along the way is interesting artwork / murals, water featrues, and landscaping.  We took the boat from Fundidora, got off at the Macroplaza for an couple hours to walk around and shop, and then rode the boat back. There is a small gift shop and nice public restroom at the Macroplaza stop. It\'s also "underground" so it\'s shaded. The boats are covered and the breeze from riding the boat is wonderful on a hot day. It was near 100 degrees Farenheit the day we rode. There is one Bar/restaurant along the riverwalk. I would have rated this attaction Excellent if there were more dining / shopping options along the riverwalk itself. The walk would be well worth it even without those things and of course it doesn\'t detract from the boat ride. It\'s safe and well patroled by security guards on bicycles.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

219775980.name: Serene
219775980.author: a TripAdvisor user
219775980.reviewBody: Very beautiful! Reminds one of Venice, Italy. The boat ride is worth it. Loved going there at night... absolutely gorgeous!

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

219680784.name: NICE PLACE TO VISIT...
219680784.author: a TripAdvisor user
219680784.reviewBody: Very nice place to visit near to the Museo del Noreste, Museo de Historia Mexicana and Museo Marco, you can make a triple play.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

218888759.name: Romantic Monterrey!
218888759.author: a TripAdvisor user
218888759.reviewBody: Wow, what a great place. A must see in Monterrey. Just perfect to go to the Museo del Acero Horno 3.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

207668268.name: Beautiful ride in boat!
207668268.author: a TripAdvisor user
207668268.reviewBody: It\'s one of the most joyful trips I ever had, the variety of waterfall is great and also quite creative. A place you shouldn\'t miss!!!

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

207526437.name: Good place to walk
207526437.author: a TripAdvisor user
207526437.reviewBody: You must visit, it is a great place to visit if you are in Monterrey City, it is has excellents views and you can enjoy walking early morning.\nAlso it is a good experience to take the river trip.\nThere are several restaurants near to river.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

207524789.name: Awesome place to visit
207524789.author: a TripAdvisor user
207524789.reviewBody: Paseo Santa Lucia its a great place to visit while you\u00b4re in Monterrey. Its located in downtown and you can either walk by the side or take a boat.\nIf you\u00b4re going on the weeken be aware that its going to be really crowed.\nThe restaurants in the area have a great view but not so good food.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

207502759.name: Nice to walk
207502759.author: a TripAdvisor user
207502759.reviewBody: It\'s very place to walk but unfortunally there not a place to eat just walk and enjoy. It\'s vvery near to park Fundidora and connect to the museums.\n

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

206044186.name: Great place
206044186.author: a TripAdvisor user
206044186.reviewBody: Paseo Santa Luc\u00eda in Monterrey City, is one of the most wonderful places you should go when you are here. This Paso ends up to Parque Fundidora.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

205602884.name: Great place, avoid weekends
205602884.author: a TripAdvisor user
205602884.reviewBody: Great place to walk and enjoy a drink or two in the restaurants around it, be careful since it is in downtown and after dark it might be dangerous to walk around because of monterrey\'s unsafe stage in the latest years, just exercise CAUTION at all times and DO NOT talk to strangers.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

202279383.name: Most important site to visit in Monterrey.
202279383.author: a TripAdvisor user
202279383.reviewBody: The best advice I can give you for this visit is carry water with you and be prepared to walk a lot.  The great part of this is that as you move forward you continuously discover new and great things along the whole walk".  You can always go back with the boat.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

202096581.name: its a MUST in Monterrey
202096581.author: a TripAdvisor user
202096581.reviewBody: It`s a great riverwalk , for me is better if you go by night. It have fountains, restaurants. Also you can go by boat across the river.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

201347594.name: Great place to visita
201347594.author: a TripAdvisor user
201347594.reviewBody:
If you travel to Monterey  go to the Paseo Santa Lucia, that is a beautifull canal and have a boat ride ,
This place is also together to the Macro Plaxa where you can see the government palace as well as the museo de arte contemporaneo MARCO and the Musdo Regional de Historia. 

The Monterrey Cathedral is also a few steps from Santa Luciam.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

201296423.name: Nice boat ride, must do in Monterrey
201296423.author: a TripAdvisor user
201296423.reviewBody: Paseo Santa Luc\u00eda is a man made canal that goes from Fundidora Park up to the History Museum.  It is a fun a restful ride, don\'t miss it.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

201262957.name: Do it by foot!
201262957.author: a TripAdvisor user
201262957.reviewBody: This place is perfect for a informal date. Walk next to the river, eat a icecream, buy some flowers, take some cheesy pictures and have dinner in a nice restaurant.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

201238523.name: Exelent place to walk/run
201238523.author: a TripAdvisor user
201238523.reviewBody: Excellent pace to walk/run over the Santa Lucia River, if you don\'t like to walk you can always rent a bike or take your own roller-skates

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

201203784.name: Great overview of downtown
201203784.author: a TripAdvisor user
201203784.reviewBody: Great way to get to know downtown, Rio Santa Lucia, Museo de Historia Mexicana and Parque Fundidora. You can hop off and walk through Macro Plaza too

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

197378334.name: Recommended ride
197378334.author: a TripAdvisor user
197378334.reviewBody:
It is a short boat ride form the Macro Plaza to Fundidora Park.
If done at night (nocturno) it has all fountains lighted.
I'll recommend you take one leg with daylight and return about 7 pm of after and you'll have the nocturno.
It goes form the Macro Plaza to Parque Fundidora (you can also walk the 2 Kms ride).

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

189138151.name: Very pleasant.
189138151.author: a TripAdvisor user
189138151.reviewBody: Honestly, theres really not much to do in monterrey in winter, and this is a bit of a stretch, just because its really cold.
