But its really pretty, starting just off the macroplaza and finishing in fundidora all the way is nicely done with water fountains and bits of art. very clean and modern. The driver also speaks on a mic and gives you information about the city along the way. At 50 pesos for a return ticket its good value, and there are 2-3 boats each hour until 8.30 pm. Bring gloves and a hat if you are going in winter!!

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

188227507.name: Good time
188227507.author: a TripAdvisor user
188227507.reviewBody: After walking through the Macroplaza, if your feet are killing you... nothing better than Paseo de Santa Lucia. You can sit down and relax at the little boat that brings you across a calmed artificial lake that goes accross the city.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

186207313.name: A nice boat ride
186207313.author: a TripAdvisor user
186207313.reviewBody: It is really cool to see how much it has been done in the visual appearance of the park, and the scenery during the boat ride with the mountains in the background is spectacular. I really enjoyed it. It is not a river though, it is a man made canal. \nThe visit to  Furnace 3 afterwards was also an interesting experience and I was surprised that in a country like Mexico something like this in terms of environment can be done.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

173918757.name: A nice place to spend an evening.
173918757.author: a TripAdvisor user
173918757.reviewBody: I have been to the Paseo de Santa Lucia three or four times. I really enjoyed the walk along the river, and there are nice cafes where you can rest and have some botanas. The locals are very proud of their river. I enjoyed the museums at one end of the Paseo (you decide whether it is the beginning or the end.) i live in San Antonio, where we have our own river walk; the one in Monterrey seems a little more artificial than the one in San Antonio, but give it time to get broken in. I have seen musical groups and dance troupes perform on some of the  stages there. The performances were free, and you can watch while seated in a fountain where you don\'t have to get wet. Don\'t fear going to Monterrey. Just be a bit sensible and be aware of your surroundings. I have been robbed in Paris, and I have been robbed in Rome, but I have never been robbed in Mexico. Go. I have traveled to Monterrey alone, and to meet friends. I feel perfectly safe, of course following a few common-sense precautions as in any city.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

170348927.name: A surprise in the center of Monterrey
170348927.author: a TripAdvisor user
170348927.reviewBody:
f you visit Monterrey, you have to visit and go for a ride in these boats at the end of the day. 

The area is amazing with and the cruise allows you to se all type of sceneries and art. 

A good moment to stop, and relax enjoying the hot/dry weather with the water arround you. 

I loved it, and before dinner (around 07pm) it's a perfect trip.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

169801781.name: Artificial river drive
169801781.author: a TripAdvisor user
169801781.reviewBody: Monterrey is my home town and has extremely hot and dry weather for at least 10 months a year. When eventually friends, family or work partners visit the city, we take them to Santa Luc\u00eda river drive by night, when is still very hot but at least the sun is not in your eyes frying you. In general, I don\'t consider Monterrey or the state of Nuevo Le\u00f3n a tourist attraction. People come here to visit family, study at one of the many Universities, work or business. In any case, I do not recommend to rent a car and try to drive in the crazy and unexisting signaling streets and avenues; very dangerous driving conditions.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

169801457.name: Lovely
169801457.author: a TripAdvisor user
169801457.reviewBody: Beautiful place, is a walk from Parque Fundidora to downton. But can also take a boat, which I recomend if it\'s summer!!! Because weather can be incredibly hot. \n\nAt the end of the trip you can visit the museums around, or maybe take a bite in the restarants nearby.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

169793126.name: Very Good
169793126.author: a TripAdvisor user
169793126.reviewBody: Safe during all day long.  A lot fountains and people especially weekends. Try to use shorts in summer and protect your suele from the sin beca use the weather is very hot in the afternoon. I don\'t recomend walking in the night .

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

169675123.name: Good one
169675123.author: a TripAdvisor user
169675123.reviewBody: The best way to go from "Parque Fundidora" to the "Macroplaza"!\nTake a boat that will transport you through an artificial river filled with crystal water. A guide explains the construction, surroundings and some history.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

169670869.name: Nice walking area
169670869.author: a TripAdvisor user
169670869.reviewBody: It is a nice renewed area of Monterrey city where you can walk along the river that recreates that old time river where the city was founded more than 400 years ago.\nThere you can have lunch or dinner at a restaurant set aside the river or just have some beer accompanied with music.\nThere are also excellents museums and galleries around....and it is just next to "Gran Plaza" the biggest on on the world...even larger than Moscow red plaza...

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

169666371.name: Very nice walk
169666371.author: a TripAdvisor user
169666371.reviewBody: Just avoid weekends if you can, it gets crowdy. Also during summer Monterrey weather is extremely hot ~ 100/110F so bring sunscreen and light clothes. For the rest, it is a very nice place to walk or swim (yes they do these iron man-type of competitions every now and then)

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

169654600.name: Monterrey really gets a a bum rap.
169654600.author: a TripAdvisor user
169654600.reviewBody: People around the worl really belive that our city is like being in Syria  Nothing further from the truth.  Like any big city we have crime, but as in any big city we should be careful not to go to the places that are dangerous.  A few years ago there was a lot of violence due to the drug cartels, but it has gone down.  There is still the "normal" crime, I don\u00b4t go to certain parts of the city, because they have always been dangerous.  I do not recommend that you travel by car, because you have to pass through a neighboring state which really is dangerous.  Be careful, but do not dismiss us as if we were the most dangerous place on earth.\n\nAnd by the way, Paseo Santa Luc\u00eda is beautiful, well kept and with a lot of families there, but that is one place I do not recommend at night.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

165242811.name: Boat ride from Parque Fundidora to downtown Monterrey
165242811.author: a TripAdvisor user
165242811.reviewBody: We really enjoyed the boat ride from Parque Fundidora to downtown Monterrey in Paseo de Santa Lucia. The ride describes many interesting features of the city and ends near the three big museums. While we did not visit the museums that day, we had a wonderful time walking around the city.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

165127227.name: A super nice place to go on sundays
165127227.author: a TripAdvisor user
165127227.reviewBody: I go to this place usually on Sunday mornings and I love it. You should go here to have a nice time with your family and friends.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

163298732.name: Best in Town
163298732.author: a TripAdvisor user
163298732.reviewBody: the best place in town, nice walk by river side , there are a couple of restaurants, but the nicest for me that night was a place called "San Luisito" in that bar was playing a band really nice and the service was good, this bar is located next to the museum.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

162651053.name: Cool take
162651053.author: a TripAdvisor user
162651053.reviewBody: Great little model of San Antonio\'s river walk.  Watch your wallets and purses a little more carefully when not on the boat, but great trip through the park and into downtown.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

153460026.name: Wonderful!!
153460026.author: a TripAdvisor user
153460026.reviewBody: Never seen anything like it.  This is a MUST if you go to Monterrey!   And it is not expensive to ride the boat.  Around $50 pesos round trip  :)

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

153126609.name: A little piece of paradise in a very big city
153126609.author: a TripAdvisor user
153126609.reviewBody: An amazing place to just take an afternoon and stroll along the artifical river in the middle of a very large city.  Just a few blocks away the traffic and noise is staggering but once you go down the steps to the Paseo you would never know that you were in Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

151854345.name: Escape Monterrey without leaving
151854345.author: a TripAdvisor user
151854345.reviewBody: Going from the area close to the Palacio del gobierno for kilometres along an artificial canal with water features, art, restaurants and street vendors was a nice relaxing way to spend a Sunday afternoon. There\'s also boats giving guided tours along it in Spanish though I didn\'t take it.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

149958122.name: One of the few open public spaces in Monterrey
149958122.author: a TripAdvisor user
149958122.reviewBody: It was developed due to the world cultural  fair 2010. It\u00b4s now one of the few open and public sites in Monterrey. Even though Monterrey is one of the biggest and whealthies cities in latin america it has not public spaces. well it\u00b4s a nice river walk (like san antonio one) and you can take little boats if you don\u00b4t want to walk, but keep in mind to visit it around "10am - 5pm)

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

147652790.name: A work in progress
147652790.author: a TripAdvisor user
147652790.reviewBody: Some perspective is important here....Monterrey is not a city known for being a major tourist destination...its not Campeche, Cuernavaca, Guanajuato, Merida, Puebla, Queretaro, San Luis Potosi, San Miguel Allende, Zacatecas nor Ciudad de Mexico or Guadalajara, for that matter.  If you like industrial parks, modern industries, high-rise residential towers, modern shopping centers, great universities, good restaurants and mountains....Monterrey has all of that.  The city is a little thin on touristic type things to see and do, however, and the government has been pouring money and effort into the Canal Santa Lucia and the adjacent Paseo.  You can learn a lot about the history of Monterrey, but the paseo remains the domain of a lot of ponderous concrete.  The development of compatible retail shops and restaurants, cafes and bars has lagged, so while you can get some good exercise by walking from one end to the other, there is not really all that much to see.  Make sure you walk when the weather is good, because on a dreary day, all that gray concrete makes it look even more dreary. The civic master plan calls for more improvements, maybe the La Capital project along Felix Gomez will be the first of a series of urban redevelopment projects that actually transforms this project into the kind of experience that it could be....right now it is promoted as one of the seven or eight) "wonders" of Mexico, which would be something of a stretch. Keep your expectations modest.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

147379245.name: Nice Sunday excursion!
147379245.author: a TripAdvisor user
147379245.reviewBody: My fiance and I enjoy visiting Paseo de Santa Lucia. It reminded us of San Antonio but its more like a man made river pool. Its a nice way to enjoy a day and spend a few hours. I recommend walking the macroplaza before going on a boat trip on Santa Lucia. It will take you to fundidora where you can walk around more! Perfect way to spend the day in Monterrey!

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

147258183.name: funny
147258183.author: a TripAdvisor user
147258183.reviewBody:
a touch of river walk in monterrey
pretty place to be afternoon with the family and friends
a botero piece there interesting
is in downtown free entrance but you need to spend a few bucks if you want to ride a bout, is fun so DO IT

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

147035193.name: Nice place to walking around
147035193.author: a TripAdvisor user
147035193.reviewBody: Nice place to visit in Monterrey. It begins at Monterrey downtown and follow until the Parque Fundidora. We were confuses about it, but during this walking we can see the mountain throughout the walking. My wife and I had a good time there. You can get a little boat round trip. But I guess is better go one trip walking and returned by boat. There are bikes to rent, is really nice. The food options are not the best for my taste, but you will have several snack options. Nice place to get nice shots with you camera.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

144709561.name: In the heart of the city, the best stroll
144709561.author: a TripAdvisor user
144709561.reviewBody:
This is a must, visiting Monterrey is a great place to go and walk while talking with you're fav person, friends or if you are on a date. the "Paseo Santa Lucia" is a long way with stairs, benchs, artificial lakes, fountains, sculptures, waterfalls, people jogging, doing yoga, dancing, meditating in the grass, grooms and brides taking wedding pictures, children playing, ppl playing music, singing, etc etc.

This a very nice walk and connects "Parque Fundidora" with "Macroplaza" "Museum of Mexican History" "Arena Banamex" and a lot of great places to delight your eyes and senses.

definitely a joyful attraction.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

141833193.name: Enjoyable afternoon
141833193.author: a TripAdvisor user
141833193.reviewBody: This was a wonderful place to spend the afternoon.  The riverwalk runs from Parque Fundidora down to the Macroplaza. Whether you walk or ride it is an exellent way to see the sights. It is clean and safe. The weekends can be busy. The cost is 50 pesos for a round trip ticket.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

140172619.name: nice walk by the river
140172619.author: a TripAdvisor user
140172619.reviewBody: it has everything, restaurants right aside the river, people selling stuff, chips, rings, whatever, and the landscapes are pretty. But do not dare to walk it in summer, you will totally melt!

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

138569921.name: Great artificial "river"
138569921.author: a TripAdvisor user
138569921.reviewBody: I didn\'t expect to find this in Monterrey, it is a very cool artificial river that they made about 2 years ago. You can take a boat and it takes you all the way in to the Parque Fundidora.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

137896274.name: very good place to walk
137896274.author: a TripAdvisor user
137896274.reviewBody: one of the best place to go for a walk, nice river walk . also lot to see museums and architecture, must go if u are in monterrey

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

137839567.name: Nice sightseeing of Monterrey
137839567.author: a TripAdvisor user
137839567.reviewBody: It is a wonderful tour right in the middle of the city town.  The guide boys are fun, they explain a lot of interesting things about the area and the sourroundings.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

136525366.name: Great place!!
136525366.author: a TripAdvisor user
136525366.reviewBody: It\'s a peaceful place, has great gardens and restaurants, and at the end of the river you can find fundidora park :)

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

136142873.name: Even on a hot day!
136142873.author: a TripAdvisor user
136142873.reviewBody: We are not used to a lot of heat, but it was really hot during our visit (upper 90\'s - 100\'s), including the day we walked along the river.  Even though it\'s not a natural river - it\'s perfectly clean (i.e. "swimming pool water) and is made of cement with no plants - it is a refreshing place to go, dip your toe in the water or run your hand through one of the many waterfalls.  It\'s very clean with nothing to make us fear for our safety.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

136107385.name: awsome
136107385.author: a TripAdvisor user
136107385.reviewBody: i just loved it all, the place its beautiful, so full of colors, history and most of all so welcoming to people from other countries. the guys that drive the boat down the river are so funny, very tent, patient and helpful understanding the history of monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

134908352.name: Nice walk or jogg around
134908352.author: a TripAdvisor user
134908352.reviewBody: Amazing walk around the old quarter in Monterrey, we did it late on a Sunday morning during the summer and the heat wasn\'t so bad. It is relaxed and can be either walked or jogged. We walked from the History Museum to the end and back along the river walk and it took us an hour and 45 min. The background classical music is relaxing and you\'ll find plenty of resting stations with vending machines and restrooms. The concerts up by the History museum are really nice too. Great for the entire family. It is nice to see such attractions in Monterrey. Highly recommended for locals looking for a break or tourist wanting to see the historical quarter.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

133614024.name: One of the sites worth seeing in Monterrey
133614024.author: a TripAdvisor user
133614024.reviewBody: First opened in 2007 for the International Forum of Cultures, it has remained well kept and is still being developed. You can take a boat trip from one end to the other for 40 pesos, (one end is the Macro Plaza or from the Parque Fundidora end). About 2 kms or so. There is a guide  on board ,but this is just in spanish, but even so you can see some great view. You can ofcourse walk it as well.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

130160239.name: VERY NICE TRIP
130160239.author: a TripAdvisor user
130160239.reviewBody: This is a very nice trip that you can take when you go to monterrey. Its a bote ride in a very clean artificial river that takes you from down town monterrey to parque fundidora. Its $50.00 pesos and you can come and go any time you want

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

127501244.name: Nice boat ride between Macroplaza and Fundidora
127501244.author: a TripAdvisor user
127501244.reviewBody:
If you only have a short time to tour Monterrey, the two areas you should definitely visit are Macroplaza with its monuments & museums, and Fundidora with its convention center, steel mill museum, and kiddie amusement park. These two are connected by an artificial river called Paseo de Santa Lucia. It looks like a very long and meandering swimming pool trafficked by tourist boats. A return ticket for the boat ride is 50 pesos for an adult and 25 pesos for a child; the trip is worth it.

The area is relatively well maintained and monitored, so it's clean and safe. We ate at one of the restaurants on the river side, and while the price was a bit high for Monterrey standard, the food was good. There are all sorts of statues, paintings, and waterfalls along the route, and of course there's the scenic view of the city and the surrounding mountains.

There was no festival when we visited, but it wasn't boring because there were enough things to see.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

126844563.name: Not too much to see
126844563.author: a TripAdvisor user
126844563.reviewBody: Worth going during the festival days, but otherwise not too much to see.  Parque Fundidora or one of the museums (Marco, Museo de Historia) are better choices.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

126144878.name: Great for a leisurely stroll.
126144878.author: a TripAdvisor user
126144878.reviewBody: Nice little cafes and restaurants dot this little body of water. It\'s enjoyable, makes you feel like you\'re out of the city.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

124533224.name: I love it!
124533224.author: a TripAdvisor user
124533224.reviewBody: Everyone should take the boat that goes from Fundidora Park to Museo de Historia Mexican. It\'s a really relaxing trip, except when the boat drivers talk to much. When the weather allows it, I enjoy walking along the artificial river too.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

123823760.name: nice romantic
123823760.author: a TripAdvisor user
123823760.reviewBody: i love taking my girlfriend to this place and great place to walk

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

123284202.name: It\'s a fun ride
123284202.author: a TripAdvisor user
123284202.reviewBody: It\'s more like a ferry that will take you from downtown to Fundidora park and back as long as you have your ticket you can use it to go oneway explore and then return later.  The route along the way is packed with great scenery.  good picture opportunities.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

122838970.name: Relax and spend time with the family
122838970.author: a TripAdvisor user
122838970.reviewBody: you can be there as a tourist, as a local, in very way and enjoy a clean and culturally rich environment with activities that go from Ice Skating, museums (more than 5) convention center, restaurants, biking, ride a boat, etc... If u r visiting Monterrey plan at least a day for all these activities.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

122297750.name: nice try
122297750.author: a TripAdvisor user
122297750.reviewBody: its getting better, place look nice but lacks of security and things to do... its nice to walk by but there are only a few stores and restaurants placed close to Museum of Mexican History, if they add more venues and things to do it would get better

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

120884551.name: Good views
120884551.author: a TripAdvisor user
120884551.reviewBody: The views of the city are good, the stories told by the guides are very funny but only offered in Spanish. some of the fountains need some maintenance. The best was the dinner at the restaurants next to the "river".

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

114960430.name: Paseo Santa Lucia ... where you will spend great moments
114960430.author: a TripAdvisor user
114960430.reviewBody: Paseo Santa Lucia is an artificial river that was inaugurated in November 2007 during the Universal Forum of Cultures in Monterrey center that takes you through 2.5 km long to the parque Fundidora, during the visit you will see murals by artists , restaurants beside the river, big and beautiful gardens. Once reaching the end of the journey to the parque Fundidora, you will find plenty to do as well as museums, I recommend the restaurant  called "El Lingote" inside what was the foundry (fundidora).\nBetter bring comfortable clothes and tennis as it is a huge park. I highly recommend them and during the tour the tourist guide will narrate the history of every important thing or place.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

102101557.name: Best (and most Beautiful) Attraction in Monterrey!
102101557.author: a TripAdvisor user
102101557.reviewBody: Paseo de Santa Lucia was inaugurated in recent years. This is the most beautiful area to visit in the downtown Monterrey area! You take a small boat down the river (price: $3.00 Dollars) which takes you on a 30 minute ride to the end of the stream. There, you may disembark, if you wish to explore the well-maintained park.

address.streetAddress: Dr. Coss, 445 Sur Zona Centro

662067926.name: nice place
662067926.author: a TripAdvisor user
662067926.reviewBody: Good for family with young children, the movie was great at the IMAX theater, major leage baseball expo was nice.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

659767668.name: Afternoon full of fun and learning
659767668.author: a TripAdvisor user
659767668.reviewBody: This is a place for people from 4-6 thru 85 at least....everyone can enjoy and learn something new. Pleasurable places to visit, play, see and learn plus an excellent movie theater to watch amazing IMAX movies. In and out places and shopping too.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

659736251.name: Excellent IMAX theater and interactive exhibits.
659736251.author: a TripAdvisor user
659736251.reviewBody: The dinosaur and MLB exhibits were really fun, and the students working the exhibits are very helpful. Go on Wednesdays, when the tickets are half off.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

652568839.name: Shamer
652568839.author: a TripAdvisor user
652568839.reviewBody: Was a icon of monterrey which the younger generation is turning into a real estae oportunity...Whatb a differ3ence a few generations and years make

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

624036368.name: Great for Private Events but you can\'t turn up the volume
624036368.author: a TripAdvisor user
624036368.reviewBody: I did a concert in a corporate private event and all the time the people working here asked us to turn down the volume. \nTake this into consideration for your events in this place.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

611022312.name: Perfect for children and adults.
611022312.author: a TripAdvisor user
611022312.reviewBody: There is a beautiful group of peacocks and different birds outside, just before you start the visit, then you have a science museum, perfect for children 3-14, and also an IMAX theater, with very interesting documentaries.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

603078672.name: Dialogos en la Obscuridad
603078672.author: a TripAdvisor user
603078672.reviewBody: An inspiring experience, walk through pich black with a blind guide and explore your comunication skills with your self, your enviorment and your guide.\nThis has been one of the most \u201ceye\u201d opening journeys in my life. I went back several times. It is never the same and I totaly recomend it for friends snd family aged teens and up.\nIf you deal with claustrophobia it is not for you.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

599921123.name: One place to definitely visit in Monterrey
599921123.author: a TripAdvisor user
599921123.reviewBody: It is located in a secluded spot in the exclusive San Pedro area and it delivers great fun for the whole family. There is a large garden where peacocks roam freely and are familiarized with humans enough so you can approach them and take pictures. There is a section dedicated for kids full with games and water fountains. The theme of the season were animatronic dinosaurs which look real and the kids greatly enjoyed. The planetarium is a small building playing continuous info about the stars and our position in our solar system, It was informative and fun. There is also an IMAX show that plays at certain times and has to be purchase in advance at the entrance of the planetarium. We spent 6 hours filled with fun and I highly recommend this place for families.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

599885392.name: So much fun!
599885392.author: a TripAdvisor user
599885392.reviewBody: Cool place. The 5th floor was totally empty when I went with my wife which is sad because it is interesting. Lots of interactive games and educational stuff but I hope SOME parents can Teach their kids patience as they tend to cut the line and (more) staff should be on hand to control that.\n

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

599881614.name: Another great place to visit in the city.
599881614.author: a TripAdvisor user
599881614.reviewBody: Cool place. The 5th floor was totally empty when I went with my wife which is sad because it is interesting. Lots of interactive games and educational stuff but I hope SOME parents can Teach their kids patience as they tend to cut the line and (more) staff should be on hand to control that.\n

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

570643422.name: Treasure in San Pedro
570643422.author: a TripAdvisor user
570643422.reviewBody:
Fantastic children’s museum
Several floors of interactive exhibits 
The IMAX theater is incredible

Even the food in the cafeteria is great!
Don’t miss out in the  ducks and exotic birds that you can buy food for and hand feed 

It’s a must see tourist spot!!!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

559070466.name: Very interesting museum and theater!
559070466.author: a TripAdvisor user
559070466.reviewBody:
I had not been at the Planetario for over 30 years! and it is still an excellent place to go with your kids!
You can see a little wear in the building walls and floors, but still the attractions and science museum experiments are very well maintained.
The IMAX feature was a bit boring, I believe that there could be better movies that take advantage of the IMAX format.
And also, two floors were closed, so we could not enjoy the museum at its full.
However, this is definitely a must go if you are a tourist in Monterrey.
Enjoy!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

556335522.name: Good place!
556335522.author: a TripAdvisor user
556335522.reviewBody: Technically it is not a planetarium but you will find many things to do, they have an IMAX dome, a very cool aviary and regularly has displays and activities for all ages. Gret way to spend the weekend.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

552602535.name: Great time!
552602535.author: a TripAdvisor user
552602535.reviewBody: Great museum with plenty for all ages to do! The live shows, theater and current exhibitions were amazing.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

549319665.name: Great for children!!
549319665.author: a TripAdvisor user
549319665.reviewBody: The main activity is an Imax Movie, a very good experiense in a theather with a georgeus screen. Also there are different leves plenty of activities where children can learn about science and at the same time have fun with them.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

538922318.name: Go early, great for kids
538922318.author: a TripAdvisor user
538922318.reviewBody: My two young boys and I have been 5+ times, and it\u2019s so much fun. We always go right at opening on Sunday, and we have the place to ourselves to run, explore, and play. Highly recommended for kids of all ages! Bring a ziplock to hold food for birds!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

525235759.name: Great
525235759.author: a TripAdvisor user
525235759.reviewBody: My boy love this place and yesterday was better for him cause the had the Lego experience  and was fun for him you can spend great time here and it\'s cheap

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

521236194.name: Dont loose time nor money
521236194.author: a TripAdvisor user
521236194.reviewBody: This is very boring even for kids. Expesive and not worth it. If you want to have fun with family go somewhere else.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

518968608.name: Superior small museum and IMAX.
518968608.author: a TripAdvisor user
518968608.reviewBody: We have gone here a dozen times. Between the special exhibits, the aviary, the outdoor activities and IMAX it is an excellent family day trip. We feed the birds, see an IMAX and walk the exhibits and always have a great time. It can get crowded on Sundays, but we always have gotten in quickly and enjoyed our day there. The gift shop and cafeteria are reasonably priced as well. The special exhibits are excellent and make the trip worthwhile with the permanent features always worth doing again.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

510787860.name: I like special exhibitions
510787860.author: a TripAdvisor user
510787860.reviewBody: Its a really nice place, need to get some work, like maintenance, we went to see a special exhibition, was really nice experience but I still believe they can do more for the place. They have special prices now what is really nice, the gift shop is really poor, you need more variety.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

507806217.name: Very Limited Hours and Long Lines
507806217.author: a TripAdvisor user
507806217.reviewBody: Tuesday-Friday, the hours are from 2:30-7:00 pm.  That\'s 4 1/2 hours per day and when we went there, the car line was about a half a mile long.  It would have probably taken us an hour just to get in.  It\'s a beautiful place but it\'s poorly managed and the hours need to be extended.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

502955377.name: Alright place to spend an afternoon
502955377.author: a TripAdvisor user
502955377.reviewBody: Planetario Alfa is nice. They are different exhibitions, you can see a few animals. Though it was crowded when we went and there was nothing extraordinary. Why not for one day but it\'s not the first place I would recommend to go there.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

500066715.name: Aviary was standout!
500066715.author: a TripAdvisor user
500066715.reviewBody: While marketed to families with kids, this is a fun place to spend 1-2 hours any hot afternoon or anyone. Best highlight is the aviary with many peacocks, peahens, geese, ducks, parrots and more! You can buy bird feed to share with the animals. The sculpture garden includes statues from all over Mexico dating back to the 700s CE and there is an interactive science/physics play area. The museum itself is very interactive as well and the exhibit on the human body lets you play games to learn about the components of the body. There are two impressive floors devoted to a lego exhibit. The cafeteria has the \u201call-the-rage\u201d (crepe-like) ice cream roll for sale which is reasonable tasting but VERY fun to watch and attempt to eat.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

486668158.name: A must see while in Monterrey, great interactive museum with planetarium and IMAX screen!!!
486668158.author: a TripAdvisor user
486668158.reviewBody: Hi,\nI don\'t care how old you are or your children are, everyone is bound to have fun here! I been coming since I was a young kid , then as young adult with my elementary-age kids, later on as teenagers, and even now that they are adults we still enjoy the occasional visit every time we are in The city for a few days. The screen is awesome and well maintained, the interactive museum and amenities are top notch ( compared in quality and attractiveness with similar places at San Antonio, Dallas, Houston TX) and obviously the price too (well below 10 US dlls). You can also bring comfortable/sport clothes and when done, hike the \'cerro Chipinque\' nearby, which is free and will make for a great workout and open your appetite just In time for a good dinner in the area ( The museum sits in the municipality of San Pedro Garza-Garcia which is top notch and one of the best suburbs for second to none food, shopping and stays).\nHighly recommend the place and surrounding area for a full day adventure and a late afternoon shopping /dine experience!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

485002473.name: Great for kids!
485002473.author: a TripAdvisor user
485002473.reviewBody: Went there on family trip, the movie was amazing but everything else is the same as 10!yrs ago it could you a little updating

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

479485133.name: A Nice Place for the Little Ones
479485133.author: a TripAdvisor user
479485133.reviewBody: It\'s actually more fun for the kids, its like a science museum so they get to play around while learning, IMAX Theater is very good. They have also a small aquarium on ground level and some animals on the outside. There is also a playground outside.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

470450567.name: Always a great outing
470450567.author: a TripAdvisor user
470450567.reviewBody:
Memorable museum spectacular movie 
Always fabulous 
Great ideas   Great exhibits 
Great staff
Special opportunity to feed the peacocks and ducks outside 
Unforgettable memories with children

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

470212888.name: Great place to visit when in Monterrey.
470212888.author: a TripAdvisor user
470212888.reviewBody: I don\'t know why it\'s listed twice but as I stated in the other listing, not a place to be missed when down in Monterrey.  Look up their facebook page to see when they have free entry and their event calendar. I went back in July and it was a great experience, there is an IMAX theatre in the middle of the main structure which shows all kinds of nature specials.  I went when they had the da vinci exhibition which was great since it was interactive.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

470212397.name: Excellent place to go and experience.
470212397.author: a TripAdvisor user
470212397.reviewBody: I really enjoyed my visit here, I went during the Da Vinci exhibition which was quite interesting.  It is a bit on the smaller side, at least the exhibition part.  I\'ve read on their facebook page that they have added other buildings to see and experience which might add to the trip itself.  Nevertheless not a place to be missed when touring Monterrey.  Granted it is in San Pedro which is a short 15-20 minute drive from downtown monterrey as long as you don\'t drive bewettn 5-7PM as the main road Gonzalitos turns into a parking lot. Sometimes they have free shows, you only pay for parking which is around $50 pesos, check out their facebook page to find out about the next one.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

467625710.name: Great to bring the kids!  it has scientific games, big birds to feed in wild area, movies, 5 floors
467625710.author: a TripAdvisor user
467625710.reviewBody: If you have kids this place is a must once a year!  Museums, surround 360 movies, big wild birds, fish, technology and physics games, gardens, big, open and enjoyable.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

462004000.name: A simple planetarium - not taken good care of
462004000.author: a TripAdvisor user
462004000.reviewBody: Planetarium has outdoor and indoor activities demonstrating some of the physical laws mostly for kids. All the equipment looks old and is not taken good care of. Inside they are screening documentaries or movies depending on what theme they have in the current month. Usually it is default movie format projected on the curved ceiling of the planetarium theather. Do not expect Imax or night-sky like experience.\nThe only exceptional part is little ZOO at the parking lot. You will see many different varieties of birds with a chance to touch them - you can buy pellets from food dispensers for a few pesos and birds are very used to people feed them.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

460480105.name: a lot of interesting activities to do
460480105.author: a TripAdvisor user
460480105.reviewBody: there is a big round screen that they show movies and they have a lot of exhibits where the kids can spend a lot of time also there is some outside activities

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

455381671.name: Fun and interesting
455381671.author: a TripAdvisor user
455381671.reviewBody: Has hand on exhibitions so that both, children and adults interact and apply fun and amazing the laws of physics.\nA good time for families with young children.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

442906174.name: Nice educational experience
442906174.author: a TripAdvisor user
442906174.reviewBody: Geared mostly towards kids, this was still enjoyable for our 3 adult group. Clever experiments, science experiment demonstrations, and a nice (tiny) observatory. We had a nice couple hours here - and especially enjoyed the park-like grounds which were peaceful and relaxing in a quiet San Pedro neighborhood.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

441254895.name: Great place to spend an afternoon
441254895.author: a TripAdvisor user
441254895.reviewBody: This is a great place if you like science, you can get into the Imax theatre and watch the movies they have available and also you get to learn while playing.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

428877705.name: Very fun place to take your kids!!
428877705.author: a TripAdvisor user
428877705.reviewBody: There are many things for your kids to do here, also, the movie they play (varies) is impressive! As an adult I enjoy visiting here, I\'m sure my kid loves it!. During summer, be sure to stay well hydrated as it gets hot !! Don\'t forget sunscreen for the little ones!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

401912343.name: IMAX was great. Exhibits were lacking
401912343.author: a TripAdvisor user
401912343.reviewBody: The iMax featured a movie about USA national parks and was awesome. The space exhibits were all in Spanish and a bit boring. This is not really a planetarium. They have a small telescope and couldn\'t see anything. If you don\'t like lots of crying kids, probably not a good place to go.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

389419453.name: Great experience!
389419453.author: a TripAdvisor user
389419453.reviewBody: This was a fun place to visit. They teach conservation and recycling and share information about space travel and the planets.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

386227061.name: beautiful experience
386227061.author: a TripAdvisor user
386227061.reviewBody: I am looking forward to go again, it is fantastic experience for adults and for kids as well. i love it there.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

365768666.name: Kid\u00b4s will love it
365768666.author: a TripAdvisor user
365768666.reviewBody: Visit MTY? do you have kids? this is one of the best paces to go with them. They have Imax theatre, and movies always.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

352201078.name: It was greatest!
352201078.author: a TripAdvisor user
352201078.reviewBody: Right now is not the best attraction to go. They don\'t have the best maintenance. Right now they have a problem because the owners want to sale and build a luxuries buildings and commercial center, etc. The IMAX movies are amazing, they always have an excellent diversity. The restaurant is not good. The expositions some are good, but another are not good.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

347932513.name: Great place to visit
347932513.author: a TripAdvisor user
347932513.reviewBody: I had visited this place last week along with friends. The iMax experience was just mind boggling. The documentary about the Grand Canyon was awesome. The museum also had 4 more floors of interesting science activities. I could see many kids enjoying the experience.\n\nI visited on the first Tuesday of the month when it is completely FREE :)

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

318946824.name: Awesome
318946824.author: a TripAdvisor user
318946824.reviewBody: It\'s a great place to visit with your family even better if you have young kids cuz there there are a lot of entertaining and fun activities to do that will teach the young but beware irs expensive and everything is in spanish.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

306164361.name: The kids will love it !!!
306164361.author: a TripAdvisor user
306164361.reviewBody:
Every time you have a chance to domsomething great withnyour kids, do not miss Planetario Alfa !!!
The movies are great and it is the largest screen in Monterrey an IMAX and the movie Jouney to Space was great !
Then visit the different exhibitions and The Observatory !!! 
And dont leave without strolling through the Aviary ( Aviario) ... 
Your kids and you will love everything !

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

302986151.name: Not so much to do/see...
302986151.author: a TripAdvisor user
302986151.reviewBody: Had it not been for the movie Journey to Space and peacocks outside, this place would had been a complete waste of time.  I was really excited to spend a day there.  To my dismay, it took about 2 hours (15 minutes of it waiting for the movie and 40 minutes to watch it).  2 floors were under constructions...hopefully for new exhibits.  I honestly wouldn\'t even recommend it unless you live or stay nearby and want to watch the movie.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

299719149.name: Great IMAX Theater  and a Nice Science Museum
299719149.author: a TripAdvisor user
299719149.reviewBody: This Museum has a long tradition on Monterrey, it is used to be one of the main attractions for locals and tourist.  Now it is a nice science museum with two permanent exhibition (A look inside your body and Old Mexicans) and two temporarily exhibitions that usually changes every six months.  We were lucky to see an exhibition about Leonardo da Vinci\'s  Machines.  Besides this museum have a Science Playground great for the kids and a lovely Stain Glass created by the great mexican artist Rufino Tamayo called "Universe".  \n\nThe other main attraction it is the IMAX Theater. You can buy tickets for the museum and the IMAX movie or just tickets for the museum.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

298967873.name: Nice for younger visitors.
298967873.author: a TripAdvisor user
298967873.reviewBody: Loved the peacocks and walking trails. Lots of things for younger children, but I\'m spoiled by first class museums in Boston, so was not overly impressed with the content of the exhibits. We did an IMAX show about space exploration and NASA, which was interesting.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

298779710.name: Science and Technology Landmark
298779710.author: a TripAdvisor user
298779710.reviewBody: This place is another landmark in the metro area of Monterrey, built by Alfa one of the biggest corporate businesses in Mexico it is now run by the government. Maybe now is a little run down, but it still has great activities, fun things to do for all family and the only IMAX Theater in Monterrey. Good place to spend an afternoon.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

298281336.name: It seems like nothing has really changed
298281336.author: a TripAdvisor user
298281336.reviewBody: This place reminds me when I was in elementary school and they used to take us as field trips. Nothing really has changed, the place seems a little old, well maintained but still old with some good expositions but not really frequented by people interested in science just in taking some selfies. It is ok to visit if you do not have anything else to do.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

293534376.name: Science and fun can be mixed
293534376.author: a TripAdvisor user
293534376.reviewBody: They handle interesting exhibitions during the year + the chance of the mega screen.\nThe place is located with a privileged view, great service and it\'s a pretty good idea to introduce children to science and somehow nature as per adjacent gardens in this cool and nice place where playing can learn.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

293029022.name: A classic
293029022.author: a TripAdvisor user
293029022.reviewBody: Bring the kids, they will like it. For couples depends on the day, some day of the week, I dont recall which one, they bring food trucks and a small bazaar which is also a good experience. They are planning on closing it to use the land for housing, so enjoy it while it lasts.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

260090659.name: Amazing
260090659.author: a TripAdvisor user
260090659.reviewBody: Nice plaplace ihgfddsddfgghjkuhdg hgbkmh wwhwhawhat a hcooeojniibxsivtnh hjgfvccvbvgcckgxvjjjjhbv ccgjknhuhcdfijc

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

259290894.name: great place to spend half day with children
259290894.author: a TripAdvisor user
259290894.reviewBody: really liked the expos, my little girl enjoyed the interaction with some of the activities they had about the human body, they had probably 4 different things, and the IMAX movies, my daughter liked the best, one about butterflies and another about coral reefs\n\ni\'would not plan to be there for more than 1/2 day, but the kids should really like it.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

244346082.name: Interesting place
244346082.author: a TripAdvisor user
244346082.reviewBody: This Imax theatre is nice, sits in a park like setting. Worth a trip if you are looking for something to do while in Monterey.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

237917636.name: Very good imax theater
237917636.author: a TripAdvisor user
237917636.reviewBody: I have been here  many times in my life. The location is beautiful. this is not the typical planetarium. If you compare it to the US planetariums this is small. But it is all the city needs. It has beautiful gardens with animals, children love coming to see them. It also has a playground with an outside caf\u00e9.  In the inside you\'ll find the science expositions and the imax theater. It is very calm. Only the days that the schools visit it is really crowded and in the summer mornings with the summer camps. My children have been in this camps and they are the best quality education you can get here in Monterrey. My only recomendation would be to plan your visit in the morning or afternoon trying not to eat here, the food is not that good.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

236634877.name: Nice way to spend afternoon
236634877.author: a TripAdvisor user
236634877.reviewBody: If you go in the morning be prepared to have many school children around you. The imax theater is nice. The grounds are very nice as well.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

227013481.name: Its ok
227013481.author: a TripAdvisor user
227013481.reviewBody: They have allot of stuff in there! But the place is old and needs some maintenance. Nothing completely horrible to make you run away, but its not a fancy museum like Marco. If you go, please go and watch a movie inside, the screen is super HUGE, thats my favorite part.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

210445517.name: Only regret is not having more time
210445517.author: a TripAdvisor user
210445517.reviewBody:
This place is awesome... it was only after I left, I realized how much I missed out on.
Went on a Wednesday (half price day), great deal for a really cool, please touch everything, 2 IMAX movie museum. It is clean, educational fun.  Like most science museums, they have 4-5 fun hands-on exhibits.  The place is big, but you won't get tired of walking.  Cafeteria is better than average food, OK price if you get a couple or family meal. Outside is very clean, lots of shade and nice paths to explore.  They have a zip line for kids!!! I can't believe I missed that!!!! Really cool picnic areas, splash pad, playground, observatory (with a giant telescope)... so much cool stuff.
The gift shop had a few cool unique items, kinda small selection for a place like that.  Prices are good for a museum gift shop.
I would put this on the top of my list for attractions in Monterrey, if you have kids or anyone with mobility issues.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

199453306.name: Agonizing venue
199453306.author: a TripAdvisor user
199453306.reviewBody: Gone are the days when Planetario Alfa was a place for genuine amazement and interactive learning. Most of the activities of this "science museum" have suffered dearly due to overuse, and now lay in ruins.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

169805049.name: Great Sierra Madre view
169805049.author: a TripAdvisor user
169805049.reviewBody: If you are visiting Monterrey the Alfa cultural center is a nice place to go, especially for children, because of the interactive scientific games and the omnimax films (extra fee). Besides, the building is looking the Sierra Madre with beautiful views.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

162651330.name: Super area to see
162651330.author: a TripAdvisor user
162651330.reviewBody: It is such a neat place with a planetarium, an aviary for birds, a museum and a great space to walk with friends or family.  Highly recommend it!!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

147379945.name: Lovely but not much to See
147379945.author: a TripAdvisor user
147379945.reviewBody: Great place to visit but there wasnt much to it. My favorite part was the outside area with the peacocks, birds and ducks. Sometimes they show documentaries and they have a few exhibits, some of which are hands on. Good place to bring kids for the day!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

137118677.name: Great Movie!!!
137118677.author: a TripAdvisor user
137118677.reviewBody: The museum was practically empty. We had a great time playing at the since exhibit. Adults and children can learn playing. The movie theater is great since you can watch science movies projected in a round screen.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

127329611.name: Beautiful Surroundings to see in family
127329611.author: a TripAdvisor user
127329611.reviewBody: I\'ve been here to see the Rufino Tamayo stained glass window, a huge panel that depicts the cosmos, it\'s beautiful and worth a visit. Also I\'ve been here to see IMAX movies, it\'s great as long as you don\'t get too many screaming kids.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

126291682.name: Fun
126291682.author: a TripAdvisor user
126291682.reviewBody: FOR KIDS! \nIt is nice and fun for kids. The playground is great, they learn and play the whole time. The movies are usually good and worth seeing them, it is a round IMAX theater, some people get dizzy... just check it out before you go.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

122839305.name: Watch a movie
122839305.author: a TripAdvisor user
122839305.reviewBody: not in that many places you will be able to see an Omnimax movie like in here. On top of all the exhibitions and just renewed activities.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

16412118.name: Great place for families with small children
16412118.author: a TripAdvisor user
16412118.reviewBody: The Centro Cultural Alfa and Planetario is perfect for families with small children.  We went here with our 5-year-old daughter.  The grounds are beautiful and have many great interesting areas for children to explore (sculptures, play area, fountains, duck pond). We saw an Imax film which was perfect for her age: Fly Me to the Moon.  My daughter doesn\'t even speak Spanish and she loved the movie.  We were staying in the center of town near the Macro Plaza.  We took a cab over to the Centro Cultural Alfa.  On the way back we took the free shuttle that runs between the Centro and the Alameda and then took a shorter cab ride from the Alameda to our hotel.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Roberto Garza Sada No. 1000 Col. Carrizalejo

617755481.name: Beautiful park .
617755481.author: a TripAdvisor user
617755481.reviewBody: The park is beautiful , no doubt . It is very well kept, safe and beautiful . The experience with the free animals is unique and the whole family can have a wonderful day . It\u2019s is quite a drive from Monterrey but the drive is also very nice surrounded by mountains and nice places to stoop for a snack or lunch .

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

601240957.name: Amazing park!
601240957.author: a TripAdvisor user
601240957.reviewBody: I went on the Safari in Disney\'s Animal Kingdom this year and I remember thinking that it doesn\'t hold a candle to Bioparque Estrella\'s safari. This one is amazing! You can buy feed and literally hand it to the mouths of giraffes and zebras and any other animal that comes near your car! And they do come! The safari was in my opinion the best part of the park but honestly everywhere else, the crocodiles show and the birds and the hike up to a beautiful waterfall. It was all a marvellous experience. It\'s all outside so you\'ll be sweating buckets so keep hydrated because it is 100% worth it.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

594505240.name: Great trip to a open zoo
594505240.author: a TripAdvisor user
594505240.reviewBody: If you have an extra day while in Monterrey, take time to go to Bioparque Estrella, a safari type zoo... You will love it...

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

594503913.name: Getting better every year!!!
594503913.author: a TripAdvisor user
594503913.reviewBody: I have visited this park about 10 times in the last 23 years. Last 3 or 4 years the park has been improving greatly, the restrooms are clean, the animals are well fed, there are new experiences and the trails are really nice. 23 years ago, we ate inside the park just because we had to eat but the food was really bad. This last time (July 07, 2018) there were quite a few really good options for food and snacks. The land is about 240 Has and it is really beautiful. There is a trail that takes about 40 minutes to walk, it is beautiful, it has bridges, waterfalls, a river, etc. Great family visit to come in contact with nature and all kinds of animals.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

556074655.name: My Favourite Memorable Place
556074655.author: a TripAdvisor user
556074655.reviewBody: The place where I fell in love with giraffes!! I went to the safari park and at last, I met beautiful giraffes. They were so beautiful and lovely. Other animals are also nice and cute :)\nIt is such a huge park so better go there as early as you can or make a plan what to see.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

551311184.name: Wonderful location to see wildlife
551311184.author: a TripAdvisor user
551311184.reviewBody: This is a wonderful nature reserve where you will get to see a large number of species and wildlife in their natural habitat. Unexpectedly interesting, well kept and safe.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

518448261.name: Great place for the kids with room to grow.
518448261.author: a TripAdvisor user
518448261.reviewBody: We have been here twice now and really enjoyed the park. It is about an hour outside of Monterrey and a bit off the road, but worth the day trip. The number of animals and other things to do is excellent. Definitely, do the safari, and then depending on your group hike the dinosaur trail, the river and water fall walk or the petting zoo. It seems there are more things coming with a lot of room to grow. Watch for ticket specials over the holidays on their website.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

502831599.name: Amazing Safari experience in Nuevo Le\u00f3n
502831599.author: a TripAdvisor user
502831599.reviewBody:
Nuevo León has a lot to offer and this is one of them. Located an hour away from Monterrey's city center, Bioparque Estrella is an interactive Safari themed Zoo; meaning you can feed, touch and play with the animals.

The price is totally worth it and not expensive at all. It includes almost everything except one or two rides.

What´s best, you can ride a boogie that will take you through their natural reserve full of giraffes, zebras, antelopes,water buffalos, and some other animals. While on the ride, the vehicle will stop so you can feed the animals and take pictures with them. This ride will last about 20 minutes.

Then, you have the whole day to enjoy of the petting zoos, a giraffe feeding station, animal rides, shows, food courts, and even a pond with fishes that eat your death skin like in the spa.

Moreover, you can also enter small aviaries with budgies and feed them. They will get so close to you that you will feel an aviary explosion of joy.

I totally recommend it if yo go to NL.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

399214946.name: excellent park
399214946.author: a TripAdvisor user
399214946.reviewBody: the prices is hight but the park is good, you can find coupon in the web and save good money, you can play with water etc............

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

386227399.name: excellent
386227399.author: a TripAdvisor user
386227399.reviewBody: in our days we must take the littleness to see wild animals as much as posible, so they will have memories of them when they grow up, we don\'t know if by their adulthood they will have the chance to still see those animals alive.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

365880767.name: Animals
365880767.author: a TripAdvisor user
365880767.reviewBody: It has a variety of animals of different species and also a some tours of different kinds. It also has places for aldults to enjoy same as kids. It has some water slide but it\'s expensive.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

322915524.name: An excellent park!
322915524.author: a TripAdvisor user
322915524.reviewBody: The park has many attractions, including a Safari where you can see sevaral animals, such as elephants, giraffes and buffalos. A very good place to visit with children.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

314079116.name: Good safari
314079116.author: a TripAdvisor user
314079116.reviewBody: Great spot, not the best safari, I guess, but is nice to have one of this, near a city full of factories and concrete. There is not a large variety of animals around, but it is fun anyway.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

298491152.name: animal kingdom
298491152.author: a TripAdvisor user
298491152.reviewBody: just around an hr drive from monterrey, this safari ish awaits u. not much of animals but here u will get to see a huge space where animals can just do their own thing. most visitors are kids, however there were adult groups too who just wanted to spend their day with nature and animals :) perfect for weekend getaway as well. there are bathrooms and food station u can hop on in case u need anything. overall it was a cool experience

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

288353434.name: Family day with wild animals
288353434.author: a TripAdvisor user
288353434.reviewBody: My boys really liked this place because of the unique opportunity to interact with wild animals.\nThe serengueti safari ride is great but the park need to put atention on vehicles used for this ride, they need some maintenance.\n

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

283149092.name: Nice place for a day trip
283149092.author: a TripAdvisor user
283149092.reviewBody: As a zoo it is ok, the camels were crazy though, they followed the safari truck and tried to took a bite of the food in your hand, actually the little girl sitting next to me was scared to cry by those camels... Despite that this is a nice place for family, lots of activities for kids. As an adult I wish they had more animal species to see.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

227013135.name: Sad
227013135.author: a TripAdvisor user
227013135.reviewBody: It has an amazing variety of animals, but there is not many benches to sit or a place to cover from the sun... and I love sun! but the park is huge, so that many hours under the sun can become a pain, literally. The animals are in small places sometimes so its sad to see them and I felt I would prefer more information.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

210443900.name: This park has a lot of potential
210443900.author: a TripAdvisor user
210443900.reviewBody:
We came here, because we were told they had a lion cub you could take your picture with.  That is ALL my daughter wanted to do while our visit in Monterrey.
We went in June, it was hot and humid.  The place is HUGE!!!, but the layout and just about everything else could be so much better.
Not a lot of shade to get from one exhibit to another. The displays themselves could be a lot better! i.e. the ARCTIC display was a small room (with a/c, so that was nice) where they play you a 5 minute movie about the Arctic (in Spanish), then you walk into this mini (and I mean mini) showcase of a mannequin dressed in Arctic attire, a stuffed polar bear and a robotic Abominable Snow Man to give the kids just enough of a scare, they wont want to go into any other display.... let's see, the film was educational I guess, the polar bear was a good picture op, and then Yeti... I don't see the educational or entertainment value.  All this at an extra cost of course.
The safari tram was cool, although we got on a bus with the noisiest family reunion... they were noisy, and kept throwing trash out the sides (disgusting), the driver never once said to stop, or to be quiet or anything.  In fact, our tour was cut short because he just wanted to get those people out of there.  The camels and ostriches are VERY aggressive when getting food, so not so good for little kids.  They let you out at a giraffe enclosure and you can feed them easy, kids like it.
Dinosaur exhibit was cool and different.  

They have animals you can take your picture with for an extra cost.  These are wild animals who do NOT want to be there posing for tourists.  The lion cub was VERY unhappy, she did NOT want to be there, kept growling and kept trying to swat and bite (she took a swing at my nephew (scratched his cheek), they yelled at my nephew for getting too close, he's 5 and first instinct was to want to pet it. I really didn't want to take pictures out of principle. 

All in all, I would have to say, this park has a lot of work to do, improve paths (not wheelchair or mobility issues friendly AT ALL), more shaded areas, cleaner facilities, cleaner EVERYTHING.  The water areas all around (including ones for the animal) smelled like stagnant water... very sad.

Monterrey has SO MANY COOL places, I would skip this one.  Consider the Planetarium (Planetario Alfa), this is one place we wished we had more time to go back.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

205604437.name: Wonderful place but 45 minutes outside of the city
205604437.author: a TripAdvisor user
205604437.reviewBody: Great place to visit solo or with your family, they have a ride where you can feed the giraffes, it is away from monterrey so I will recommend you NOT to adventure driving alone, hire a tourist guide or make friends with someone local who can take you and show you around, lots of kidnap cases happen around or close to this side of town so BE CAREFUL but enjoy the place, it is worth the visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

193825450.name: so funny!
193825450.author: a TripAdvisor user
193825450.reviewBody: is fun place especially if you get children but not only for them, I have 22 years and I really had fun a lot is a nice place, you can feed the animals by purchasing a cup of food, igualmanera fish found in the lake but be careful when you go on the course and the ostrich approach will not be fed from his glass since this animal is accustomed to wrest full glass people lol\n\nas children have fun =)

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

167684568.name: Park with potential.
167684568.author: a TripAdvisor user
167684568.reviewBody:
The overall experience was good and fun, great natural location with amazing views, very nice to have an outing from the city or have a picnic. The admission prices are fare. Needs a bit of input  in terms of $$ for innovation, quality and mainly ideas because the park's got great potential. Could have been a top class experience...

-Animals: The park is in general not very clean. On one hand, we saw litter practically in every animal enclosure/cage ,which was sad. Also, It was sad to see a tiger and a lion being handled very un professionally by staff. Some animals like these, are being used to make money out of photographs. On the other hand, the animals from the Safari look very happy and healthy. Safari would be better with more animals/ more variety. (no tigers, no lions, etc)

-Staff: In general very unprofessional, some personnel don't even wear badges and uniforms so hard to tell if they can help you or not. However, most staff were kind and welcoming. Staff very unprepared for what they do and they sometimes mislead you or don't know how to provide you the information. 

-Facilities: Dirty ,all in all. Rubbish/litter everywhere. Lack of good practice in handling the parks rubbish - no sustainable input, no recycling campaigns not even for educational purposes (the park is full of families with children) the park itself could be very educational... in terms of nature/animal  preservation and sustainability. They have a first aid centre, which is a must. Some attraction with no wheelchair access in general the park isn't well fitted for wheelchairs or people with disability.

-Attractions: The Dinosaur land best descriptive is : "cheap".. bad quality animatronics and very unrealistic. But its got potential to be a great attraction, very nice locations. It could be a more thrilling experience if Dinosaurs and prop were more realistic and of better quality. The other attractions are fun and safe.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

157914861.name: excellent trip with my family
157914861.author: a TripAdvisor user
157914861.reviewBody: we had a great day with the family when we came here. lots of fun things to do with the kids, you can go there when they open and leave until park closes, totally recommended.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

147606833.name: Best investment in the area
147606833.author: a TripAdvisor user
147606833.reviewBody:
The Bioparque Estrella was very fun, it has enough activities to keep your whole day full. They have the safari where you ride an open trolley around their very extensive grounds to see many animals in what feels like their natural habitat.  Some animals (the harmless ones) are allowed to come close to you and they will stop the bus so you can see them up close. Also before you get on, they sell plastic cups with feed that you can give to the animals, it was a fun experience even for adults just watch out for the ostriches!  They will steal the whole cup right out of your hand in a very swift motion.

Then there are also different games for kids like line gliding and skipping from log to log over a small pond.  
My favorite activity was to walk through the trails, they are pretty long so be prepared to walk a lot.  They're very interesting with some areas going down, others climbing up and even some Indiana jones looking bridges made of wood which are quite scary to be honest but the views are breathtaking and there is also a beautiful waterfall to admire.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

136419960.name: Well maintained and very pretty
136419960.author: a TripAdvisor user
136419960.reviewBody: A whole more best than expected. The place is beautifull, very green and well maintained, the animals at the safary seem healthy and comfortable, It is a lot of fun to feed the animals, beware of the camels they are very forward!.\nThe other atractions are also very nice, you can have a nice fun day with the family and is very affordable.\nOverall very nice experience

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

136170243.name: the safari was fun
136170243.author: a TripAdvisor user
136170243.reviewBody: We really don\'t like to see animals caged and living in conditions that do not let the animals live a "normal" life for them.  There is an area in this park where this is the case with smaller animals.  However, the safari area is great.  The animals are in a similar climate to what they\u2019re used to and have tens of acres to \u201croam\u201d (better than a cage anyway).  There are some fun kids\u2019 activities, too, but it was too hot for us to enjoy them.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

133615057.name: Well worth a visit, but is a full hours drive or more south from Monterrey
133615057.author: a TripAdvisor user
133615057.reviewBody: I have been a couple of times but not recently. Usually when people have visited me. You can go on a safari ride through some of the most beautiful scenery which is lushious and green. There are girafs, hippos, osteritches etc. There are also some lovely walks and paths that you can take and some activities for children

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

124836353.name: Nice way to spend a day outdoors
124836353.author: a TripAdvisor user
124836353.reviewBody: It\'s a fantastic place, especially in summer with various activities for both, adults and kids. We took a tour of wild life sanctuary in our own car, and enjoyed it immensely, with animals walking up to car window; pretty safe as long as you don\'t get out of the car.  If you happen to visit in winter (like we did) then do take your own picnic as not much food available inside or nearby. Would love to visit again in summer...

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

1502559.name: THE BEST!! PLACE TO GO!
1502559.author: a TripAdvisor user
1502559.reviewBody: WOW, that was really the best place and it had the best memories. OK, maybe it\'s for kids.. but I\'m a big kid, my wife loved it too.. better then we expected.. they take you on a ride in a tour bus, and the animals are right on top of the bus.. looking for food.. the camels stick thier heads right inside, zebras, you name it it was worth it.. \ncost is about $10 us.. the trip to the place was $20 (each way) from Cola d Cabello, or more from down town.. so try to arrange a group to go.. or rent a car.. or do whatever you can this was the best part of monterry tourist locations. They also have a waterfall. If you have only one free day this is where I would go again. oh watch your hands on the ostridges...

address.streetAddress: Carretera a Rayones Km. 9 A 55 minutos de Monterrey

674841247.name: Via Ferrata best on the continent
674841247.author: a TripAdvisor user
674841247.reviewBody: This is my second time on Via Ferrata with Gaia Xtreme guiding was an amazing experience. It was also my birthday, so climbing with that intensity made it even more special. The group was small, we started early, the guides were professional and we all had a blast!

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

650155619.name: Never knew this place existed
650155619.author: a TripAdvisor user
650155619.reviewBody: Our contacts in Monterrey took us to this place on our free day as we usually do a tour somewhere in the city during our mission trips.  This is a pass through the mountains in which there have been flash floods.  Very high cliffs can be seen from the river bed with some perches here and there...oned of them is a residence.  Saw several rock climbers applying there skills and a group of rockslimbing novices in a trainng class.  Beautiful scenery but it gets cool when the sun goes down.  Worth a trip to see this place and it is not far from the city center.

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

646134090.name: INCREIDIBLE
646134090.author: a TripAdvisor user
646134090.reviewBody: This place is amazing... perfect for jogging, biking, atvs and of course, the best place to climb in the country. The Via Ferrata excursion is out of this world...

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

609606605.name: Treasure!
609606605.author: a TripAdvisor user
609606605.reviewBody: It is so amazing to reach this place in about 15 minutes from the city hustle and traffic, amazing. The view of the mountains and the entire stretch of around 17km is beautiful. You have couple of places in between to stop, there are spots for rock climbing and other activities which I wasn\'t able to explore. Seems interesting, weekends have heard it gets crowded. Early mornings should be lovely. This place should be higher ranked on the places to visit list for Monterrey :)

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

582474516.name: PIco Independencia- Via Farrata
582474516.author: a TripAdvisor user
582474516.reviewBody: If you like a little adventure in your travel then look up a guide and complete the Via Farrata in the Parque La Huasteca. There is an steep uphill hike to the base/ start of the climb and thus a downhill hike out.  The views of the area from up on the Via Farrata route  are amazing as are the guides and locals that will be on the climb with you.

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

566580004.name: beautiful place
566580004.author: a TripAdvisor user
566580004.reviewBody: Go during the week, on the weekend it is a mexican party area, especially on sunday.  Beautiful views of the mountains and hiking opportunities but I would go with a a group to be safe.  Very hot in the summer.\n

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey
