544129657.name: Amazing. No other words.
544129657.author: a TripAdvisor user
544129657.reviewBody: This place is a treasure. Nestled in the valley between beautiful mountains only 15 min from city center. At the entrance we rented bikes 200 pesos the first hour then 50 pesos each hour after. We rode about 7km out and any cars passing by were very respectful. The road is flat, maybe a little uphill from the entrance but this is only noticeable on the way back as you hardly need to pedal. We returned our bikes and then drove out to the dam. It\'s only 14-15km from the entrance. Very beautiful area. We also saw people rock climbing, running, and walking. This road leads to the dam so it literally has no other purpose other than leisure and getting to the very small town in the middle. There are several places to stop along the way to relax or even buy a snack. Absolutely gorgeous area.

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

506994217.name: Overwhelming on full moon nights
506994217.author: a TripAdvisor user
506994217.reviewBody: Just breathtaking how this mountains look when illuminated by the moon during a clear night . The light effects make them appear surrealistic . It is worth the ride to enjoy this quiet and relaxing park and just stare at the spectacular sights that nature allows you to glimpse. Enjoy and take pictures !!!

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

500062726.name: Wonderful to walk or bike!
500062726.author: a TripAdvisor user
500062726.reviewBody: This canyon is a FANTASTIC place to bike. We rented road bikes from EcoBikes right outside the entrance, which opens at 7am (you can also rent mountain bikes). Though there are guards at the entrance, you can arrive before and still enter without issue. BEWARE the road has very little shade so start early, bring plenty of water and try to be complete by 11am. The mountains on either side of the road are breathtaking and the striations along the ridges, beautiful. There are small stores and farms alongside the road which we did not enter, but looked inviting. The path ends after 18 KM (11.4 miles) at a dam that one can climb, but we did not. Fun side note, the Tuesday we biked there we saw the Nuevo Leon Cycling Team practicing! We spent about 4.5 hours completing 100 KM of cycling (it\u2019s VERY flat).

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

485993539.name: Excellent for cycling or running
485993539.author: a TripAdvisor user
485993539.reviewBody: We were told about this place by a native of Monterrey-and we are thankful to him. The park is surrounded by mountains and has a great place to ride bikes or walk/run. The road is paved and goes all the way to a sealed water damn - the distance is about 9.3 miles. People that are out driving are very respectful to bikers-. It\'s a beautiful place and you have to come see it for yourself. There is no admission fee-it\'s free!

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

479479967.name: Beautiful Mountains
479479967.author: a TripAdvisor user
479479967.reviewBody: Super Scenic Place, Road is about 16 kms long and you end up at Presa Rompepicos, its great for mountain climbing, cycling and running (both trail and road). But choose well when to go. Weekends (from about 4 pm till late night) you can see crowds of people, families, dogs, but also lots of drunks. Early morning the place is desolated so that\'s not good either, unless you are going in group. Behind the Rompepicos, there are unpaved roads for trail running.

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

472222929.name: Romantic, Historic
472222929.author: a TripAdvisor user
472222929.reviewBody: I love that I was recommended this place by a local. Its a short drive from the center of Monterrey and totally worth it. There were couples taking pictures for weddings, there were BBQs going on, and I even spotted a group of men riding horses on the road! Never mind that though, GREAT SCENERY! Very romantic.

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

469750077.name: Impressive rock formations
469750077.author: a TripAdvisor user
469750077.reviewBody: Our guide took us here since we had seen a out everything else in town.  Found the rock for Atkins to be massive and quite impressive.  Were told that the river that runs through it is known as"Death River" because rains in the mountains can cause flash floods which have taken many unsuspecting people over the years.  Saw a number of rock climbers on the rock faces and would have liked to go to the overlook about 200 feet above the canyon floor but we were limited on time that afternoon.  Good place to explore in the future when we have a little more time.  And it is not that far from town.

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

460379441.name: Scenic
460379441.author: a TripAdvisor user
460379441.reviewBody: Beautiful to go visit. Scenic is breathtaking and the roads are in excellent shape. I highly recommend this trip.

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

429523906.name: Trail runners are welcome
429523906.author: a TripAdvisor user
429523906.reviewBody: Great for trail running!! There are lots of places you can run (rail road or trail) best at mornings!

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

429317671.name: If you are a lover of nature!
429317671.author: a TripAdvisor user
429317671.reviewBody: This place is a must if you are a lover of nature! has a greatttts views!! I live near of this place and I recommend sooo much to go by the sunset/nights! the reflect of the sky over the big rock! is incredible!

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

420860637.name: Breathtaking!
420860637.author: a TripAdvisor user
420860637.reviewBody:
This has to be one of the most beautiful places I've ever been to.
Located a distance away from the busy city, this place is stunning and quiet.  
The River Catarina runs through it given the opportunity for people to go and swim or relaxed on its calm but rocky shores, maybe do some grilling (must bring your own grill). The water is always freezing no mater what time of year but on a hot day it feels amazing to sit in its shallow areas. 
Definitely great for hikers and climbers as well.

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

419294033.name: La Huesteca
419294033.author: a TripAdvisor user
419294033.reviewBody: As you drive up to the sheering cliffs you you can see various dune buggies and four wheelers driving by. Great place to rock climb.

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

388857335.name: Scenic view ride (Mountain &  road bike option)
388857335.author: a TripAdvisor user
388857335.reviewBody: It\'s a 10 miles road with scenics view of a valley with beautiful mountains and the past path of Santa Catarina River.  At the end of the road you\'ll  find an abandoned dam.  It\'s worth it if you have time!  Many people  uses this road  to ride in bike so if you\'re a biker don\'t  miss it.

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

359374920.name: Biking while mountain watching
359374920.author: a TripAdvisor user
359374920.reviewBody: This place is good for mountain biking. I rode from entry point to the great retaining wall. Other activities that could be carried out are mountain climbing, running, horse riding or just sit in the car and watch...\nTake as much or as little time as you like. It is a bit tricky to find the official and only entry. But once you do you realize mother nature has awesome powers, this place can and has filled up with water.

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

338505975.name: Great place for a sunday morning
338505975.author: a TripAdvisor user
338505975.reviewBody: This place is visited by families on Sundays and it is good to walk around, kind of windy but nice and fun specially if you have a 4 wheeler.

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

329559209.name: Good for a quiet afternoon
329559209.author: a TripAdvisor user
329559209.reviewBody: Good place to ride a bike, run around and play with your dog. The view is incredible, with large open spaces to camp or picnic. In rain season , small rivers appear. \n

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

311013881.name: Beautiful place for pictures.
311013881.author: a TripAdvisor user
311013881.reviewBody: This place is beautiful for pictures. I love to come here with my family every time I visit Monterrey. We normally make it a picnic day and bar b q at the park. We have hiked up towards the top but it can be dangerous due to lose gravel and rocks. There are sometimes a few people offering to give the kids a ride on horseback while they pull the hose along. They tend to let the older people ride them on their own while they watch from a distance. \n\nMy family likes to stop by the food stand at the entrance of La Huasteca park to buy some "elotes" Corn in a cup. They are pretty good but don\'t expect the corn to be sweet like in the states. They also sale other things I would recommend getting.

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

299015050.name: Amazing views of the limestone hills but very crowded on weekends
299015050.author: a TripAdvisor user
299015050.reviewBody: I visited this place long time ago and again last week.  The amazing views are the same but unfortunately i discovered that visiting on a Sunday afternoon makes for an incredibly crowded scene with very long traffic lines.   I would highly recommend avoiding the weekends if possible and going during the week.   The hills and the beautiful plants make for an impressive drive.

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

298787458.name: A Beautiful Place to Look At or to Visit
298787458.author: a TripAdvisor user
298787458.reviewBody: The Huasteca canyon is a beauty to look at in the mornings. If you happen to drive by close or on a high point in Monterrey you may have a fantastic view of the Huasteca with the dusk coloring the area. Or if you like the adventure you can take your bike and visit the canyon for a fun adventure. There are restaurants in Santa Catarina close to the Huasteca where you can spend an evening looking at the canyon illuminated by the moon while enjoying a nice diner.

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

298549958.name: Incredible Formations
298549958.author: a TripAdvisor user
298549958.reviewBody: You can either make this a short trip to the park entrance to see the formations, or drive about an hour through the canon to the Rompe Picos Dam. I recommend the later. When hurricanes have hit Monterrey, the canon is completely covered by water. There is an impressive dam that will likely have no water as it will only fill up when there is a hurricane. Drive trough the small hole in the lower right of the dame to gauge it size. Later google \u201cFotos Presa Rompe Picos Alex\u201d and be impressed by the amount of water that the dam holds, and how it effectively saves Monterrey from disaster. The rock formations on the mountains makes the drive a very enjoyable ride. You can also bike to the dam.

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

295846035.name: Great place if you bring your wheels
295846035.author: a TripAdvisor user
295846035.reviewBody: Either by bicycle or skates, or even car, this place is worth going, there is hiking routes, climbing routes, bike paths... well mostly asphalt, and many people around. The place is lively mostly when the "river" has some water on it. Take some time to visit it, its close to the city but since its huge, you will probably will need your own wheels, mostly a car to get there and view around or a bike if you are into that.

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

279612262.name: Simply Amazing Vistas of the Canyon
279612262.author: a TripAdvisor user
279612262.reviewBody: Truly one of the most beautiful Canyon vistas just a few hours south of the border. Highly recommend as a day trip or just a drive through Troy to see the Majestic wonders of nature formed into a canyon.Families with small children and even brides were in the area enjoying the day the water and the beautiful sites for picture taking. One day is definitely not enough to see all of this beautifulcountryside, definitely a picnic is in the works for the next visit to the area to enjoy the day to the fullest. Highly recommend a visit to the Huasteca  Canyon

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

256377094.name: amazing rock walls
256377094.author: a TripAdvisor user
256377094.reviewBody: Very close to the city is a national park, where you can appreciate these mountains wall rock formation, is and arid place if you like site seen places, claiming, rappelling, this is quite a place.

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

241317699.name: Incredible place for Rock Climbing
241317699.author: a TripAdvisor user
241317699.reviewBody: The canyon has undergone a ton of changes over the past few years. Roads are back after the hurricane. Simply incredible and a lot of new climbing being developed both single and a lot of huge multi pitch.

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

238789876.name: beautiful
238789876.author: a TripAdvisor user
238789876.reviewBody: Overall I like mountains and this one was no exception, nice place to visit although could not walk through it as it was late in the day.\nThe view is breathtaking

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

202446053.name: Beautiful and grand!
202446053.author: a TripAdvisor user
202446053.reviewBody: This is definitely one of my favorite spots in the whole city, the views are just amazing, it really makes you see how small you are in comparison to nature. I went there to take some night pictures and they are just absolutely astounding.\nThe ONLY thing I would criticize is that there are no bathrooms, there was only one that I could see, and it was privately owned next to a store, they charged to use it, and it was pretty bad, not the worst I\'ve seen, but still pretty bad.\nI think maybe one of two port-a-pottys (at least) along the way would be good to have, especially if you\'re there for the whole day or night.

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

150443920.name: A must see
150443920.author: a TripAdvisor user
150443920.reviewBody: Anyone visiting Monterrey really must make time for a trip into La Huasteca. The views are nothing short of spectacular - pictures cannot do it justice. Since the hurricane, the road is only gravel and I would advise against going more than 4-5 km unless you have a vehicle with good clearance, but even in a small car the first 4-5 km are easily managed. If you are not a hiker or climber, this is still worth the trip - even if you don\'t leave the car.

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

150346340.name: Great place for rock climbing
150346340.author: a TripAdvisor user
150346340.reviewBody: If looking for a place near the city of Monterrey to practice rock climbing, "El ca\u00f1\u00f3n de la Huasteca" is a great place to start, has many routes with different degrees of difficulty and on the weekends you will always find a fellow climber willing to share experience and goo stories with you. \nBeware of the lonely dogs that abound there, you can fall in love with one and want to take it to home with you!\n(Is in the mountains.. ok? they will be no bathrooms so bring your toilet paper with you)

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

147000383.name: Great Walking and Hiking
147000383.author: a TripAdvisor user
147000383.reviewBody: Walking and hiking in the canyon is beautiful and great fun, however, you need to go with someone who has been there before. The roads are washed out from the hurricane, but are being re-paved as I type this (which is actually a bit disappointing. I love the rough ride and rural-feel you get once you pass in to the canyon!). A lovely place to take visitors to Monterrey who want a lovely long, not too strenuous hike.

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

141366076.name: Sightseing
141366076.author: a TripAdvisor user
141366076.reviewBody: Was a beautiful place, full of air and tranquility. I used to go there to  have an special moment, inner space. But unfortunately due to insecurity and violence that Nuevo Leon is linving and having you cannot go there at night and on weekends is so full that sometimes people use to drink and get drunk. Very poor security. That\'s a big shame

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

134485925.name: Amazing geology
134485925.author: a TripAdvisor user
134485925.reviewBody: This is past of the Cumbres National Park, which covers most of the mountains to the south and south west of Monterrey. La huasteca has the most incredible geology as all this is limestone and was once part of an ancient sea bed you can find shells and sea fossils in the stones, Also see how the rock was folded, and created to look like curtains. It is also a place for rock climbers, best to go with a guide, and take care as the rock is fragile. Any other country this park would be a National Monument to the specific geology of the area.

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

124498921.name: Still recovering from Hurricane Alex
124498921.author: a TripAdvisor user
124498921.reviewBody: This is really a beautiful place. But the road was washed out making access difficult.

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

95801749.name: best thing to do in Mexico
95801749.author: a TripAdvisor user
95801749.reviewBody: book in advance. the guides are extremely pofessional. I don\'t know another place on the world where you can do so extreme climbing without having a professional experience.

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

54258472.name: The mountains of Monterrey are amazing
54258472.author: a TripAdvisor user
54258472.reviewBody:
The best thing about Monterrey, Mexico is the surrounding mountain range, and this was a great way to see it. 

These mountains have ridges that are unlike any I've seen in the US. They are bizarre and random and stunning. We didn't rock climb with ropes -- we had 4 kids under the age of 8 with us -- but we did boulder a bit and climbed around with the kids. We had a great time and saw interesting homes on the way there -- some were shacks, others were practically mansions -- all in very close proximity. 

I thought this canyon was fun, but not spectacular. However, after the trip, all of our kids who can talk said that this was the best part of the vacation. Please keep in mind the gates to this park close early (6 pm), which cut our time there short.

address.streetAddress: situado al sur de Monterrey

544131278.name: They close early
544131278.author: a TripAdvisor user
544131278.reviewBody: The park closes at 5. We got there just before 3. We didn\'t realize they cut off the main trail to see the waterfall around that time to make sure people aren\'t around the park after 5. We didn\'t know this so we only saw the first part. It was a very nice walkway with a creek on the side and occasional views of the mountain. The trees were fairly dense and added an ambiance of solitude to the place. Beautiful rock bridges make for some nice crossings and pictures. The price for just the first area is 20 pesos. There\'s a higher price for each section that you pass from what I could tell. But I think the max was 100 or so pesos? Oh also the getting there was pretty rough with cobbled and potholed roads. But it can be done in a car no problem. Just have to go slow at times.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Nacional entronque a Valle Alto

499784774.name: Wonderful natural park
499784774.author: a TripAdvisor user
499784774.reviewBody: If you feel like taking a fun hike with amazing views, you should go to La Estanzuela. It\'s easy to get there and the hike is mostly in the woods, so it\'s not so hot.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Nacional entronque a Valle Alto

486887563.name: Beautiful views
486887563.author: a TripAdvisor user
486887563.reviewBody: Great to go and take a walk or excersice and has a beautiful small river and views of all the mountines that surround the park

address.streetAddress: Carretera Nacional entronque a Valle Alto

482674124.name: Excellent, challenging hike
482674124.author: a TripAdvisor user
482674124.reviewBody:
Parque Estanzuela was quite the challenge, but definitely worth it! We have been wanting to check out this place called Parque Estanzuala, apparently a smaller and less commercialized version of Chipinque. We arrived at about 1 pm on Saturday, and it was packed! So much so that the 2-way street had cars parked on both sides creating a 1-way street in the middle. It made it difficult to accommodate the cars leaving the park, and thus if you plant to leave before 1 or 2 pm, my recommendation would be to part sooner and walk in so that you do not have to fight the traffic. The park “closes” around 2pm, meaning no additional cars can come, because of the distance from gate to hiking trail. 
	Upon arrival, we paid 20 pesos each to get in. No tiendas or cafeterias, just some Coke vending machines (that didnt work). Thankfully we had a bookbag and plenty of water. And thus we began our hike. The park is set up pretty simply - one nice, flat, paved path in a circle from the main entrance, probably about 2-3 km long. At the apex of the paved circular path is a single brick-layered path heading up into the mountain. This leads to the cascada (waterfall) and small river. We took this path, however ended up using the worn away dirt paths on either side, because the incline was so steep, and the bricks so worn, that we were slipping! After about 40 minutes, we reached a concrete platform. This marked about the halfway point to the Waterfall. At this point, we were pretty tired but after some convincing, we decided to finish the hike.
	The next 40 minutes were a mixture of beauty, danger, challenge, and reward. True hiking. Steep. Tight paths, rock formation, etc. There is a small cliff about halfway up the second leg that we stopped and took a picture on- great views! You can hear the echo of the waterfall for about the last 10-12 minutes of the hike, creating excitement for your arrival! Upon arriving, the area was pretty busy with other people, all swimming and enjoying the cool, refreshing water. We dropped a towel down and enjoyed about 40 minutes of the sounds of the waterfall and feeling of the cool water on our feet and face. 
	Overall the trip was about 4 hours from parking to driving away. Probably 1:45 to get to the top, 40 minutes relaxing, and 1:30 down, with break in between. I would not recommend this for someone is does not have good balance, cannot hike steep inclines, or is afraid of heights. We thoroughly enjoyed it, and will hopefully return to visit soon!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Nacional entronque a Valle Alto

474378144.name: Best place MTY
474378144.author: a TripAdvisor user
474378144.reviewBody: This is the best place in monterrey if you want to go for a quick getaway. You can stay as long as you want but you can do it with 4 hours. Ther\'s two ways to do it. The path, wich is safe and easy but boring, or you can go up river. Definetly the best and more enjoyable way to do it. Be awere, it can be dangerous and a little bit extreme, but the view is simply amazing.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Nacional entronque a Valle Alto

458804756.name: Beautiful find!
458804756.author: a TripAdvisor user
458804756.reviewBody: Around 4 km up a country cobblestoned road you reach the entrance and staging area of this nicely kept natural park in south Monterrey. From there you have a "standard" 1.5 km trek up the side of a tranquil creek and can take in the beautiful sites that include towering trees and interesting wildlife (bird-lovers will really enjoy this park). Once you reach the 1.5 km mark you can either circle back down the opposite side of the creek or continue up-mountain where there are nice, refreshing waterfalls. A camera in addition to your typical smartphone is recommended and bug repellent is NOT optional! Enjoy!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Nacional entronque a Valle Alto

429312099.name: In contact with nature!
429312099.author: a TripAdvisor user
429312099.reviewBody: This place is sooo pretty! for some locals unknow also, this is the reason why this place continue so natural! great to talk a walk!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Nacional entronque a Valle Alto

428586271.name: Beautiful place but only for fit people
428586271.author: a TripAdvisor user
428586271.reviewBody: This place is beautiful. Get there early to avoid the crowds. If you are not fit, stay at home or go to Chipinque. You need to hike a lot to get to the waterfalls. To get to the most beautiful one you have to hike for at least 2 hours. There are no signs at all but you only need to hike parallel to the river. I was a little pissed about this at first but I think it is better that the place remains untouched and without hundreds of people. \nPlease please please do not litter on the park!!!!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Nacional entronque a Valle Alto

424199217.name: Wonderful!
424199217.author: a TripAdvisor user
424199217.reviewBody: It is a park that is half an hour from downtown Monterrey - ideal for walking, exercising and purely enjoying the beautiful natural landscapes. The entrance fee is 20 pesos but I\'d recommend going early around 7-8 am to find a free parking lot near the entrance. If you are walking to reach the small waterfalls and wish to return to the pricipal entrance, bear in mind that it will take you around 3 hours.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Nacional entronque a Valle Alto

405638489.name: Be prepare...
405638489.author: a TripAdvisor user
405638489.reviewBody: With water, snacks, comfortable clothes, towel, a good pair of fresh socks!!! \nthe earlier you get there the better, you may spend at least 4-5 hours there.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Nacional entronque a Valle Alto

389447168.name: Nice hike!!
389447168.author: a TripAdvisor user
389447168.reviewBody: If you want a long hike and get a swim in waterfalls and big holes with water, the park is the place for that. It is a very nice place, i enjoyed it a lot with friends. The only negative point is that the first hike part, when it gets very steep, the floor is not adapted for that. People fall over because is too sleepery. They should have put cement or else. Very nice experience

address.streetAddress: Carretera Nacional entronque a Valle Alto

332781927.name: One of the best natural parks in Monterrey
332781927.author: a TripAdvisor user
332781927.reviewBody: This park is a great alternative to Chipinque, walk its 5Km in a open nature environment, if you\'re lucky, you can even take a look at some wildlife like squirrels or bears.\nYou should avoid going on sundays if you want to really enjoy this place.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Nacional entronque a Valle Alto

283480339.name: Increduble place - needs better attention
283480339.author: a TripAdvisor user
283480339.reviewBody: Keepers and owners should pay more attention to details - put signs on the way to get there - there is no information to get there by car. Signaling!! Not expensive at all and informs visitors. You need to be at the level of this amazing place - dont f**^#} it up!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Nacional entronque a Valle Alto

258584815.name: Fantastic place!
258584815.author: a TripAdvisor user
258584815.reviewBody: Like a quiet and nice walking around an oak forest? this is the place!, located just a few minutes from Monterrey down town this is one of the best places to meet with nature! You can do bird and butterfly watching! The palce got restrooms, parking lot, it has a nice walking path! You can not miss it!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Nacional entronque a Valle Alto

133614703.name: Beautiful Place
133614703.author: a TripAdvisor user
133614703.reviewBody: It is a lovely natural nature trail through a green valley. It reminded me a bit of a little corner of the English Lake District. There is a stream that runs down the valley. Many butterflies depending on the season.\nIt is some 20 km south of Monterrey city. Be sensible about the time you go. It does have opening and closing times, which vary depending on the season, but I\'d recommend going in a group and travel to and from the place, (from the National Highway to the Park) without hanging arround and attracting attention to yourself. The site does have park rangers and security

address.streetAddress: Carretera Nacional entronque a Valle Alto

673542248.name: Pleasantly surprised,  and a great place for events
673542248.author: a TripAdvisor user
673542248.reviewBody: The staff here are incredibly accommodating,  and the museum tour is short, but incredibly interesting.  Also, my work had our Xmas party here,  and the place is an incredibly elegant place to have a large party.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

668974538.name: Just amazing
668974538.author: a TripAdvisor user
668974538.reviewBody: Went with family and a toddler, experience 2 very educational shows, one about our atmosphere and the other about the story of Fundidora was amazing with all the music and light production, is a most if you are visiting Monterrey, went up the highest part you can view the whole city and finished at "El lingote restaurant, with a super quality service! Very recommended

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

659391391.name: Fun and interesting
659391391.author: a TripAdvisor user
659391391.reviewBody: A great place to visit in Monterrey. There is a tour guide with you and the whole tour is really interesting. There is a great view from the to the top, a beautiful view of the city and mountains. You will also learn a lot about the history of Mexico\'s industrial revolution and other things. Then after you can walk around the Parque Fundidora, rent a bike or take the bus that gives you a tour around it.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

657217753.name: Interesting historical site
657217753.author: a TripAdvisor user
657217753.reviewBody: Really interesting place to visit. I was w large congress and therefore had cocktails, orchestra, and history movie in main lobby. Amazing. The light show was also cool.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

651809169.name: Amazing !!
651809169.author: a TripAdvisor user
651809169.reviewBody: Really is a place that you shoul go ! is History, It is an amazing experience also has a good restaurant, and you can enjoy all around

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

644321547.name: ENTERTAINING AND EDUCATIONAL !!
644321547.author: a TripAdvisor user
644321547.reviewBody: It is a nice place to visit with or without children to get a cultural notion about monterrey, also the restaurant is ok, not great, but if you want anything besides fast food at fundidora park, this is one of the options you have.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

642528769.name: Interesting place to visit in Monterrey
642528769.author: a TripAdvisor user
642528769.reviewBody: Unusual exhibit in the middle of a beautiful park.  My husband liked this a lot more than I did, but it was still worth the visit.  The guides were excellent.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

640896936.name: Past and future of Monterrey
640896936.author: a TripAdvisor user
640896936.reviewBody: To understand why Monterrey is so different from other places of Mexico, you must visit this museum and its surroundings, like Paseo de Santa Luc\u00eda. It links past and future, it is feasible to take a look backwards in the past and comprehend the working ethics of the people of Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

639020652.name: Museo Horno 3 Restaurant
639020652.author: a TripAdvisor user
639020652.reviewBody:
This restaurant is in Fundidora Park. El Lingote
The chef is one of the best in Monterrey
He used to work in restaurant La Guacamaya in San Pedro
His touch in the kitchen is great
I recomend for lunch eat the salmon with almonds c
The price is worth it; and I recomend was go and try this experience!!!

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

621959645.name: Great museum! Must visit while in town.
621959645.author: a TripAdvisor user
621959645.reviewBody:
I was unsure about the museum visit but decided to attend. Tickets are sold at the entrance but it is definitely worth paying. You receive a personal tour by a dedicated guide during all your visit.
Different "shows" take place as well as a visit to the top of the old furnace structure in a customized lift. Every activity is interesting.
Nice views of the city from above as well. Try to visit when weather is comfortable.
Inside exhibitions are also amazing, you can learn about the process of steel manufacturing in detail as well as the history of the company.
Visit can take 2-3 hours.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

615848136.name: Amazing experience!!!
615848136.author: a TripAdvisor user
615848136.reviewBody: The museu is very interesting and intuitive, it was inaugurated in the 1900 and was under duty until 1986, when it closed due the recession, it was converted in an amazing , visual and technological museu where you can learn and be inspired about how this so important piece of our life\u2019s is obtained and used. Best part was to  be in the \u201chorno \u201c 3 and be able to see each detail of this giant piece by piece. The environmental show was also great. The lingote is also a great place to eat .

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

599879717.name: Provides a great view and many interesting things to learn.
599879717.author: a TripAdvisor user
599879717.reviewBody: A great way to spend a few hours!  A must see in the city.  My wife and I were not given a guide, for some reason, yet we saw everyone else with one.  Despite this, we still had a good time.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

594734474.name: Must Do!
594734474.author: a TripAdvisor user
594734474.reviewBody: We\'re usually not museum-goers when we travel but this was a must for us while in Monterrey. It\'s $100 pesos to get in, and there is plenty to see with two galleries, one interactive one, and two guided shows that takes you into the actual furnace. You can also take the tram up to the top and get a view of this beautiful city! Most of their guides speak only Spanish but there was one guide who spoke english and helped us out! Highly recommend a visit!

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

590390420.name: Nice trip back in time!
590390420.author: a TripAdvisor user
590390420.reviewBody: This museum brings out the story of this magnificent place. One of the founding fathers of this great city it portrays what an amazing place of forge this used to be. This visit may include a visit to the uppermost part of the forging chimneys which in turn offers an amazing view!\nA must see to your Monterrey visit!

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

590387274.name: Cool Place To Visit
590387274.author: a TripAdvisor user
590387274.reviewBody: This restaurant is built on a former steel production facility in Monterrey. We got there late at night, so didn\u2019t get to tour it. However, it was a great experience and we enjoyed the restaurant. Had a delicious steak for dinner, and the service was very good.  Next time I will get there earlier and check out the history gallery or furnace show. I hear they are great!

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

570204667.name: Fun
570204667.author: a TripAdvisor user
570204667.reviewBody: This is a great place to visit, especially if it\'s your first time in Monterrey. There will be a tour guide escorting you and the elevators/lifts are really interesting. When you get to the top, you have a beautiful 360 view of the city and mountains which you\'re allowed to take pictures. You will also learn a lot about the history of Mexico\'s industrial revolution and other scientific things. Please make sure you tip your tour guide. I will be visiting this place when I return hopefully soon.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

567795302.name: Interesting historial perspective
567795302.author: a TripAdvisor user
567795302.reviewBody: This old blast furnace and attendant equipment has been lovingly restored to make an excellent and unique museum to a vibrant industrial past. Don\'t miss the \'blast furnace show\' and make sure you take the \'walk to the top\' which is actually a lift ride with spectacular views at the top.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

565155657.name: Super interesting
565155657.author: a TripAdvisor user
565155657.reviewBody: The exhibition was really amazing, what a great surprise! Worth a visit if you like to see this kind of industrial shows. The Horno 3 Show is worth watching! And don\'t miss the visit to the top of the factory.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

559127039.name: Highlight of Monterrey
559127039.author: a TripAdvisor user
559127039.reviewBody:
If you ever find yourself in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, Mexico, you need to be in this location. Is inside a HUGE park with tons of things to do for visitors (national and international). 
Is more than a museum, there's also a family restaurant called "Lingote de Oro" (The Golden Bar), a little pricey but still is amazing because the restaurant is on a second level, you can see the whole park while you're eating (if you decide to eat outside, there also an inside-option).
Of course the word "museum" is not the title for showcase, this is an actual museum from now-remodeled Foundry. The Foundry was one of the primary sources of revenue of the city, making one of the most profitable cities during 80's/90's. Now you can get a tour and learn more about metallurgical business.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

551315407.name: Monterrey Icon and a nice place to walk, learn, and eat
551315407.author: a TripAdvisor user
551315407.reviewBody: Not only does it have a very interesting museum, there\'s also a rollerskate section, and the Lingote restaurant

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

544445091.name: Superb site and experience for formal dinner event
544445091.author: a TripAdvisor user
544445091.reviewBody: We had a large conference event in the location and it was superb. The food was lovely, the wait staff prompt and at tentative and the surroundings picturesque. The multimedia history presentation, complete with smoke, flames, video and light show was totally unexpected. What a wonderful tribute to history and way to both keep history alive and repurpose an important aspect of Monterrey.\n\nThe grounds are attractive and the view was lovely. Don\u2019t miss the chance to walk inside the large furnace and experience the massive size and time-marked walls of it for yourself...

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

529600747.name: Monumental Steel Mill
529600747.author: a TripAdvisor user
529600747.reviewBody: This old steel mill, which has been converted to a museum and events venue is worth visiting. The grounds of the old mill have been converted to a very popular city park and the mill itself can be visited by tourists. Especially for heavy manufacturing buffs.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

525605564.name: Museum, restaurant and Zip lines!!
525605564.author: a TripAdvisor user
525605564.reviewBody: Great combination!! Offers activities for the complete family, you can visit the museum and learn about the history of this place, also it has a restaurant and even you can rent a package where you can go through the zip lines inside the building. \nAt the top it offers a great view of the city!!

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

521178561.name: Great attraction
521178561.author: a TripAdvisor user
521178561.reviewBody: This museum is by far the most interesting part of the Fundidora Park. It has exhibits, a smelting show, a catwalk with great views of the city. Well worth the entrance fee of $100 ($6 USD). I will come back. It is great.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

520897033.name: Excellent Museum!!
520897033.author: a TripAdvisor user
520897033.reviewBody: Don\'t miss the opportunity to visit this museum, it\'s very Interesting, they have guided tours and they explain the history and process of the Fundidora. Lots of information, pictures, presentations and fun activities!\n

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

518858997.name: Great place with history and technology
518858997.author: a TripAdvisor user
518858997.reviewBody: I enjoyed learning about the steel industry and the opportunities for photography abstract and Urban style, were fantastic

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

515776854.name: Amazing place
515776854.author: a TripAdvisor user
515776854.reviewBody:
The museum is modern, clean, interactive, but most importantly, interesting. The many displays and screenings made it a place where one could easily spend half a day. Our tour guide was a high school student on social service and he was a pleasure to be with. He knew his stories and was happy and patient with us. 
The lookout at the top of the horno is amazing. Full views of Monterrey.
We got there by taking the boat from Museo de Historia Mexicana and that made it a lovely day out.
The price might seem a bit much for some, but it definitely is worth it.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

506014682.name: Amazing place, interesting history
506014682.author: a TripAdvisor user
506014682.reviewBody: It\'s a beautiful place, prepare yourself to walk and face the heat (in case you visit in the summet). There\'s a lot of trees on the paths there and the museum is interesting. At night time, you can see the whole factory light up, which is nice.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

500065867.name: Fascinating to explore (not great English though)
500065867.author: a TripAdvisor user
500065867.reviewBody: Climbing into the heart of the blast furnace itself was incredible! You have the ability to not just walk through where the workers went but into the heart of the steel-making plant itself. Though the guides speak close to no English, there are a few English signs and if you know something about steel making, you can get by. The history section was especially interesting for understanding more about the way the peso gained and lost value (mostly lost) in the 80s and 90s due to inflation. This economic history is not directly described but inferred from propaganda ads, print advertisements, pictures, worker sign in cards and other primary pieces of evidence. The steel example room is good for kids (lots of hands-on activities). The funicular that takes you up to the top is fun and provides great views!

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

488539790.name: A glimpse into history
488539790.author: a TripAdvisor user
488539790.reviewBody: What a treat to stumble upon this living museum in Parque Fundidora. The interactive museum is a steel plant that has been restored and repurposed to include a blast furnace, demonstrations, a restaurant and stunning views from the top. I had no idea how steel is deeply steeped into the history of Mexico and the economic development of Monterrey. It is a must see.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

477953505.name: Fascinating story of triumph and tragedy
477953505.author: a TripAdvisor user
477953505.reviewBody: How do you go from scratch to great success and all the way back? This museum takes you on this journey from the early 1900\'s to the mid 1980\'s sharing insights of how the Porfiriato encouraged foreign investment and know-how and how it all ultimately collapsed under poor management and (. ..)  political intervention... Oh, and the science is pretty awesome too!

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

476438540.name: Excellent place to learn about economy start in Monterrey
476438540.author: a TripAdvisor user
476438540.reviewBody: Inside of Fundidora Park, you could find the museum "Horno 3", learning about materials and how Monterrey started it\'s development. \nAt the end of the visit you could enjoy a great Lunch or dinner on the restaurant above the museum. Prices are regular but we\'ll served. Enjoy your visit.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

468168464.name: A truly extraordinary experience
468168464.author: a TripAdvisor user
468168464.reviewBody: Dont let the fact that this is a museum about the history of steel making in Mexico housed in a restored blast furnace keep you from going to Fundadora Park and finding this wonderful museum. I was amazed at how much everyone in my group enjoyed it, Shorter versions of the Spanish signs are presented in English, you can get the information you need to understand this important industry and what it has meant to Mexico, Ive been to a lot of museums all over the world but this is just extraordinary. The large park around it is beautiful and interesting as well. You can get here by boat along a canal, do that too

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

466528816.name: Ironworks Factory
466528816.author: a TripAdvisor user
466528816.reviewBody: This was very interesting. Most of the placards for the exhibits were in both English and Spanish. The ride up to the top floor was not pleasant for me because I do not like heights, but I am glad that I got to the top to see how the iron ore was processed. There was a walkway with great views, but again, not a great place for those who do not like heights. We had someone with us who could translate the tour guide\'s Spanish to English. The whole experience gave me an appreciation for how hard people have had to work to earn a living so that everyone could enjoy the benefits of products made from iron.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

465780179.name: For the money you get 2 hours of a great tour.
465780179.author: a TripAdvisor user
465780179.reviewBody: In my recent visit to Monterrey my GF and I decided to visit the Steel history museum of MTY. I must say the Tour was amazing, they assigned us an English speaking tour guide who was very informative. My family is from monterrey and i have always passed by the old facotry but i never knew the real history behind the city and how it was founded on the steel industry.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

456981486.name: I didn\'t expect to like it that much
456981486.author: a TripAdvisor user
456981486.reviewBody: OK so I was not that enthusiastic about visiting a museum about steel and it\'s history in that city, but it turned out to be a really awesome visit! Compared to a lot of the European museums, this one is pretty interactive (one of the things I loved about their museums). \n\nYou get to play around (especially the kids), then you get a show with how the steel was manufactured, then you get to see an interactive evolution about our planet earth all in one! It\'s pretty cool. Sometimes I felt like a kid again. Definitely must see!!

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

455988444.name: Great experience!
455988444.author: a TripAdvisor user
455988444.reviewBody: Went to the museum and afterwards going up with the elevator. you have a great view and can walk around on the old furnace, especially for people interested in steel history a must! great view also!

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

452652489.name: A day in Parque fundidora Museum Horno 3
452652489.author: a TripAdvisor user
452652489.reviewBody: In december vacations with my two kids we had a sunny day visit to the Fundidora Park, we went into the museum where it really exposes all of the Steel Factory history, very well known as on of the pilars who made Monterrey very productive and a great city, the museum it\u00b4s established inside one of the old steel ovens and it is presented as a very clear and well presented as the same level as any international museums, Monterrey is a great city to visit and a great place to live.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

447604035.name: ...Monterrey, Monterrey de mis amores...
447604035.author: a TripAdvisor user
447604035.reviewBody: Eye opening/much history & learning on what made Monterrey the industrial capital of Mexico.  Love it & proud to have had uncles who worked there.  Highly recommend & you won\'t spend much.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

443449519.name: A great place to visit, enjoy good food and do many different activities
443449519.author: a TripAdvisor user
443449519.reviewBody: Everything from a really exclusive restaurant, museums, ice rink, shopping. It\'s the place to go with family or friends. Lots of green areas and a variety of attractions. A must visit in Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

442909930.name: Steel factory turned museum - this is good stuff!
442909930.author: a TripAdvisor user
442909930.reviewBody: Located in the Parque Fundidora, Horno3 is a museum that honors the city\'s industrial heritage. From walking inside a furnace, to scaling the heights of the stacks, this museum offers some new experiences for visitors and is a must see in Monterrey. Not to mention the boat ride to get there is loads of fun...and relaxing. And they have a great restaurant as well - Horno 400. Look for my review of that also.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

440750564.name: Good for Children!
440750564.author: a TripAdvisor user
440750564.reviewBody: Very interactive and hands on for kids. (I don\'t have any kids). But we acted like kids and played with everything anyway. There is also good views at the top of the museum.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

439365701.name: Incredible place
439365701.author: a TripAdvisor user
439365701.reviewBody: Is an incredible place as you find yourself eating in what was once part of a steelmaking process and now have made it a great place to eat for business or with your partner

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

439158305.name: Eye opening
439158305.author: a TripAdvisor user
439158305.reviewBody: I bet there are very less museums that can teach you so much about the steel.\nWe use steel everyday, and before coming here, I knew very less or almost anything of how it arrive to use.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

438178700.name: Very interesting
438178700.author: a TripAdvisor user
438178700.reviewBody: I didn\'t know what to expect, it was surprisingly good and interesting. This museum has a great way to make steel fun. I enjoyed the views you get when you take ride to the top of the furnace.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

437924579.name: Great place
437924579.author: a TripAdvisor user
437924579.reviewBody: We\'re in Monterrey for a month and wanted to understand more about its history and culture .Horno 3 was recommended to us and so glad we visited . Lots of interactive displays , great views from the platform at the top of the building and a stunning show  which shows how the steel works operated before it closed . To finish off a great visit we had food in the restaurant - highly recommended .

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

434144310.name: Incredible and a must see
434144310.author: a TripAdvisor user
434144310.reviewBody: This place is awesome and a must see! It is incredible what they have done with the old steel mill in turning it into an interactive museum. They also have a fine restaurant that I didn\'t go to but looks worth the try.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

419748111.name: Nostalgic and majestic
419748111.author: a TripAdvisor user
419748111.reviewBody: The museum and its shows are a must once being at parque Fundidora. When you are there the lift will give you a nice view of the city.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

401897263.name: A MUST VISIT!
401897263.author: a TripAdvisor user
401897263.reviewBody: What a museum!   This was a feat to renovate this monstrous facility in the middle of a gorgeous park.  I don\'t think we have anything like it in the USA. The history of steel making is quite interesting for people of all ages and if you come to Monterrey it would be a shame to miss it. They even have zip lines and a restaurant on top of the mill.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

397057597.name: Museo Horno 3
397057597.author: a TripAdvisor user
397057597.reviewBody: Historic place in a beautiful park. We learn a lot about the steel industry and how it help Monterrey to became the third biggest city in Mexico. Interactive  museum, great for all ages.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

393570211.name: Industrial Museum!
393570211.author: a TripAdvisor user
393570211.reviewBody:
It's an excellent option if you want to learn something about the steel history in Mexico.

The museography is great. It's very interactive. They have a movie about the steel process.

Inside the building they have an delicious restaurant with the name "Lingote". 

It's a great museum.

Go!

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

391192720.name: "History of the Industry in Monterrey"
391192720.author: a TripAdvisor user
391192720.reviewBody: Nice museum to get to know the industry of Monterrey.  It also has a nice place to do events like weddings.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

382040566.name: Perfect location for a Terminator Movie!
382040566.author: a TripAdvisor user
382040566.reviewBody: Amazing premises! And to think that people worked here makes it even more incredible. The tour and the show are worth the visit, as well as the views of Monterrey from the upper levels of the horno.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

378816904.name: Excellent Museum
378816904.author: a TripAdvisor user
378816904.reviewBody:
We visit the Fundidora Park, and decided to visit the Horno 3 Museum.  Since the entrance it is really nice the work that the architect Sir Nicholas Grimshaw has made of the museum.  The landscape is really nice and the detail of the fountain that resemble fog or mist is an excellent detail as it remember you of the steel production process.  
The museography is  really good and very informative about the process in which the steel is produced, and it also introduce you into the history of the old steel furnace and how the corruption of the government got into bankruptcy and important industry in Monterrey.
The show of the furnace is something not to be missed, as it shows you through light and sound the way in which the steel was produce and in the furnace you are watching.
The entrance cost is of 8 dollars more or less, and you can ride an elevator to watch from the top of platforms around the furnace Monterrey city and the Fundidora Park.
If you are in Monterrey an have the time it is worth it the visit to this Museum.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

377156079.name: Industrial Heritage
377156079.author: a TripAdvisor user
377156079.reviewBody: We can go onto the top of furnace by sitting on a lift to insert raw materials to furnace. It is fun. Explanation of a student-guide was very precise and attractive.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

370780174.name: Great overview of the steel industry
370780174.author: a TripAdvisor user
370780174.reviewBody: It is a very well thought out museum interesting for the adults and fun for the kids. Even the extreme will have fun sliding high in the sky.\n

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

346023422.name: Loved to understand this process
346023422.author: a TripAdvisor user
346023422.reviewBody: Simply well done and executed to recreate the process of foundry plus the history of the city and al those interactive and educational games for children and the parents also!

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

332310757.name: Museum of an Empire. An Era that built the City
332310757.author: a TripAdvisor user
332310757.reviewBody:
The Museum is a living testimony of all the men that worked very hard to convert the mining materials into Iron and Steel.
Museum does a great job of showing the history and the process that is used to convert the mineral into useful product, that is then sent to other companies to build the products we use in modern day and age.

Staff is courteous and knowledgable. Please make sure to tip properly, as they are all volunteers there.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

314074957.name: Must in Monterrey
314074957.author: a TripAdvisor user
314074957.reviewBody: Great, as it explains the birth of Monterrey as an industrial city, and it has also nice attractions to understand steel making process. The Furnace Show (show del horno) is a must.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

298775425.name: Part of the Industrial Heritage of Monterrey
298775425.author: a TripAdvisor user
298775425.reviewBody: This is the site where once stood the first steel making facility in Latin America. The Compa\u00f1\u00eda Fundidora de Hierro y Acero de Monterrey was a legendary company that had different phases from privately owned to government lead. The museum is there to remember one of the companies and industries that helped Monterrey develop into the force behind Mexico industrial growth. The museum is a great attraction for the kids that can learn about steel making and have fun. A must visit while in Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

290845243.name: Historic museum
290845243.author: a TripAdvisor user
290845243.reviewBody: A museum of the historic iron industry in Monterrey, the Horno3 is a very interesting and well maintained place where entertainment of many types is provided.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

283622126.name: Worth it.
283622126.author: a TripAdvisor user
283622126.reviewBody:
A must visit when in Monterrey.
It's really impressive to see a factory converted in to a museum.
The museum is really interactive. The ArcelorMittal section has really cool simulations and games that can capture the attention of both children and Adults.

Most of the content in the museum is in Spanish, with a very brief summary in English. 
We didn't take the guided tour so I cannot say the mode of communication. But if you understand español it shouldn't be a problem. 
The elevator to go to the top of the factory is really cool. It's more of a ride to the top of the factory in the elevator that was probably used by the workers back then.
There is also a restaurant at the second floor for the food enthusiasts to review.

All in a all a very educational and informative experience.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

275371685.name: Cultural
275371685.author: a TripAdvisor user
275371685.reviewBody: I recommend this place as a foreigner because it gives you a hint of part of the Mexican economy, it is important that you assist to the show.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

273853380.name: Amazing museum.
273853380.author: a TripAdvisor user
273853380.reviewBody: This is a unique museum, very interactive, with lots of things to see and do. We had a guide who explained every single detail of the museum and spent at least 3 hours with us while we toured the museum. Didn\'t get to see the main show of the place, as it was closed to a private event, but we did pay a reduced price because of that. Horno 3 is a must-see in Monterrey, the history of the museum is very interesting and the best thing is that I learned a lot from this visit.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

270642414.name: Very interactive
270642414.author: a TripAdvisor user
270642414.reviewBody: We were visiting and had a guided tour, this guy was great and really showed us around. Museum exhibits part of the history of steel, the working conditions for the miners and workers, the properties of the material itself, the projected future uses. The movie is highly recomended. A very complete tour.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

268411041.name: Amazing
268411041.author: a TripAdvisor user
268411041.reviewBody: This place is really amazing. It\'s actually what used to be the real steel mill back in 1900-1986. It\'s placed inside Fundidora Park, which is very large and nice. Be sure you ask for "The Furnace Show" (Show del Horno), it\'s a magnificent show and you can walk inside the big furnace. Also, highly recommended to take the Summit Stroll (Paseo a la Cima), you\'ll take the elevator to the highest point of the furnace and have a very nice view of the entire city and his mountains.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

256513581.name: Very nice experience
256513581.author: a TripAdvisor user
256513581.reviewBody: You should take a minute to see this piece of story.They show a video and some stories about how they start this project. it is interesting to see and a good history class

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

253542810.name: Creative Attraction!
253542810.author: a TripAdvisor user
253542810.reviewBody:
horno3 (Furnace 3) in Monterrey -- a giant city park and man-made riverwalk, converted from a former industrial wasteland of abandoned steel mills.

Nice to see thousands of people using such an effective public space, beautified and reclaimed from what could have been a disaster.

We went ziplining and rappelling through the catwalks, towers and inner works of the old steel plant.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

242637803.name: Try the Canopy / Zip line, its a blast
242637803.author: a TripAdvisor user
242637803.reviewBody: I decided to try the canopy adventure tour at Museo del Acero Horno3 and thought I would post about it on Trip Advisor because I have not seen any other reviews on this activity. And its worth writing about! You take a freight elevator up about two thirds of the way to the top of the plant and then you take the access stairs and ladders all the way to the top. Note that you cannot access this part of the plant any other way, the \u201croof walk\u201d (separate tickets) which I also did, only goes up about two thirds of the way. And the view from the very top is spectacular! From there you work your way back down over a series of zip lines and rappelling drops. Its really pretty clever how they work the descents in among all the industrial equipment and the vantage points are unlike anything you will experience. I have done canopy lines in wilderness settings and they are fun and scenic. But this felt like you were in a James Bond or Jason Bourne movie, moving through the foundry. \n\nThe tour is very well organized. Two guides in bright orange kit you out in safety gear, explain the procedures, and escort you every step of the way. They speak English, Spanish and German so there is no loss of communication. They also had the right mix of seriousness and fun \u2013 they would take your picture, ask if you wanted to go slow or fast, etc. But they were VERY attentive to the safety matters and I never once felt that I was at risk. Yes, it was a bit scary at times, but it was the good kind of scary that comes from a well designed activity. And like I said, it was the only way to see this part of Horno3. If you have any interest at all in adventure activities, I would highly recommend this.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

239434432.name: Awesome!
239434432.author: a TripAdvisor user
239434432.reviewBody: I got impressed with this museum, it\'s one of the coolest places I\'ve ever been. My father and I had great conversations with the museum guides about the history behind the steel industry in Mexico, they were very helpful and friendly, explaining everything and answering all of our questions. The views at the top of the building are as awesome as the building it self!

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

227887970.name: Amazing museum, lots of fun!
227887970.author: a TripAdvisor user
227887970.reviewBody: I\'m going to be honest here... I\'m not a museum kind of person, but this museum in particular was very interesting. You have the option to take a guide if you want, they are students doing internship and mine had a very dull voice to be honest, also my husband was very excited about the place so he kept asking lots of questions and I\'m not very sure she was happy about that. In spite of her it was very interesting. It has an interactive part which I kept thinking would be amazing for my daughter. They also have a historic part which was very interesting,  they don\'t make it boring really, I liked that. \nAt certain times of the day there is a show at the top "El show del horno" very interesting, it is in Spanish but it has subtitles in English where the old workers of the factory tell stories and you can see pictures and video of how it all was back then, it was really interesting and at the end of the show you can go inside the furnace and see how it all worked.\nThere is also canopy, although I didn\'t try that so I couldn\'t tell if it is any good.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

221464353.name: Amazing site, but be prepared to be guided
221464353.author: a TripAdvisor user
221464353.reviewBody: Just the thought of what was done here is amazing. They took an old steel mill, gutted it, and created a wonderful museum dedicated to steel and its production. The problem: you MUST go around with a guide, who explains every minute detail. You may not wander around by yourself, linger, etc., rather follow a guide. I found it off putting at first ... you walk in, sweaty and hot, and the last thing you want is to interact with someone one-on-one while you\'re trying to get your bearings and cool down. That said, the visit to the top of the mill is fabulous, with great views, and a really nice breeze.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

218889387.name: Great job converting that place.
218889387.author: a TripAdvisor user
218889387.reviewBody: You must allow yourself at least 4 hours to see everything. Very good for the kids in the interactive area. For my part I wanted to be in contact with that impressive piece of modern industry. Very good view on the top. You will even find there a fine restaurant.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

207625763.name: Monterrey\'s steel history in a nut shell
207625763.author: a TripAdvisor user
207625763.reviewBody:
Monterrey is often recognized by its steel industry now almost gone.  One of the pillars that help this city grow and expand was the Fundidora Monterrey steel mill.  With its blast furnaces and high chimney towers.  One thing I remember most was that early in the morning you could see a blue flame coming out of one of this chimneys.

Today all those furnaces and chimneys are silent, but you can revisit the past in the Museo del Acero Horno 3 (Furnace # 3 Museum of Steel), which is the actual furnace # 3, refurbished and refitted to serve as a museum.

You will enjoy a nice walk through the exhibits, a brief lights & sounds presentation and you can eat at "El Lingote" (The Ingot) restaurant, at the top of the museum.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

197667810.name: Informative and Entertaining Museum
197667810.author: a TripAdvisor user
197667810.reviewBody: A very interesting structure and more information about the process of manufacturing steel than most people would ever want to know, as well as related history, presented in a mostly clear and entertaining fashion. The walkway on top of the structure offers a great view of the city.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

192120833.name: Wonderful museum, absolute must for young children
192120833.author: a TripAdvisor user
192120833.reviewBody:
This is one of the best science museums I've been to so far.  It's very well set.  It's essentially a restored old steel mill which was completely restored for display purposes, and you get to walk all around it with different exhibits all related to the process in which steel is made. 

The exhibitions are very well designed and maintained.  My children love this museum, and I definitely recommend any tourist coming to Monterrey with children to set aside 3 to 4 hours for this museum. 

It's located in Fundidora Park, which also hosts several other attractions, some permanent and some temporary.  Also during the weekends they usually host public events. All in all, it's a great place for a walk with large beautiful gardens. 

If possible try to avoid the weekeds, as it can get very crowded.  Parking is costly, but there are plenty of lots close to the different areas within the park.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

189139300.name: Very educational, english speaking guides too
189139300.author: a TripAdvisor user
189139300.reviewBody: We only really went to kill some time and get out of the cold wet weather. But it was ok, 90 pesos buys your entrance and a museum guide , ours spoke english very well and was very informative. Its well kept and there is a show they do about how the furnace worked with lights and sounds and fire which was really good. Probably better with children, there is an interactive part of the museum aimed solely at children.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

186207389.name: Worth a visit
186207389.author: a TripAdvisor user
186207389.reviewBody: If you want to fill in time or finish your Paseo Santa Lucia it is really worth it. You can get some real insight about hte life of the workers in this still factory. Educational

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

182117338.name: Terrific venue!
182117338.author: a TripAdvisor user
182117338.reviewBody: This museum is not only a great historical resource telling the story of the area\'s steel industry but is located in what used to be a working foundry! It\'s a very cool place for this reason alone but the exhitbits are interesting and mostly in both English and Spanish. Neat little gift shop also.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

169804176.name: Historic place
169804176.author: a TripAdvisor user
169804176.reviewBody: Monterrey is an industrial city and one of its old plants was "Fundidora" like Smelting Steel so this is an interesting visit to learn about how Steel used to be produced

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

167519903.name: A very nice tour!
167519903.author: a TripAdvisor user
167519903.reviewBody: The tour of the steel industry and history in and around Monterrey is very good. The guides are exciting and knowledgeable and love questions as they are very interactive. The scenery from the top of the furnace is spectacular!

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

151009768.name: Nice museum
151009768.author: a TripAdvisor user
151009768.reviewBody: Nice museum it\'s a great way to understand a very important part of the history of Monterrey. You can visit museum in around 2-3hrs max.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

136107519.name: love it
136107519.author: a TripAdvisor user
136107519.reviewBody: awsome place to take the kids and learn how metal was made  and the history behind it. you can see how the raiload was a help to the iron workers, little games for the kids to play

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

129746071.name: Learn About the Heyday of Mexican Steel Production
129746071.author: a TripAdvisor user
129746071.reviewBody: El Horno 3 is undoubtedly the most interesting venue at the Parque Fundidora with the museum at the base of the structure and added attractions like the Carbon Elevator ride and the excellent restaurant El Lingote located on the upper level.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

123284021.name: Gives a new apreciation for Paper Clips!!
123284021.author: a TripAdvisor user
123284021.reviewBody: The museum Horno 3 which is inside the Fundidora Park is very interactive, the show is great the view at the top of the oven is awsome.  This is where they used to melt the iron to create steel.  The tour is very instructing.  Because it is inside the Fundidora Park which is huge, make sure you know where you are parking (there are over 10 parking garages) otherwise you will walk for miles before you get to the museum.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

122839356.name: Nice Museum
122839356.author: a TripAdvisor user
122839356.reviewBody: Probably one of the best organized of the region, although I was not that excited about the history of the steel in the region, is a nice place. Try the restaurant.

address.streetAddress: Av. Fundidora and Adolfo Prieto, Parque Fundidora

653448145.name: Just Stunning Views
653448145.author: a TripAdvisor user
653448145.reviewBody: If you are ever in Monterrey or the surrounding area you must make this a priority to do.I would advise going very early to beat the crowds. It is a steep incline to walk up, people were running up the path...it takes about 1 hour to reach the viewing point, then you can continue even further up. Make sure you wear suitable clothing & footwear & take plenty of water etc. Once you reach the viewing point WOW the view is simply stunning overlooking Monterrey. I have been both in the daytime & nighttime & both are equally stunning views. There is no cost to enter. You have to park on streets nearby the entrance so it can be difficult finding somewhere to park. Overall just WOW,

650161867.name: Beautiful site to see
650161867.author: a TripAdvisor user
650161867.reviewBody: Located on the Southeast side of the city, it towers above the city of Guadelupe and Monterrey.  During the summer, it is normally visible every day but in the late winter, we may not see it for days due to cloud cover.  This visit we saw the mountain about 3 of the 8 days we were there.  One day we saw it clear enough to see that they entire mountain was covered in a thick green forest, nearly capping the top peaks.  A sight to behold.  We have traveled to the base of the mountain several in the past only to find that it is much larger than it looks from the city.  Needs to be seen and admired as a wonderful back drop to the bustling city of Monterrey.

553584222.name: A long walk
553584222.author: a TripAdvisor user
553584222.reviewBody: If you are here and like trailing, walk to the top is a good challenge. No if you lack or physical condition or don\'t like hicking.

534735759.name: Saddle Up
534735759.author: a TripAdvisor user
534735759.reviewBody: The Cerro de La Silla is a mountain range in the shape of a saddle located in Monterrey, Mexico (actually the mountain is in Guadalupe). It is one of the most beautiful mountain ranges you will ever see and can be seen wherever you are in Monterrey.

508809394.name: Everyone can get to the top!
508809394.author: a TripAdvisor user
508809394.reviewBody: It took my brother and myself 4 hours to get to the top and 1.5 hours to descend. Not sure what\'s the length of the trip, but it wasn\'t that bad.\n\nI\'d recommend to bring 2-3 small oranges (great source of water), 2L of water pp, seeds (pecan, almond), & granola bars.

500063102.name: Challenging but worthwhile 4-hour hike!
500063102.author: a TripAdvisor user
500063102.reviewBody: This is perhaps the most built-up/well-known spot to hike in Monterrey due to it\u2019s short, painful climb and incredible height (>5K feet). The climb has two almost equal halves which are basically at a 45 degree angle the whole time. There are cut-backs and a few flat portions, but the climb is definitely intense. The total distance from start to finish for us was 11.2 miles. The views show the entire city below the cloud line and other almost-as-high mountains all over. Don\u2019t worry if you run out of water or need a snack, enterprising folks sell oranges and the like at various points. There is also a Cristos statue just about .25 miles from the mid-point mesa portion. At the very top, the Mexican raccoons (very different than those in the US) await those who make it to bring them food - we didn\u2019t feed them but those who did found them to be gentile and friendly.

444708050.name: Nice hike!
444708050.author: a TripAdvisor user
444708050.reviewBody: Nice hiking close to the city. The view on top is gorgeous. Once you reach the fence you can keep walking to the right of it to get a nicer view. There is also a viewing platform that is about ont hour from the start. Whole hike to the antenna took us five hours back and forth. Bring enough water!

426174354.name: The pride of Monterrey
426174354.author: a TripAdvisor user
426174354.reviewBody: This fascinating mountain practically defines Monterrey. It has inspired many a myth from ghosts to UFOs coming through there.\nIt is a steep and dramatic mountain, but hardly the only one enclosing the city in its air bubble.

423703421.name: Symbolic
423703421.author: a TripAdvisor user
423703421.reviewBody: This lovely shaped mountain is a well-known symbol of the city of Monterrey.  The hiking trail is about 5 km long to reach the top and the ascent is considered to be fairly difficult, taking approximately 3 hours to complete.
