A panoramic view of the city of Monterrey seen from the top is quite rewarding. I enjoyed viewing it at sunset from San Pedro suburb I used to live in when studying in Universidad de Monterrey!

421431920.name: Walk up to Pic Antenna from Bosque de La Pastora on Sept 10, 2016 - 6 hours
421431920.author: a TripAdvisor user
421431920.reviewBody: I had read on a website that there is an \'easy\' walk up to the Pic Antena. It took me 3 hours to climb from Bosque de la Pastora up to the Antena. I started climbing at 9 on a Sunday morning. The first hour and a half, I really felt there were too many people, and many are climbing while listening to music on their phones (without headphones...). Many people were going down already, I think many climb up very early to enjoy sun rise and avoid high temperatures. Then you reach an large concrete floor where in most of the people will stay to have lunch or whatever. I found the second half of the walk was much better: less crowd, sometimes I was alone, but the walk is sometimes more difficult. You do sweat a lot. This can be called an easy walk because no specific equipment is required (just a good pair of trekking shoes, stones and rocks on the ground), but this is quite exhausting. The view is off course very nice, but if there are clouds like often at the top, you do not see much, just fog. The Antena spot it self is disappointing, I could not enjoy the view from there we were in a cloud passing by. There was no space there to enjoy a lunch, or else maybe you have to continue on a small path under trees that may lead somewhere but I did not take it. It took me also three hours to come back to Bosque de la Pastora where I had parked my car for free in the neighbourhood just down the Bosque de la Pastora. The Bosque de la Pastora entrance has a gate it seems only residents can drive in. But the way from the entrance of the Bosque de la Pastora to the circuit is easy to find, and lots of people wearing running shoes are on the way too.  I could see on the way a scorpio-like bug, many butterflies, black small animals hiding in the trees, this made it a good experience overall. If you do not have enough water, some vendors wait for you on the way saying \'agua fria\' when you pass by.

418105398.name: An icon of the city
418105398.author: a TripAdvisor user
418105398.reviewBody: Going for a walk or a climb in the mountain is a lovely activity for a weekend. If you are not up to it, you can drive and have an AMAZING view of this fantastic city.\nAt worst take a picture with the mountain in the background because the saddle shaped mountain is unique to this city and a city icon that can\'t be out of atleat some of your pictures of the city.

381898000.name: icon of Monterrey
381898000.author: a TripAdvisor user
381898000.reviewBody: icon of Monterrey - interesting shape of the mountain. you can have it in the background of many pictures.

317340237.name: Great
317340237.author: a TripAdvisor user
317340237.reviewBody: It\'s an awesome place for going alone or in family you can walk it up slowly and enjoy the view or just climb it ip in an hour but you have to be patient because you can  have some trouble cimbing it up.

311392451.name: Impossible to don\'t see it!
311392451.author: a TripAdvisor user
311392451.reviewBody: It\'s the nicest thing to see in Monterrey and anywhere you go, if you look around it\'s always there! \nDon\'t go to Monterrey without having your eyes on "the chair"

284213944.name: Cerro de la Silla, Monterrey city symbol
284213944.author: a TripAdvisor user
284213944.reviewBody: It is a big mountain that represents a saddlehorse and it is Monterrey city symbol. You can take very good pics when you are at Macro Plaza, near Life Fountain

268535872.name: Worth walking
268535872.author: a TripAdvisor user
268535872.reviewBody: This is the most emblematic mountain in Monterrey. This mountain is being destroyed by construction companies building houses and destroying the Green \u00e1reas. Even then there is a track you can take to walk up the mountain, it can be steep and dangerous if you do not know how to go up and back.

253175616.name: Great View!
253175616.author: a TripAdvisor user
253175616.reviewBody: Water falls is amazing and majes you feel like you are in a country place, The mountain View is beautifull a great landscape of the city.

253115951.name: The symbol of hard working Monterrey people
253115951.author: a TripAdvisor user
253115951.reviewBody: This is the symbol of Monterrey city. Imponent views and a trademark of northern Mexico. A Visit to Monterrey is complete when you take a picture with this mountain at the back

244964916.name: Cerro de la Silla
244964916.author: a TripAdvisor user
244964916.reviewBody: I had the privilege of actually climbing part of the "cerro" and it is filled with wonderful wild flowers, insects, waterfalls, etc, etc.  Even bad tasting wild oranges grow there.  This is a MUST see place and you must be in great shape to climb.  Many locals go there every morning for their daily exercise. I was there in August and I carried a sweater as it can get a bit chilly in the mornings.  It is a very safe place to go and you will encounter random people going up or coming down the mountain.  Recommend a good pair of sneakers with good grip as you will be climbing over rocks, down trees, puddles, etc. When weather is hot many go there to cool off under the various waterfalls.  There are no bathrooms. We parked our car at the end of a neighborhood and just climbed.

237920236.name: The icon on Monterrey
237920236.author: a TripAdvisor user
237920236.reviewBody: Whenever you see a picture of a Mountain beside the name Monterrey you are seeing the Cerro de la Silla. It is called this way because it is very similar to the horse chair and the traduction is hill form the chair. It is really beautiful , different and inspiring.

186231064.name: Great view of the mounting chain
186231064.author: a TripAdvisor user
186231064.reviewBody: It is a very nice experience to go all the way to the top of the mountain to be able to see the chain of mountains, but if your physical condition is not so good, the middle part is also worth it to get a panorama of the city. The way up is a little bit heavy, but not impossible. It takes about 2-3 hours maybe to go all the way to the top depending on your condition. If you decide to go on summer please take a lot of water and sunblock because monterrey is a very hot city.\n \nOne last thing, when you go al the way to the top, try to go around the antenna area to get the good view.

144191983.name: Pico Norte, really breathtaking!
144191983.author: a TripAdvisor user
144191983.reviewBody: The "cerro de la silla" give you a chance to do a really nice trekking... but you have to be prepared because in the las kilometers will be the hardest!

135467838.name: The city of the mountains
135467838.author: a TripAdvisor user
135467838.reviewBody: This is one of the mountains responsible for Monterrey being called "The city of the mountains". This mountain receives it\u00b4s name because it looks like a horse saddle. You can better appreciate ir from "The Obispado"

128264272.name: Beautiful Vistas
128264272.author: a TripAdvisor user
128264272.reviewBody: Definitely worth the trip up this mountain.  It is breathtaking.

123265405.name: Landmark
123265405.author: a TripAdvisor user
123265405.reviewBody: This mountain is the city\u00b4s landmark. I can be seen from all the metropolitan area, except on rainy days. In Monterrey we consider bad weather whenever the Saddle Mountain is covered.

102464542.name: Great for a jog up up up!
102464542.author: a TripAdvisor user
102464542.reviewBody: This jog path is great to test your physical condition and get new fresh air.\nCrowded from people from all ages, especially on weekends. Once you go up you will admire the perfect scene that Monterrey city offers you.

670566688.name: Maceo Plaza Shopping
670566688.author: a TripAdvisor user
670566688.reviewBody: What a fun shopping experience. Indoor shops as well as outdoor vendors. Everything you want to find while shopping is there in one form or another. We felt safe and secure while there. The Policia presence is strong and most people were friendly. Not all shops speak English so a translating app could help. Shops open around 10am and if you like fewer people then mornings are for you. If you like lots of people, after 3pm is bussy.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

659400191.name: Must to visit!
659400191.author: a TripAdvisor user
659400191.reviewBody: A very nice place in the heart of the city of Monterrey Nuevo Leon.  The building has a very nice structure and architecture.\nThere are some statues and a fountain in front of the building. Other statues and a new fountain were under construction. There are some museums there too. The food is great and cheap. It is worded the visit!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

656643001.name: Cold day
656643001.author: a TripAdvisor user
656643001.reviewBody: I have lived in Mexico for 25 years.\n\nWe went on a cold day. Cold days are very unusual in Monterrey. This is normally a nice place to walk around and visit local shops and see local things. Not so much on cold days.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

643613682.name: Beautiful Plaza
643613682.author: a TripAdvisor user
643613682.reviewBody: We visited the Marco Plaza on a New Year\u2019s trip with Go With Jo from Harlingen, TX. \nThis plaza is the heart of downtown Monterrey and was 2 blocks from out hotel, Gran Ancira. The pedestrian walk ends at this plaza and across from it is the governor\u2019s palace. The plaza has various churches and other attractions near by. Plenty of vendors are also here. From here you can see the Sierra Mountain saddle formation or serr\u00f3 de la silla. \nThe Neptune water fountain is here and it\u2019s a spectacular site. Other sculptures and museums are nearby as well. This is friendly walking site.  This plaza is a Sunday attraction for family and the young in love. It is well known for courting couples.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

632678010.name: Nuce place to walk around and enjoy the view
632678010.author: a TripAdvisor user
632678010.reviewBody: This was a stop of the boat ride \u201cSanta Lucia\u201d The plaza is a historical location and very clean and well kept worth while to spend time and enjoy Monterrey\u2019s history.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

601239477.name: A peaaceful walk
601239477.author: a TripAdvisor user
601239477.reviewBody: Great place to take a lazy stroll and people watch. It\'s very well watched by the tourist police, it\'s near a lot of cute restaurants, and since it is HUGE you won\'t get bored. There\'s three museums bordering it, and they are free on Sundays, perfect to learn some history or just enjoy some art. Lovely plaza.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

600464158.name: Nice informative and entertaining place.
600464158.author: a TripAdvisor user
600464158.reviewBody:
This is a very nice place in the heart of city. It comprises of the old administrative building of state assembly . The building is now converted as a museum. The building is has very nice structure and good piece of architecture.

There are some statues and fountain infront of building. There is also History museum on the side.

There is also a nice elevated  walk way infront of the buiy. This faces towards the mountain view and you can get some Street food and handicrafts and suvinier shops along the road.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

599882148.name: Beautiful!
599882148.author: a TripAdvisor user
599882148.reviewBody: For me, this is the center of the city and has a lot of historic statues and buildings that play an important role in the city.  This is likely one of the first things you will see in the city and gives a good first impression.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

597116551.name: Visit this iconic area!
597116551.author: a TripAdvisor user
597116551.reviewBody: Another must see, if you\'re in centro. Have lunch, or come for photos. You can find small stalls around to shop. However in summer, there is not much shade.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

592460222.name: A must do in Monterrey
592460222.author: a TripAdvisor user
592460222.reviewBody: This is pretty much the center of the city and gives you close access to museums, shopping and food.\n\nCome and check it off you list!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

578408000.name: Ideal for a nice walk
578408000.author: a TripAdvisor user
578408000.reviewBody: You can see different attractions and historic landmarks while taking a walk. Just be sure to take an umbrella for those sunny days. You can also find nearby places to eat.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

568756413.name: Full of history and new ideas
568756413.author: a TripAdvisor user
568756413.reviewBody: This is the centre of Monterrey and a great place to stroll day or evening. The area around the municipal palace is very interesting with nice historic buildings and museums.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

568182002.name: Big and interesting
568182002.author: a TripAdvisor user
568182002.reviewBody: Is a lot museums to visit and really beautiful place to take pictures, a lot of restaurants around I have a good time in this place .

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

567051313.name: Experience the culture of Monterrey
567051313.author: a TripAdvisor user
567051313.reviewBody: We took the boat from the Fundidora and docked at the Macroplaza.  There is such an amazing amount of history and culture in this one place.  Statues that tell the history of Monterrey, buildings all around that show the development from old world to the new, street vendors of authentic Mexican food and souvenirs as well as shopping stores of all kinds.  Just a few blocks in each direction are also many great food options.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

566699864.name: Funday!!!
566699864.author: a TripAdvisor user
566699864.reviewBody: This is a great place to visit with all kind of different people dress up, food, clowns, sculptures, etc...great place to take pictures.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

562592253.name: Sunday Funday!
562592253.author: a TripAdvisor user
562592253.reviewBody: We visited the plaza on a Sunday afternoon, and it was alive with people and music! There was a small flea market selling various clothing, shoes, souvenirs, ice cream, raspados, and LOTS of food. Make sure to take a look at the murals inside of the municipal building. There we found Love music and hundreds of happy locas dancing their hearts out. It was a beautiful scene! Check out the beautiful cathedral\nWhile you\u2019re there.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

560730267.name: Excellent area to relax
560730267.author: a TripAdvisor user
560730267.reviewBody: Beautiful park downtown in Monterrey. You find all kind of vendors from street massages to sidewalk tacos

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

558153930.name: A decent but average central plaza by the normal standards in Mexico.
558153930.author: a TripAdvisor user
558153930.reviewBody: A decent but average central plaza by the normal standards in Mexico.\n\nNot too many shops or restaurants ... mostly just the city and state government buildings and nothing more. Not lively at all.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

551316118.name: place to connect with other interesting points
551316118.author: a TripAdvisor user
551316118.reviewBody: You can visit churches around the macroplaza, as well as museums, and also take a boat to Fundidora. It is recommended to visit Monterrey\'s centre.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

547962276.name: Great history.
547962276.author: a TripAdvisor user
547962276.reviewBody:
Loved the history and the plaza.  

My family is from here and I loved seeing the history of the city.  

I will be back again I had a great time. Just learning of history of the city was fun

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

546865503.name: A great place to walk and see the people of Monterrey
546865503.author: a TripAdvisor user
546865503.reviewBody: Take time to walk the entire plaza from Constitucion to the Governor\'s Place especially on a weekend when the crowds are out. Street food and drinks, performers, street artists, small arts and crafts, as well as modern wares, can all be found here. You might even see the army band or a street arts festival. Day of the Dead is even more impressive. Have your photo take in front of a statue or fountain or stay to dance under the city hall in the late afternoon. It gets a bit crowded in the late afternoon, but you really get to see a great cross-section of the people of Monterrey. Several museums are along the perimeter. Many hotels are within walking distance of the plaza as well. Take your time and enjoy the stroll.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

546848935.name: Peaceful
546848935.author: a TripAdvisor user
546848935.reviewBody: Despite the traffic speeding by, the Macroplaza is a quiet spot with benches full of se\u00f1ores reading books in the morning. Enjoy the people watching and visit the Cathedral across the street.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

544628898.name: A beautiful space in Monterrey\'s downtown
544628898.author: a TripAdvisor user
544628898.reviewBody: The Macroplaza is a big square but it also has several museums, fountains and parks.You can admire the beautiful landscapes of the city mountains and the architecture of the old Government Palace. This is one of the touristic referents of the city. Also, you can find the boarding point for the boats that travel along the Santa Lucia Drive, the artificial watercourse that connect the Macroplaza to the Fundidora\'s Park.This is one of the must-go of Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

544130763.name: Nice plaza
544130763.author: a TripAdvisor user
544130763.reviewBody: This is a standard city center. The statues were nice. And the area is generally relaxing and enjoyable. I really liked the mermen fountain and the church to the left of the government palace.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

534172130.name: TO ENJOY A NICE TIME IN MONTERREY!
534172130.author: a TripAdvisor user
534172130.reviewBody: As its name indicates, is a large square.  In fact, one of the largest plazas in the world.  Definitely its size is impressive since it covers 40 hectares of the City of Monterrey.  Walking around the place is very pleasant, you find sculptures, fountains, monuments, historical buildings and even artisans sales.   You can get a good beverage and take a walk, then find a little bench to sit and enjoy a sunny day.  You can visit historical buildings like the Metropolitan Cathedral, Government Palace, Federal Palace, Museums and a lot more to explore!  Recommended!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

521187508.name: Nice big plaza with good attractions
521187508.author: a TripAdvisor user
521187508.reviewBody: This is a very large public square with gardens, picnic areas, street vendors, libraries and public shows. Very good way to spend an afternoon.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

510647024.name: Visiting the Macroplaza with family and friends
510647024.author: a TripAdvisor user
510647024.reviewBody: There are a lot of statues to see and requires lots of walking. The architecture is so amazing and everything is outdoors.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

480075402.name: Not for the snooty
480075402.author: a TripAdvisor user
480075402.reviewBody: This Is surely one of the most popular weekend hangouts for local folk that like to walk around, check out cheapy trinket stands ... or come celebrate a local soccer clubs\' championship! Beyond that, not much to see but a relative \'local classic\'.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

476797243.name: What a city
476797243.author: a TripAdvisor user
476797243.reviewBody: You can always tell how safe and interesting a city is by how their citizens interact within it freely and in Monterrey it\'s a perfect example, after 5pm, thousands literally go to the Macroplaza to see clowns local entertainment and just to have a a cup of fruit and relax. Surrounded by fountains and trees you really enjoy the Plaza, they also have multiple music events. you can\'t come and blow this place off it\'s full of architecture and a authentic feeling to it

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

476156856.name: A nice big square complex
476156856.author: a TripAdvisor user
476156856.reviewBody: A nice square, or complex of squares and parks, to take a walk. Some impressive statues around and interesting architecture. You can find many museums and other important buildings around it.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

470211393.name: Excellent place to enjoy a relaxing walk.
470211393.author: a TripAdvisor user
470211393.reviewBody: Its a great place to just go for a walk after shopping or dining during your stay.  Many times during the year you will find concerts or people setting up shoppes.  I myself frequent it during the month of december when you can find countless Mexican souvenirs.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

466532597.name: Bring an Appetite
466532597.author: a TripAdvisor user
466532597.reviewBody: We bought gifts from the many vendors at the park. It was great seeing families out on a Sunday afternoon enjoying the wonderful weather.  I tried the Mexican Grilled Street Corn, which was fabulous. There were so many freshly squeezed juices for sale - all of them were great. Of all of the places I went to in Monterrey, this one I will remember the most because it was so relaxing and charming.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

457433860.name: Cute - seen some concerts and events during my stay
457433860.author: a TripAdvisor user
457433860.reviewBody: It\'s a huge square, there\'s nothing to expect more than that. However, it takes you to 3 of the museums that are in the city centre, it has nice cafe\'s and if you face east you gat to also see the mountains. I was frequently there because my hotel was really close.\n\nThat is the place you take the boat to Fundidora park. You should go there.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

453490509.name: Gran plaza
453490509.author: a TripAdvisor user
453490509.reviewBody: Excellent views. Great shots for your memories. Very nice architecture all around. You can visit the Museo del Palacio (free entrance)

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

439160882.name: Is really Macro
439160882.author: a TripAdvisor user
439160882.reviewBody: Huge public place for sightseeing, taking pictures or just spending time relaxing.\nIt is always appreciated that governments care to give this public places instead to shopping malls...

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

434142498.name: It\'s ok
434142498.author: a TripAdvisor user
434142498.reviewBody: Nice cathedral and nice plaza for walking although the stores are more suited for local tastes, nothing for tourists like souvenirs of any kind and limited eateries.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

426179176.name: Another place with history beneath it, or so they say...
426179176.author: a TripAdvisor user
426179176.reviewBody: In order to build the new and lovely plaza, large parts of the old city had to be destroyed. This upset many residents of the city. I personally heard from the staff of a museum on the plaza that the ghost of a monk still haunts it, and was even caught on the security camera. Modernization comes at a dear price, but it is a lovely plaza.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

423700646.name: Grande
423700646.author: a TripAdvisor user
423700646.reviewBody: Macroplaza is a true, local landmak of Monterrey! Emblematic, spacious - very specific and important part of downtown Monterrey. However, there are some abandoned areas and some of them are badly damaged. The walk along the plaza is itself very pleasant though, remember to wear some comfortable shoes!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

417282591.name: Great place to Visit and shop!!!
417282591.author: a TripAdvisor user
417282591.reviewBody: Macroplaza is free and takes you right in to the Centro de Monterey. It has nice monuments. Nice green space. Great for a day of some inexpensive shopping while in Monterey. Great and fresh street food in the area. The food is very affordable and delicious!!!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

390759431.name: Must-see in Monterrey
390759431.author: a TripAdvisor user
390759431.reviewBody: Don\'t miss strolling along the vast Gran Plaza (Macroplaza) in Monterrey.  Fine museums, historic and modern architecture, great place to people-watch and take photos.  Minutes from metro stations, shopping, restaurants.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

378639909.name: For museum people
378639909.author: a TripAdvisor user
378639909.reviewBody: At Macro plaza are 4 museums close each other maybe 3 or 4 blocks. So that could be a good place to visit but for people like the culture. Macro plaza it is just very close to downtown where there many stores.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

378590410.name: Beautiful and makes for great selfies with Neptune.
378590410.author: a TripAdvisor user
378590410.reviewBody: It is really a beautiful part of Monterrey, the view of el cerro de la silla and kids running around having fun are so great. I really enjoyed the underground shops and the natural sounds of monterrey around me and it is surrounded with shops as well. Makes for a great visit but it can be really hot, take water with you.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

378075064.name: Grand Plaza in Downtown area
378075064.author: a TripAdvisor user
378075064.reviewBody: This is the centre main square between the Museum Palace, Cathedral, Contemporary Art Museum, History Museum and Metropolitan Museum. The Statures are exquisite.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

369833955.name: Gorgeous
369833955.author: a TripAdvisor user
369833955.reviewBody: Visit the Government building and walk around! Lots to see! Food and craft vendors and lots of places to take good pictures.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

363126201.name: Nice, relaxed.
363126201.author: a TripAdvisor user
363126201.reviewBody: The place is big. We took the boat tour and it lasted one hour. Magnificent gardens, very well taken care of. The place is lovely although commenting with my wife, it lacks the wow factor for some unknown reason. Definitely worth visiting.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

358504583.name: Best plaza ever
358504583.author: a TripAdvisor user
358504583.reviewBody: Several blocks long, walking trails and parks, very nice scene of strolling families. Great street venders selling crafts and food, and not at all aggressive. Museums, hotels, gov\'t buildings surround it with stupendous architecture and sculptures. Very beautiful and safe.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

357959537.name: Downtown just like others but quite cleaner
357959537.author: a TripAdvisor user
357959537.reviewBody: This is a place for downtwon , big town is  Monterrey , so you can walk into a museum or into the church, some clowns and some other urban performeres will be found there.\nThere some snacks, and there are  a lot of police and mailitary forces surveillance the place, so it is "safe", it is a place to visit in couple of hours.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

356082500.name: Nice to visit in winter or cloudy day
356082500.author: a TripAdvisor user
356082500.reviewBody: it\'s an interesting place, you can see monumets of mexican heroes and people who participate in fundation of this city.\nMonterrey is a Hot place, about 100\u00b0F , so it\'s better to visit in a cloudy day.\nthere is the "Museo de Historia Mexicana" near to macroplaza, this is a beautiful museum

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

341720091.name: Nice family area
341720091.author: a TripAdvisor user
341720091.reviewBody: Nice very large plaza to walk around many things to see and kind of do on the weekends very busy, there was comedians, many many food carts, several vendors, and massage chairs with the elders which seemed popular, also leads to the museo de palacia plaza which is beautiful ! not a must see but Its nice to check out if you have time.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

339293614.name: Great place to walk and enjoy the architechture and view of the mountains
339293614.author: a TripAdvisor user
339293614.reviewBody: It\'s a great boulevard built over several streets. You can walk from the municipal  building to the governor\'s palace (about a mile).

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

338506525.name: Good to walk around on weekends
338506525.author: a TripAdvisor user
338506525.reviewBody: Lots of clowns and street artists or entertainers, good for families and to grab a churro or some corn and enjoy while walking and admiring the plaza, recommended for families but just be cautious with your surroundings.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

335529550.name: Massive public space, well utilized
335529550.author: a TripAdvisor user
335529550.reviewBody: We visited downtown Monterrey over Christmas week. The entire time, there was a festival in the park that included food and item vendors, free ice skating, and lots of people enjoying the weather. There is a variety of public art and the park provides good access to the downtown shopping area.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

331722585.name: Great place to people watch!
331722585.author: a TripAdvisor user
331722585.reviewBody:
A large park and place to stroll around and look at fountains, view the Monterrey government buildings, and watch the interesting people who frequent the place.
If you enjoy being around families, Sunday afternoons are the best. There are street performers, clowns, magicians, and lots of wares available. 
I would highly recommend the massages done by the disabled men and women near the Plaza Morelos. You can have your back or your feet massaged at a very affordable price and they do a decent job.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

331153434.name: Beautiful plaza but...
331153434.author: a TripAdvisor user
331153434.reviewBody: It looks really nice in the evening but it\'s not a sight you definitely have to see when travelling around in Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

327835472.name: Been there twice
327835472.author: a TripAdvisor user
327835472.reviewBody: The first time I went was back in August and the plaza had many street vendors but the area was not very clean. In November, not add many vendors but very clean. I enjoyed both visits for different reasons. I would like to spend more time to go into some of the museums the next time.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

314077747.name: Full of vendors
314077747.author: a TripAdvisor user
314077747.reviewBody: Used to be a nice place, but it doesn\'t have a nice view anymore as it is full of vendors and their vending tents. It is kind of dirty, also.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

308760372.name: Beautiful Plaza
308760372.author: a TripAdvisor user
308760372.reviewBody: It\'s a must each and every time I visit Monterrey.  Love the view of the mountains, palacio and the fuente de Neptuno.  WiFi is also offered so serves as a plus.  It\'s beautifully maintained.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

298785793.name: A Different Plaza
298785793.author: a TripAdvisor user
298785793.reviewBody: Most towns or cities in Mexico have the main square between the most important church and the government building. Monterrey was just like that with the Metropolitan Cathedral and the old government building that you can see across the Macroplaza. It was like this for many years, until along with the modern times a visionary governor came and transformed the whole layout. Now we have a gigantic square or plaza (Macroplaza) that extends from the city hall to the state government palace. You can walk the Macroplaza and enjoy the different attractions around and inside it.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

292891532.name: Loved the statues
292891532.author: a TripAdvisor user
292891532.reviewBody:
This two parks is full of historical buildings and museums.

If you visit Monterrey it's hard not to cross any of these to parks since most of the tourist attractions is located here.
My favorite is the big fountain located at the macroplaza.

When I visited I saw a lot of military guarding these two parks, made me feel very safe.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

288581983.name: Central City Park
288581983.author: a TripAdvisor user
288581983.reviewBody: This park is fairly modern and random in many ways. It\'s central to many of the city\'s museums and other attractions. It\'s fine, but nothing special.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

281407471.name: Local icon
281407471.author: a TripAdvisor user
281407471.reviewBody: One of the biggest plazas in the entire world, la Macro has fountains, trees, theater, museums and lot of things around. You will find local people and lots of tourists also.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

280491113.name: day with friends
280491113.author: a TripAdvisor user
280491113.reviewBody: We met some friends in Monterrey and spent a day walking through the Gran Plaza.  Lots to see, from the "carrot" to the statues, a dance group rehearsing, the river that flows through the corridor.  We thoroughly enjoyed strolling around the area.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

277008995.name: Lots to See, History and Scenery
277008995.author: a TripAdvisor user
277008995.reviewBody: Walking the Gran Plaza was easy, with lots of shade and spots to relax. I had always wanted to see the Neptune fountain and we also visited the Palacio de Gobierno. There is plenty of shopping nearby with restaurants and hotels. A pleasant way to spend an afternoon!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

273422244.name: A Monterrey "Must-Visit"
273422244.author: a TripAdvisor user
273422244.reviewBody: The Macroplaza is located in the center of the city. It is flanked by several government buildings, including the historic "Palacio del Gobierno", which in addition to the Governor\'s office also houses a museum. Three more museums face the park: the Museum of Contemporary Art (MARCO), the Museum of Mexican History, and the Museum of the Northwest. The plaza includes fountains and ample spaces used for public open-air events - often free - including concerts, theater, regional handcraft and food markets, etc.  It also is one of the endpoints of the "Paseo Santa Luc\u00eda", a canal and walking path that leads to Parque Fundidora (another great place to visit - from the Macroplaza, you can go on foot or take a boat along the canal). You can also walk to the "Barrio Antiguo" from here - an old neighborhood with antique shops, restaurant, bars, etc.\nI have been to the Macroplaza repeatedly for cultural events in the park or in the surrounding buildings, to take a boat on the canal, or just to walk and have a meal at one of the nearby restaurants. I have always found it clean, although on special occasions it gets very crowded and might be left less tidy. It was one of the first places I took my parents when they came to visit.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

271434631.name: Macroplaza
271434631.author: a TripAdvisor user
271434631.reviewBody: The Old Town of Monterrey was renovated in 1980. The Macroplaza is the world\'s fourth largest plaza. It has several landmarks : Neptunes fountain, the cathedral and "El Faro del Comercio" which should not be missed by night. This plaza is a place where the people from Monterrey gather to promenade on weekends. You can find vendors selling mexican candies and icecream.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

270000109.name: Beautiful Plaza
270000109.author: a TripAdvisor user
270000109.reviewBody: The Plaza is beautiful as well as all the families that get together there. Its very centric so you have a lot of people coming through it as well as very lively.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

268537658.name: Not a good experience
268537658.author: a TripAdvisor user
268537658.reviewBody: This is a huge park`-plaza. There are a lot of vendors, unkempt and full of trash. I do not understand how this can be downtown and can not be clean. Families come here to walk and visit museums, unfortunately use the fountains as pools and some fountains are very dirty.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

260162493.name: It is a real and huge plaza
260162493.author: a TripAdvisor user
260162493.reviewBody: The place is located just at the heart of Monterrey. It contains all the public buildings of the city including also some museus. If you take the boat trip from Fundidora Park will disembark here. Downtown adventures in Monterrey starts here. Bring a camera and don\'t forget to take photos.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

259318688.name: Cool place to hang out
259318688.author: a TripAdvisor user
259318688.reviewBody: Fountains, beauty, statues and Palacio nearby.  Many families and couples go here.  Food vendors and, of course, teens giggling and cracking jokes like anywhere in the world.  \n\nRather large so wear comfortable shoes.  Best time to visit is after work or weekend afternoons - especially Sunday.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

254784487.name: Excellent family activity
254784487.author: a TripAdvisor user
254784487.reviewBody: Sunday afternoons are the best time to walk the plaza, buy snacks from the various vendors, catch a street performer, and get a cheap massage from a disabled worker. Everyone should take advantage of this great place in Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

236634973.name: Beautiful
236634973.author: a TripAdvisor user
236634973.reviewBody: Very large central plaza with many street vendors, performers, and lots of people watching. Sunday afternoons are the best. Also, you can get a very inexpensive and good massage by the handicapped people close to Plaza Morelos.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

226675581.name: Another Photo Opportunity
226675581.author: a TripAdvisor user
226675581.reviewBody:
First order of business is to make sure you have a good pair of comfortable walking shoes.  This is one heck of a long green space from end to end located in an area that is full of businesses and restaurants.  You will want to set aside at least a couple of hours to stroll past the statues, stop and admire the wonderful fountains, watch an acting class performing al fresco, visit a museum, and shop in the stores and restaurants that are situated in courts below the surface of the plaza.

Towards the lower end of the plaza is a monolith that towers above the surrounds and used to set the sky ablaze at night with a green laser (don't know if that continues now).  We made our trek during the day, however. We found that there were a good number of indigenous campesinos visiting at the time with colorful serape style clothing and an aversion to having their picture taken (capture your soul kind of thing I think??).  The sights will definitely keep you camera shutter snapping.

We were not concerned with our safety and managed to see quite a bit during our couple of hours strolling the plaza.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

220457103.name: A very nice walk with lots to see
220457103.author: a TripAdvisor user
220457103.reviewBody: I spent about 2 hours walking around the Macroplaza area on a Saturday. There are lots of monuments / fountains / sculptures etc. to see. There are street vendors selling souvenirs and snacks / drinks. Adjacent to the Macroplaza are pedestrian streets with plenty of shopping with both indoor and outdoor options. I never felt unsafe walking around during the day (didn\'t visit at night). I think you need to exercise the same caution you would in any city.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

205603275.name: Just to take a short walk and that\'s it.>BE CAREFUL
205603275.author: a TripAdvisor user
205603275.reviewBody: This plaza is very beautiful and it is considered to be the biggest one in the world even bigger than the red plaza in Moscow but it is located in downtown so lots of beggars, lots of pick pocketers, people asking for money and some street entertainers, just watch your wallet at all times, less crowded during the weekdays, recommend to go between 12 p.m. and 5 p.m. none will bother you, if you go after dark you are at risk.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

188652863.name: So beautifull at night
188652863.author: a TripAdvisor user
188652863.reviewBody: not far from the channel...exciting at night with the lights. Don\'t beleive that Monterrey is un-safe - that\'s the safe city and I feel comfortable at 22:30 at the plaza with a lot of young people. That was afe and fun

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

167520096.name: A pleasant stroll!
167520096.author: a TripAdvisor user
167520096.reviewBody: Located in the center of town in front of the old government house this is a nice park with lovely fountains to stroll and walk around. Close to the boat ride through Santa Lucia.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

162651578.name: Good place to see, lots of action, but be a little careful
162651578.author: a TripAdvisor user
162651578.reviewBody: There\'s lots going on here, street shows, artisans, museums etc.  However, be careful, as it also brings thieves and pickpockets etc.  You just need to have your wits about you, and not show any large bills or wear expensive jewelry; you want to blend into the surroundings as much as possible.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

159528775.name: Nice place
159528775.author: a TripAdvisor user
159528775.reviewBody: Interesting place to walk around but it could be to hot during summer time. take care about your skin. there are couple of museums nearby and old quarter

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

157246973.name: Spend the day or afternoon
157246973.author: a TripAdvisor user
157246973.reviewBody: This is a great place to just hang out.  There is usually something going on and if not there is a lot to see.  There are a bunch of different statues and fountains to see.  It is a huge area to walk around so you can for sure spend a couple hours there.  There are a lot of shops and stores nearby, including a pedestrian only street.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

156384596.name: Nice place to visit!
156384596.author: a TripAdvisor user
156384596.reviewBody: This area of Monterrey is busy but it is nice to check out. Several museums on this area and a lot of people, but it is worth it.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

153460438.name: Beautiful
153460438.author: a TripAdvisor user
153460438.reviewBody: Very nice plaza.  Work was being done to it.  By the looks of it there\'s more water fountains coming yet.  No traffic, since it is all underground.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

147379785.name: Beautiful Sunday
147379785.author: a TripAdvisor user
147379785.reviewBody: Great place to people watch, take a walk and eat street food. The fountain is , the federal palace is beautiful and the church is worth stepping into. The parking is a little pricey too!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

141366150.name: Dirty plaza
141366150.author: a TripAdvisor user
141366150.reviewBody: Lack of fountain maintanence, trash in the streets, there\'s no rules for pedestrian so it gets dirty...not recommended on weekends

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

136107610.name: shopping
136107610.author: a TripAdvisor user
136107610.reviewBody: great place to shop and take a few souvenirs, its a whole street with shops on both sides and you can pretty much find anything there from something to eat to shoes, clothing  you name it.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

135467578.name: Nice typical place for tourists.
135467578.author: a TripAdvisor user
135467578.reviewBody: It\u00b4s well taken care of and has many places around. The only thing I don\u00b4t like are the couples that sit or lay down on the grass. Oh and also those people that let their children play in the water fountains.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

124898132.name: Smooth walk in the Gran Plaza
124898132.author: a TripAdvisor user
124898132.reviewBody: I love pictures, and I have walk the gran plaza at nite to take pics of alone dark buildings... i hope  you try it.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

122839263.name: Do not leave without seeing it.
122839263.author: a TripAdvisor user
122839263.reviewBody: Part of the full complex of attractions together with Parque Fundidora and Paseo Santa Lucia, all of them connected. Macroplaza is a little bit dirty sometimes, specially when there is a lot of people. Here avoid to walk late in the night unless there is an special event and there is extra security personnel.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

1502555.name: good place to be
1502555.author: a TripAdvisor user
1502555.reviewBody: This was one of the locations that is in touch with most attractions downtown. It has several statues as well as being near art museo like the MARCO, and walking distance from the inter plaza (shopping) and Barrior Antiqua.. so a good location and very touristy.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion a 5 Zona Centro

487286060.name: Nice mall, and good restaurants choices.
487286060.author: a TripAdvisor user
487286060.reviewBody: its right next door to my hotel, in Monterrey, has nice stores and also a good food court and other interesting restaurants that are worth trying. Good place to visit.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Vasconcelos # 402

471977920.name: Higher end mall
471977920.author: a TripAdvisor user
471977920.reviewBody: Terrible to figure out to walk. But has a food court and some nice restaurants. Rolex and Omega is sold her so bring your money.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Vasconcelos # 402

458465137.name: Good alternatives to eat
458465137.author: a TripAdvisor user
458465137.reviewBody: It\'s been a while since I visited Paseo San Pedro; there are some several restaurants available within the mall, including a PF Chang, Italiannis, La Garufa (great Argentina steakhouse), and a Sierra Madre Brewery restaurant. They also have an small food court with no so many options and an Starbucks in the first floor. The cinema theater is in the second floor and it is a great option to go with friend a or family, although beware is packed on weekends.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Vasconcelos # 402

429885426.name: paseo San Pedro
429885426.author: a TripAdvisor user
429885426.reviewBody: A nice place to go shopping or to the movies.  There are many high-end brand stores,including Palacio de Hierro (a smaller version of Printemps or Galeries Lafayette).  It has a food court and some restaurants. You\u00b4ll find shops like Zara, Mango, Mossimo Dutti, and Crate and Barrell. There is a cinema, and the NH hotel connected to the mall. You won\u00b4t have any trouble with parking space.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Vasconcelos # 402

418260235.name: NOON AT Paseo San Pedro
418260235.author: a TripAdvisor user
418260235.reviewBody: Nice mall to visit and spend some times in their restaurants as Italianni\'s and PFChang\'s among others. Nice shopping place and entertainment places to take your family.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Vasconcelos # 402

370806424.name: Best mall in town!
370806424.author: a TripAdvisor user
370806424.reviewBody: Looking for the best shopping in town?.... This is it. All designer stores in a small shopping center. Very convenient to walk through and spend a good time. Quite expensive though but what can you expect from the best european and american brands?\nFast food court and a couple of nice restaurants available for lunch or dinner. It is located in a very nice and safe area, easy to get to and with a large parking lot. You will not regret your visit.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Vasconcelos # 402

339688528.name: Not my favorite
339688528.author: a TripAdvisor user
339688528.reviewBody: The only thing that I like about this shopping mall is the location. Besides that there is nothing much. Few stores and quite empty.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Vasconcelos # 402

338514129.name: Good place to see stores
338514129.author: a TripAdvisor user
338514129.reviewBody: This place is expensive and has expensive stores, it is good to walk around and watch people walking around. Recommended maybe on a Saturday afternoon.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Jose Vasconcelos # 402

659768531.name: A beautiful plaza with a variety of shops and restaurants plus movie teathers
659768531.author: a TripAdvisor user
659768531.reviewBody: This is a nice place to go have a coffee, eat snacks, watch a movie, have lunch or dinner or just walk or seat to enjoy the view. No problem with parking or security, either on a rainy day or a sunny one. Excellent place to spend an afternoon or dinner.

address.streetAddress: Av. Vasconcelos No. 755, Col. del Valle, San Pedro Garza Garcia

576949748.name: Nice place for movies and dinner
576949748.author: a TripAdvisor user
576949748.reviewBody: A 3 floor mini \u2018mall\u2019 with different restaurants on the top. It\u2019s great if you go and watch a movie and then a nice dinner.

address.streetAddress: Av. Vasconcelos No. 755, Col. del Valle, San Pedro Garza Garcia

545092203.name: Expensive but worth it
545092203.author: a TripAdvisor user
545092203.reviewBody: Went to the Cinemex and was surprised by how expensive it was. When I saw the screen and the quality of sound, I understood. Completely worth it!

address.streetAddress: Av. Vasconcelos No. 755, Col. del Valle, San Pedro Garza Garcia

518050140.name: Shopping
518050140.author: a TripAdvisor user
518050140.reviewBody: After visiting a museum we wanted to do some shopping, we visited this mall but found out is mainly restaurants, ice cream and coffee mall. Good parking, a great atmosphere in the Cerveceria a great bar/grill . Plenty of security. \'The Entrance\' has a greater selection of bars but that is a bit noisy for my fast.

address.streetAddress: Calzada Del Valle 401

233773588.name: Parking lot charge
233773588.author: a TripAdvisor user
233773588.reviewBody: I personally think that shopping centers should have free parking lots. The only reason I went to this plaza were the restaurants, there\'s better options with free parking lot.

address.streetAddress: Calzada Del Valle 401

211407021.name: Great place for dining, not so much for shopping
211407021.author: a TripAdvisor user
211407021.reviewBody: Read the previous comments, they are quite accurate.  The strong point of this project is the number and variety of restaurants located on the top level.  All of them offer outdoor terrace dining, and since the project faces south, you can enjoy a magnificent view of the Sierra Madre.  Some of the best restaurants in San Pedro are to be found here.  \n\nThe less strong aspects are due to the fact that this project is now ten years old and is no longer state-of-the art.  The middle level and the lower level are a hodge podge of various boutiques, services. automotive showrooms, a Starbuck\'s Coffee and other uses.  There is a surface parking lot and two levels of underground parking (all pay).  The escalators are in the northeastern corner and there are also elevators, but the lateral and vertical circulation leaves something to be desired and the signage in the parking garage could be better.  There is an entrance from Calzada del Valle in the front, but the exits are to the west, to Av. Rio de la Plata, or to the north, in back of the project, to Av. Rio Manzanares.  You need to be traveling west on the Calzada del Valle in order to access this project, it can only be accessed from this direction.  401 is generally quite crowded in the evening and really crowded on Friday and Sat. evenings, so consider making reservations.  If you are not sure what you want to eat, this is a good place to come, you are likely to find something that suits your taste.

address.streetAddress: Calzada Del Valle 401

203446606.name: Lively place
203446606.author: a TripAdvisor user
203446606.reviewBody: I don\'t go there often, since most times seems to be very crowded... I was there last night and realised that "crowded" is not a fair way to describe it... It is a lively place, with different options, including coffee shops, ice cream shops, bars and restaurants... The place is interesting and safe... Different places attract different groups, from young people to senior citizens... Nice place...

address.streetAddress: Calzada Del Valle 401

673541743.reviewBody: This place is great! Take the ride along the Paseo Santa Lucia on the Boat to get there. When there, enjoy everything from museums, food, beautiful views and great events. I go at least once a month to ride bikes there too

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

670566234.author: a TripAdvisor user

There are vending machines to get a cold beverage as well as little pop up stands.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

644428999.name: Fun afternoon
644428999.author: a TripAdvisor user

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

643608727.name: Steel Mill Foundry
643608727.author: a TripAdvisor user
643608727.reviewBody:
We were in Monterrey for a New Year’s Eve party. We traveled with Go With Jo from Harlingen, TX. 
An included trip was a visit to the steel foundry park or Parque Fundidora. This steel mill operated in Monterrey from 1901-1985 and was one of the largest economic generators in Monterrey. Since it’s closure, the city of Monterrey has developed it into a public park with many family attractions. 
Entrance to the park is free but the river barge costs is minimal. Among the attractions are the St. Lucia river barge rides,  the steel foundry museum, a bicycle route, jogging route, and in development is Mexico’s Baseball Hall of Fame.
When in Monterrey, I strongly recommend the Parque Fundidora.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

641448422.name: World class attraction
641448422.author: a TripAdvisor user
641448422.reviewBody: This place was once one of Monterrey\u2019s top industries generating hundreds of jobs and income for the city and the State of Nuevo Le\u00f3n. However with progress came pollution. Those times are gone and now it is back on its feet helping to generate hundreds of jobs but this time as a tourist attraction and without polluting. The park offers a large variety of options when it comes to entertainment, for kids and grownups. There are museums, one of them interactive and restaurants. A perfect place to spend an entire day.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

639764849.name: Trail of lights
639764849.author: a TripAdvisor user
639764849.reviewBody: Some friends bought us here for an annual event luzcopia. Mainly to bring the kids. Very nice park and cool to see the lit up displays. Not sure what park is like during the day but its very clean and good place for a nice walk. All was OK except parking was far and confusing and restrooms hard to find.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

639174869.name: A MUST visit
639174869.author: a TripAdvisor user
639174869.reviewBody: If you ever go ti Monterrey, you have to go to Fundidora Park. Part of the Monterrey history. Great walksides, great monuments, great food and a nice landscapes

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

639006292.name: Nice view
639006292.author: a TripAdvisor user
639006292.reviewBody: Well place to visit, do some excercise, spend time just to have fun with your friends or your family.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

You can:

-Exercise and relax

Among others!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

632677421.name: Fantastic oark
632677421.author: a TripAdvisor user
632677421.reviewBody: We went to this amazing park. It was at one time the largest foundry in Mexico. All three faundry ovens were still in place, very clean and one was a museum. The park is huge and they provide a free tour bus to see the entire park which took 20 minutes. They also provide rental of quite a numberof bicycles. There is also a \u201cSanta Lucia\u201d boat ride that took you around a man made river, it was very nice and relaxing. The entire park was green well kept clean and the lawns were manicured. My wife and I really enjoyed this visit made oue weekend trip to Monterrey worthwhile.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

631987063.author: a TripAdvisor user

The park is easy to get to and the entrance and exist are very easy to find, when attending a music festival keep in mind it will be VERY crowded, both times i have paid extra for VIP access because the bathroom situation is generally better and to me thats worth it.  The last time we visited was for Mother of all rock festivals (Guns n roses was headlining) the park was nice and clean and again easy to get in and out of .

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera
