address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

581469269.name: Interesting but that\'s it
581469269.author: a TripAdvisor user
581469269.reviewBody: This area was cool and it was interesting but I was getting bored pretty quick... Just not that much to do once you\'ve walked around the park

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

581252393.name: beautiful park
581252393.author: a TripAdvisor user
581252393.reviewBody: This park, has a beautiful garden, with places for bikes and skates, and they have museums and a ride  with a boat for the river to go downtown, and a restaurant called lingote, with very good food

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

580518394.name: Best place in Monterrey
580518394.author: a TripAdvisor user
580518394.reviewBody: If you want to take a walk or ride a bike this place is perfect.\nInside of it you can do some activities and also is very close to paseo Santa Luc\u00eda.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

580141406.name: If you have spare time
580141406.author: a TripAdvisor user
580141406.reviewBody: If you have free time in Monterrey it\u2019s a good option for tourism, very close to downtown Monterrey and Cintermex convention center.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

578409044.name: Really Amazing
578409044.author: a TripAdvisor user
578409044.reviewBody: I love coming to parks and I\'ve visited them all over the world but this one really stands out as something special.  The city managed to build a large amount of green space around old industrial installations and it makes for haunting beauty in a place you can walk, run, bike or just relax.  It\'s a massive park too and well worth exploring.  Do note the area around the park can seem a little rough but don\'t let that stop you.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

578407439.name: A must when going to Monterey
578407439.author: a TripAdvisor user
578407439.reviewBody: The place is amazing and enourmeous. We were here for the Pal Norte music festival and the venue is simply amazing. You can visit any other time of the year and you will get to see a bunch of stuff.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

575047453.name: What an incredible place
575047453.author: a TripAdvisor user
575047453.reviewBody: I love this park you always feel very safe here never had problem . This park holds big concerts and incredible events all the time . As you walk you can here music playing through the speakers around the park a nice soft New Age music normally like Enya . The grass is very green and there are many trees . You feel like your walking in paradise . There are museums and many things to see around here

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

568182445.name: Wow
568182445.author: a TripAdvisor user
568182445.reviewBody: I have really good time in this place , is a lot of activity to do with the kids and family a lot of museums and history to learn, places to eat , you can bring you bicycle \ud83d\udeb2 or rent one and was really clean and safe to be with the family.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

567795102.name: Amazing regeneration of an old industrial site
567795102.author: a TripAdvisor user
567795102.reviewBody: This place is a revelation. In an industrial city where \'gritty\' is the norm this place is a jewel. This former industrial site has been transformed into a wonderful, extensive parkland for all kinds of passive and active recreation whilst incorporating the remains of some pretty amazing old industrial buildings either as museums or useful modern spaces. It is a playground for locals and visitors alike.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

566879489.name: One of the best parks
566879489.author: a TripAdvisor user
566879489.reviewBody: This is a really great park in Monterrey that used to be a foundry and has now been incorporated in to the uniqueness of the park.  I felt very safe running through the park at 6am or 9pm . It is very populated and has several amenities for families and those looking for exercise.  It is a must see if you are visiting.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

566857765.name: Nice park.
566857765.author: a TripAdvisor user
566857765.reviewBody: Lots of green grass and well designed landscaping. Museums and rides and something for everyone. Lots of eating places. Great for families. \n\nZip line and boat rides.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

564355255.name: Clean, calm, fun
564355255.author: a TripAdvisor user
564355255.reviewBody: My wife and I have made many trips to the park and it to be a great place to take walks and ride a bike and have a picnic style lunch. We bring the backpacks and make a day of it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

563259488.name: Where the locals converge, for good reason
563259488.author: a TripAdvisor user
563259488.reviewBody: I went on a Sunday and there were lots of people - mostly locals.  I can understand why - it is a very beautiful and well kept park, even the man made lake is clean and clear and with mountains at your backdrop the atmosphere is very relaxing. Here you can see mostly Mexicans having fun, children laughing sweetly and adults alike smiling profusely. There are numerous outdoor activities like playing ball, biking, jogging, riding a boat, going on rides or just plain strolling.  I felt very, very safe.  Just note it is a huge park, and Paseo de Sta Lucia and Museo del Acero Horno 3 are actually within this park, and so are a lot of other attractions like Cintermex. There are water fountains and clean rest room everywhere.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

562393232.name: A fun day
562393232.author: a TripAdvisor user
562393232.reviewBody: First of all, make sure you have plenty of time for this visit, so mean things to do for the family, Take the small boats, visit the candy museum, have a beer, a coffee... enjoy your visit.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

559069629.name: Great park for a day trip!
559069629.author: a TripAdvisor user
559069629.reviewBody:
I came with my 12 year old daughter and nephew. I was surprised that considering the size of the park, which is huge, it was very well maintained and cleaned.
The ice skating court and the furnace museum are a must go attraction.
Even the bathrooms were neat and clean!
I highly recommend everybody to go for a day trip relax and amusement.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

558916744.name: WEEKEND AT MONTERREY
558916744.author: a TripAdvisor user
558916744.reviewBody: It has several places to spend a family weekend inside, like taking a boat trip at Santa Lucia Riverwalk, even better at night !\nThere are musical events al Arena Monterrey every other week with internationals singers. For the kids, you can go to Plaza Sesamo Park

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

558156050.name: Nice place to ride a bike or stroll around. Interesting use of an old industrial site.
558156050.author: a TripAdvisor user
558156050.reviewBody: Nice place to ride a bike or stroll around. Interesting use of an old industrial site.\n\nYou can see the mountains surrounding the city and there are quite a few sites within the park.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

555263194.name: A nice park to relax and enjoy any spare time
555263194.author: a TripAdvisor user
555263194.reviewBody: Very nice to walk around. It\'s clean and peaceful. Not too busy but also there were a lot of people using this park at the weekend when I went there to kill some time.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

553369162.name: Parque Fundidora. Mandatory visit while in MTY
553369162.author: a TripAdvisor user
553369162.reviewBody: Lovely view from the top and the tour inside de Fundidora museum was very interesting. The park itself is a lovely place to go for a walk. You can stay there for hours.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

553003730.name: Ziplines
553003730.author: a TripAdvisor user
553003730.reviewBody: Great place to do zipline. This is very close to the downtown, You can spend a few hours doing the zipline and later spend time in the park

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

551585212.name: Most amazing park in Mexico
551585212.author: a TripAdvisor user
551585212.reviewBody: This is by far the most amazing park in Mexico, it has everything! Attractions, an artificial river (like the one in San Antonio), a small zoo, it has a movie theatre where you can find cultural and art movies, it has 3 or 4 museums, the most important is "Horno 3", this is a museum that talks about the history of the park and history of Monterrey. Fundidora park has a restaurant, vending machines, washrooms, small lakes, you can rent a bike, it has a hotel, parking lot, there\'s a subway station 2 or 3 blocks away. Park admission is completely free, museums, restaurant, and other attractions are not free, but prices are cheap.\nArena Monterrey is next to Parque Fundidora, this means that there are so many shows, concerts and attractions close to this place. During the year, music festivals like "Pal\'Norte", "Live Out" or "Machaca Fest" are held here.\nThis place is perfect for families or couples.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

551339887.name: Luztopia (Christmas show) at Parque Fundidora is beautiful.
551339887.author: a TripAdvisor user
551339887.reviewBody: The Christmas light show "Luztopia" is wondrous. There are dazzling light displays, such as the white castle, and street performers, and vendors (fresh churros!), as well as a ferry ride. Entrance is free. This is must-see in Monterrey at Christmas time.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

551325905.name: Never-ending urban park
551325905.author: a TripAdvisor user
551325905.reviewBody:
This unique park was recovered by the city after it served for many years as the grounds for a huge steel mill. The city cleaned it up, built very attractive infrastructure and took advantage of many of the steel mill's amazing structures. It offers attractions for young and old and it is very much worth visiting.

The grounds are very safe, clean and well kept. Children can very safely ride bicycles, roller skates, skate boards, etc. Exercise buffs can walk, jog, run or cycle on the very long track around the park.

Great location to spend the whole day with the family.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

550404388.name: Awesome park!
550404388.author: a TripAdvisor user
550404388.reviewBody: It\'s a huge park with many different attractions, cultural ones and natural landscapes. It also includes an artificial river where you can take a boat ride to the city center and mexican history museum.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

548532429.name: Grat place to bike
548532429.author: a TripAdvisor user
548532429.reviewBody: Very big and nice park with nature, food kiosks, water, bike rentals and even a concert venue. Excellent to go spend an afternoon.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

544899389.name: Clean and green!
544899389.author: a TripAdvisor user
544899389.reviewBody: I was here for the wanderlust event in monterrey. Although I have been in the city for a while, this was the first time I was here and early morning.. lovely place to walk, run, exercise, yoga and see the sunrise.. the place is clean and huge and the way it has the old structures restored is brilliant.. one of a kind.. you can spend a nice relaxed day out here.. will definitely go back soon..

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

544672174.name: Splendid! A place to visit many times
544672174.author: a TripAdvisor user
544672174.reviewBody: The Fundidora Park is a recovered space where the steel foundry was located. They used old pieces of the factory for making sculptures and fountains. It is a novel concept that converted an unused yard in an ample and beautiful park. It is the perfect location for spending a family day, walking, visiting museums and taking a ride along the Santa Lucia Drive. Don\'t miss the chance for visiting this touristic attraction.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

543250225.name: Weekend spot
543250225.author: a TripAdvisor user
543250225.reviewBody: Good place to spend a relaxed sunday. Even if being in the middle of the city, the place is a good one to walk and just hangout. Easy to access; parking is around 60 mxp for all day

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

542221523.name: Culture and nature from reconvertion
542221523.author: a TripAdvisor user
542221523.reviewBody:
I did love the place.

I arrived from downtown with the unique boat of Santa Lucia River. At the place that used to be a big factory nowadays plenty of spaces for rest, do exercise, walk. The building mainly reconverted as cultural or sports facilities; architecture reconversion, sculptures and fountains everywhere.

I rented a bicycle at a very low price and enjoyed very much. Ii is really a very good use of time plenty of pleasure. The only recommendation is that bikes should be provided with chains in order to get down in different spots that actually have bicycle stations.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

539986893.name: Very nice
539986893.author: a TripAdvisor user
539986893.reviewBody: We visit PF in a tour that includes the paseo Santa Lucia in the river is very relaxing and the express way to see the park; and then we visit el museo del acero in the park we so the light show and enjoy the nite museum

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

535135077.name: Big and beautiful..
535135077.author: a TripAdvisor user
535135077.reviewBody: This is an awesome place if you want to spend a day walking or riding a bike.. Green areas all over the place. Nice and clean.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

534458271.name: NICE AREA
534458271.author: a TripAdvisor user
534458271.reviewBody: Previously, this area was an iron factory and approximately 50 years ago, was turned into a recreational park.  You can enjoy a nice walk, rent a bike for a ride, also concerts and cultural events are held here.  Some retaurants have been install at the old buildings of the previous factory.  Located near the central plaza of Monterrey, at about 10 minutes by taxi.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

529670658.name: Nice place
529670658.author: a TripAdvisor user
529670658.reviewBody: It is a very nice place to go with the family to walk, to run or to take a ride in bicycle, a lot of beatiful gardens, you can rent a bicycle there and it is not expensive. It is good if you bring your lunch and there is a lot of places to rest and to eat.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

529260011.name: Nice place for sightseen
529260011.author: a TripAdvisor user
529260011.reviewBody: It is a historical location in Monterrey. Very good to know a little more about the history of the city.\n\nThe park is very big and good for sports. Sometimes you can have the opportunity to see a show from some famous artist there!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

529060171.name: Nice surprise in big Monterrey
529060171.author: a TripAdvisor user
529060171.reviewBody: Parque Fundidora is quite big, a very nice walk from one side to the other. There is even a small boat that takes you to one of the corners of this park. Everything is very clean, pleasant music all the time from speakers all over the park.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

528825918.name: Enjoyable huge park
528825918.author: a TripAdvisor user
528825918.reviewBody: This park is huge. Good for a couple of hours walking around, running or just relaxing. A lot of playgrounds for kids as well. If you feel like visiting a museum, there is the "Horno 3", a steel industry museum.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

527704456.name: Great place to rent a bike
527704456.author: a TripAdvisor user
527704456.reviewBody:
This park is very large so I decided to rent a bike to check it out. The bike rental is about a 2 minute walk from where the boats drop off. It costs $30 pesos for one hour. 

Over one hour I managed to ride two complete loops of the main road, going at a relatively brisk pace and making a few stops for photos. 

Best to visit in the evening when it is cooler. In the middle of the day the sun is too bright and hot. 

There are lots of places to stop and linger such as fountains, playgrounds and the old industrial remains. You could easily spend an interesting couple of hours here. 

While I rode the boat into the park from the museum I decided to walk back. It was a lovely stroll along the man made river that didn't take very long. Lots of places to stop for a cold drink along the way.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

525605172.name: Awesome place to chill!
525605172.author: a TripAdvisor user
525605172.reviewBody: Had to wait until my third trip to finally meet this place. Totally worth it!! Great place to hang out, you can walk, run or rent a bike to explore the park. \nThere is a museum called Horno 3 where you can learn about the history of the place and what is even more incredible is that you can take a package in which you can go through several zip-lines inside the building and also through a floating bridge.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

525585741.name: Nice Park
525585741.author: a TripAdvisor user
525585741.reviewBody: We stayed at the Holiday Inn, & the park is at the entrance. It is a nice park to walk around, plenty to see & do. A really nice walk down the river to the old town. One thing i would like to see is more food/drink stalls. Enough to do for a couple of days of strolling around.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

525228490.name: Awesome venue!
525228490.author: a TripAdvisor user
525228490.reviewBody: So much to do here!  There are museums, zip lines, bikes to rent and all sorts of places to walk to.  Vendors abound.  Also this is a prime venue for music festivals.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

524982063.name: Beautiful park
524982063.author: a TripAdvisor user
524982063.reviewBody: We walked the full length of the Riverwalk and was really impressed with how clean and well designed everything was. There are Bose outdoor speakers throughout the entire walk area playing classical music. I recommend going here if you come to visit Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

524362914.name: Beautiful!
524362914.author: a TripAdvisor user
524362914.reviewBody: I spent a couple of hours on the Fundidora and loved it. It\'s a beautifully gardened park, with lots of green and water fountains.\nFree of charge!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

522364110.name: Nice place
522364110.author: a TripAdvisor user
522364110.reviewBody: Place is great, excellent location, nice terrace and good menu, service is kind of slow and not that attentive!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

521845727.name: Iti\u00b4s a great historical place whare you can better understand Monterrey\u00b4s heritage.
521845727.author: a TripAdvisor user
521845727.reviewBody: ITS GREAT, DON\u00b4T MISS IT!! - FUNDIDORA tells us a lot abouot Monterrey\u00b4s spirit. By transforming this iconic "steel melter" into a public place for tourism, local and foreingn visitors will have a great time - Factory facilities transformed into museums, concert halls, lakes and a professional race track! it also connects with Rios Santa Lucia for a boat ride to Monterrey Downtow.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

521776785.name: Worth to be there, and staying around it for a taste of Nature & Relaxation in the city\'s heart
521776785.author: a TripAdvisor user
521776785.reviewBody: The park used to be the main steel mill, the largest in latinamerica for decades.  The site is now a modern park, green, open, vast, full of trees and gardens, walkays and large routes for bycicles and skating, where the local community comes daily to enjoy the beauty of it, circling around magnificent industrial artifacts, original from its flourishing days, refurbished for their beauty and historic technology, that transformed our world in the 20th century. Great for families, along with friends, also alone as many do for a healthy stroll, exercise and relaxation.  The place has refreshements, food, museums, movie theaters, concert halls, with a free access to the park, and some minor cost for the museums, etc.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

521148406.name: Huge a full of attractions
521148406.author: a TripAdvisor user
521148406.reviewBody: We visited the park and spent about 4hrs there. Lots of art exhibits, museums, and the Horno 3 part was amazing. One of the greatest things in Monterrey for sure. You can\'t miss it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

519088889.name: fantastic
519088889.author: a TripAdvisor user
519088889.reviewBody: My great grandfather was one of the original engineers of the Fundidora they had turn this into a beautiful walk boat ride, well worth it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

510762645.name: Nice place to understand progress
510762645.author: a TripAdvisor user
510762645.reviewBody: Really nice to see how a very industrial area in the past has been converted in a green park, quiet and ready to make open air activities. An oasis full of trees and green areas in the middle of the growing polution. To think how we would like to have big cities development in the future

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

509516108.name: Overrated
509516108.author: a TripAdvisor user
509516108.reviewBody: It was fun for a day but not close to our expectations. Coming from NYC and other populous cities, this park was sub par at best. Clean yes.. unique no...basic park to ride bicycles and watch people.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

508813097.name: Amazing!
508813097.author: a TripAdvisor user
508813097.reviewBody:
A must see location. This place has a lot of history, there are museums inside the park, you can rent bicycles (including tandem), places to eat. There are exercise machines, Ice Skating ring, and a small theather (for concerts mostly).
You would pay $50 MXP for parking for the whole day, there are different parking lots that you can use. If you go Monday-Friday, I would recommend to get therearound 10am and leave around 4pm to avoid traffic. Friday-Sunday is not too bad any time of the day.

There are romantic places that you can have dinner with your +1. Is actually a secured location, but still if you bring your children make sure to not lose sight of them, this place is huge!. 

a couple of times a month, there are huge music festivals, or cultural festivities, so make sure to visit accordingly!.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

507058785.name: Value tour
507058785.author: a TripAdvisor user
507058785.reviewBody: I been visited this place with my friend in Monterrey. They chahe 60 MXN which is worth to spend on this tour.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

503600297.name: FOR A FULL DAY TOUR!
503600297.author: a TripAdvisor user
503600297.reviewBody:
Within a city that does not have so many mayor parks, this one is a given ! It has a bit of everything, from movies in one of the most state of the art imax theaters you have seen (way better that the one in central park, nyc), at "el papalote" museum for children, or nice restaurants such as "el lingote" inside the "Horno 3" industrial museum.

There are A LOT of things to do in this park, so take your time and enjoy!!!

P.S..- Even though all attractions are affordable, you do need some money to get around!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

502635001.name: Take a walk
502635001.author: a TripAdvisor user
502635001.reviewBody:
This is one of he biggest parks Monterrey has for its locals and their visitors. There is always something fun to enjoy. The park has many ammenities for you to use. There is many equipment throughout the park for you to excercise, there is a service to rent bikes, there is enough space to walk, run or roller skate. 
Also, don't be surprised if there is a mommy to be having a photoshoot at the park. 
There are little stores that sell, elotes, tostitos preparados or some kind of beverages. 
In this place, you never bored. You might get  a little tired because you have to walk a lot, but it's worth it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

500065661.name: GREAT Park to walk and picnic in
500065661.author: a TripAdvisor user
500065661.reviewBody: Plan to spend SIGNIFICANT time here or return more than once. There are loads of things to do and see and you won\u2019t want to rush around to better enjoy the people watching and site seeing. Families, couples and friend-groups abound the park which is very sweet to see (especially because few people walk around the city itself due to size/layout). There\u2019s a jurassic park kids adventure, various pieces of the blast furnace scattered around, bike rental, snack booths, exercise equipment, the Horno 3 and 4, the fake river the leads into the park, various fountains and plazas and more. Despite going three times, we felt as if we could have returned and still had more to do! I recommend taking pictures with the sites and mountains in the background.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

499801427.name: Nice park with old industrial buildings and museums
499801427.author: a TripAdvisor user
499801427.reviewBody: The Parque Fundidora is a nice park with old industrial buildings and museums. The old steel buildings are interesting to see. Especially the Horno3 is worth a visit. From the top you have an excellent view over Monterrey and La Silla. It is a pleasant parque that is recommendable for an afternoon visit.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

496986782.name: Perfect for a weekend stroll
496986782.author: a TripAdvisor user
496986782.reviewBody:
Beautiful and vaste park on the heart of Monterrey.

Perfect for couples, friends, families (and Pokemon Go lovers!!)...

Ideal to bring a picnic, there also are lots of shops selling drinks & delicious "elote"

Haven't tried it but you can rent a pedal boat on the little lake.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

496955140.name: Touring our city
496955140.author: a TripAdvisor user
496955140.reviewBody: As always a beautiful park.  Well maintained. We could only visit the Muscera, because the Museum of steel si closed on mondays. Anyway our friend from Canada had a great time. All in all is a must visit while in the city

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

496048779.name: Romantic walk in the park at night
496048779.author: a TripAdvisor user
496048779.reviewBody: This park is built for romance. The boats, the lights, the river itself. The only problem? The music! I don\'t know who picks the music but it was like the most obnoxious pop music in the world, really ruins the mood. They should go with something classic, something gorgeous to match the beauty of the park. All in all though you really should go, the park is huge and there is something for everyone. We rented bikes and took a boat ride. We are going back to see what we missed, there is so much to see.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

495195666.name: Great place for walk around.
495195666.author: a TripAdvisor user
495195666.reviewBody: Nice views. I guess it is a very well-managed park. But there are not many good places to eat.\n\nAnyways, I recommend it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

492065734.name: Outstanding
492065734.author: a TripAdvisor user
492065734.reviewBody: If you are looking for a place to run this is the one. Also, it is connected with "Paseo Santa Lucia", you can catch the boat here. It has a museum and it is near to Arena Monterrey and Cintermex. Inside of the park there is a Holliday Inn.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

488702315.name: Amazing development
488702315.author: a TripAdvisor user

For me it was just okay.  I didn\'t get to see much of the park but there seemed to be a lot to do.  Bikes to rent and a small amusement park for young children.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

485159112.author: a TripAdvisor user

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

476150843.name: Nice park
476150843.author: a TripAdvisor user
476150843.reviewBody: Really nice park to spend some time. There are some interesting modern art to be found also. Some cultural places in and around the park.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

472222681.name: A must see for tourists
472222681.author: a TripAdvisor user
472222681.reviewBody: Great for kids and if you love museums! Educational and fancy! A must see for tourists, especially people wanting to learn more about the culture and history or Monterrey!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

471125873.name: Excellent choice for leisure in Mty
471125873.author: a TripAdvisor user
471125873.reviewBody: Nice park to enjoy with kids and rest too. It also offers bike riding options, museums and restaurants.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

469485826.name: Oasis in Monterrey
469485826.author: a TripAdvisor user
469485826.reviewBody: I stayed at a hotel downtown so walked to Parque Fundidora via the man-made river path(about 45 mins).  There is an option to take a boat (60pesos) from downtown to the park as well...fyi: operator of the boat gives a tour but it is all in Spanish.  The park is free, well-maintained, and a great place just to walk or bike around.  Bike rentals are 30 pesos/hour.  Many playgrounds throughout for kids to play.  Resistance and exercise stations at various points around the park as well.  A couple of cafes and museums are available options too.  Overall, a very nice, clean, safe, low-key, place to enjoy the outdoors. A metro stop just north of the park(10 min walk) also allows easy access.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

468962691.name: Great for walking and picnic
468962691.author: a TripAdvisor user
468962691.reviewBody: Fundidora is one of the few "greener" places in Monterrey. It is a nice park where you can do a lot of stuff and there is often a lot going on. It\'s a great place for kids as well since there are lots of playground all around the park and it is safe. The are lots of museums and places where you can grab food. If you want to be active you can rent bikes, go ice skating, go for a run or use some of the "outdoor" gyms they have around the park.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

468275142.name: Nice park
468275142.author: a TripAdvisor user
468275142.reviewBody: Parque fundidora is a nice park, there are places where you can rent bikes at a very low price. I entered the park at the main door and I had to walk like two miles to get to the park, so I recommend that you enter through the iStay hotel if you don\'t want yo walk all the way to the main park.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

467951735.name: Mrs
467951735.author: a TripAdvisor user
467951735.reviewBody: I really enjoy the ride. This is a very nice place. You can do it riding a bike, walking or take a boat. \nI highly recommend it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

467238593.name: A park for a walk
467238593.author: a TripAdvisor user
467238593.reviewBody: This is a beautiful big park surrounded by former industrial buildings that make the visit very interesting. There is a museum, an ice skating rink, a lake, a restaurant "Horno 3". Its a nice place to have a family day.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

467124192.name: Nice place to walk
467124192.author: a TripAdvisor user
467124192.reviewBody: This is a great place to go for a walk, do some excercise, and also they have museums and a variety of things to do for the whole family. Also there is some playgrounds for kids.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

466253170.name: big park
466253170.author: a TripAdvisor user
466253170.reviewBody: this park is like central park in NY, big, nice and huge..... ah and free entance. beside the cintermex, so if you stay close to that place you can go and make exercise.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

465598550.name: Santa Lucia channel
465598550.author: a TripAdvisor user
465598550.reviewBody: It\'s a very well acomplished artificial channel that connects from Macroplaza or downtown all the way to inside the Fundidora oark, you can apreciate part of the old and new part of downtown city, it is in very good condition and well maintained, if you are visiting with kids is a must, but you want to walk at the Fundidora park worth visiting

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

465252085.name: Nice Park
465252085.author: a TripAdvisor user
465252085.reviewBody: I spent the morning strolling through the park.  There are some museums I didn\'t go into  any so I can\'t speak to them.  But I did go through the dinosaur attraction it had a lot of different types of birds which I really enjoyed.  I tried to rent a bike but didn\'t have any ID on me so was unable to do so, but I would have loved to have just rode a bike around.  Overall nice well keep park.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

463354096.name: Amazing and beautiful
463354096.author: a TripAdvisor user
463354096.reviewBody: Fantastic park to walk around and spend a morning, afternoon, evening. There are constantly people exercising around the park - running, biking, or using the exercise machines around the park. There is a small "lake" and many fountains. This park is full of beautiful remants of when it used to be a foundry. A great place to explore.\n\nThere are activities like a zipline and dinosaur park. Also a bike rentals, but warning, lines can get long.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

460478425.name: Good place to walk and a lot of thinks to do
460478425.author: a TripAdvisor user
460478425.reviewBody: there is museums playgrounds rides and a lot of interesting things to do you can spend 1-2 day there with a lot of fun

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

460013804.name: Peace of calm in Monterrey
460013804.author: a TripAdvisor user
460013804.reviewBody: This place is nice place for walking , run , and just past the time in the city making a break. You have several options inside and it\'s safety place full of people and families

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

459641544.name: Nice food with great desserts
459641544.author: a TripAdvisor user
459641544.reviewBody: The food was nice, a lil\' above the average for the area, but the desserts OMG they were amazing, I would recommend the creme br\u00fbl\u00e9e all the way

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

458467514.name: Place to walk, ride and learn
458467514.author: a TripAdvisor user
458467514.reviewBody: The Parque Fundidora is a great option to go with the family on the weekends; I like to ride our bikes together, and my kids like to eat churros in the park. Consider visiting the exhibits in the Horno3 museum, you learn a lot about the history and culture of Monterrey

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

458333961.name: A great look at the Monterrey industrial past turned into art!
458333961.author: a TripAdvisor user
458333961.reviewBody: A must see when you visit Monterrey, NL, Mexico. On a video production trip to Monterrey We stayed at the Holiday Inn-Monterrey Parque Fundidora. \nLocated right at the edge of the park. The park is the area where the former Monterrey Steel Foundry Company operated from 1900 until 1986. The park has extensive walking tracks, playgrounds, a lake, Ice rink, museums, etc, etc, but the coolest thing is the old steel foundry structures that stand imposing as historical sculptures.\nBring your camera for a feast of abstract photography and fantastic URBEX photography! Monterrey is a prosperous and very large city with many places to visit safely. from the park you can take a fun boat ride  to the Macro Plaza on the Canal de Santa Lucia.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

457991245.name: Didn\'t spend enough time here.
457991245.author: a TripAdvisor user
457991245.reviewBody:
I gotta say, this was a surprisingly good experience that I didn't expect. 

This is an abandoned steel foundry that has been converted to an urban park in a beautiful way. It has greenspace, a canal with a water taxi and more than I had the time to experience.

The individual buildings have been retained and repurposed (in the case of Horno 3) as a museum and interpretive center. Well done!

While our time was so limited I didn't see as much as I wanted to, this is clearly a great achievement.

We arrived via the water taxi from the commercial development just west near the Macromall. It was about a 2 km ride thru various points in the development.  Never made the ride back do to time, but it was great.

This is THE must do place to visit if in Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

457202868.name: Excellent
457202868.author: a TripAdvisor user
457202868.reviewBody: Excellent place to visit alone, with yor family or your friends. No words to say how nice is this place. You can ride your bike, run, or just relax there. It is easy to get there by taxi and you don\'t neee to pay to entry (free).

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

456979768.name: I have been there more than once! <3
456979768.author: a TripAdvisor user
456979768.reviewBody:
It's a very big park but it's got everything you want! I was there for a walk and ended up spending the entire day. You should try to go there by boat, it's a nice experience (and it does not cost that much either) but it's not a must. 

A must is the museum inside Horno 3 (I have a review of that one as well). And the dino park. I loved it there. They also have a lot of concerts and events there so you might find some pretty interesting things to do. 

BTW, don't forget to walk along the "river" towards the city center (Macroplaza). They also have some cool yellow squares that you cna have fun taking pictures with. I did.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

453489874.name: Parque fundidora
453489874.author: a TripAdvisor user
453489874.reviewBody: Great place for a walk and a visit of museums.\nYou can also take a boat and go up to the downtown. The entrance for the Hierro museum is about 100 pesos and the boat ride is 60 pesos.\nNice to do it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

449466090.name: Took the boat to the park
449466090.author: a TripAdvisor user
449466090.reviewBody:
At the beginning of Paseo Santa Lucia which is a very touristy area of Monterrey there is a boat that can be taken along the water, there is a tour guide that tells you all about the history of the place. It's a lot of fun and super affordable. 

The ride is about half an hour and you can get off at the half way point to explore parque la fundidora. It's a beautiful area and very safe. Great for young couples as well if you're on a date 😊 

Gorgeous

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

447603088.name: ...Love the history of it...
447603088.author: a TripAdvisor user
447603088.reviewBody: Beautiful 360\u00b0 view of Monterrey.  The museum & show was eye opening & helped me understand more about the importance of La Fundidora.  Loved it & will visit it every time I\'m back in Monterrey.  You won\'t spend much.  Highly recommend.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

447188405.name: Beautiful, clean public park
447188405.author: a TripAdvisor user
447188405.reviewBody: Great safe place to take the whole family.  You can rent bikes and it only takes you 15 minutes to ride the whole park.  There is a museum of steel that is interactive and modern for the kids.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

447044301.name: Big
447044301.author: a TripAdvisor user
447044301.reviewBody: It is a big park,we enjoyed our time there but I\'m sure that we didn\'t see everything in the park, we need to go early to see everything. I love it, it\'s clean, tidy but I think you need a map and to plan before you go to know what exactly you want to do. You can ride bicycle, visit museams, eat, go around, let the kids be kids if you have any. I didn\'t pay anything before entrance. I think I\'ll give it another planned visit.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

446153262.name: Great mix of industry, culture, landscape and tradition
446153262.author: a TripAdvisor user
446153262.reviewBody: This is the best example to show how does all of these merge in one city, you will find a bunch of funny options for all age people, you can take a long walk, learn about the former steel company, take a boat trip, see some bird show but you can\'t miss the "Horno 3" complex

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

446126653.name: Beautiful strolling park
446126653.author: a TripAdvisor user
446126653.reviewBody: Right at the center of Monterrey City you can find this beautiful park where you can rent a bicycle, bring your skates or simply walk between the trees that grow in the ruins of the long closed forge. Also, the park has a restaurant in the top of one foundry buildings where you can see the city at night, or you can go to the different museums that the park has like the wax and film museums. Fundidora connects directly with Paseo Santa Luc\u00eda a riverwalk that ends in the commercial center of the city "Barrio Antiguo".

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

445599308.name: Beautiful park
445599308.author: a TripAdvisor user
445599308.reviewBody:
Best place to walk and spend some time in an open and green environment. Worth seeing but definitely made for locals. 

There's places to excersice and you will see all ages and lifestyles walking the parks. 

Look up for any events, there's always something going on

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

443301706.name: Best place in Monterrey
443301706.author: a TripAdvisor user
443301706.reviewBody: This is a smaller but funnier version of Central Park, with a little Monterrey twist.... Steel. You can walk through the trees or get lost in the remains of "Fundidora", a steel company that represents the past of our city. Enter the museum or get something to eat. There is even a zip line at the top of the main building. Concerts, festivals, exhibitions, and a bunch of other things.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

442908822.name: Awesome public space - relaxing water ride
442908822.author: a TripAdvisor user
442908822.reviewBody: OK - totally unexpected! This would be my hangout if I lived in Monterrey. Plenty of bike/pedestrian/rollerblading paths lining the man-made waterway. Ferry boats with a guide. Museums and attractions and restaurants at the terminal points.\n\nI\'d go back to Monterrey just to spend a long weekend at this area of town.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

442680399.name: The Best Place in Monterrey to have a Picnik, Walk, Run, Skate or Bike
442680399.author: a TripAdvisor user
442680399.reviewBody:
Fundidoras has an excellent road to bike or run at around 3.5 km, plus you can run or walk on Paseo Santa Lucia all the way to Macroplaza.
Inside the park you can rent a bike for one or more hours and ride on the road at any time before 8 pm. 
Inside the park you can find a water park (Plaza Sesamo), Cineteca, Wax Musseum, Auditorio Banamex and Cintermex,
The best place to park your car is inside the park and you can stay as log as you want for 50 pesos
Dogs are not allowed inside the park

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

440750341.name: Fun Place to Explore!
440750341.author: a TripAdvisor user
440750341.reviewBody:
I don't have children but this would be a great place to let your children run wild. You can bike around, walk around, run around all you want. At the end of the trail is the Steel Museum. If you have kids, I think this is a good museum to go to. It is very hands on and interactive. For adults- you get good views at the top. I recommend going here. This park attaches to the "River Walk" which I also highly recommend. There are a ton of fun water fountains and features throughout.

There is plenty of shade as well.
NOT pet friendly.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

440476409.name: Great park
440476409.author: a TripAdvisor user
440476409.reviewBody: I was surprised and shocked how big it is. We were walking for already 1 hour and we didn\'t even arrived to the middle of it. It is very nice, clean, well maintained, with a lot of interesting sculptures.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

439158472.name: Heart of MTY
439158472.author: a TripAdvisor user
439158472.reviewBody: Without any doubt, this place is the heart of MTY.\nSport, culture, food, relax, events, tourism... there are hundreds of things happening here at same time and for sure something will fit you.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

438968557.name: Delightful
438968557.author: a TripAdvisor user
438968557.reviewBody:
The park is quite big. They have speakers all around the park so they played soothing music. 

You can rent a bike for 30 pesos. 

There are museums around the park.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

438178071.name: You have to visit when in Monterrey
438178071.author: a TripAdvisor user
438178071.reviewBody: I got to the park on the boats you can catch by paseo Santa Lucia, it\'s great to take a walk or rent a bike and ride around the park. It\'s very clean and well trimmed.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

438170661.name: Nice place to ride a bicycle
438170661.author: a TripAdvisor user
438170661.reviewBody: It\'s a medium size park. It\'s good to ride a bicycle. You can borrow it. There\'s an old steel factory you can enter with a fee.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

436473937.name: Perfect Family Spot
436473937.author: a TripAdvisor user
436473937.reviewBody: We love Parque Fundidoria! There\'s so much to do there; from amusement rides and animal exhibits to great spaces to walk and cycle, you really can\'t go wrong! The water features and views of the mountains are beautiful. The old buildings add a cool ambiance and are perfect for taking pics in front of.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

434139049.name: Beautiful place to visit
434139049.author: a TripAdvisor user
434139049.reviewBody: Truly recommend place to visit right next to the expo center and you can do lots of walking or biking along with lots of families. They also have some snack places along the way.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

431937692.name: One of the nicest urban parks in Mexico and the world
431937692.author: a TripAdvisor user
431937692.reviewBody:
Parque Fundidora was quite a discovery for me last year. I had been going to Monterrey on business forever, and had not have the chance to visit the park in all its details.

I fell in love with this place in the Summer of 2015, and have made it my favorite spot in Monterrey ever since. I make every effort to stay at the "Holiday Inn" hotel inside the park whenever it is possible, even when the hotel is starting to look a little shabby...

I paryicularly enjoy running in the mornings or afternoons across its different pathways, including the "Paseo Santa Lucia" which I particularly like.

A complete travel guide could be written about the park, but I will end up my comment with an invitation to visit, and to highlight its absolute master centar piece the #3 furnace "Alto Horno 3", which I drool for, particularly being a Chemical Engineer. The visit to the furnace, it's restaurant, and the museum are really worth while a visit.

Enjoy!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

430140679.name: Love it!
430140679.author: a TripAdvisor user
430140679.reviewBody: You can walk around because its vary safe.  Its clean and you can find any type of restaurants around to a very reasonable prices.  There is souvenir vendors around and so many options to get.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

429849522.name: Good place to run
429849522.author: a TripAdvisor user
429849522.reviewBody: Excellent park to go running in the morning it\'s fairly safe and there are plenty of runners around 630 in the morning.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

429498862.name: Great place to take the kids
429498862.author: a TripAdvisor user
429498862.reviewBody: This is an excellent place to spend your day with kids. It has good tree shaded areas with playgrounds for the kids, the attraction Loroaventura, in which my 14mo and 9mo really enjoyed feeding the Macaws, the Paseo Santa Luc\u00eda. Plus the Horno 3 Steel Museum. Great for kids and adults.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

427753104.name: Haven\'t been? GO!
427753104.author: a TripAdvisor user
427753104.reviewBody:
Absolutely love coming to this park! Rent a bike and enjoy yourself! Not sure what else to add, I mean, who doesn't love parks?

Family friendly! 
Singles friendly! 
Friend friendly (haha) 
Couple friendly! 

Don't miss out.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

423700784.name: Idyllic
423700784.author: a TripAdvisor user
423700784.reviewBody: \nAn idyllic place full of surprises. Excellent choice for your family because it has no cost and is well preserved. The smell of flowers makes you feel incredibly welcome. Green, clean. Amazing

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

422892250.name: Best place for runners
422892250.author: a TripAdvisor user
422892250.reviewBody: Nothing beat the view of mountains and the old fundidora. I was there for a three-day exhibition and I ran this park everyday.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

419570761.name: Clean, awesome, nostalgic
419570761.author: a TripAdvisor user
419570761.reviewBody: Parque Fundidora is a living example of a fusion between past and present. An old smelter transformed into a beautiful park and several museums. \nI was skeptical at first if it was worth to visit but I was wrong. The park and museums are living up to the highest expectations. The guided tours and shows in Horno 3 are very creative and unique. And of course the park is well maintained.\nIt is something worth to do in Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

419287550.name: Have to do the boat ride!
419287550.author: a TripAdvisor user
419287550.reviewBody: The park is great there is a lot to do there but the boat ride is must. You can take the boat to visit the restaurants by the water or the factory they make sweets.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

419286320.name: One of the places to visit in monterrey
419286320.author: a TripAdvisor user
419286320.reviewBody:
Fundidora is a abandoned steel factory now turned into a park over a wide spread area. Atheletes,marathoners,joggers will love this place. You have few things to see here

.Steel factory tour 
.Wax museum
.Theatre showing cultural and art films
.Some ducks and pigeons :)

Park is picturistique and you get lot of scope to take pictures.

Dont go on a sunny afternoon but visit during evening hours for relaxed experience.

Easily accessible and no entrance charge.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

418098866.name: A beautiful transformation from refinery to a multi purpose shopping, museum, park and MUCH more.
418098866.author: a TripAdvisor user
418098866.reviewBody: This is the way old refineries should be transformed into modern areas with shops, museums, restaurants and expo areas.\nThey kept the refinery as a structure that adds personality to a park that has lots of things to offer ranging from restaurant, museum, park with artificial lake and much, much more.\nGreat place to take the kids on a nice weekend stoll.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

417499200.name: Awsome place
417499200.author: a TripAdvisor user
417499200.reviewBody: Its a great park where you can rent a bike or carry yours and have fun riding over the trail or skate , there is a little lake manmade where you can rent a little boat with pedals to have fun, also there are tables for habe dinner under the tree shades there is a ice skate where they rent you the special shoes for skate for a low price around the 150 pesos or 7 dlls for 2 hrs  sometimes are music events in the area named banamex auditoreum, you can also access to the paseo andalucia where there is a river manmade with boats with a tourist guide who explain you trough the ride interesting things of the construction of the chanel and of history of the city.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

417282002.name: Another Great Park in Monterey
417282002.author: a TripAdvisor user
417282002.reviewBody: Great place to take the kids and family to hang out for half a day. Very nice place with historical areas to walk around and get to learn about. Very informative place in regards to Monterey. I would recommend a visit here for the family.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

416195342.name: Beauty in a Park
416195342.author: a TripAdvisor user
416195342.reviewBody: Lots of things to see and do in the park for everyone.  Beautiful and well kept park.  Definitely worth going for a walk alone, with friends or with family.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

408174384.name: Great location to visit
408174384.author: a TripAdvisor user
408174384.reviewBody: This place is a museum, park, nature walk, bike trail all rolled into one. It is definitely worth the effort to stop and check it out.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

403573111.name: Huge Park for family outings
403573111.author: a TripAdvisor user
403573111.reviewBody: The kids love to go there because they have a small lake to feed ducks. They have a few libraries that are very friendly and informative. You can easily spend 4 to 5 hours there.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

400632819.name: Great view of the park, city and surrounding mountains.
400632819.author: a TripAdvisor user
400632819.reviewBody:
Great park that has a museum iron works complex. Place is neat and the view from the top of the complex is great. The sheer size of it is epic.
I particularly recommend to visit it at sunset. You can take great pics in the golden hour and then at night when the structure is illuminated fantastically. You can almost hear it at work...
Price is just MXN 40, about USD 2....
Overall an excellent place to visit.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

400456778.name: This is a must see in Monterrey
400456778.author: a TripAdvisor user
400456778.reviewBody: If you are visiting Monterrey, you must visit the Parque Fundidora.  The park is an old industrial site transformed into a safe and beautiful park.  In addition to the many options for exercising, there are also museums and a restaurant with a great view in the old foundry building. Very unique and interesting!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

399397291.name: Get to now the origins of Monterrey
399397291.author: a TripAdvisor user
399397291.reviewBody: A must if you visit Monterrey. You can get to now some of the citys origins and have a nice walk through all the gardens and museums. Nice choice to go with family and friends and you can have a picnic there. If you go to the Horno 3, avoid the restaurant. It has good food but nothing special and quite expensive. But if your budget allouds it, well, go for it haha the views from the reataurant are just great. Be prepared for the heat and get some comfortable shoes. Don\'t forget tour camera!!!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

399368727.name: Very clean place
399368727.author: a TripAdvisor user
399368727.reviewBody: Very clean, well kept public park. There are lot a of activities going on in this area and all the people are very friendly.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

398032199.name: Nice you have walk a lot in the sun
398032199.author: a TripAdvisor user
398032199.reviewBody: It\u00b4s better to go on autumn, because of the weather. The attractions are mainly for children, there are only one or two interesting museums for adults\n

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

397063949.name: A must in your trip to Monterrey
397063949.author: a TripAdvisor user
397063949.reviewBody: If you like to walk , ride a bike , watch industrial landmarks , spend some time at museusm , watching a play or a movie. This is the place to visit . Has a 3 km not abandoned racetrack that surrounds  the old steel mill . At a walking distance you will find the Santa Lucia river that will lead you to the downtwon area. Be aware it is NOT PET FRIENDLY . Free access (except for the parking lot )

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

396962080.name: A highlight of Monterrey
396962080.author: a TripAdvisor user
396962080.reviewBody: Excellent park that has been wonderfully reconstructed. Don\'t miss out on the opportunity to cycle (renting a bike is really cheap) and enjoy the sunset!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

393382394.name: Something for everyone
393382394.author: a TripAdvisor user
393382394.reviewBody: Great for picnics, riding bike or skating, photographing, walking. There are lots of beautiful playgrounds for the kids. Be sure to check the event calendar, there is always something going on, independent films screening, musical performances, dance performances, plays, children\'s storytime, etc...

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

391522983.name: Biggest Park in Town
391522983.author: a TripAdvisor user
391522983.reviewBody: This is the biggest  Park in Monterrey.  Great sideealks for joggers,  runners,  cyclers. It\'s always crowded on weekends.  There any any options to eat.  Attached to this park is the Paseo Santa Lucia that is a must if you\'re there. Go and know it!!!!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

391191544.name: "Great Park"
391191544.author: a TripAdvisor user
391191544.reviewBody: It\u00b4s a great park to excersise, bike, run, walk or roller skate.  Nice gardens to make pic nics and lot\u00b4s of thing to do inside.  Musems, Loroventura, Arena, etc.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

390873517.name: Nice Park for Picknic and much more
390873517.author: a TripAdvisor user
390873517.reviewBody: Is a real nice park that contains history, art, fun places, picnic area, entretaiment, date, etc, many things you can do,,  if just want to know it, you can invest all day or just 3, for hours to walk all over, and be ready to walk and walk or rent a bicycle.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

387886587.name: Family
387886587.author: a TripAdvisor user
387886587.reviewBody: Really cool how they converted this steel mill into a park. They have multiple things to do in this park. I believe they even have zip lines.. There is a nice restaurant on the top of the old steel mill.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

386230146.name: Nice place
386230146.author: a TripAdvisor user
386230146.reviewBody: Interesting place to visit, but also they have a lot of events there, and they are good events you can go to. check beforehand on internet pages, that will give you an idea of what events will be held there.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

385953705.name: Who\'d of thought that a steel mill could be a playground?
385953705.author: a TripAdvisor user
385953705.reviewBody: I have been to Monterrey 3 times in the past year for business, this time I had a chance to stop here and visit the park. This place has been "repurposed" for lack of a better word, it was a former steel mill in the city of Monterrey and could very well have become more of an eyesore than the place of beauty that is home to museums, concert venues playgrounds and so much more. It is in fact a free place to visit, the cost is in parking and some of the attractions the park offers such as the area housing birds and animatronic dinosaurs. I would recommend sunscreen and water for a day in the very strong sun.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

385325438.name: Don\'t miss it
385325438.author: a TripAdvisor user
385325438.reviewBody: This is a converted steel foundry, which may not sound like much, but they have done a terrific job in converting this into a wonderful park. There are many things to do here, it is extremely clean. In the park itself there is a museum about the foundry. This is a major visit sight for school trips. There are wonderful photo opportunities here as well, a kind of par course. This would be wonderful place for an early morning run. There is no charge for the park but there is one for the museum. Parking does have a charge but it is very modest. In addition there is a restaurant that is reputed to be good, unfortunately we did not have a chance to try it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

385056743.name: Great for an early run
385056743.author: a TripAdvisor user
385056743.reviewBody: This is a great place to go early mornings for a run. Huge park that is kept very clean. Your can take the Paseo Santa Lucia ride from here.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

384760991.name: Very large park
384760991.author: a TripAdvisor user
384760991.reviewBody: Plan to spend the day. There are boat rides to the town square. You can rent bikes to ride. Many scenic places around the park. You can get lost there easily. Take a picnic and plan to relax and spend plenty of time there

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

383425309.name: place for Walking, Cycling
383425309.author: a TripAdvisor user
383425309.reviewBody: A nice place with tree shades in summar, open ground to be enjoyed in the winter. bi-cycle tracks for enjoying hte ride. you can rent a cycle for 30 pesos 1 hour. kids park available. nice place to send couple of hours.\nThis place organize shows as well.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

380881366.name: A fairly new development right by the Mexican museum.
380881366.author: a TripAdvisor user
380881366.reviewBody: A lovely evening walk by the water with plenty to see. Has lovely views of the mountains, restaurants and water and art features along the way.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

376598104.name: A different kind of attraction.
376598104.author: a TripAdvisor user
376598104.reviewBody: A fun place to visit. Our large wedding party group took the boat ride from the Museum/ Historical Society near the Presidential Palacio to the Parque de Fundidora. What a pleasant surprise to have such a nice and scenic open area available to roam through. I would suggest stopping in the main foundry for a bite to eat or a refreshing drink. There is a nice view of the nearby main peak of the Sierra Madre range which overlooks the city. Everyone found the time spent there to be quite relaxing. I would recommend it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

376261439.name: Worth seeing
376261439.author: a TripAdvisor user
376261439.reviewBody: It\'s great to see such a creative use of old industry blight! It feels historic, magical and beautiful. A must see when visiting Monterrey!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

374257479.name: A MUST in Monterrey
374257479.author: a TripAdvisor user
374257479.reviewBody: With museums, attractions, restaurants, stadiums, auditoriums, race track, etc., Fundidora has it all. You can pretty much find anything for anyone. Usually full of athletes at sunrise and into the early part of the day, it is a great place to train on your road bike or go for a jog. As the day progresses, local and foreign tourist start to appear in the museums, convention center, aviary or just to spend a nice couple hours walking inside the park. As the sun sets, the luxurious restaurant stands out with its great illumination, and if luck, so will the multiple concert venues inside the park. It is a must  when visiting Monterrey.\n\nCon museos, parques, juegos, restaurantes, estadios, auditorios y la pista, fundidora lo tiene todo para todos. Desde intensos entrenamientos a las 6 am de bici de ruta, hasta una cena formal en el Horno 3, en fundidora encuentras lo que necesitas. Le da vida a la ciudad fomentando la actividad cultural y deportiva que tanto carecemos como pa\u00eds.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

373396767.name: Amaizing place to rest, get fun riding bike, make exercise, enjoy nature, parks and the exciting ride a boat
373396767.author: a TripAdvisor user
373396767.reviewBody: You can live an amazing experience with your family in Parque Fundidora:  riding a bike, riding skates, flying a kite, making exercises with free equiment, riding a pedal boats, riding a big boat through the Santa Lucia Artificial River, you can enjoy the nature like ducks, lakes, you can go to thePlaza Sesamo Amusement Park and The Casa de los Loros where you can see many kinds of parrots, feed them and enjoy the tirolesa.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

372855828.name: Great environment
372855828.author: a TripAdvisor user
372855828.reviewBody: It is a really nice place to go for a visit, and even to go running or cycling. Pretty clean and very familiar,  I strongly recommend it as a place to visit in Monterrey

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

370995824.name: Beautiful and fun park
370995824.author: a TripAdvisor user
370995824.reviewBody: Developed on the grounds of a former steel mill this extensive park is great for all ages as you can walk, run , bike, skate around this superbly well kept and clean park that includes several museums and is adjacent to a very fun Sesame St-themed waterpark. Truly fun for those that enjoy the outdoor life, culture and even fine dining. Enjoy!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

370796998.name: Awesome Park!!
370796998.author: a TripAdvisor user
370796998.reviewBody: This park is one of the best in the city, it has so much going on and very clean. Surprising for Mexico parks, however, it seem they really invest time in the maintenance and care of all the green areas. It has a multi-purpose center that has something for everyone, literally everyone. While there they had a car show, antique show, arts and craft show, and vacation show. Really recommended to everyone.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

369833317.name: Awesome place!
369833317.author: a TripAdvisor user
369833317.reviewBody: Beautiful clean park with everything for a family or a single person to spend the day! Food, museums, rides, bike rentals and trails !

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

368480447.name: Its a great place to enjoy with the family,
368480447.author: a TripAdvisor user
368480447.reviewBody: While in Monterrey, you have to go Parque Fundidora and Paseo Santa Lucia, a nice place to enjoy the family or friends.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

365707410.name: Fundidora
365707410.author: a TripAdvisor user
365707410.reviewBody: This is one of the places you must go when you visit Monterrey, I think it\u00b4s the best mexican park, there\u00b4s a ice skate place, bike rental, varius entertainment.\n\nYou\u00b4d love this place.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

364405057.name: It\u00b4s a place for a walk or ride in bicycle
364405057.author: a TripAdvisor user
364405057.reviewBody: Yo can get there walking from the big plaza in the downtown or by boat through the santa lucia artificial river, you can walk if you want and is better to visit at night,

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

362419318.name: Love this place
362419318.author: a TripAdvisor user
362419318.reviewBody: Awesome place to visit! I wish we had the time to walk it everyday or exercise around. Great outdoors, many museums, lakes and playground. Definitely a great sight seeing spot in the city.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

361906627.name: Best Mexican park I\'ve ever been to..so far \ud83d\udc4d\ud83c\udffc
361906627.author: a TripAdvisor user
361906627.reviewBody:
This park was amazing. I did the mini zip line and took a boat ride to the end of the park. It's just beautiful. Prices for the boat ride and zip line were inexpensive. I wish I could have gotten on the cart that takes you to the top of the Horno3. We arrived late. I also liked that it had bikes to rent just in case you wanted to tour without walking. 

The only thing I really didn't enjoy was the boat service. They only had 3 boats to move people around and to get back, there was a long line. They had more than 7 other boats unavailable because "staff was short." People were getting really upset and yelling and protesting at the ticket man because they really wanted to get back to the other side of the park. The staff didn't do anything about it. We waited more than an hour and a half to get a boat ride back to where it started (the ticket includes a ride to the end of the park and back as long as it was before 8:30 pm, which we arrived an hour ahead of time).

Overall, great experience. To let some frustration out, we walked to the top part of the park and bought churros rellenos. We were extremely satisfied.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

360344087.name: what a park!
360344087.author: a TripAdvisor user
360344087.reviewBody: When you visit Monterrey, you must visit the Parque Fundidora; majestic views, you can walk or ride a bike, enjoying the green areas...

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

358438728.name: Amazing place to visit in the City
358438728.author: a TripAdvisor user
358438728.reviewBody: Just a great place to visit when you\'re in town. You can ride bikes, have a picnic, go out for a jog, or just stay outdoors and take pictures.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

358180370.name: A great park
358180370.author: a TripAdvisor user
358180370.reviewBody: This is truly a great park. Beautiful with lots of biking and walking trails, clean, safe and open late. It is also connected via a canal to the center of the city. It is located on the site of a former foundry with interesting exhibits and a great restaurant to boot.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

357955208.name: nice spot when in Monterrey
357955208.author: a TripAdvisor user
357955208.reviewBody: We spend some time walking around this place, is really good for family, different options to attend and nice attractions inside the park

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

357916911.name: Bikes, snacks and trees.
357916911.author: a TripAdvisor user
357916911.reviewBody: If this is your first time in Monterrey, this park is a must. Clean, big enough and with many activities available. Be sure to go early in the morning as heat in Monterrey can be pretty strong. Many of Monterrey biggest music festivals take place here. You can rent bikes to use inside the park; it\'ll take you about 15 minutes to complete a circuit around the park. The old foundry furnace stands as a small museum and you can climb to the top for the view or take the small zip line circuit. As a plus, it is connected to the Santa Luc\u00eda River walk and has a pier if you wish to take the boat tour.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

357069474.name: Definitely worth seeing
357069474.author: a TripAdvisor user
357069474.reviewBody: A nice diversion before or after a trade show at the Cintermex. Good restaurants, safe and unusual photo opportunities

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

356814128.name: Interesting oasis in the big city
356814128.author: a TripAdvisor user
356814128.reviewBody: Nice repurposing of a huge old foundry/steelworks into a big urban park complete with river, tons of biking. Good restaurant in the old steel mill called Furnace 3 but it\'s closed mondays!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

356375254.name: perfect for family and fun!
356375254.author: a TripAdvisor user
356375254.reviewBody: it\'s a very nice park, pretty big for exercise, running, jogging. if you want some time with friends, or better spend some time with family around nature, they are a lot of activities you can do!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

356085610.name: Nice place to visit
356085610.author: a TripAdvisor user
356085610.reviewBody: its a nice place to visit, you can take a ride on bike, there are bikes for rental, eat an ice cream, walk below the tres, visit "Horno3" the Steel foundry Factory this is a representative palce of monterrey

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

356039109.name: Nice family or friends time
356039109.author: a TripAdvisor user
356039109.reviewBody: many options, many activities or just chilling is great here! Go and have a nice outside! \nDuring the mornings is great to go for a run

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

352200323.name: Visited!!!!!!.........
352200323.author: a TripAdvisor user
352200323.reviewBody: When some relatives or parents come to Nuevo Leon is very important that they know the Parque Fundidora, they have museums, restaurants, you can walk, you can ride in bicycle, etc. This place is wonderful. I love it!.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

347933288.name: Excellent place for all to spend one full day
347933288.author: a TripAdvisor user
347933288.reviewBody: I had visited this parque in Oct\'15 with couple of my friends. The boat ride was very exciting and interesting. The wax museum was also very good, though it was costly. The other parts of the museum are also worth spending an entire day with family/friends.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

346336084.name: Beautiful
346336084.author: a TripAdvisor user
346336084.reviewBody: Amazing to walk or ride a bike around, they offer different actives for all family members. There are plenty of seats just to relax and read a good book

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

346022922.name: From dump to wow
346022922.author: a TripAdvisor user
346022922.reviewBody: Amazed every time I go there, who would have tought the creation made for the spaces, designs, engineering, landscape and  arquitecture all for us to have something and to be proud of it!!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

346004548.name: Good place for a walk
346004548.author: a TripAdvisor user
346004548.reviewBody: Great place to walk, to run if you like it, to sightsee. It has an ice skating place, restaurant and museums

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

344160166.name: A haven of nature and culture
344160166.author: a TripAdvisor user
344160166.reviewBody: Parque Fundidora is a large, well-maintained park with many attractions: green areas; paved paths of various sizes for walking, running and biking; and former industrial buildings and other facilities now destined for cultural and recreational activities. There\'s too much to describe in a brief review, but you can find more info on their website. I go there regularly to give origami workshops in the Center of the Arts, but I also visit with friends and visitors in order to go for a long walk or eat at "El Lingote" (a restaurant on the premises), catch a film at the Cineteca (a space mostly dedicated to art cinema), and/or go on Paseo Santa Lucia, which is a canal connecting this huge recreational area to the museums and the Macroplaza in the center of the city. The park is worth visiting on its own, but it\'s also great to make an afternoon or day of it by visiting the Macroplaza and the museums and then taking a boat down the canal to stroll through Parque Fundidora and visit any of its many attractions.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

341522080.name: Amazing
341522080.author: a TripAdvisor user
341522080.reviewBody: Loved coming here was almost my favorite part of my trip. so many people on a Sunday (day & night) theres a glass bridge towards the end of the park. so cool. so many neat things to do, and see here.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

341046226.name: If you visit Monterrey, you have to visit this
341046226.author: a TripAdvisor user
341046226.reviewBody: Monterrey became famous for the industries, one of them was Fundidora, an iron factory that closed last century and became a big park, with auditoriums, hotels, museums and even one arena.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

340459578.name: Great park to explore, especially if you\'re a runner.
340459578.author: a TripAdvisor user
340459578.reviewBody: I drove to this city park for the sole purpose of running in the morning - I\'m happy I did.  There is about a 2KM loop that you can bike or run that was quite popular, even at 7AM.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

339292662.name: Great place to have a walk and enjoy the view of the city and mountains.
339292662.author: a TripAdvisor user
