339292662.reviewBody: We came to the park on a tour bus and were amazed with its size and varieties of areas for different agesand interests.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

332306305.name: The pride and jewel of Monterrey
332306305.author: a TripAdvisor user
332306305.reviewBody:
The former glory of Aceros Monterrey, a steel plant, has been converted to a great public place, a green lung for the grey chaotic City that is Monterrey.
For a few hours, you can even forget about the urbanistic mess that the City has turned out to be.
Fundidora Park has converted the great steel Ore Oven into a museum. It is a great destination for children, and schools, to learn about the past of this industry in the region.
They offer a few tours, given by the young interns working there.
You can accend to the top of the stack, by the elevator that takes you about 70 meters up in the air. Great views to the park, and portions of the City.

Worth the time to visit with family and children.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

331660581.name: Great place
331660581.author: a TripAdvisor user
331660581.reviewBody: Best place on Monterrey, clean, fun & safe! You can\'t skip this beautiful park! Great city, can\'t wait to go back next year!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

330880183.name: Great park for couples and families!!!
330880183.author: a TripAdvisor user
330880183.reviewBody: Awesome park!  It\'s a beautiful park!  A must place to visit while in Monterrey!  Lots of shades. You may rent a bicycle and snacks may can be bought. Very nice!!!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

329984786.name: Excellente
329984786.author: a TripAdvisor user
329984786.reviewBody: A beautiful park in the heart of Monterrey city.. with a lot of fun.. for everybody.. a must visit for anybody visiting Monterrey..

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

329769005.name: Culture, sport and entertainment. All in one place.
329769005.author: a TripAdvisor user
329769005.reviewBody: Fundidora Park is an area full of diversity, from going to the cineteca to watch a good movie, or work out in the morning or afternoon. Located in the center of the city is the largest park in Monterrey. You can also enjoy musical entertainment in the Arena Monterrey and Auditorio Banamex.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

328483563.name: Quite large park with few attactions
328483563.author: a TripAdvisor user
328483563.reviewBody: It\'s nice to be able to go to such a park in the middle of the city, but besides the attracions of Horno3 the park has little else to offer - some nice information on the city or the flora would have been good

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

327241270.name: Beautiful
327241270.author: a TripAdvisor user
327241270.reviewBody: A beautiful, well-maintained park in Monterrey.  Excellent for a run, walk or bike ride.  I was in Monterrey for a week and went there almost everyday for some exercise and relaxation. Highly recommend it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

326106834.name: All great
326106834.author: a TripAdvisor user
326106834.reviewBody: All great for visiting with family, friends or even alone. So much to do. Walk, ride, go the Santa Lucia water channel, visit the Steel Museum (Museo de Acero), go to concerts at the Banamex auditorium or the big Arena Monterrey... All around a great place to visit

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

325560953.name: Amazing Re-Purposing
325560953.author: a TripAdvisor user
325560953.reviewBody: This park was an old steel foundry/blast furnace site that was converted into a park. It is a great place to stroll and find out about what was once there. Instead of scrapping the old plant and steel it was creatively re- purposed into walls, sculptures and a museum.  \nShade, benches and fountains make it a pleasant place to spend a few hours.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

323100007.name: A great place to exercise, walk around and enjoy the scenery.
323100007.author: a TripAdvisor user
323100007.reviewBody: I always enjoy my visits to Mexico mainly because this park is so amazing. It\'s huge with many things to do from the Wax museum to the iron coal tower. There are always people out having a good time all year around. There are many play areas for kids and bike rentals situated within the park. I\'d recommend spending the day here exploring everything this park has to offer.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

321448453.name: Great place to breathe in Monterrey
321448453.author: a TripAdvisor user
321448453.reviewBody: Parque Fundidora is a great park in the middle of this huge city of Monterrey where you can run, walk, ride a bike, it has great green lawn areas, lake, you can go from Fundidora up to downtown passing by Paseo de Santa Lucia, where you can find singers, musicians...\nIt has an air of New York Central Park, but smaller\nIdeal for family, couple, children...

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

320250002.name: Huge park, with lots of things to do
320250002.author: a TripAdvisor user
320250002.reviewBody: This park is great. Huge with lots of different attractions. There is a cinema, ferris wheel, playgrounds, lake, etc. It has a lot of grassy areas, and paved routes. Maybe not the best place if you\'re looking for shady trees though. But it\'s a nice place to visit.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

320065107.name: Excelent
320065107.author: a TripAdvisor user
320065107.reviewBody: It was an industrial place in the 70s and now is a great sports development, leisure, has 3 local for shows where there have been high-class artists from pop to rock\n\nRecommended

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

319708226.name: great outdoors
319708226.author: a TripAdvisor user
319708226.reviewBody: if ure looking for a place to run, bike, skateboard or rollerskates... this is the best place to go. can be crowded during weekends but its cool to do some exercise around here. there are also snack stalls u can go in case and some museums to check in between. i come here almost once or twice a month... :) also they got huge parking space so dnt worry if u come in large groups. sometimes they hold 5k run here due to awesome space they have.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

315398058.name: Great Park
315398058.author: a TripAdvisor user
315398058.reviewBody: It\'s quite good it has a lot of attractions inside it although you will need money for most of them you will have a lot to do there

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

314073554.name: Tourist resort
314073554.author: a TripAdvisor user
314073554.reviewBody: Best place to visit that is actually on the metropolitan area in Monterrey. It offers very nice places to get a picture for tourists and comprises a lot of different entertainment places, and it is also great for locals to have a stroll around, ride bike, run, jog or just walk for relaxing.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

312228533.name: Love my hometown
312228533.author: a TripAdvisor user
312228533.reviewBody: Since I left my city many years ago, I\'ve been at Fundidora park just a few time. We visited the park 1 month ago with my parents and my kid, He enjoyed the park, the zip line and the playground,!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

312058498.name: What change can accomplish
312058498.author: a TripAdvisor user
312058498.reviewBody: The old industrial Park has been changed into a park for cultural events, expositions, museum and some restaurants. It is a lovely place where you are free to roam and enter different expositions being exposed by mainly local people. They have changed an old factory into a beautiful park

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

310739957.name: Nice place to see
310739957.author: a TripAdvisor user
310739957.reviewBody:
If you have time to wander and like parks, go this this one. Set on the grounds of old industrial land (former steelworks converted to recreational and cultural centre), this is a unique way to showcase what is essentially and industrial city. Well thought out.

I was there on a Thursday so not a lot of people. I suspect the weekends are really bustling which would make it either more fun or less, depending on whether you like crowds.

It was fun to get there via the Paseo de Santa Lucia (boat trip on artificial river).

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

309805713.name: Great exposition in Parque Fundidora, Minterrey Mexico
309805713.author: a TripAdvisor user
309805713.reviewBody:
We had just few hours free during our business visit on Monterrey and strolled in the park which was an old foundry whixh was converted to recreation and cultural place.
We appreciate the successful project which include now a theater, museums, bookstore and wide tracks for bycicle riding, jogging or calm walks.
We saw interesting exhibition of documentry pohotogras, another on the life and inventions of Nikolay Tesla, A concert of camera music with great performers from Germany and enjoyed a good dinner on a restaurant which was built on one of the higgest foundry installations.
It was exciting and completely surprising.
Our appreciation to the people who made this remarkable conversion project.
Amos N , Israel.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

305837270.name: Amazing park, I love it
305837270.author: a TripAdvisor user
305837270.reviewBody: This is a very big park for walking around, jogging, ride a bicycle, go to a museum, attend a concert, etc, with your family, couple or by yourself.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

305810848.name: Worth a visit
305810848.author: a TripAdvisor user
305810848.reviewBody: Really nice park on the site of the old steelworks in Monterrey. Has kept some relics from its industrial past and made it a real recreational highlight for families, walkers/runners, cyclists etc.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

305541965.name: Nice place for an evening walk
305541965.author: a TripAdvisor user
305541965.reviewBody: A park with a nice view of the city mountains and the old foundry. An ideal place for walking, jogging or riding a bike, specially during the evening when the heat is gone

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

302988823.name: Lovely Park!!
302988823.author: a TripAdvisor user
302988823.reviewBody: I have gone once a year for the last 3 years, with my last visit being a few days ago.  It is definitely getting better and better.  Lovely place, the Ferris wheel was cool, the atmosphere was relaxing and I see more buildings being turned into stores, exhibits or other types of businesses. Love that you can catch Paseo Santa Lucia on the premises and stays opened until 10 p.m.  My 3 year old loved walking around and playing in the playgrounds.  Everyone should at least stop by to check it out.  I promise, it\'s a cool place to just chill or exercise.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

298967894.name: Lot of things to do.
298967894.author: a TripAdvisor user
298967894.reviewBody: Huge park, lots of things to do. Bring sunscreen as most walking area is not shaded. When we visited, the carnival was in town, which was great fun!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

297946484.name: good place to visit for a sunday morning...
297946484.author: a TripAdvisor user
297946484.reviewBody: you can visit there and enjoy biking, skating, running and walking, you have different museum there...

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

295294743.name: A very nice walk
295294743.author: a TripAdvisor user
295294743.reviewBody: This open space is located near downtown in Monterrey, is a very nice walk connected to other attractions like Paseo Santa Lucia and three of our main museums. just wear sunblock and a hat, have plenty of water and you are done!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

294431260.name: Lots to see and do.  Boat trip super fun.
294431260.author: a TripAdvisor user
294431260.reviewBody: Lots of variety, plenty of rest and snack stops (good thing given the heat.)  Main smelter is fascinating and there are besides, rides, museums, and parks.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

290844708.name: Great place for family visits
290844708.author: a TripAdvisor user
290844708.reviewBody: This historic park has many great activities for the family in which fun is guaranteed. I recommend renting a bicycle (or bringing your own) and riding through the park. There also are zip lines and an small zoo in which a great time is guaranteed.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

289384313.name: Nice Green Space in the City Center
289384313.author: a TripAdvisor user
289384313.reviewBody: The park with is completely manufactured right down to the river and streams running through it, but if is meticulously clean, quiet and relaxing. It could use a few more shaded areas as most of the open space is just that: open - under the hot Monterrey sun. Worth going to but wear a hat :)

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

288353334.name: Nice park to walk around and have some coffee too!
288353334.author: a TripAdvisor user
288353334.reviewBody: The park is converted from an old iron smelter. They kept the basic foundation and parts of the original smelter, and utilize it as a  large art piece, as well sa housing cafes and other sites. There is a lot to do here, and  a water park also.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

287354993.name: Walk, bike, run, watch, relax, drink, more
287354993.author: a TripAdvisor user
287354993.reviewBody:
It's an awesome urban getaway within the city. Many locals visit this park. It gets lot of people during the weekends. The park is quite big, so one can still find a place to relax.

I went here on one afternoon. It was hot and humid. So took shelter in one restaurant with a nice view. Fun place to watch locals with families. There were many girls out getting their pictures on the occasion of quincinera. 
There are trails for walking, biking and roller skating. It's absolutely a family getaway place.

The best time to go is in the morning and in the evening in th ed summer time as it  gets hot in thed afternoon. I walked in the park. It'd green and it industrial due the old factory remains that's still sitting there. The view of heavy metals and industrial look amongst the green trees adds quite a contrast to the scenery.

This is nice place to relax after much sightseeing in the city.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

286906295.name: Great weekend
286906295.author: a TripAdvisor user
286906295.reviewBody: Very big, and perfect place to have a saturday or sunday. you can walk or you can rent a bike to enjoy all the park, it has inside a ice skating place, plus many threes, benchs to make a picnic, and Horno 3. you can stay there the whole day, or at least great part of it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

285038887.name: Must see
285038887.author: a TripAdvisor user
285038887.reviewBody: Definitely the most emblematic park in Monterrey. Make it your first stop when you visit. Plan your day properly too because it has so many activities like motorboat rides, bicycles rent and, a museum. Beautiful to visit and it can also be a very romatic place to visit with your partner.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

284868110.name: I was pleasantly surprised.
284868110.author: a TripAdvisor user
284868110.reviewBody: I really enjoyed visiting the Parque Fundidora. We took a boat from the Museum of Mexican History to the Parque Fundidora, it was 60 pesos, similar to the riverwalk in San Antonio, it drops you off in the middle of the park. I really liked hearing about the history. I\'d say wear your workout clothes if you plan to visit in the daytime as it\'s pretty warm and you\'ll work up a sweat walking around.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

284543049.name: Beautiful modern park
284543049.author: a TripAdvisor user
284543049.reviewBody: The best way to see this place is by taking a boat. The place is amazing and has a lots of museums along the way.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

284536665.name: Best park in town
284536665.author: a TripAdvisor user
284536665.reviewBody: A great place to be on weekends with your friends, family and your couple.\nMost things to do as bike, skate, run, etc.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

284400934.name: Fundidora Park Fun!
284400934.author: a TripAdvisor user
284400934.reviewBody:
I went on July 2014 to Monterrey and took a trip to the Fundidora Park.

We took a taxi, they are very cheap, just be careful. A group of us went there and had to divide onto 4 taxis. 3 of us arrived fairly quicky and paid the same amount but the 4th group got there about 10 mins late and were charged higher because they were taken through a longer route.

Inside the park you will be fascinated! It is very well taken care of, green, clean, and very big! I We were there almost all day and still did not finish walking it all.

There is a small gym area you can go workout in. There are people performing on certain areas of the park.
There is a wax museum inside the park that has many tour hours and they are a couple bucks per person.

There are many places you can eat that go from stands to very fancy restaurants.
Also there are many attractions, I personally liked the Ferris wheel, which has a package for one hour and a bottle of wine if you want to fancy-up your stay.

There is also a boat tour that takes you along the parks river. It is very nice and fun specially with friends. The tour is about 40 mins long as I recall. You can either take the ride back or get off at the end of the route and walk out of the park.

If you decide to leave you can get to a central plaza.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

284218636.name: Great park to have a busy day!
284218636.author: a TripAdvisor user
284218636.reviewBody: Fundidora is an icon in Monterrey. It use to be an iron industry until it closed. The city decided to build a park in the place with a great success. It is big and with a lot of space for running, bicycle ride and even yoga. They have also an ice rink and an artificial lake where you can practice sport fishing and many others activities. It is a beautiful place and if you are in Monterrey Parque fundidora is a must in your list of places to visit!!!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

283145613.name: Nice park in Monterrey
283145613.author: a TripAdvisor user
283145613.reviewBody: It was a lovely park as you got exhibitions to see, museums to explore, bikes to ride etc. The park occasionally hold events which would add extra fun

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

281208998.name: Awesome
281208998.author: a TripAdvisor user
281208998.reviewBody: You just cant\u00b4t leave the city without visiting this place which offers a lot of interesting things to do, at every time you will find fun maybe in bikes, feeding duck or skating on ice and also offers, from different points, a whole panoramic view of the city... its fantastic!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

281040027.name: Former Industry
281040027.author: a TripAdvisor user
281040027.reviewBody: It\'s a MUST when you try to understand the nature and basis of Monterrey\'s development. Before the problems presented with the syndicate, this place contributed mainly to the iron industry. Currently, some machines are kept around the grass and there\'s even an oven. You can have dinner in the top of this former oven and get a very interesting view of the city!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

281010437.name: Family Reunion Score
281010437.author: a TripAdvisor user
281010437.reviewBody: Fundidora was amazing!  You get to step into and see a glimpse of where Monterrey started within the industrial era and how they became a benchmark within Mexico.  There is a huge Ferris wheel and a Rail Car that you can take pictures on.  The mining plant that of course is now shut down as well as feed the ducks, etc., etc., etc.!  Great place especially in the evening time when it isn\'t as hot!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

278399300.name: Lovely park
278399300.author: a TripAdvisor user
278399300.reviewBody: its a great place to go see when you go visit Monterrey. its full with history and beauty! love this massive park great work or art and what is left of the fundidora..

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

277850986.name: Beautiful!!
277850986.author: a TripAdvisor user
277850986.reviewBody: This park is really big and beautiful, you can visit it by walk or ride a bike around the park, you can check out the museums inside the park, ice skate or take a long walk along the river.\nIs very clean and green and you can make the most out of the activities in the park.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

277652358.name: Perfect for tourists
277652358.author: a TripAdvisor user
277652358.reviewBody: If you wanna walk and take a close look of a former iron company turned into a park, this is the place: industrial and green. Very clean, safe.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

275370223.name: Amazing
275370223.author: a TripAdvisor user
275370223.reviewBody: Parque Fundidora is a really good place for spending time with your family, it is full of activites for everyone, there is a Ferris wheel, museums, art expositions, a man made river with a beautiful view. You can also rent a bike if you want to have a ride.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

274470124.name: A wedding
274470124.author: a TripAdvisor user
274470124.reviewBody: This visit was sort of different. A wedding this time. I always enjoy evry visit to this lung of Monterrey City. Hope they keep this place as good as it is... A paradise for runners by the way (of course depending of the weather conditions).

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

273854327.name: Please pay a visit to Parque Fundidora!
273854327.author: a TripAdvisor user
273854327.reviewBody: The park is huge, there\'s lots of attractions inside of it and it\'s green (very green). My expectations for the park were minimal, so I was pleasantly surprised to see how well maintained and safe the park is.\n   As many other reviewers have said, this is a must-visit, must-see in Monterrey, you will have lots of fun and will learn a lot. There are exhibits, several museums, the children\'s museum, arts museum, etc. It\'s really worth the visit!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

270643467.name: Awesome
270643467.author: a TripAdvisor user
270643467.reviewBody: I really recomend visitng the park in april because the weather was so nice. Very clean, very safe. there are lanes for people that want to ride their bikes and places to exercise. This park is huge.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

269865519.name: Very nice
269865519.author: a TripAdvisor user
269865519.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful places in Monterrey downtown, maybe the best one. Very well mantained, and with a lot of nice panorama. Go up the horno, to see all the city from above.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

268531984.name: Huge park
268531984.author: a TripAdvisor user
268531984.reviewBody: This is a place to walk, sit or take your bicycle and have a  nice afternoon. There are benches, lots of grass and shade to rest. Unfortunately there are not a lot of bathrooms or w\u00e1ter faucets around, so be prepared.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

264586792.name: Great for families
264586792.author: a TripAdvisor user
264586792.reviewBody: The Parque Fundidora along with the Paseo Santa Lucia are great places to go with the family but too crowded if you go on weekends.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

263121742.name: Beautiful Place
263121742.author: a TripAdvisor user
263121742.reviewBody: It is a really nice place to visit either with family or friends. It has nice beautiful gardens and good food.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

262228473.name: Beautiful
262228473.author: a TripAdvisor user
262228473.reviewBody: This place is great and a good place to hide withing such a big and hectic city. Great place to run or bike. They rent bikes and there are plenty of museums, cinema and cultural venues. Also excellent food options and beautiful views of the old metal factory

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

260974997.name: good for family time.
260974997.author: a TripAdvisor user
260974997.reviewBody: pretty well maintained gardens and the small streets inside very clea, the playgrounds are good and they also rent bikes, the churros and papitas con crema were not so good but eatable bring comfy shoes.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

258679855.name: Awesome
258679855.author: a TripAdvisor user
258679855.reviewBody: As other people have mentioned here. This park is not only huge but also a must seen in Monterrey. Go with time to spent there. It also has a nice trip on a boat til downtown where you can walk through the Gran Plaza. If you have a free day to spare somewhere, go there.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

256375462.name: Excellent park
256375462.author: a TripAdvisor user
256375462.reviewBody: you can spend the entire day walking through a forest in the middle of monterrey, with fountains, attraction, museums, expositions, they even have a movie  theater, exposition, and events. is popular place so during weekend you\'ll find people jogging, families, bikers.\n

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

255110516.name: A great place to visit
255110516.author: a TripAdvisor user
255110516.reviewBody: I go to this park once or twice a month, and it is always worthwhile.  Besides ample lawns and man-made ponds and fountains, it is the site of many cultural and recreational activities, including everything from ice skating and large event venues to a children\'s library and museum exhibits. It used to be a steel foundry, and the land and some of the buildings were repurposed as a park and a sort of civic center.  It\'s family friendly, offering food at a range of prices and venues (from food carts to the "El Lingote" restaurant), plenty of restrooms (although they are not always clean), rentable bicycles, and more.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

254804221.name: Tranquility in the city
254804221.author: a TripAdvisor user
254804221.reviewBody: This place is the best Monterrey has to offer in terms of park life, plenty to do with the kids.  Excellent place for exercise too.  The museum and the boat trip are excellent too.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

254782018.name: Great place to visit!
254782018.author: a TripAdvisor user
254782018.reviewBody: I really liked the museum as it is very well kept. The ambience is very quiet and you have plenty of space to walk. the gardens are very nice and the museum inside is beautiful.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

249150292.name: Simply Beautiful
249150292.author: a TripAdvisor user
249150292.reviewBody:
This park is amazing and worth visiting. The views of the city are beautiful from here. The museums, the attractions and specially the Paseo de Santa Lucia are a must do. My children enjoyed zip lining and the paseo. Do bring cash for drinks and snacks, so bring comfortable shoes because there is a lot if walking if you plan to explore the whole park. I do recommend you stay after sunset, everything looks much more enchanting at night specially the museo de acero. Bring bikes, roller skates if you want and if you have little ones do bring a stroller they will probably be tired at the end of the day.

By the way you do need to pay for zip lining about 5dlls per person and for the Paseo about 8 

did I mention clean restroom facilities. Yes the restrooms are very well kept except most of the time there is no toilet paper SO do take something just in case.

Hope this helps
Thank you

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

248080630.name: One Word: Awesome
248080630.author: a TripAdvisor user
248080630.reviewBody: It is a fantastic place for everything! You can take your bike, or rent one. You can go exercise, or just walk with your friends or significant other. It is an awesome place, it has some small museums inside and during night is just enchanting. I totally recommend this place. Everyone who goes to Monterrey should visit Fundidora

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

239433152.name: Beautiful place with grea attractions
239433152.author: a TripAdvisor user
239433152.reviewBody: The Parque is really beautiful, I went there with my father for an event in Cintermex. The things we enjoyed the most were the Museo del Acero Horno 3 and the boat ride to the city center. You can rent a bike and ride all around the park, the bike paths are well maintained, as well as the the rest of the park.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

238336986.name: Go prepared!
238336986.author: a TripAdvisor user
238336986.reviewBody: When you visit Parque Fundidora, make sure you do the following, carry money for snacks & drinks, either take your bike, skates or stroller, the race track runs all around the park and it\u00b4s a good circuit! There\u00b4s museums, a book shop, ice skating rink (fee required-expensive), a movie theater (check listings), many gardens, bikes for rent, snack shops, museums.\nIt\u00b4s worth the ride, if you want to picnic, you can. \nPhoto shoot? why not? it is really nice there!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

238084795.name: Gigantic multi purpose park, fun!
238084795.author: a TripAdvisor user
238084795.reviewBody: While in beautiful Monterrey, I attended a concert on the Parque Fundidora grounds and then went to check it out again when the crowds had dissipated. A former steel foundry, the old smokestacks and other hulking buildings are a charming nod to the park\'s industrial past, and today, locals and tourists can enjoy a plethora of activities there. Bicycle rentals are available, bike paths are wide and accessible, there is a gigantic Ferris wheel to ride and even an ice rink. I wasn\'t expecting to find figure skating in Mexico but it\'s there! There is a lot for kids to do, including an arts center. Walking the paseo de Santa Lucia is a fantastic way in or out of the park too. No trip to Monterrey is complete without a visit here. I wish we had a park as great at this one in my home town!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

237920659.name: Nice excercise park
237920659.author: a TripAdvisor user
237920659.reviewBody: This big place is nice to go a Saturday or Sunday. there isn\'t much to do but this days there are carts that sell food. You can go eith your skates, skateboard or bike. It is great to excercise, very big place. You will have a nice view and have an escape from the traffic. You can also have a picnic.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

236611635.name: You don\'t want to miss this.
236611635.author: a TripAdvisor user
236611635.reviewBody: If the weather is nice, you must go enjoy this respite in the middle of the city. Rent bikes,  bring a picnic,  enjoy a nice family day with lots to see and do. Classical music broadcast throughout,  and free wifi as well.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

230201270.name: The only thing worth seeing in Monterrey (sorta)
230201270.author: a TripAdvisor user
230201270.reviewBody: This was my first time at this park, I was not displeased. Everything in this city sucks, it is super expensive compared to much lovelier and friendly cities in Mexico. This was pretty much the only thing you can do for free. It is ok, nothing fancy about it. It was nice to find a place in Monterrrey that is not so dirty and crowded. Did I mention it was free? It is worth the effort, but good luck getting there if you do not know your way around or have a car. I had to walk for 40mins bc no one could give me clear directions on how to get there by bus. They rent you bikes for 20pesos two dollars american give or take. So check it out if you dont have money for much better attractions.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

227884240.name: Excellent park, everything in one place.
227884240.author: a TripAdvisor user
227884240.reviewBody: This park is first of all enormous, which makes it perfect for a lot of things. it has space for whatever you can imagine. I came with my husband and we walked along the park and took pictures with the oven parts around it from the old factory and saw that there\'s space for exercise, for relaxation, for entertainment.. everything. Also I found it great that they are very much into the ecological and giving back to the nature thing, you can even find a little place where they give away seeds to plant your own tree.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

225988294.name: A must to go!
225988294.author: a TripAdvisor user
225988294.reviewBody:
Parque Fundidora is one of the most beautiful parks in Mexico, in spite of the number of visitors that have daily, always you will see it clean and a is very safe place.
A good option to stroll around, you can rent bikes or do some exercise, lot of races are organize in here, and inside you can go to some art & cultural exposures.
Behind the Horno 3, you will find "Biblioteca Libre" where you can go for a book to read for free.
You can parking at Cintermex Parking lots, or at the Parking of Parque fundidora, for only $50 pesos (not limit time).

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

225901037.name: PARQUE FUNDIDORA IS A MUST IN MONTERREY
225901037.author: a TripAdvisor user
225901037.reviewBody: It is a must in Monterrey; you will love walking around this park. Just be sure to have with you a bottle with water and sun block!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

221464105.name: Urban renewal at its finest
221464105.author: a TripAdvisor user
221464105.reviewBody: This is a beautiful and impressive park that you really should not miss. It\'s very hot in Monterrey, so walking around a park can be a sweaty experience, but Fundidora is worth it. The old steel industry stopped working there in the 1980s, and the steel mills were abandoned. With creativity and foresight, they\'ve been incoporated into the landscape of the park. The largest mill -- Horno 3 -- is a museum, and it\'s worth the trip. This is a must see in Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

220504514.name: Beautiful Setting
220504514.author: a TripAdvisor user
220504514.reviewBody: This park is large with lots of parkways to walk, jog, ride a bike etc. Plenty of trees for shade along the way. Well patroled by security on bicycle. Perfect for a walk day or evening. There are additional attractions located in and around the park as well.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

219773948.name: Stroll and Relax
219773948.author: a TripAdvisor user
219773948.reviewBody: Great park to take a nice stroll with friends, a loved one or solo...its really clean and you feel safe. There are many places to have a picnic or just sit and read a book. The boat ride was very nice. Clean, family-oriented. Loved it!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

218888486.name: Nice place to relax
218888486.author: a TripAdvisor user
218888486.reviewBody: Like every where else in downtown Monterrey this parc is very clean and well maintained. Good place to relax. They rent bike but we didn\'t find where, but must be ideal biking.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

211474350.name: Evening stroll in the park.
211474350.author: a TripAdvisor user
211474350.reviewBody: A great park, follow the water or take the boat. Hire a bike, walk or run. Exercise on the fixed equipment. Stop for a snack, drink or meal. A great, relaxing venue.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

211407778.name: Go often
211407778.author: a TripAdvisor user
211407778.reviewBody: I have been here many times. I think it is wonderful that something as wonderful as this park could come from such failure. This park is very large and being at one end of the river ride you need to decide which end of the boat ride you want to start at. I suggest you park in Sesame Street parking lot as the fee is very low I think it was $4 for the day. It\'s a short walk to the foundry where you may want to try the food, I think it is really good but you do need to take the tour of the plant it was done very well and explains what it was like when operational through a show and tell performance. All that was missing was the heat. Then for $8 I take the round trip boat ride into Monterrey Central but that\'s a review for another day filled with Museums, and Food and Shops oo my.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

210812566.name: Fun long day
210812566.author: a TripAdvisor user
210812566.reviewBody: We went to this park with our bycicles and we had hours of fun. There are paved roads where you can drive or walk, spaces to sit on the grass or benches. There is a lot of open space, be sure to take you sunscreen and/or cap to protect from the sun. There is only a few places to buy food and drinks, be sure to take your own. If you do not have a bycicle you can also rent one there. We arrived at 10 and left at 6 pm. We had so much fun.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

205602693.name: Beautiful place if you go on business
205602693.author: a TripAdvisor user
205602693.reviewBody: If you visit Monterrey for business, do not stay at your hotel, grab a taxi and get here, very nice place to walk, roller skate or simply enjoy an ice cream, very safe  and friendly people, besides that it is so big that even if crowded it feels empty at all times.\nGets hot in the summer so use sun blocker and it has a bird place where you can enjoy different kind of birds, highly recommended for families or friends.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

201214118.name: Every taste find a place here
201214118.author: a TripAdvisor user
201214118.reviewBody: A multifunctional park with several attractions, you can have a great run in a flat road (it was a stop for the Champ Car World Series). It has an art cinema (cineteca) with good foreign movies, a library for kids and the Acero Museum. With large open areas with games for children and picnic areas.\n\nGreat place to spend a full sunday.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

199452530.name: Diverse and Afforable
199452530.author: a TripAdvisor user
199452530.reviewBody: Whether you enjoy running in the track, watching art films, or fancy dining, Fundidora is the place to go. There is always something going on, ranging activities for families, children, couples or senior citizens. Best of all, most events are free of charge.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

199328694.name: A nice place to walk or run
199328694.author: a TripAdvisor user
199328694.reviewBody: This park is great with all the necessary things for you to spend a wonderful time.\n\nAlso the events on the weekends are good to enjoy the park....

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

197377926.name: Excellent park
197377926.author: a TripAdvisor user
197377926.reviewBody:
The park is on what used to be La Fundidora (smelting).
It has a point of the Santa Lucia boat ride, nice way to arrive from La Macro Plaza.
It has bicycle, running roads, exercise areas...
Nice place for a leisure stroll, the views include some of the fundidora hornos (furnaces), it has views to the cerros (mountains) that surround the park.
If you have many hours there is the recommended Horno 3 museum (1-3 hours), Casa de los Loros (parrots, monkeys, etc) and Parque Plaza Sesamo (half of the rides are wet)
Views at sunset are gorgeous.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

194679405.name: Interesting tour of Monterrey\'s heavy industry
194679405.author: a TripAdvisor user
194679405.reviewBody: This park is built on what used to be one of the largest steel mills in Mexico. It was shot down after protracted labour conflict in the 1970s and eventually taken over by the government and turned into a park and museum. The museum part is so-so but the park can be interesting for families with children. The museum seemed rather disorganized, without a logical or chronological order, and most of the historical information seemed to be from the perspective of former owners. Nothing about the workers who made the mill so profitable for decades. The restaurant at the museum seemed overpriced, so I did not risk eating there.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

190776688.name: This is an example of well spent tax payers money.
190776688.author: a TripAdvisor user
190776688.reviewBody: Owesome place. Perfect for walking, skating, etc. This park is the end of a man-created river that has several fountain art pieces, paintings over it\'s stream. This river is Santa Lucia. the boat trip has a cost of 40 pesos round trip. you can stop at the edge of the river to drink one of the hand crafted beers. It goes up to Macroplaza. Arena Monterrey is inside the park. I stayed at the holiday inn inside the park as well. Best choice ever. You must include this in your bucket list.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

189571318.name: An amazing park
189571318.author: a TripAdvisor user
189571318.reviewBody: Fundidora Park is great, you should bring sunblock and comfortable shoes because the park is way too large and you will be walking a lot, it\'s cool to see how they include the steel industry with the nature.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

188227275.name: Great park
188227275.author: a TripAdvisor user
188227275.reviewBody: At the end of Paseo de Santa Lucia, you can find the Parque Fundidora... an amazing structure with a great fancy restaurant at the top named "El Lingote"... great views, good to have a nice walk.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

186207362.name: Great views
186207362.author: a TripAdvisor user
186207362.reviewBody: When you walk through the Park or take this boat rides on the canal the scenery is amazing and some nice murals as well. Worth a visit

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

181431588.name: A nice park to enjoy an evening (or a whole day!)
181431588.author: a TripAdvisor user
181431588.reviewBody: I came a few times to Fundidora, the first was to get on the boat ride that takes you to the Macroplaza and back-- super nice (artificial river and all). The next time i spent with my mother wondering around the different gallerias and exhibitions they have on the ground-- very very enjoyable.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

170313224.name: Beautiful Park!!!!!
170313224.author: a TripAdvisor user
170313224.reviewBody: This is one of the best attractions in town. A well planned park built where a former metal company functioned in the past.  You can go and exercise, rent a bike or just enjoy a nice walk.\nYou can also find museums, restaurant in the magnificent old buildings.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

169799667.name: One Afternoon of Fun
169799667.author: a TripAdvisor user
169799667.reviewBody: One of my favorite place in Monterrey. You can walk, bike, skate, around the park. They have bike\nrentals . Also they have a lake where you can rent a 4 person boat o kayak. You can enter with your pic nic or they have food stations allover the park. There is a train ride for all the family. Also they have playground stations all over the park . Inside there is a Art Cinema with a great selection from all over the world, a theater, 2 musems, waterfountains. A great attraction call HORNO3 with stations for the kids to have fun, a ride to the top where you can see ALL MONTERREY. One thing I love it is that they have nice music all over.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

169673281.name: Nice Park
169673281.author: a TripAdvisor user
169673281.reviewBody: A really nice park constructed in the lands of a former metal company.\nThere are plenty of activities to do: museum, bicycle rental, ice skating, restaurants, running tracks, exercise stations, etc.\nBring food for picnic or buy it here.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

169457443.name: Great Park to go for Bike ride !
169457443.author: a TripAdvisor user
169457443.reviewBody: Great place to visit and exercise !! We went there in the evening and the weather is not very hot, perfect for you to ride a bike to tour around. With a bicycle you can know the place and I would recommend that, since the park is really huge, and its difficult to travel in foot. The rental fee for the bicycle is reasonable. So go for a ride instead of by your foot.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

167519172.name: An amazing place to visit!
167519172.author: a TripAdvisor user
167519172.reviewBody: The tour of the foundry is excellent as is the light show at the #3 furnace. A nice place to stroll and safe to walk about.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

165363256.name: A must when you visit Monterrey
165363256.author: a TripAdvisor user
165363256.reviewBody: You can spend a day at Fundidora. Bicycle ride, moovies, gardens, fast food and an excellent restaurant, a museum and an elevator to the top with a wonderfull view.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

165242633.name: Great for a bike ride
165242633.author: a TripAdvisor user
165242633.reviewBody: I brought the family to visit Parque Fundidora during a Saturday afternoon. We all had a great time. The bike rent is 25 pesos per hour and one hour is enough to get to know the park. It was hot, but we enjoyed our time.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

165127565.name: So many things to do.
165127565.author: a TripAdvisor user
165127565.reviewBody: You should go here if you plan to spend a whole day doing fun outdoor stuff with your friends. You can take your bike and ride it all across the racing track that was once used for the Grand Prix 2001/2006, also you can go and have cheesy picnic with your date. There are some good restaurants like "El Lingote" in the Horno 3 area.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

164716891.name: Very nice park!
164716891.author: a TripAdvisor user
164716891.reviewBody: Nice and clean area, there are play area for childrens, green area to sit, to exercise.\nHighly recommended "Horno 3" muse and top view (after 6 pm)

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

162650144.name: GREAT place to go and visit.
162650144.author: a TripAdvisor user
162650144.reviewBody: This place has it all, zip line, kids park, water park, biking, walking, pedal boats on the pond, restaurants.  Go check it out, and take the Santa Lucia boat ride (its kind of like the riverwalk in San Antonio).  Safe place, and great for kids and adults.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

160456558.name: Great beautiful place to relax
160456558.author: a TripAdvisor user
160456558.reviewBody: After a long day of work this is a good place to relax. If you get a chance visit the casa de Los loros, it\'s very beatiful. You only pay 7.00 dollars or 70.00 pesos, by the way thy will take you dollars to pay to go in.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

157099038.name: Great attraction when visiting Monterrey, MX
157099038.author: a TripAdvisor user
157099038.reviewBody: A nice quiet, out of the bustle of Monterrey.  Full of families walking, roller blading, playing soccer and picnicing.\nHas some great venues for entertainment and a good museum of steel making.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

155850345.name: Worth a visit with the kids
155850345.author: a TripAdvisor user
155850345.reviewBody: You can rent a bike for less than a couple of bucks an hour, use the outdoor gym equipment, visit the exhibits including the Horno3, and Casa de los Loros (House of Parrots), or for the younger kids, there is a number of playgrounds.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

153459951.name: Beautiful Park!
153459951.author: a TripAdvisor user
153459951.reviewBody: Very nice park.  Spent some time walking there.  Didn\'t have a chance to visit the museum there, but would definitely want to in my next visit.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

149958365.name: A beutiful ex- industrial park
149958365.author: a TripAdvisor user
149958365.reviewBody: The biggest and more beautiful park in the city. This magnificent places is surrounded with old factories because the whole place used to be a steel factory, not the feeling and the machines state but the workers are gone. An excellent place to run and exercise a little bit. But keep in mind, It\u00b4s not for dogs. nor cats.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

147379347.name: Industrial Park
147379347.author: a TripAdvisor user
147379347.reviewBody: This park is a great place to visit! It used to be an old steel factory but after it closed they turned it into a museum. You can walk, run or ride a bike around the park. There are lots of play areas for children and green areas to rest. Sometimes they have art exhibitions in some of the buildings. There is always street food. Also, it is worth taking a trip to the top of the main building in Horno 3.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

147000857.name: Great for Walking and Photography Enthusiasts!
147000857.author: a TripAdvisor user
147000857.reviewBody: Not only do I love walking in the Parque Fundidora, I love all of the industrial architecture that is so beautifully landscaped. On a sunny day it is a beautiful spot for taking photographs. The free art exhibitions at the small museums were a wonderful surprise. I have been back twice and still have not managed to walk the entire park. A gorgeous tribute to the city\'s industrial heritage!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

141834215.name: Great place for a walk
141834215.author: a TripAdvisor user
141834215.reviewBody: This is a huge park that always seems to have something going on during the weekends. It is a walkers or joggers paradise. Also, inside the park you can board the boat for the riverwalk, visit the Horno 3 museum, visit the Cintermex complex, and more.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

140172621.name: great park
140172621.author: a TripAdvisor user
140172621.reviewBody: It is a nice park to exercise or walk a little, it also has restaurants inside. The museum at horno 13 is very nice.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

138570081.name: Huge park, nice to walk around
138570081.author: a TripAdvisor user
138570081.reviewBody: It used to be a Fundidora and now it\'s been turned into a huge park you can spend the day walking around. Has some art exhibits and museums.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

138541490.name: Excellent for family or couples!
138541490.author: a TripAdvisor user
138541490.reviewBody: This park is amazing.  Very clean, safe, a few vendors selling snacks, well lit.  There is also an ice skating rink.  The staff at the rink is very friendly and there is a deli/cantina upstairs with food and drinks that you are able to overlook everyone ice skating as you stuff your face :-) LOL.  The park also has bicycles available for rent as well as a boat ride along the canal.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

136107448.name: alive
136107448.author: a TripAdvisor user
136107448.reviewBody: its a huge park, that makes you just wanna sit down and enjoy the view of the mountains around the city. its very green and alive with all sort of things to do.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

134655382.name: Excelent for a family day...
134655382.author: a TripAdvisor user
134655382.reviewBody: This is an amazing place for exercising and spend a good time in family. You can picnic, feed ducks, rent bikes or bring your own. It has play areas for little chidlren.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

134513808.name: Great city project
134513808.author: a TripAdvisor user
134513808.reviewBody: This site used to be an old steel mill. Now the city has converted it into a wonderful park that is a great place to pass a Saturday or Sunday afternoon. This place is HUGE so you can find some privacy if you want, or you can join others for leisurely strolls. You can go up in the old steel mills and there\'s even a good restaurant in them where you can enjoy beautiful views of the city at night. I lived in Monterry for 2 years and never tired of coming here!

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

134168595.name: Very nice place to walk in, great restored factory buildings
134168595.author: a TripAdvisor user
134168595.reviewBody: This is a very nice park in Monterrey, especially due to the fact that they had the marvelous idea of putting speakers with classical music (at an appropriate volume) throughout the park - you feel like walking with your own soundtrack, it\'s pretty nice. I wasn\'t there for leisure (there are goveernment offices inside so I was going for meetings there) but the place looked very pleasant, and you can visit some old factory buildings and steel infrastructure which looked pretty nice.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

130160407.name: A great place with lots of things to do
130160407.author: a TripAdvisor user
130160407.reviewBody: This is a very large extension in where you can find almost everything. Whether you like to run, bike, eat. Theres a museum, an ice skating, theatre, lots of things to do, sesamo kids park. You can go all day and you will find lots of things to do in a very clean an secure place

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

129745954.name: A Gem in the City Center
129745954.author: a TripAdvisor user
129745954.reviewBody: One great venue for visitors to Monterrey is the Parque Fundidora. The park sits on the site of a huge steel mill and has a number of interesting things to do at the park. The museum in El Horno 3 is very interesting and is interactive. My favorite activity during my visit was to ride up to the observation deck on cars which follow the old carbon elevators to the top of El Horno 3. The view is breathtaking and the cost of 40 pesos per person makes for a very inexpensive treat.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

127138027.name: How they took a grimy factory and made a beautiful park
127138027.author: a TripAdvisor user
127138027.reviewBody: A true beauty. The good people of Monterrey managed to take a grimy steel mill and make a beautiful, educational and people friendly park, in the middle of Monterrey where you can spend hours learning about the history of the mill, the workers, the process, the labour and the environment. \nVery interesting\nAccessible through an enchanting little boat ride from the center of Monterrey

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

126844309.name: Lots to do!
126844309.author: a TripAdvisor user
126844309.reviewBody: Beautiful grounds, nice museum (Horno 3).  Definitely a great way to spend a Saturday or Sunday afternoon. \n

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

126652959.name: crowded
126652959.author: a TripAdvisor user
126652959.reviewBody: always crowded, full of kids and people in bikes!,   its about 3km, and u can get lost at some parts.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

126291675.name: Grat way to spend a Saturday
126291675.author: a TripAdvisor user
126291675.reviewBody: Spend a nice Saturday morning going to Parque Fundidora, nice place to walk, see different people, go to Lingote to have lunch, read a book, and end your day having coffee in the caboose.\n

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

126148800.name: Relaxing
126148800.author: a TripAdvisor user
126148800.reviewBody: A nice park, with too much grass and a river stream; ideal for rest.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

125685771.name: Must visit!!!
125685771.author: a TripAdvisor user
125685771.reviewBody: During my trip I stayed at Holiday Inn Parque Fundidora which has access to the park. The park is exceptional. It used to be a old metal factory. The structures left from the old time allow it to be a perfect place for pictures. I love the ambiance music. While you walk the classical music kept playing in the background.\n\nThis is a must visit place, no matter if you are in business or pleasure.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

124836746.name: Need at least two days to visit most of the attractions, if not all.
124836746.author: a TripAdvisor user
124836746.reviewBody: Whether you want to spend a day just lounging around or doing activities, Parque Fundidora is a perfect place-  Exercise, bicycle, visit museums, amusement parks or simply take a boat across to History Museum, also has plenty of playground for kids. The list is endless...

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

123556263.name: great place to visit
123556263.author: a TripAdvisor user
123556263.reviewBody: It was fun and good experience. The place is a old factory and they adapt it like a museum.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

123283991.name: A great place to unwind in town
123283991.author: a TripAdvisor user
123283991.reviewBody: The whole park is very beautiful and huge a lot of things to do and it would take more that a day.  Specially if you are going to the exhibitions. You can skate, bike, picnic or just walk and enjoy the scenery

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

123138961.name: Excellent place to take the family for a walk.
123138961.author: a TripAdvisor user
123138961.reviewBody: A huge area where to take your bicycle, skates, and spend a nice afternoon with the family.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

122839110.name: Together with Santa Lucia, is a must-do in Monterrey
122839110.author: a TripAdvisor user
122839110.reviewBody: Please go there, see all the activities from the morning until the evening and take pictures of the mountains, you can see them right outside of Horno 3.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

122297753.name: a runners gettaway
122297753.author: a TripAdvisor user
122297753.reviewBody: if you like to run and need a place to run in this city, this is the place, a former indy series racing track is now a running, cycling, skating route, great gardens, completely secure and in the middle of the city.

address.streetAddress: Calle Adolfo Prieto S/N Colonia Obrera

660454802.name: Colonial-centric and dull
660454802.author: a TripAdvisor user
660454802.reviewBody:
Both exhibits (yes, there were only two) were crap. The first was basically mass glorification and brown-nosing of 'intrepid' white European 'explorers' who 'discovered' Mexico's wild landscapes and advertised them to the world. Not a word to be said about the indigenous peoples who had lived there and knew about their land thousands of years before. Oh, except a brief mention of them as 'indian barbarians' who attacked the poor foreign intruders. How can a country so degrade its origins. Then again, I guess a lot of their ancient indigenous artefacts have been looted and held in the British Museum, so maybe they didn't have anything to exhibit.

The second exhibition was just a bunch of statues of the Virgin Mary. I was there for thirty seconds.

This was NOT a museum of Mexican history. The attached Museo del Noreste was much more thorough and less biased, but also had too much writing. They are spotlessly clean and shiny with WiFi and nice toilets, but absolute sellout places. Support non colonialist culture instead.

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

659397145.name: A great museum to learn
659397145.author: a TripAdvisor user
659397145.reviewBody: I visited the Museo de Historia Mexicana during my visit to Monterrey Nuevo Leon. It cost $40 pesos but they told us that there is a day when it is free. The museum was beautiful and they have really clean upgrade bathrooms. The visit was interesting. I recommended!

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

656643322.name: Anniversary trip
656643322.author: a TripAdvisor user
656643322.reviewBody: I\u2019ve been in Mexico for 25 years. This is the first time I have been here. It is a typical Mexican museum which means it has a few things and lots of writing.\n\nIf you read Spanish this is a fairly good museum to visit if you do not read Spanish, you will be disappointed.

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

641412019.name: Great family fun
641412019.author: a TripAdvisor user
641412019.reviewBody: Entrance was free for us near Christmas holiday. It is located near the Macroplaza, governors palace and other touristy things. During Christmas there is a giant artistic tree made of something fun and unique (this year it was colorful chairs stacked 50\u2019 or so high). You can get there from parque fundidora via the paseo the Lucia. You can also park near there at any number of places. Just like for someone waving/snapping a red flag and they\u2019ll direct you. It is common to tip the parking guy ~15 pesos.

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

614239167.name: Combine with nearby museums
614239167.author: a TripAdvisor user
614239167.reviewBody: There are five salas on the second floor; pre-historic times, pre-Hispanic civilizations, Spanish rule, revolutions of the 19th century, and modern Mexico. Everything is in Spanish,  you probably won\'t learn much if you don\'t speak the language. \n\nOn Tuesday the entrance is free, in addition to Sundays (when most Mexican museums are free). The ticket here also gets you to nearby Museo del Noreste and Museo del Palacio, and you should really try to visit all three for a complete experience.

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

603082956.name: Speechless
603082956.author: a TripAdvisor user
603082956.reviewBody: One of the best museums we have ever been to!! The expo about the casts was amazing, as well as the display upstairs! We loved it!

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

599880919.name: You can learn a lot here.
599880919.author: a TripAdvisor user
599880919.reviewBody: This is a must see in the city and you can learn a lot of important things about Mexico and the countries history.  An enjoyable experience.

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

597115399.name: Good, best to have a spanish guide if possible!
597115399.author: a TripAdvisor user
597115399.reviewBody: It was a good experience to learn about Mexican history. Only a the top floor. But interactive learning. Full stem train. Very educational. Everything is in spanish. They do have some computers/interactive touch screens, which you can change the information to English. But I think thats not enough, to get the whole experience, try to find a English guide - they may do this service at the museum. FYI you are not allowed to bring water bottles, but they have a baggage room to store items.

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

587003910.name: Beautiful Museum.
587003910.author: a TripAdvisor user
587003910.reviewBody: My wife and I visited the Paseo de Santa Lucia. After the hour or so walking around we decided to visit the museum to cool off and use the bathroom. The museum was beautiful and what was expected to be quick visit turned into a while. They have ancient religious artifacts and modern art. Highly recommended for a visit.

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

580519611.name: most
580519611.author: a TripAdvisor user
580519611.reviewBody:
This museum is 1 of 3 museums in the area. Tuesdays and Sundays are free entrance.

The museum itself is very nice and worth the visit. But the expositions are super good. 

It’s all about the Mexican history from ancient times to modern days.

It’s a good place for kids to visit because the museum is interactive and it’s very easy to catch the children’s attention.

If you are there you should also visit MUNE that it’s next to this museum and you can get to it by crossing the cristal bridge inside the museum.

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

565907888.name: Interesting history of Mexico and the Northeast
565907888.author: a TripAdvisor user
565907888.reviewBody: There are 3 museums here -Mexican history, the NorthEast of Mexico & Texas and Maria Feliz. The NorthEast Museum is very interesting as it tells the story of the this area of Mexico and Texas, as they were one country at one time. start at the bottom and each floor covers a different time in history. Information is in Englsh/Spahish. the Museum of History is in Spanish only, and you can request an English speaking guide. We were with the guide for 1.5 hours and he was informative,engaging and we learned a great deal. We didn\'t go see the Maria Feliz museum.

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

561805529.name: Enjoyable
561805529.author: a TripAdvisor user
561805529.reviewBody: The museum is located near the theater and other intresting sites.  The day I went I was able to enjoy performances by some singers from a singing academy. They have these performances once a month, and an upcoming exhibit they are having is from mexican actress Mar\u00eda Feliz hope I have the opportunity to enjoy it.

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

551137892.name: Good place with lots of Mexican history
551137892.author: a TripAdvisor user
551137892.reviewBody: You are recommended to visit displays for about 1 to 2 hours, the place has a little Mexican history and the exhibits are in English and Spanish as well, this is not as big as some other museums that are located in the capital Mexico City but it\u2019s good to be entertained for about 1 to 2 hours.

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

550473243.name: Very good museum
550473243.author: a TripAdvisor user
550473243.reviewBody: This is a nice place to spend a few hours learning about Mexican history.   Nowhere near as good as museums in Mexico City, but very good nonetheless.  Only about 50% is translated into English and 0% into other languages.

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

547391778.name: Good museum
547391778.author: a TripAdvisor user
547391778.reviewBody: I spent an afternoon here in December 2017. The museum has good exhibits with extensive information. From the English-speaker\'s point of view, I found the fact that you could use a QR code to get an English translation of the museum information really great. Unfortunately, I didn\'t have international roaming turned on for my cell phone, so I couldn\'t take advantage of the service.\nI really liked the Maximillian and Charlotte exhibit and the pre-historic to voyage of discovery exhibits very much.

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

542208523.name: Searching the culture
542208523.author: a TripAdvisor user

The architecture of the museum very nice, and the location is the best it can have along with the Northeast museum and Paseo Santa Lucia.

Once inside a very nice surprise with and excellent museography; modern and interesting; You can find from the beginnings of Mexico to the contemporary.

Acclimatized, with free cloakroom, clean washrooms, and concierge.

Is a must

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

468167681.name: A wonderful museum
468167681.author: a TripAdvisor user

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

449222465.name: Good
449222465.author: a TripAdvisor user
449222465.reviewBody: The museum is good and the staff was friendly. We paid 40 pesos each for 2 museums. There are like 4 or 5 exhibitions in the 2 museums. They contain regions history, Mexican culture and Mexican film history.you can take photos without flash. However,they isn\'t offer us any guide, so we explored the place by our own, most of the things there are in Spanish.the Atm machine in the museum is not working too.  And yeah, we got 10% discount to the museum cafe.

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

439160708.name: Another approach of Mexico
439160708.author: a TripAdvisor user

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

430975263.name: Mexican culture
430975263.author: a TripAdvisor user
430975263.reviewBody:
This is probably the most beautifully resumed way of the mexican history and culture. 

Every exhibition this museum has is in perfect condition, it has interactive activities for children and is very illustrative. I have to congratulate as well to the people that works there, they are really friendly and kind. 

The fauna exhibition is very interesting because is very organized and informative. My favorite exhibition is the one of the emperor Maximilian and Charlotte because of the articles they have of the couple, as well as the exhibition of the evolution of the mexican industry and how Monterrey had a big part in it. 

I really recommend this museum, it enlightens you about Mexican histori.

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

396217719.name: Outstanding Overview of Mexican History!

The exhibits are well-done, and well-lit. \nThere are several exhibits behind closed doors, so make sure you see them all. \nHINT: Take a camera. I learned very important aspect of Mexican history. There are facts in the form clay statues that indigenous people in mexico came in contact with Chinese people long before Europeans arrived in mexico.

All the information printed at every specimen is in Spanish language. The English speaking staff made my life easy and helped me to know a lot about the Mexican history. 

The museum is not very big but got tons if information covering many milestone in the history of Mexico. Unlike other museum in mexico especially mexico city, this museum is not overwhelming. It's totally doable and great opportunity to learn about the mexico history.

I think this is the must place to visit in Monterrey.

They didn\'t have any at the moment but a guide found me in the museum and walked me around for a while and asked if I needed help ordering lunch too. Nice exhibits and history of the area. address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

218977363.name: King Tut!
218977363.author: a TripAdvisor user
218977363.reviewBody: I highly recommend you NOT miss the opportunity to see the King Tut exhibit. Came here on Tuesday (free museum day), I was surprised it wasn\'t crowded.  Then again, regular admission is $40 pesos ($3 dollars and change) and I believe kids are always free. My kids learned had just learned about Ancient Egypt at school and were very excited about seeing THE King Tut!  And saw him we did! Very interesting exhibit, helped my 7 and 8 year olds understand how they discovered the tomb with many of it\'s treasures.  The detail on clothing, accessories and thrones found were amazing! Information in both English and Spanish available, staff was super nice, helpful and knowledgeable!\nWe stopped by the rest of the museum after spending a couple of hours on the Egypt floor, it was interesting! As someone who was born and raised in Mexico (and now lives in the US), it was really interesting to share with my kids some of our history in ways they could understand and was somewhat interactive.\nOn a different note, it was a bit hard to find (not being familiar with the area), they don\'t have too many signs on the building, it\'s a big building, but then again, there are lots of big, important-looking buildings around, and none with too many signs.  I finally pulled in to ask someone wearing a badge only to realize they had a tiny sign, I would have never seen unless I had pulled over to ask for directions.  So just look for the big white plain looking building.

But this museum shows you all their origins from the beginning of the american tribes and then the mixture with spanish casts, then their history through nowdays.  It was a cool experience. address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

201720785.name: History, Art, Architecture: All in One Museum
201720785.author: a TripAdvisor user
201720785.reviewBody:
Spend a day in this stunning, modern museum with a modest-sized, yet historically and artistically impressive collection and you will not be disappointed. 

The building itself is worth the visit.  It is gleaming white, with sharp soaring angles that will almost stop you in your tracks, and a wonderful location within view of the national palace and literally just steps away from Monterrey's famous river walk. One side of the museum has a beautiful cascade with trees and other plantings. It's a favorite spot for picture-taking (weddings and birthdays, especially girls' 15th) but also a nice place to cool off on a hot day or dig into a brown bag lunch. See my picture.

A new temporary exhibit, "Between Ideas and Machine Guns: 1913-1914," will run through June 29, 2014. It offers a look at social and political developments in two confused years of violent revolutionary struggle. If you're interested in colorful figures like Emiliano Zapata or Francisco "Pancho" Villa, this is the exhibit for you. Don't miss the display of Villa's ornately embroidered canvas leggings, pistol and knife with beautifully decorated holster and sheath, and fancy belt. See my picture.

A second temporary exhibit of much longer duration features Ivory religious effigies, highly decorated with handworked silver from the late 17th to the early 19th century. Whether you are religious or not, you will be thoroughly engaged by these beautiful images, many of them portraying the Virgin Mary in elaborate head dresses. They are stunning to behold. See my picture.

The permanent exhibits are also interesting, featuring fine examples of pre-Columbian art (many objects are delightfully anthropomorphic), a variety of historical artifacts that do a good job of telling Mexico's history in all its glory and tragedy, and a display of historical paintings depicting the interesting and then thought to be "scientific" notions of "castes" or racial mixes. Properly understood now to be examples of pseudo-science, they nevertheless offer insights into Mexican identity. An English-language video  plays on a loop to help non-Spanish speaking visitors understand their significance.

For amenities, there's a brand new book and gift shop, a snack bar on the lower level right by the river walk, and clean modern restrooms. Many days offer free entry, but the standard fee is 40 pesos, about $3 US, which gets you into this museum plus the Nuevo Leon museum connected by a glass walkway over the river walk, and also the exhibitions of the national palace across the plaza. It's a bargain.

I have been to this museum four or five times in the last several months. You can do it in a day, or even a couple hours if you're pressed for time. Just don't miss it. It's as pleasant a spot as any in Monterrey, and it will help you understand the city, the country, and the people.

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

My only complaint would be the lack of english translation, but that\'s my fault for not speaking much Spanish in a non-english speaking country. The collection is definitely worth the visit!

At this moment there are three expositins, one is thhe Belle Epoque with artifacts, dresses and furniture of the Belle Epoce. 162650199.author: a TripAdvisor user

137118157.author: a TripAdvisor user
