126148917.author: a TripAdvisor user
126148917.reviewBody: A free museum that allows to see the whole mexican history, from the Mayas to the present time. Don\u00b4t miss it.

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

124498948.name: First class place
124498948.author: a TripAdvisor user
124498948.reviewBody: This museum is well worth the modest entry fee. You can spend a couple of hours learning more about Mexico. Highly recommended.

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

122839044.name: Beautiful museum with excellent location
122839044.author: a TripAdvisor user
122839044.reviewBody: right next to macro plaza and at the beginning of Paseo Santa Lucia. Just walking outside it is already a nice sightseeing. Learning in one place the history of the while country is also nice from the educational point of view.

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

122591265.name: nothing special
122591265.author: a TripAdvisor user
122591265.reviewBody: I was a little bit disappointed. Thank God Museo Del Palacio is just across the street and it is much more worth to see

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

106878149.name: One of the best museums of Mexico.
106878149.author: a TripAdvisor user
106878149.reviewBody: They managed to present the whole history of the country in one exhibit. You can ask for an english tourguide or just visit the exhibit by yourself. Even the information is mostly in spanish, you can find english info in the interactive screens.\nThey do showcase the zapotec, tlaxcaltec and northern cultures (this regarding the previous reviewer) and the Lagartera sculpture outside of the museum IS designed to get covered in green moss.\nCheck them out. They close on mondays.

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

277787.name: A great place!!!
277787.author: a TripAdvisor user
277787.reviewBody: This museum is a good place to find out about Mexico\'s history.  Its got lots of antique objects that symbolizes the early settler&#8217;s way of life.  It dates back from the prehispanic era to the present day.  It&#8217;s a cool place to learn how Mexico&#8217;s culture developed since a long time ago.\n

address.streetAddress: Dr Coss 445 Zona Centro

659993379.name: Have to visit
659993379.author: a TripAdvisor user
659993379.reviewBody: Great place to find some of the history of the city, no too big, but very interesting, when possible try to go

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

599881930.name: An important thing to do in the city.
599881930.author: a TripAdvisor user
599881930.reviewBody: One part of the museum was closed so my wife and I got free entry.  A nice place to learn a little bit more about Mexico and provides a good view of the city.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

598349590.name: Great views, worth going!
598349590.author: a TripAdvisor user
598349590.reviewBody: Take an iconic photo of Monterrey! Great views, speakers playing music! Toilet facilities. Drive up & take a quick photo!

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

534724241.name: A 5-Star Experience
534724241.author: a TripAdvisor user
534724241.reviewBody: One of the most revered sites in all of Monterrey. The Palacio del Obispado, which sits up on a hill, was the place where the people of Monterrey headed to when the American\'s invaded Mexico in late 1846. And on a side historical note, the Palace was the headquarters for Pancho Villa as he rapped and pillaged his way across Northern Mexico and southern Texas.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

525224961.name: Great views!
525224961.author: a TripAdvisor user
525224961.reviewBody: Saw the flag displays while visiting the Bishop\'s Palacio.  Was a very hot day, but the views were impressive.  The flag is ginormous!

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

520895988.name: Small Museum.
520895988.author: a TripAdvisor user
520895988.reviewBody: We went to the Obispado Museum, it\'s a very small museum, they charge $55 pesos per person the best part is taking pictures outside.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

510640303.name: Visiting obispado with friends and family
510640303.author: a TripAdvisor user
510640303.reviewBody: We visited the Obispado with family and friends. It\'s a great sightseeing place. You can drive up the mountain and it has a really great view of the whole city.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

489388334.name: THE VIEW!!
489388334.author: a TripAdvisor user
489388334.reviewBody: This places was incredible, The view just breath taking. I can only image been her at night with your better half.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

449997295.name: Perfect place to visit for an afternoon
449997295.author: a TripAdvisor user
449997295.reviewBody:
We got the afternoon off to see some sights so we headed to the Mirador and the Museo del Obispado. 

The building harkens back to the days of Mexico's war with the French. Originally a Catholic place of worship at the top of the highest hill in Monterrey it became a prime spot to take over as a Military Fort for the Mexican army due to the strategically well placed buildings that oversee the entire city. 

Now long after those incarnations the buildings have been transformed into a small but well curated museum. The architecture is stunning and the brightly painted walls add a beautiful touch. 

Highly recommended

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

429314867.name: Simple but interesting about Monterrey\u00b4s history!
429314867.author: a TripAdvisor user
429314867.reviewBody: This museum is very small! but have interesting details about Monterrey\'s history! it take to the important milestones in the history of how the Obispado was a important point in the evolution of the city.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

423704488.name: Superb
423704488.author: a TripAdvisor user
423704488.reviewBody: The best museum in the whole state to learn the history of "Los regios ". It\'s an old church that was used in several battles as a strategic forth. In the upper part of " El cerro del obispado" you can appreciate Mexican Flag and its evolution, at night you can get astonished by the view of the city\'s lights.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

419289323.name: Great Views
419289323.author: a TripAdvisor user
419289323.reviewBody: As you drive up through the winding road to reach the top of the Church, you are reminded of the History of this place. The canons face out and reminds you that this church was once a fort that tried to stop the invading American forces, but to no avail. When you reach the top you can see the panoramic views of the city.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

401776848.name: The museum is average its ok to visit once
401776848.author: a TripAdvisor user
401776848.reviewBody: Themuseum has early hours, they close early and some days is not open, you can enjoy city views after you get out because the museum is not that big, there is an entrance fee here and overall it was ok

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

396980943.name: Nice and beatiful place to visit in Monterrey
396980943.author: a TripAdvisor user
396980943.reviewBody: This a good place to go to learn about history of Monterrey and to see the beatiful view from the Bishop Hill, there is a Little museum and a big majestic M\u00e9xico\u00b4s Flag.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

349286630.name: One of the oldest buildings in the city
349286630.author: a TripAdvisor user
349286630.reviewBody: Originally, this was the residence of the bishop, at the end of the 1700, but now is a museum and, since is located at the top of a hill, you will find excellent views of the city.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

338508234.name: Lovely view specially at night
338508234.author: a TripAdvisor user
338508234.reviewBody: Lots of people visiting this place, they have free and paid parking at 20 pesos for all you want to stay you just have to find the free ones if you don\'t wanna pay. Recommended around 6-7 p.m. to enjoy the pretty views of a huge city like Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

331153628.name: Amazing view
331153628.author: a TripAdvisor user
331153628.reviewBody: Unfortunately the museum was already closed in the evening but the view as just amazing! You should definitely go there when you are travelling to Monterrey! It\'s one of the best places!

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

298782189.name: Witness of a Forgotten War
298782189.author: a TripAdvisor user
298782189.reviewBody: The war when the USA invaded Monterrey was largely fought in the Obispado. Recently they discovered with google earth a large trench that was used in that hill very close to the museum. In this museum that is located in the building that used to be the bishops house in the 1800\u2019s, you will find weapons, clothing and different articles related to that war and age. It is an important part of the history of the city. You can also watch the city from the different observation points.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

281011002.name: Family Reunion
281011002.author: a TripAdvisor user
281011002.reviewBody: This place is absolutely gorgeous!  From the rows of flags that have been utilized for different battles to the museum and the history behind the structure and the merry go round and the large chess board and the list goes on and on!  We need to go back again!

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

268538188.name: Great view
268538188.author: a TripAdvisor user
268538188.reviewBody: This is a small museum up on a small mountian. Inside the museum there are old carriages, clothe and cannons. The visit does not take you more than an hour, but once you are outside the view of the city is great.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

265973049.name: Must see
265973049.author: a TripAdvisor user
265973049.reviewBody: it is not a place that people tell you to visit but it was definitely one of my favorites. This place should really be at the top of the list when you visit Monterrey. There is a museum but it was closed when I visited so nothing to say about that. However, there is a lookout point that oversees all of monterrey and the adjacent cities. Just wow.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

251621909.name: Lovely view of the city and mountains, and good people watching too
251621909.author: a TripAdvisor user
251621909.reviewBody: My friends took me here on a recent visit to Monterrey and I\'m glad that they did. It\'s a must-see without being a tourist trap. There are several viewpoints for lovely photos, and you\'ll likely catch a few brides or girls on their fiesta de quincea\u00f1era- it\'s a popular place to take photos on special occasions. As a visitor it\'s a delight to see people on important days of their lives like that, the joy is a bit contagious. My friends and I also rode the carousel (only 20 pesos at the time of my visit) for a good laugh and 360 view of the city and valley. There was also a small fee for parking, but I believe that you can park farther down and walk up if you don\'t mind the hike.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

250422308.name: Great piece ofe history
250422308.author: a TripAdvisor user
250422308.reviewBody: Even though the museum is fairly small, it is indeed very interesting. You will learn about city history and enjoy the fantastic views from up there. Take your cameras because you wont get a better view of the city than from here. Just one thing I would like to suggest, if you are taking a stroller be prepared to carry the stroller when going up or down stairs as there are no.ramps or elevators. Take comfortable shoes and water there wont be anyone selling anything up there. Be prepared to walk sometimes uphill.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

248160807.name: Great views
248160807.author: a TripAdvisor user
248160807.reviewBody: Museum is fairly small, Sunday entrance is free, on a clear day you can enjoy great views of the city, the visit can be done in about an hour.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

224255738.name: The view of Monterrey
224255738.author: a TripAdvisor user
224255738.reviewBody: We did visit the museum, but the bit we really remember is the view. Amazing panoramic view of the whole City and surrounding mountains. You can drive virtually to the top, walking the last 100m to the viewing area. Well worth the visit, especially on a clear day. .

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

205603531.name: Beautiful museum but better outside.
205603531.author: a TripAdvisor user
205603531.reviewBody: This museum has not much inside but outside it has beautiful view of the whole city, you can sit on one of the cannons used for war and see how the world goes on down there in the city. If you go on weekends, they have a free lights and sound show for everyone at around 9 p.m., you will see lots of cars with couples doing their stuff, not very family oriented after dark, more like a motel 6 on wheels if you know what I mean, almost no police presence after dark.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

188145245.name: Very nice view of the city better at night be there before 10 pm close
188145245.author: a TripAdvisor user
188145245.reviewBody: This place is not close to pubic I was there dec 18 2013 nice view of the city a much to see not too far too walk from hilton inn in monterry very steep be in good shape if you are planning to walk parking available at if your drive with a car

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

169459115.name: Great view, but please go earlier if you want to enjoy more on the night view
169459115.author: a TripAdvisor user
169459115.reviewBody: We were arriving there late near to 10pm. They are very punctual in the closure, and they closed the gate at 10 sharp. I think its bad since we need to climb over the gate to get into our car, but quite a good experience to climb over the gate. The view from Obispado is gorgeous !! We were there during the SUPER LUNA thus had the chance to take a photo with the Super Luna and Cerro de La Silla. Great but limited time to enjoy. Will go again but earlier ^.^

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

164960203.name: Nice view!...
164960203.author: a TripAdvisor user
164960203.reviewBody: You should visit this place, because it gives you the chance to see in a unique way the city of Montterey.\n\nDuring the night the city looks beautiful and the area is more than safe. Check the area near the church and also the top were is placed the Mexico Flag.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

157915002.name: a good option if you don\'t want to spend much time
157915002.author: a TripAdvisor user
157915002.reviewBody: the best thing is the view from the obispado deck, however do spend a few minutes wondering around the museum, nice collection of sacred art.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

123284076.name: On a clear day you can see the whole city.
123284076.author: a TripAdvisor user
123284076.reviewBody: The place is very old and needs more up-keeping but if you love history you have to go.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

122838971.name: Important Landmark of the city.
122838971.author: a TripAdvisor user
122838971.reviewBody: Go there for the historical exhibition, but more over, got to see the city from the top in an almost 360C view at the museum or at the flag pole area just 100 meters away from the museum in the top of the mountain. As a foreigner you might not be that interested in regional history, but the architecture and the view make this visit totally worth it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

1527004.name: Beautiful View
1527004.author: a TripAdvisor user
1527004.reviewBody: I have just returned from Monterrey. I visited the Obispado during my last night there. It was magnificent and the view of the city at night is great. The building is open and it actually has some nice pieces of Mexican historia. I would encourage anyone to visit this site.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

415084.name: The Straight Scoop...
415084.author: a TripAdvisor user
415084.reviewBody:
The Obispado *was* closed for renovations a few months ago, but it re-opened fairly quickly. It's a fascinating building in its own right, situated atop a hill with a commanding view of the entire city, and was built as a home for the retiring archbishop (in the U.S. we would probably call this "the bishop's palace").

There is a small admission fee to get in. The museum itself focuses on the fascinating history of the state of Nuevo Leon. There are exhibits depicting early Spanish colonial exploration and settlement in the region, events of the Mexican revolution and the war against the United States, and there are several exhibits that explain some of the story behind the state's major industries (beer brewing, steel, glass, packaging, etc.) One of the most interesting exhibits in my opinion were the clerical robes and religious artifacts used in the city's churches and cathedrals.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

405317.name: Museo del Obispado
405317.author: a TripAdvisor user
405317.reviewBody:
Somebody wrote a review in July 2001 that the Obispado is now closed to preserve it.  Well I was there in October 2001 and toured it, so either this review was told the wrong info. or they changed their mind.

In any case, it's well worth seeing.  The views are great atop the hill overlooking city, and lots of historical displays inside.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

258008.name: Historic church
258008.author: a TripAdvisor user
258008.reviewBody:
El Obispado is no longer open to the public. The general public isn't allowed inside anymore, to preserve it.
Supposedly the mexicans fought off an army from the U.S.A.
relatively easily from the high elevation. Pancho Villa supposedly hid there for a time.

   The view of Monterrey at night from Obispado is spectacular. Bring a good camera and a tripod.

address.streetAddress: Calle Rafael J. Verger s/n Colonia Obispado

588089457.name: Metropolitan Center, Monterrey, Mexico, 6/2018
588089457.author: a TripAdvisor user
588089457.reviewBody: shopping center is very modern and in one of the best and most expensive quarters of Monterrey with business areas, large office buildings and restaurants, so it is fairly safe. You find all major cloth chains, a large Adidas (bought the mexican WM football tricot) and Puma store. Wothwhile to have a look

address.streetAddress: Lazaro Cardenas #2400 Valle Oriente

539104256.name: Nice high-end restaurant area
539104256.author: a TripAdvisor user
539104256.reviewBody: Located right across the street of Fashin Drive, a nice and secure area in San Pedro municipality. This is not a shopping center but a restaurant area. It combines the best of the best cuisines such as steaks houses, seafood, regional, fusion, Italian, etc. it has a big comfortable parking lot and offers valet parking also. Very exclusive but somehow expensive.

address.streetAddress: Lazaro Cardenas #2400 Valle Oriente

521492387.name: Average place if you don\'t want to get out of San Pedro then it\'s OK
521492387.author: a TripAdvisor user
521492387.reviewBody: This place is like a little commercial plaza with tons of restaurants and typically people who visit this place are San Pedro people who can afford the high prices for the Mexicans so the place is visited by those with a fat wallet and their friends. They have US stores just like in the US but double the prices of course. Good to go and watch people walk around or buy yourself some snack and walk around, nothing that wows people just another average shopping center.

address.streetAddress: Lazaro Cardenas #2400 Valle Oriente

648484594.name: The best part of Monterrey!
648484594.author: a TripAdvisor user
648484594.reviewBody: The Barrio Antiguo offers a pristine and authentic excursion into Mexico\'s colourful, colonial and indigenous history. You\'ll find interesting architecture and great bars which usually offer live music acts every night. There\'s a vibrant but extremely relaxed nightlife scene with many fairly new, leaned-back venues and hip options nicely nestled into the old town atmosphere.

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

599882382.name: One of my favorite parts of the city!
599882382.author: a TripAdvisor user
599882382.reviewBody: Tons of restaurants, galleries and other interesting things to see.  It is fairly clean too and people are friendly here.

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

589057403.name: Mostly closed shops, not much there.
589057403.author: a TripAdvisor user
589057403.reviewBody: After a little restoration project a few years ago this was set to be a trendy place to visit. Not so. Most of the shops were closed. A few open restaurants selling boring food. Disappointing

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

553584741.name: Get drunk
553584741.author: a TripAdvisor user
553584741.reviewBody: Don\'t forget to have a night tour at Barrio Antiguo and get drunk, La Iguana, since 1991 it\'s the right place.

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

540563301.name: Old vibrant neighborhood..
540563301.author: a TripAdvisor user
540563301.reviewBody: The friendly vibes, antiques all around and colorful buildings will be worth it.. I am in Monterrey for a while so I have been here twice - once on a very sunny day and second time in good pleasant weather.. it is crowded on both days.. :) \nThe place is lined up with cafes and restaurants and there are streets with carts for shopping - books, antiques, incenses, handicrafts and what not.. it is so beautiful to just walk through these lanes even if you don\'t shop much.. be careful as it is crowded, not sure how safe it is at night.\n

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

527138346.name: Worth the visit!
527138346.author: a TripAdvisor user
527138346.reviewBody:
According to my Mexican colleague, this place has been around since the 17th century, and lots of the buildings were from that time.

This place has lots of small stalls selling all sorts of things, there are lots of restaurant and bars around.

We went in the afternoon and the weather is quite hot, we couldn't finish covering all the streets.

Worth a visit to experience an old town

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

521194672.name: Very nice old-town feeling
521194672.author: a TripAdvisor user
521194672.reviewBody: This is a very nice part of town, with lots of bars, nightclubs and restaurants. It really comes to life at night. Great place to have dinner and some drinks.

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

488544546.name: Great place for human observation
488544546.author: a TripAdvisor user
488544546.reviewBody: Walking around the neighborhood with a camera (during the day) is a great way to take in the surroundings without feeling rushed or out of place. It\'s more crowded at night and there are plenty of opportunities to dance, drink and dine.

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

481247557.name: Monterrey\'s "Old town"
481247557.author: a TripAdvisor user
481247557.reviewBody: This place is booming with bars again after the city became un safe.   As in every big city, watch out for pick pockets and try to walk in places where there are others walking.  Very nice and lively place.  For every budget and taste.

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

472223097.name: The 6th Street of Monterrey
472223097.author: a TripAdvisor user
472223097.reviewBody: They have a bar for every style of person and every personality. Romantic places like Tres Lunas are my favorite, which is more of a cafe. Bars are fun at night, a great place to drink with friends!

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

463742510.name: The place for pub crawlers
463742510.author: a TripAdvisor user
463742510.reviewBody:
To start with barrio antiguo is a place suitable for
1) photo shoots with nice background of antique buildings and patios.
2) To gather with friends and have drinks in various pubs and food joints
Prices are reasonable. This place can be reached through metro as well and is near santa lucia.
At times we see food carnival and concerts going on. Nice fountain with sculptres and some government buildings make the place worth a visit. Most happening place and worth visiting

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

439774849.name: Walking back in time
439774849.author: a TripAdvisor user
439774849.reviewBody: The barrio Antiguo is a section of Monterrey that is on hold in time. all the constructions there are from the late 1800\'s and are very well kept. Some are transformed inside into restaurants and bars which are great. Very safe zone with many friendly people

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

424201336.name: Mixed feelings
424201336.author: a TripAdvisor user
424201336.reviewBody: Used to be a great place to be on Saturday night and to stroll on Sundays. Unfortunately I do not think it is still as safe as it used to be. Best to go in a group if you choose to and take a taxi back.

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

359365574.name: Walk the streets
359365574.author: a TripAdvisor user
359365574.reviewBody: I was surprised to find this place well and alive, if you know what I mean. On a Saturday night it had a amicable atmosphere, typical of northerners. There are plenty of places to choose from, such as restaurants, music and clubs is up to you.\nPay attention to where you park, is best to take a taxi.

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

341718158.name: Night life !
341718158.author: a TripAdvisor user
341718158.reviewBody: Younger nicely dressed locals with a few nice clubs/bars down jose morrelos the most busy street. Drinks are cheap!!!!!! if you love beer get a caguama! less than $5 for a 32 oz. indio. Cafe igana is a really awesome rock bar and the interior is just amazing. Try to go when the full club is open. My dad and I had a blast drinking till 2 am three out of 5 nights spent in monterrey....we were walking up and down the street all the way thru macro plaza. We stayed out til 3am and had no problems whatsoever. Great times! Cant wait to go back.

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

338508589.name: Not what it used to be
338508589.author: a TripAdvisor user
338508589.reviewBody: This place used to be clean, safe and fun but after lot of things happened in Monterrey, this place became dangerous specially at night, it was full of discoth\u00e8ques now some remaining around but still not safe at night.

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

331722839.name: Historical beauty!
331722839.author: a TripAdvisor user
331722839.reviewBody:
There are plenty of art museums, galleries, and little shops to occupy a person for an afternoon. The best day of all to go, though, is Sunday afternoon for the street market which includes local crafts, antiques, and just about everything in between.

The restaurants in the Barrio range from cheap to very expensive and there are many types of cuisine. 

Make sure to pay attention to the different architecture styles and to peek down the different little streets along the way. You never know what you will find!

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

323100289.name: Good place for night life
323100289.author: a TripAdvisor user
323100289.reviewBody: I\'ve frequented Barrio Antiguo during my stay in MTY and had a great time every time. There are a plethora of bars, nightclubs and restaurants. During the weekend days there is even a market on some of the back streets that sells an array of mexican arts and crafts.

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

320222583.name: Nice neighborhood but nothing extraordinary
320222583.author: a TripAdvisor user
320222583.reviewBody: This neighborhood has old Mexican architecture in downtown Monterrey, with restaurants, bars, small art galleries and a few hostels. It has good day and night ambient but I think the whole area needs improvements in building facades and urban infrastructure, moreover in the quality of the streets pavement. Still you can go on weekend mornings to have a good Mexican breakfast, buy some "artesanias" (handcrafts), and then go to the near Macro-Plaza. For young people the nightlife is ok but is not the best of town.

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

315216869.name: Best place in Monterrey!
315216869.author: a TripAdvisor user
315216869.reviewBody: I absolutely love this place! I fell in love with this place the minute I saw it. It has this colonial vibe to it and there are a bunch of hidden read awesome places that you have to find because its not very visible from outside. There is a sunday antique fair during the day that is out of this world. If you are in Monterrey you absolutely have to go there! In terms of security, I wouldn\'t go there at night, it tends to attract shady characters.

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

298930043.name: Great walk in the old town
298930043.author: a TripAdvisor user
298930043.reviewBody: It is not that alive as it used to, but it is safe now that the clubs are gone. There is still some bars, cafes and enough to keep you busy for some hours. Its worth a visit but avoid middays on sunny days since it get hot with not many shades around. The best places are there, and I mean bars with personality like the Cafe Iguanas, the 13 Lunas and the Akbal Bar upstairs from the Casa del Maiz restaurant.\n\nTry the weekend market in the calle Mina, they start 11 am or leave at 7pm on sundays, you will find some upscale art and not the usual maret stall stuff besides antiques and tourist.

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

205604165.name: Not worth the visit unless during the day
205604165.author: a TripAdvisor user
205604165.reviewBody: This place used to be a nice place with lots of bars and restaurants to enjoy nightlife, now with all the crime in Monterrey , it has turned out to be a place for prostitutes, crime and gang activity,\nYou can appreciate beautiful decorated house during the day, walk a little but DO NOT adventure to go at night or you will be disappointed, if you decide to drive around, lock your doors and be aware of your surroundings.

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

156707209.name: Colonial side of Monterrey
156707209.author: a TripAdvisor user
156707209.reviewBody: Walk narrow cobblestone streets to unique bohemian like restaurants and shops. Monterrey doesn\'t have many places like Barrio Antiguo, the small neighborhood is similar to Oaxaca City. Go on a Sunday afternoon to a very cool artisan street market.

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

147379844.name: Beautiful but Dangerous
147379844.author: a TripAdvisor user
147379844.reviewBody: It used to be the center of nightlife but at the moment most of the restaurants and bars are closed because of the insecurity problems. It is a beautiful place to drive through but I dont think it is safe at night!

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

145251807.name: Nightlife is mostly gone...
145251807.author: a TripAdvisor user
145251807.reviewBody:
Unfortunately most of the information on Trip Advisor is very outdated regarding Bario Antiguo as it relates to the nightlife.   In most recent years this area was plagued by Narco traffic shootings and killings.   Unfortunately the once vibrant nightlife has disappeared and many clubs have since closed.   Even on a Saturday night only a few places remain open, but few people venture there.   Most locals will discourage tourists from visiting Bario Antiguo and the nightlife scene has moved on to other parts of the city.   At this point, it only is worth visiting during the daytime as the former nightlife is just a shadow of its former self.    This all started with a shoot-out and killing at Cafe Iguana (Another user posted a review, which indicates they have since closed).   Locals got scared and stopped coming.

I wanted to see this for myself as it was hard to believe - I had very fond memories.   I did visit one of the few places remaining open in this area called Nueva Luna.   It had live music that started around 10:30 at night (I went on a Saturday) and drinks were cheap (30 pesos for a beer).

However, if you are planning on a night out in Barrio Antiguo itself you would be better off going somewhere else.   When I asked about Barrio Antiguo at the hotel, another hotel guest was listening to my conversation with the hotel clerk.  I could see her negative expression and head shaking.   She told me to avoid, but I still went out of curiosity. .   Should have listen to her.

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

123284172.name: It gives you the feeling of being in a small provincial town!
123284172.author: a TripAdvisor user
123284172.reviewBody: Brides go and take their pictures there.  and I just love to drive around it, it is very old Mexico style.  At night the bars are sometimes good sometimes not.  Better to go with someone who knows the area.

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

122838969.name: Historical in the day, time to party in the night
122838969.author: a TripAdvisor user
122838969.reviewBody: nice walk with Art Galleries and cafe\'s during the day, night clubs and restaurant during the evening. unfortunately right now is not the best place to go during the evening, but walking during the day is really nice. Is right behind Marco, that is other must see place of the city.

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

121788489.name: Old School Charm
121788489.author: a TripAdvisor user
121788489.reviewBody: This area might be considered as dangerous to many these days. But on Sunday, in the afternoon, it comes alive again. And you can find craft, vintage items, art etc. Also some cool cafes such as Trece Luna, Tierra Libre in the area for the weekday boredom.  A must-go in Monterrey!

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

19446125.name: Update - Still got it going on
19446125.author: a TripAdvisor user
19446125.reviewBody: I noticed some of the reviews where old, so I thought I\'d fresh\'n it up.  The barrio is still the place from Wed to Sat. Best days on the weekend, you will find every sort of music you like and a few places to eat.  lots of people there on the weekends, you will be able to accomodate most age ranges 18 +

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

6503085.name: barrio antiguo is the coolest
6503085.author: a TripAdvisor user
6503085.reviewBody: I\u00b4ve been visiting the barrio antiguo area since I first started going to Monterrey years ago and Its has changed. for the best I think. here there is a wide variety of music and scenes. from spanish pop to reggae. for heavy metal try a bar on morelos named "Ibex" Its all a heavy metal place should be. there was a 10 peso cover last time I went in, and 10 pesos a beer. but it can be higer if theres a well known band inside, and they bring them from as far as sweden. theres a couple reggae bars on Morelos and Mina. One is the "Waye" its a small place where you can have a conversation and relax some times they have a band come and play beer is 15 pesos. across the street is the "Riviera" its also a reggae bar with ska thrown in to the mix they also have live music I heard three bands in one night and theres no cover. the beer and drinks are really cheap at 10 pesos for beer and 35 pesos for mixed drinks and they even sell 32 oz bottles and the rare and elusive Indio and sol brava 40 oz which is nearly impossible to find elsewhwere, believe me I asked and was told theyre available in Mexico city. there is the "Cafe Iguana" and "Antropolis", which are very large and crowded the music was pretty good but they started playing music that caters to soccer hooligans so theres a bit of scuffles. the beer is cheap here at 10 pesos but they dont have mixed drinks. they dont have cover chargeaswell. theres all types of clubs for all tastes so find the one thats right for you. and dont forget on sundays "El Callejon Del Arte" it s the "art alley"  theres all types of people selling antiques and hand made objects and art.

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

1502542.name: Nice buildings in Barrio Antiguo
1502542.author: a TripAdvisor user
1502542.reviewBody: This was a nice area to visit durring the day if you like to look at old buildings and some really cool doors. We didn\'t hit it at nite, but I was told that people really like to party there.. just be careful of the cop cost if you are drinking to much. But over all it was close to the marco, inter plaza (shopping) so worth a walk over there.

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

1261044.name: Definatly the place to be... Barrio Antiguo
1261044.author: a TripAdvisor user
1261044.reviewBody:
I am a 25yr old IT consultant who was sent to Monterrey for two weeks to do some work for a regional office. My trip ended up lasting 3 weeks, and I must say that all of my time outside of work was spent in Barrio Antiguo area. One of the hottest disco's in this area is the KokoLoco. the club is 3 floors & It features 2 different dance floors, the first of which is Alternative/Rock and was the most fun for me... 
The 2nd and 3rd floor feature Pop & Dance Music.. the third floor is a loft over looking the 2nd. Drinks are cheap here and the best night to go is Friday. If you are looking for just a simple bar, I really enjoyed the Nueva Luna. It is a resturant/bar featuring live music every night of the week. There are sooo many bars and discos in this area I have a hard time remembering all of the names but I can tell you that this is one of the hottest cities I have ever been to when it came to a weekend night life. Barrio Antiguo is definatly the place to be as it reminded me alot of Burbon Street New Orleans (with out the bad smell and dirty atmosphere) on friday and sat nights.... I have seen mention of the Blue Moon in other posts.. this too was a very nice bar to visit playing the latest in Hip-hop/rap/dance music. The Blue Moon is not in Barrio Antiguo, but is located in the Plaza area. Drinks here were also fairly cheap. For resturants, I would reccomend the following...

La Bikni - 5 Star resturant with all types of food & featuring live music. La Bikni also features a disco on the roof featuring all types of music.

La Parola - 5 Star Itilan Resturant with all the trimmings. Very romantic to take your specail someone

La Valentina - 5 Star resturant featuring all kinds of food, but dress nice and make a reservation or you wont get in. La Valentina also features a disco (I forgot the name of the disco) with exellent music.

Bambuka - This is a Resturant/Bar/disco with a New York City atmosphere. This Resturant/Bar sits on the second floor of a building featuring indoor/outdoor dining, good music and Large Plasma screens playing music videos... Again Dress Nice and Make a reservation or you wont get in....

And remember Taxi's are VERY cheap in Mexico so don't do anything stupid.... take a taxi to and from your hotel if you plan to go drinking... ;-) Hope this helps some of you and I hope you are able to enjoy Monterrey Mexico as much as I did...

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

1229441.name: Hottest City in the world!!!!!!!!!!
1229441.author: a TripAdvisor user
1229441.reviewBody: If you are looking for a good time head to Monterrey,Mexico. I travel to mexico a few times a year each time to Monterrey. When I go me and my friends hit the clubs and bars along with everything in between. \nSaltillo is cool and a lot more laid back. I was there from August 5th-13th 2003. IF you\'re looking for hot rap clubs there is nothing better than Republica. It\'s located in Barrio Antiguo and it\'s pretty new. Thursday night is the best night to go. When Republica isn\'t rap- everyone goes to At Loft. It\'s just down the street from Republica and it\'s almost as good. If your\'e looking for bars Mangos is cool it\'s just causal laid back, where as Blue Moon is trendy and cool. You won\'t regret going to monterrey! It\'s the best city in the world. :)

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

1149822.name: A Cool Place
1149822.author: a TripAdvisor user
1149822.reviewBody: this is a great place to hang out, it rocks being here because all the bars and discos are so close to each other that you can go bar hopping until morning, there is a place for every taste, there are some places that you can go to hear live bands of jazz, blues, etc, while drinking some coffe or some places to hear rock and party! those places are located in 17th century old buildings or i dont know how old but it gives great look and feeling. So COOL!!!

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

842219.name: Gotta love Barrio Antiguo!
842219.author: a TripAdvisor user
842219.reviewBody: I just came back from living in Monterrey for six months. Barrio Antiguo is by far my favorite part of the city. This is where all the bars and clubs are at. The perfect place to go party all night!\n

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

719306.name: one little thing...
719306.author: a TripAdvisor user
719306.reviewBody: Although it\'s true that it\'s an old part of the city, where some buildings date as far back as the 17th century, the description featured in this webpage fails to mention that the place is also crammed full of bars, clubs, coffeehouses and such where college students and young professionals hang out.\nI think it\'s a very cool place.\n

address.streetAddress: Calle Padre Raymundo Jardon de Mayo 5 Zona Centro

670168312.name: New Palace
670168312.author: a TripAdvisor user
670168312.reviewBody: The Base Ball Stadium of Sultanes de Monterrey was totally renewed in 2018. It\u00b4s a very good place to go with family to enjoy base ball games. Since last years you could see in a renew stadium, the oficial season of mexican base ball league and in some months of the year you could see major league base ball games with several teams. This people is doing a very good job.

address.streetAddress: Manuel Barragan

603468697.name: Renewed Stadium, Big Leagues Style!! -Only smaller-
603468697.author: a TripAdvisor user
603468697.reviewBody: Always a good time while in Monterrey to visit the Baseball Stadium. I suggest you not to be on "Butaca" but on the lower levels behind 1st base (you\'ll avoid the sun, will have an excellent view and would "feel" the crowd vibes).

address.streetAddress: Manuel Barragan

587005716.name: Atmosphere of a AAA game in the States.
587005716.author: a TripAdvisor user
587005716.reviewBody: My wife and I were in town and her family gave us free tickets to the baseball game. The atmosphere and the stadium reminded me of a AAA game in the US. Each section had its own beer attendant which made it nice. The quality of play was good and there were a couple former major leaguers in the lineup. The music and cheers seemed non stop but I realize that this is the trend at all major sporting events. It does keep the crowd involved. If you like baseball, you won\u2019t be disappointed. One recommendation is to arrive super early because traffic is terrible and parking is worse.

address.streetAddress: Manuel Barragan

581469516.name: As good as most stadiums in United sTates
581469516.author: a TripAdvisor user
581469516.reviewBody: I\'ve been to all but 5 major league baseball stadiums and this park was as impressive as most.  It has a great scoreboard and great place to watch a game

address.streetAddress: Manuel Barragan

367450660.name: Monterreys baseball stadium
367450660.author: a TripAdvisor user
367450660.reviewBody: Even though Monterrey is his a fan or famous for baseball, going to the baseball stadium in Monterrey is quite an experience, you can see all kind of people, from young child/teens up to senior citizens enjoying a nice ball game.

address.streetAddress: Manuel Barragan

363742754.name: Fun to spend some family time!
363742754.author: a TripAdvisor user
363742754.reviewBody: The stadium is older, but it is still very functional. Very traditional ball game fare, with peanuts, popcorn, soda, beer, and traditional Mexican snacks as well. Parking is limited, but we were able to find a spot with the help of some guys running around outside.

address.streetAddress: Manuel Barragan

661715094.name: Beautiful place
661715094.author: a TripAdvisor user
661715094.reviewBody: Well, if you come to Monterrey and walk by downtown you should go to the catedral.. the arquitectura it\u2019s beautiful. You feel welcomed, hearted and peaceful.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral Metropolitana de Nuestra Senora de Monterrey

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

578409576.name: Worth a Visit
578409576.author: a TripAdvisor user
578409576.reviewBody: As long as you\'re touring the Macroplaza (as I hope you are if you\'re visiting here), it\'s worth stopping into this church.  They have some pretty murals and stained glass and the architecture outside is nice to take in as well.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral Metropolitana de Nuestra Senora de Monterrey

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

562732483.name: A quick must see when downtown.
562732483.author: a TripAdvisor user
562732483.reviewBody: Stop and see the central city cathedral. It is a quick visit and a nice small renovated cathedral. Pope John Paul II stopped here and there is a plaque dedicated to his visit to Monterrey.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral Metropolitana de Nuestra Senora de Monterrey

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

562592727.name: Beautiful, but okay to skip
562592727.author: a TripAdvisor user
562592727.reviewBody: The most impressive part of this cathedral is the sculptures. The inside decor is very simple, and has an ornate mural behind the altar. If you\u2019re pressed for time, it\u2019s okay to skip this cathedral. Although beautiful, there are more impressive places to visit in this area.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral Metropolitana de Nuestra Senora de Monterrey

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

553578198.name: Lovely, not spectacular
553578198.author: a TripAdvisor user
553578198.reviewBody: This is a beautiful, mostly simple, cathedral.  The facade is the most elaborate part of the architecture.  Inside, it is mostly white and plain except for the altar area which has colorful, contemporary murals above.  It is a peaceful refuge right off the Macroplaza area. Worth stepping into for a few, calm moments.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral Metropolitana de Nuestra Senora de Monterrey

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

546848518.name: Small for a cathedral
546848518.author: a TripAdvisor user
546848518.reviewBody: Mexican Cathedrals tend to dominate the surrounding area and draw you in, such as the Cathedrals in Mexico City, Toluca, and Morelia. Monterrey\'s Cathedral is more subdued, but worth a stop if you are in the centro. It is peaceful and well kept, and features beautiful frescos behind the altar.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral Metropolitana de Nuestra Senora de Monterrey

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

534730558.name: Breathtakingly Beautiful
534730558.author: a TripAdvisor user
534730558.reviewBody: The Cathedral Metropolitana de Nuestra Senora de Monterrey stands out on the edge of the Monterrey Macroplaza. It\'s as beautiful and majestic on the inside as on the exterior.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral Metropolitana de Nuestra Senora de Monterrey

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

534452917.name: BEAUTIFUL!
534452917.author: a TripAdvisor user
534452917.reviewBody: Located at the Macroplaza area.  Big church with a neo classic facade from the end of the 19 Century.  A beautiful architecture in its exterior as well as in the interior.  At the interior, a colored mural above the altar.  A simple altar with detail in wood.  Nice details in stone at the pillars and domes.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral Metropolitana de Nuestra Senora de Monterrey

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

453490320.name: Catedral metropolitana
453490320.author: a TripAdvisor user
453490320.reviewBody: Free entrance of course. It isn\'t a big cathedral but it is very nice to sightsee. You can also take a ride along the ciudad vieja. \nWould be a very good idea to do this visit the same day of parque fundadora and paseo Santa Luc\u00eda.\nNot a good idea for a rainy day.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral Metropolitana de Nuestra Senora de Monterrey

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

440750856.name: Worth a quick look!
440750856.author: a TripAdvisor user
440750856.reviewBody: I wouldn\'t go far out of my way to see this church. It is small but well kept. Worth a look if you see it a few blocks away.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral Metropolitana de Nuestra Senora de Monterrey

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

621330453.name: Great Exhibition hall
621330453.author: a TripAdvisor user
621330453.reviewBody: This was a great venue for the tradeshow I attended.  Loved the dinosaur skeleton in the entry!  Could use a few more dining options, but pretty good overall.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora 501 Colonia Obrera

603465792.name: Top Expo Spot
603465792.author: a TripAdvisor user
603465792.reviewBody: Good business amenities, private rooms, restaurants and even an Oxxo inside. TIP: If participatin on an expo try contacting the "Cintermex" team to purchase packages of promotion better/cheaper than the ones the Expo organizators offer

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora 501 Colonia Obrera

597111892.name: Went for the tattoo expo!
597111892.author: a TripAdvisor user
597111892.reviewBody: Was great fun, at the same time they had animex (anime expo) on. Lots of people. If you come early, its great. Good range of facilities; toliets (a little dirty&in the main area only), food (big line at lunchtime), atms (may seem hidden). You can easily walk to the fast food places outside. As expected, no one spoke English. But the place, space & facilities were great, didn\'t expect these higher standards.  If i was a local, I would return all the time. If you\'re a traveller & interested in an expo, I\'m sure you would enjoy.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora 501 Colonia Obrera

562731925.name: Excellent City Expo Center
562731925.author: a TripAdvisor user
562731925.reviewBody: From holiday shopping, pet shows, book fairs, wedding and home shows, to business specific trade shows and a couple good restaurants too, there is always something happening here. Our favorite is the holiday shopping where you can get great products made in Mexico for cheap prices. I always get my western boots each year here and jewelry for the Mrs. Stop in when it is open to see the dinosaur skeleton in the main hall. \n\nTIP - Park underneath the building.Much easier to get into and out.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora 501 Colonia Obrera

482126398.name: Fabtech 2017 - nice venue
482126398.author: a TripAdvisor user
482126398.reviewBody: Was at Fabtech show, and this place had it all from a built in market, low scale restaurants and very upscale restaurants. Place was very clean and safe, with very attentive and helpful staff that spoke both Spanish and English.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora 501 Colonia Obrera

467128272.name: Nice place for business
467128272.author: a TripAdvisor user
467128272.reviewBody: It is a nice place for business and events! It has several rooms for conferences, or massive events. Also it has a convenience store inside for anything you need and a ATM machine right at the entrance, there\'s also a few restaurants that aren\'t that good but the food is cheap. Also the place is located inside of Parque Fundidora, which has many interesting things to do during the day and you can also visit paseo Santa Lucia. There is a Holidsy inn right in front of Cintermex, people there are very friendly and helpful.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora 501 Colonia Obrera

464489058.name: Nice host venue for an event - Expo Carnes
464489058.author: a TripAdvisor user
464489058.reviewBody: This venue played host to Expo Carnes this past week.  The facility is very diverse in nature, with shops, services, and tourist attractions.  There is a dinosaur skeleton near one skeleton, and outside that entrance, there is a park made in a rehabilitated area that once housed steel mills - some of the old equipment is integrated into the park, making an interesting view.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora 501 Colonia Obrera

444924969.name: Unless your event is an expo, wont do any event again there
444924969.author: a TripAdvisor user
444924969.reviewBody: Went there for a 2 hour conference as a support team and I honestly would suggest anyone dont do their event there, unless you have no other option. Lack or personnel, no one seem to care during event setup, some area smell like piss everywhere.\n\nDo your event at a hotel

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora 501 Colonia Obrera

439325584.name: Great!!!
439325584.author: a TripAdvisor user
439325584.reviewBody: I was there for some conferences and ended up loving the place which includes ice rink, different museums, and even Jesus Adrian Romero\'s Church! great stuff!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora 501 Colonia Obrera

381585890.name: Congreso petrolero
381585890.author: a TripAdvisor user
381585890.reviewBody: Nice venue for trading shows. Air conditioner works fine. The issue is that to pay parking ticket there are a long line. They should permit you pay at anytime, the rate is flat, they limit the exit up to 15 min after you pay?

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora 501 Colonia Obrera

381352814.name: It\'s big
381352814.author: a TripAdvisor user
381352814.reviewBody: The convention center in Monterrey is big. There are places to eat. It has an adequate hotel nearby. Don\'t expect high tech or amazing service.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora 501 Colonia Obrera

358183444.name: Exhibit hall that is largely empty
358183444.author: a TripAdvisor user
358183444.reviewBody: This appears to be a modern exhibit space with some offices, stores and fast food places. Most of it was empty, although they had a great dinosaur skeleton in the lobby. The food is so-so (all fast food) but there was handy convenience store here.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora 501 Colonia Obrera

352931824.name: Huge enormous site
352931824.author: a TripAdvisor user
352931824.reviewBody: I attended a relatively small 250 person event this week with the Governor and all worked well.  The odd part is the space is enormous  for 1000\'s.  Our room was nice and it was easy to go up two fights on an escalator to get there. Apparenlty the old Fundidora was the best job in town at one point and this is an historic venue of sorts.  Why only three stars then?  Parking log.  Driver had to leave me in the car waiting as he got out of the car at the parkihg area to pay in one of two machines.  All 250 of us at the same meeting got out at the same time and there was a line.  Imagine with a bigger meeting and it was traffic

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora 501 Colonia Obrera

341569737.name: Another expo center
341569737.author: a TripAdvisor user
341569737.reviewBody:
This is the same thing you'll see anywhere else in the world. This is a exposition center. 

Its a medium size expo. Nothing really interesting to see inside but the expos 

Traffic to get there its horrible at any time

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora 501 Colonia Obrera

277849189.name: Nice trade show venue
277849189.author: a TripAdvisor user
277849189.reviewBody: I exhibited at a trade show here (Fabtech). It\'s a nice venue with everything you would expect. There are plenty of staff available to help when you need something. There are restaurant / caf\u00e9 options for eating as well as a convenient store located in the common area. The only problem I had this time was the public Wifi never worked during the entire show. The outside area is nice as well with re-purposed foundry cauldrons as fountains and direct access to Parque Fundidora. Plenty of taxis available just outside the gates.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora 501 Colonia Obrera

274841418.name: Typical convention center
274841418.author: a TripAdvisor user
274841418.reviewBody: Typical convention center in Mexico.  Not heated so if a cold front comes through be prepared with a coat.  It has happened it gets very cold inside.  Ample space inside with ample restrooms.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora 501 Colonia Obrera

260163010.name: Miss more food options
260163010.author: a TripAdvisor user
260163010.reviewBody: Cintermex is a pretty nice and huge place for fairs in Monterrey. It is located in Fundidora Park and many of great fairs occurs here. The issue in my opinion is that their food court contains few options. If it has more options definitely would be great.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora 501 Colonia Obrera

244673082.name: Nice, modern, safe convention center.
244673082.author: a TripAdvisor user

Is easy to get to and has good well lit parking.  There is a fee for parking.  The shows are either free, or a small fee.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora 501 Colonia Obrera

239435440.name: Good place for events
239435440.author: a TripAdvisor user
239435440.reviewBody: I went there with my father for an environmental engineering event. The place has clean restrooms, restaurants inside the building and a small Oxxo store where you can have some coffee, snacks or even burritos or tacos.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora 501 Colonia Obrera

238789682.name: Nice movie theater
238789682.author: a TripAdvisor user
238789682.reviewBody: Movie admission is mx 48 which was at the time like 4 dollars!\nIt is a non smoking place but close the garage they allow people to smoke and keel the door open which is basically allowing people to smoke inside as smoke all goes in.\nThey should make law to smoke 10 meters off the doors for other people\'s comfort, seats could use a little more love

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora 501 Colonia Obrera

167519584.author: a TripAdvisor user
167519584.reviewBody: A great place to conduct business with good quality restaurants - a one stop shop to do business. The amenities, AV and service do a business traveler right and make meetings peasant.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora 501 Colonia Obrera

163298277.name: Nice place to Walk
163298277.author: a TripAdvisor user
163298277.reviewBody: Nice place to walk and calm down, needless to tell the boat trip is really fun, the tourist guy telling "local" jokes is awesome and hilarious, bad thing those jokes are only in spanish, I dont know if there is a trip in english.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora 501 Colonia Obrera

160457908.name: Great place to have a show
160457908.author: a TripAdvisor user
160457908.reviewBody: Great place to have a show, we were there for Fabtech and it was very good, they have great service n great food too. They offer you free wifi by the lobby, compare to Mexico City last year, this place was very cool to go, right next to parque Fundidora .

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora 501 Colonia Obrera

145252653.name: Just an average cinema
145252653.author: a TripAdvisor user
145252653.reviewBody: It\'s a cinema in a big city, there\'s not much special about it.. go if you wanna catch a movie!! Nachos with cheese are good! =)

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora 501 Colonia Obrera

138542028.name: Very large and open space
138542028.author: a TripAdvisor user
138542028.reviewBody: This place is great for people looking to slow down the pace.  It is connected via covered walkway/skytube to the hotel next door.  There is also a park beside the cintermex that has benches and plenty of shade.  Not really much to do inside the building, it is mainly offices and meeting rooms for larger groups.  There is a small sports bar/deli on the 2nd level.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora 501 Colonia Obrera

124898337.name: run run run
124898337.author: a TripAdvisor user
124898337.reviewBody: excellent place to you almost anything you want, from joging, running, camping, walking with the kids, ride bike or enjoy the scenary.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora 501 Colonia Obrera

661737496.name: Such a lovely place
661737496.author: a TripAdvisor user
661737496.reviewBody: Absolutely lovely. Really nice place to hang out with friends,family, kids or couples. They are some really nice restaurants, and places to get desserts (cakes,cookies and ice cream). So worth it

address.streetAddress: Carretera Nacional 500, Colonia Valle Alto. Monterrey Nuevo Leon.

588713654.name: Nice Mall in Monterrey
588713654.author: a TripAdvisor user
588713654.reviewBody: Shopping center with many restaurants-Bars, Cinema, bookstore, Kids playcenter and big parking place

address.streetAddress: Av. La Rioja 245 Residencial la Rioja

447340118.name: I went twice during my two week vacation!
447340118.author: a TripAdvisor user
447340118.reviewBody:
I really enjoy shopping at Esfera Centro!
My husband and 7month old son were with me for our first of two trips to shop there, and we brought along my father n law today for our second trip this week. My son was excited for the majority of our time there. He loved the lights of the Christmas tree, Santa (was waving to my son today), all of the people, and new moments for him. 

There are a few nice toy stores with good quality toys, some wooden etc., and there is an arcade and Game Center that is huge and even though he is too little now for this arcade, his face lit up when he heard the sounds and saw all of the colors and excitement in the room. We took a few photos with lights that he liked so I will try and add them to this review. 

I think that I counted 6 or 7 shoe places, my husband and I always go to the sporting goods stores, the Oysho store there is enormous and the best that I have seen, and I love the accessories store Vani for little crystal hair clips and hair bows for gifts to my sons little friends. During both trips, we went to a great coffee place located on the main level, across from Starbucks and a popular sushi place, where I enjoyed a good cappuccino and apple strudel the first time, and then a mocha and slice of chocolate cake the second trip, fantastic! They also had soups and sandwiches and comfortable inviting terrace seating where servers bring foods out to your table for you. Oh, and there are free refills for Americanos and also for a few other coffees. 

The parking in the garage was free both times that we went, and I love that the shopping center wasn't over crowded which made it so that we could enjoy our time there much more, and we didn't have long lines for anything.

address.streetAddress: Av. La Rioja 245 Residencial la Rioja

397134833.name: Movies and restaurAnts
397134833.author: a TripAdvisor user
397134833.reviewBody: Everything great and so close for people who live in this part of town , recommendEd  to visit for shopping and in the way to SANTIAGO town , also for nice restaurants to hang around and have a beer

address.streetAddress: Av. La Rioja 245 Residencial la Rioja

375488960.name: Nice place
375488960.author: a TripAdvisor user
375488960.reviewBody: This mall is nice however it could have a better selection of stores and restaurants. It is called Fashion Hall but except for the H&M store you can find the same stores than anywhere else. The gym has been delaying its opening for months. At least the movie theaters are very good and it is nice to have them so close from home

address.streetAddress: Av. La Rioja 245 Residencial la Rioja

524367174.name: Made me want to go back to school!
524367174.author: a TripAdvisor user
524367174.reviewBody: The Tecnologico de Monterrey is an international College with state of the art facilities, beautiful campus, and excellent programs. I was truly impressed! Were I younger, I\'d try to enroll and take a few tech classes. :)

itemReviewed.name: Instituto Tecnologico de Estudios Superiores de Monterrey (ITESM)

address.streetAddress: Avenida Eugenio Garza Sada y Luis Elizondo Colonia Tecnológico

436432534.name: Alma Mater
436432534.author: a TripAdvisor user
436432534.reviewBody: Visiting is always kind of a nostalgic experience since this is my alma mater. The campus architecture is a postmodern \u2013 Mexican, trying to emulate an American university campus, but with a distinct Mexican flair. At the entrance there is a large mural representing the values of the University in the city of Monterrey. The place was modeled after MIT in Boston MA  and their approach to education is very similar. The campus is always well-maintained, just  impeccable and it\'s a pleasure to walk around. Dara several places were you can have lunch or dinner and if you do I would recommend ordering the "chilaquiles" at any of the cafeterias.

itemReviewed.name: Instituto Tecnologico de Estudios Superiores de Monterrey (ITESM)

address.streetAddress: Avenida Eugenio Garza Sada y Luis Elizondo Colonia Tecnológico

429310603.name: The campus is beautiful!
429310603.author: a TripAdvisor user
429310603.reviewBody: The campus have a mix of architecture! nature! fauna! and modern! The access is limited but if you are able to take a look, you will not regret!

itemReviewed.name: Instituto Tecnologico de Estudios Superiores de Monterrey (ITESM)

421897883.name: Nice short trip in the Campus
421897883.author: a TripAdvisor user
421897883.reviewBody: I just had a short trip to get familiar with the campus. I takes less than one hours to roam around the gardens, the buildings, and the Rectoria building but it\'s enough to grasp the vibrant university environment. Worth to visit.

itemReviewed.name: Instituto Tecnologico de Estudios Superiores de Monterrey (ITESM)

address.streetAddress: Avenida Eugenio Garza Sada y Luis Elizondo Colonia Tecnológico

320259066.author: a TripAdvisor user
320259066.reviewBody: I stayed in a female apartment-style dorm on campus because we visited a friend who is a student. The accommodations were great, as we had our own kitchen, access to laundry facility, and our own private pool!

itemReviewed.name: Instituto Tecnologico de Estudios Superiores de Monterrey (ITESM)

address.streetAddress: Avenida Eugenio Garza Sada y Luis Elizondo Colonia Tecnológico

268536593.name: Best university in Mexico
268536593.author: a TripAdvisor user
268536593.reviewBody: This is a university campus and it is great to visit. Rectoria has a great mural you must take a picture. Building are a beauty, fountains with ducks, peacocks and deer around the garden. There are restaurants and places to sit and enjoy the great trees. Students seem happy.

itemReviewed.name: Instituto Tecnologico de Estudios Superiores de Monterrey (ITESM)

address.streetAddress: Avenida Eugenio Garza Sada y Luis Elizondo Colonia Tecnológico

253115834.name: The best private university in Mexico
253115834.author: a TripAdvisor user
253115834.reviewBody: The main Campus is amazing. First, enter at Rectoria building. Take a picture there with the mural at the back. Then, walk to the library building, it has a fountain up front with many ducks. Walk to the lake and see the peacocks and the deer that stroll around. The gardens are beautiful and the guards are friendly. Worth a visit

itemReviewed.name: Instituto Tecnologico de Estudios Superiores de Monterrey (ITESM)

address.streetAddress: Avenida Eugenio Garza Sada y Luis Elizondo Colonia Tecnológico

246416584.name: Educational and sporting delight!
246416584.author: a TripAdvisor user
246416584.reviewBody:
ITESM campus Monterrey is the main campus of the ITESM system. The best of Latin America. 

This campus is the biggest and it has all the careers (other campus have many of them or only some subjects). It also has the most sport classes. Sport facilities are amazing.

The facilities are delightful; they're huge, so the campus has bicycles for you to move internally. You can also bring your own bicycle.

This University also offers masters' and doctorates' degree programs.

itemReviewed.name: Instituto Tecnologico de Estudios Superiores de Monterrey (ITESM)

address.streetAddress: Avenida Eugenio Garza Sada y Luis Elizondo Colonia Tecnológico

237920018.name: Best University in latin America
237920018.author: a TripAdvisor user
237920018.reviewBody: The I.T.E.S.M. is the most important university in all Latin America. It was originally constructed inspired in yhe MIT buildings. If you have visited both you will feel the resemblance in the older buildings. The buildings from the last three decades have a more modern look. recently a rennovation is being made in the soccer, tennis, pathways etc.

itemReviewed.name: Instituto Tecnologico de Estudios Superiores de Monterrey (ITESM)

address.streetAddress: Avenida Eugenio Garza Sada y Luis Elizondo Colonia Tecnológico

225991196.name: Big changes!
225991196.author: a TripAdvisor user
225991196.reviewBody: After you get graduated, every time you come back to the campus you will find some new places, now Tec de Monterrey is going through lot of changes so the campus will not be the exception. There are bikes available to go around the campus, and some investment is on the roadmap. So proud to be an EXATEC.\nIs important to consider that this is not an attraction so at the entrance you will be questioned about what is the reason of your visit, and could be possible that the security guard not let you go in.

itemReviewed.name: Instituto Tecnologico de Estudios Superiores de Monterrey (ITESM)
