659992616.name: Great View of the city
659992616.author: a TripAdvisor user
659992616.reviewBody: I highly recommend to take a visit, being atop of this hill, would give you an incredible view of the city, it is awesome

624101077.name: Best view of the city
624101077.author: a TripAdvisor user
624101077.reviewBody: At cerro/mirador del obispado you could get the best view of Monterrey city. Try to go before the sunsuet so you can see the day and the night

566700733.name: Great View!!!
566700733.author: a TripAdvisor user
566700733.reviewBody: This place will take your breath away literally..lol..the view is awesome but getting up there is a real work out. You will be able to see the entire city and all the mountains they have..\n

534725232.name: Transport Yourself Back in Time to late 1846
534725232.author: a TripAdvisor user
534725232.reviewBody: It is here where the good people of Monterrey came for safety, as the American Army poured into Monterrey during the Mexican-American War of 1846 to 1848.

521494004.name: Loved the view right before sunset
521494004.author: a TripAdvisor user
521494004.reviewBody: You can see the whole city at anytime during the day, at night they were charging 20 pesos for bringing your car all the way to the top of the mountain, from there you walk a little more and get to the flad, great experience specially at night.

604083334.name: Good place!
604083334.author: a TripAdvisor user
604083334.reviewBody: Bathrooms cold be better and cleaner. Good clean pools. It\'s a great place to take babys and children.

address.streetAddress: Agricola, 3700 - 1 Ote. Colonia Agrícola

478915749.name: Poor management, not enough employees
478915749.author: a TripAdvisor user
478915749.reviewBody: Too expensive for a poorly maintained and overcrowded park. Not a place to enjoy and relax. There is not enough space for all the people that goes during the vacation season. Trash overflowing from trash cans, dirty restrooms etc.\nPaid $250 pesos per person to enter at 4:00 PM, they closed the pools at 5:30 to 6:00, the website says they close at 9:00PM. \nWill not return.

address.streetAddress: Agricola, 3700 - 1 Ote. Colonia Agrícola

424206363.name: Aquamundo
424206363.author: a TripAdvisor user
424206363.reviewBody: The best part of this park is definitely the aquatic area - \'\'Aquamundo". We had fun, however the bathrooms are disgusting. It is quite shocking for a park of such size not to have decently cleaned bathrooms. Also, there should be some more attractions offered soon as there are still very few games for adults.

address.streetAddress: Agricola, 3700 - 1 Ote. Colonia Agrícola

413305513.name: Can\'t mention a positive thing!
413305513.author: a TripAdvisor user
413305513.reviewBody:
I have been there as party guest in August 2015 and 2016, so I do not have an idea of the entrance cost but I would not pay a cent for it. It does not a have a positive side, which a pity as the park is in its 20th anniversary and it should be another icon of the city.

First of all, employees are mostly teenagers without training which do not give a damn for the customer experience. Most of the attractions and rides are in poor conditions and some are closed. The "OVNI" attraction is closed since my 2015 visit; this time, we also found closed the "Maremoto" and "Trenecito". We stayed 1 hour in the line for "Lanchas del Lago Contar" as they had 3 boats broken and only 2 passengers were allowed per boat. Water attractions are closed at 6, the park closes at 7, even on Fridays or Saturdays; employees are rude at closing times as if they try to run away from there as soon as possible. Closed areas smelled terrible.

Food is terrible and expensive. You will only find burgers, hot dogs and snacks. Water is also expensive, a $8 pesos bottle is sold in $25; it is not allowed to access the park with food or beverages, even water.

At the end of the day, they presented a show called "Fiesta" which was a great opportunity for the kids to be with the characters and take photos. However, the parade car looked like made by kids, not at the level it should be.

The park deserves a better management. There is a plaque at the entrance with the logos of 8 or 10 big companies which sponsor the park, I couldn't imagine how will be the park without those funds (if they even exist).

address.streetAddress: Agricola, 3700 - 1 Ote. Colonia Agrícola

401778985.name: Not very well maintained and somehow expensive
401778985.author: a TripAdvisor user
401778985.reviewBody: This place has potential to be a very nice place but unfortunately you see trash around at all times, it is expensive if you take your family and it seem slike none care about this place just to get your money and that is it.NOT good.

address.streetAddress: Agricola, 3700 - 1 Ote. Colonia Agrícola

399367769.name: Small ok theme park
399367769.author: a TripAdvisor user
399367769.reviewBody: Not too bad of a place, I was not impressed by it. Half of the rides and shops were closed, it\'s a small place and with half of it being closed was upsetting.overall ok for the price we paid. Aquamundo shuts down at 6pm.

address.streetAddress: Agricola, 3700 - 1 Ote. Colonia Agrícola

386228520.name: Fantastic
386228520.author: a TripAdvisor user
386228520.reviewBody: i went with my kids several times  in their younger years, but i definitely go again for them, the pools are clean, the rides are excellent, it is a bit expensive but you can stay there all day without getting tired. check schedules for the shows, do not missed that last parade.

address.streetAddress: Agricola, 3700 - 1 Ote. Colonia Agrícola

277885154.name: If your daughter loves Elmo...
277885154.author: a TripAdvisor user
277885154.reviewBody:
This is the place to go...

It's a small theme park but the staff is very helpful, friendly and nice. Monsters are very friendly and playful with the kids so my toddler loved it.

The water park was a relief since it was a very hot day (Wear lots of sunscreen) but it looks like it had better days. 

Some things need a good clean up like the changing rooms in the Aquatic park. No changing tables and rusted dirty floors with poor lighting. 

Some rides where not working but it was not a big deal for us since our daughter is too young for them.

It's a nice place but it is a shame to see it a little bit let down. It has potential to be an awesome place for both kids and adults. 

If your toddler is a Sesame Street fan, this is the place to go. It's super cheap.

We wouldn't mind to pay a little bit extra for better installations.

address.streetAddress: Agricola, 3700 - 1 Ote. Colonia Agrícola

258811211.name: Good
258811211.author: a TripAdvisor user
258811211.reviewBody: Is a good place for todlers and small kids, that know and like sesame street. There not too many atractions, the food is bad, and a little expensive (because quality is really low, only one kind of burgers, one kind of hot dogs, and that\'s all). But the shows with the sesame street characters are good, and kids enjoy that. In summer there is a water park, I\'ve never been. \nWatch out with the cup-cakes, are painted with colors that leave stains in skin for days, and in clothes will never leave.\n

address.streetAddress: Agricola, 3700 - 1 Ote. Colonia Agrícola

164798674.name: This place is the worst park I have ever been to.
164798674.author: a TripAdvisor user
164798674.reviewBody: If you plan on going to this park think again you will just lose time and money. I worked there for about 2 years as a lifeguarde and it is the worst park ever. They dont contract people to pain the pools so they make the lifeguards paint even if they dont know how. It might not be to hard to paint but there are some stupid people out their. So by the time that they fill up the pools and get it ready for summer you can see paint coming off and it stays in the water. They dont have very good filters for the pools which means that every morning the lifeguards have to go into a green disgusting pool and try to clean it up. Sometimes I would find dead animal in the pool one time we found a snake not too big about a foot long and a small racoon but we would always find cocaroches and they would just take them out like nothing happened and the walls all green I cant believe I ever worked there but money had to come from some were right*\nbut if your young and wana hook up with some one this is the perfect place to go just make sure you go on a busy day*****

address.streetAddress: Agricola, 3700 - 1 Ote. Colonia Agrícola

140172560.name: good amusement park
140172560.author: a TripAdvisor user
140172560.reviewBody: the only thing that I don\'t like about this place is the lack of spaces to sit and rest, everything is so exposed to the sun, and in this hot city you just can\'t afford to be like that.

address.streetAddress: Agricola, 3700 - 1 Ote. Colonia Agrícola

122297751.name: terrible simply terrible
122297751.author: a TripAdvisor user
122297751.reviewBody: water park is disgusting, shows are OK but the theater smells like its been wet for like ever.. not a good place to take your children

address.streetAddress: Agricola, 3700 - 1 Ote. Colonia Agrícola

670165803.name: Totally renewed!
670165803.author: a TripAdvisor user
670165803.reviewBody: The Zoo La Pastora in Guadalupe, outside Monterrey, taking Eloy Cavazos avenue. A very good work was done renewing all the infrastructure of this place. The animal habitats where very suitable for each and the travel into the Zoo is very nice. The animals are in a very good condition and you could find services in food and rest rooms.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Eloy Cavazos Pablo Livas

526786203.name: Great with kids, Animals looks fine
526786203.author: a TripAdvisor user
526786203.reviewBody: We went in family and enjoyed the zoo. Area is pretty extensive with a good variety of animals, looking well treated.\nGood option for weekend family activity or even school event

address.streetAddress: Avenida Eloy Cavazos Pablo Livas

307691749.name: Beautiful except...
307691749.author: a TripAdvisor user
307691749.reviewBody:
The zoo is awesome, we got to see many happy animals in thoughtfully created habitats, the animals looked well cared for, the zoo seems well loved and cared for too. It's also larger than I had imagined, with more species, they have done a nice job.

The only downer? The awful stadium someone decided to build right next to the beautiful zoo. I am not against stadiums, but this was not the place to do it. Inside the zoo is like a tropical Garden of Eden and the stadium looks like a mammoth sized alien space craft that landed in this beautiful jungle. It's HUGE and metallic and industrial looking, in a word it's : awful. . And noisy. But that is not the zoo's fault, the zoo is amazing. 

I was shocked at how little they are charging to get in, we paid 30 pesos for adults and 10 pesos per kid. I think they should charge more to help keep up the maintenance but that is just my opinion.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Eloy Cavazos Pablo Livas

134654836.name: Pleasently surprised....
134654836.author: a TripAdvisor user
134654836.reviewBody: It took over 15 years for me to go back to La Pastora Zoo. On my last visit I was kind of disappointed and sad to see the animals were not on a very good shape. I decided to give it another try due to the recommendation of a friend of mine who said the visit was totally worth it. So, we decided to take our children and we had a great time. We should totally help this zoo recover the good reputation it had several years ago.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Eloy Cavazos Pablo Livas

126291773.name: Sad..
126291773.author: a TripAdvisor user
126291773.reviewBody: Last time I went, I took a group of first graders, although they seemed to enjoy it, they were disappointed to find out some typical animals were not there. They have few animals, it is old, not the best conditions...

address.streetAddress: Avenida Eloy Cavazos Pablo Livas

124767420.name: Fantastic place for little ones.
124767420.author: a TripAdvisor user
124767420.reviewBody: I went there with my husband and three yrs old son, and all of us had a lovely time. It\'s big enough to spend a day, and not as commercial as places in United States- no visual stimuli, beckoning kids to buy, buy, buy, just the animals and lots of place for little ones to run around. I absolutely loved the place and would recommend it anyone with kids.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Eloy Cavazos Pablo Livas

123138927.name: Where are the animals?
123138927.author: a TripAdvisor user
123138927.reviewBody: We got there at 9am. Either most of the animals were still asleep, or the 10 pesos entrance fee (almost nothing) is not enough to have more animals in this theme park.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Eloy Cavazos Pablo Livas

122297752.name: a sad Zoo
122297752.author: a TripAdvisor user
122297752.reviewBody: sad sad Zoo, even though they take good care of the animals, the place seems completely sad, almost abandoned... visit it so they can get more income and renew it.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Eloy Cavazos Pablo Livas

18341223.name: La Pastora Zoo
18341223.author: a TripAdvisor user
18341223.reviewBody: It is not only a park but also a zoo with lots of animal from all over the world like lions, elephants, hippopotamus, rhinos, tigers, monkeys, etc. it\'s pretty huge and has a snacks and souvenirs area.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Eloy Cavazos Pablo Livas

599882696.name: Has potential
599882696.author: a TripAdvisor user
599882696.reviewBody: 2.5 stars. Parque Ninos Heroes has so much potential but it seems like it needs a little more love and care and to be taken care of a little more and maybe the word should spread more about this place. My wife and I went today and it was very empty and seems like it can improve with a little attention.\n

address.streetAddress: Avenida Alfonso Reyes y Servicio Postal Colonia Regina

508814153.name: Sport Complex!
508814153.author: a TripAdvisor user

address.streetAddress: Avenida Alfonso Reyes y Servicio Postal Colonia Regina

424208760.name: Pleasant park
424208760.author: a TripAdvisor user
424208760.reviewBody: Really cool place for exercising, bike riding and running. Also to bring the family or friends -  very clean and quiet place. Parking on the side of Alfonso Reyes is closing at 5 pm. The Barragan side closes late but charges $10 pesos. If you enter via university, they charge you $8 pesos. Unfortunatley there is usually a lot of traffic if you want to reach the park and also some of the areas are quite dark at the evenings so you need to watch out.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Alfonso Reyes y Servicio Postal Colonia Regina

640396457.name: Getting better.
640396457.author: a TripAdvisor user
640396457.reviewBody: The zoo has added attractions and exhibits. With more dinosaurs, more birds and the lemur experience it is turning into a great place to visit.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora S/N Col Obrera

536282479.name: Nice afternoon with the kids
536282479.author: a TripAdvisor user
536282479.reviewBody: A small zoo with animated dinosaur replicas. Some parts of Loroventura were great and the animals very well cared for and then parts obviously would not pass for a zoo accreditation in most parts of the world.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora S/N Col Obrera

436573498.name: Dinos, birds and lemurs...oh my!
436573498.author: a TripAdvisor user
436573498.reviewBody: We took our three-month old to Loroventura and, while she slept through most of the park, we enjoyed looking at the various species of birds and checking out the mechanical dinosaurs. I felt bad for the small size of enclosure some of the birds were in. The big cages you could walk through were much better (though we didn\'t go in since we have such a young baby). Overall a nice day out for the family.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora S/N Col Obrera

424202114.name: Recommended when around
424202114.author: a TripAdvisor user
424202114.reviewBody: One of the best options to spend your free time in Monterrey, awesome birds and shows as well as animated dinosaurs around the park. It\'s like you\'re in the city but with more accessible prices. Recommended when around

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora S/N Col Obrera

399368438.name: Small nice park.
399368438.author: a TripAdvisor user
399368438.reviewBody: Nice smal park, overall,pretty good. Lots of different birds. A small,part of it is modeled after Jurassic Park which makes it interesting.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora S/N Col Obrera

391191224.name: "An Oasis in the middle of the city"
391191224.author: a TripAdvisor user
391191224.reviewBody: Great park with lots of parrots and macaws, and now with 20 real size dinosaurs around the park.  It\u00b4s a must for kids and grown ups.  It has a big tirolesa and extreme games.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora S/N Col Obrera

259981818.name: Amazing place to visit with kids.
259981818.author: a TripAdvisor user
259981818.reviewBody: This place is very entertaining for kids.  It was a very unexpected surprise to find a place like this in Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora S/N Col Obrera

237026731.name: Nice afternoon!
237026731.author: a TripAdvisor user
237026731.reviewBody: Right in the middle of Parque Fundidora, we were surprised at the amount of beautiful birds, the excellent bird show, and the lovely walking paths. Make sure not to miss this.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora S/N Col Obrera

169722195.name: Fun For Everyone
169722195.author: a TripAdvisor user
169722195.reviewBody: I like that they have a lot of Loros species, and also have a lake inside and you can rent 4 pepole boats to have fun on the lake. They have a Tirolesa for the extreme ones.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Fundidora S/N Col Obrera

642443202.name: World Class Museum
642443202.author: a TripAdvisor user
642443202.reviewBody: Contemporary art museum at world class level with permanent impressive displays right in downtown Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

603474139.name: A delightful place!
603474139.author: a TripAdvisor user
603474139.reviewBody: A must visit in Monterrey, one of the best museums in the whole country. Check if any of the courses interest you! There\'s always something going on in MARCO :)

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

599881254.name: I look forward to going back soon!
599881254.author: a TripAdvisor user
599881254.reviewBody: I really enjoyed the 2 or 3 hours I spent here and that ringing phone is just so creepy!  I do not like the local "artist" and his pictures of the cat, however but everything else is basically flawless.  4.75 stars!\n\n

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

589057831.name: Used to be a trend setter for new Mexican plastic arts. Has lost some of its leadership
589057831.author: a TripAdvisor user
589057831.reviewBody: When it opened, this museum started showing new, excellent Mexican artist. A true trend-setter. Now it\'s lost most of its leadership and settles for proven artists. Still very interesting. The building itself is worth a visit

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

567353272.name: Beautiful museum
567353272.author: a TripAdvisor user
567353272.reviewBody: The building itself was really beautiful and we\'ll kept. The photography exhibit there was absolutely stunning. I really enjoyed it. A great way to spend a few hours in the center of the city. Air conditioning was welcomed in the midday heat.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

551310398.name: Must see museum
551310398.author: a TripAdvisor user
551310398.reviewBody: For art lovers, young and not so young, this is an amazing place where you will experience an art collection second to none in Northern Mexico

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

547665283.name: Worth a visit
547665283.author: a TripAdvisor user
547665283.reviewBody: Located next to Monterrey\'s Cathedral, the Macro is a must see while visiting. I really enjoyed the current Tamayo exhibit, and had never seen so many of his paintings in one place. Free on Wednesdays.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

539562299.name: Modern art museum in Monterrey
539562299.author: a TripAdvisor user
539562299.reviewBody: It\u00b4s sad to see such a beatiful architectural building with very boring and lame exhibition in the all year round, the only very interesting we saw was the temporary exhibition of Pixar and the building

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

518443322.name: One of the best contemporary museums in the hemisphere.
518443322.author: a TripAdvisor user
518443322.reviewBody: Featuring three traveling exhibit halls, this museum brings world-class traveling exhibits to Monterrey. Exhibits are amazing and wide-ranging. The constantly rotating exhibits are always excellent. We have seen exhibits featuring every media and are well presented often in Spanish and English.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

508982955.name: Architecture is nice
508982955.author: a TripAdvisor user
508982955.reviewBody: It\'s a good place to spend couple of hours . The architecture built very nice.\nThe statues are sculpted with best design.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

500066005.name: GREAT museum with excellent curation
500066005.author: a TripAdvisor user
500066005.reviewBody: A MUST-DO for those in Monterrey. On Wednesdays the museum is free (and busier), but definitely still enjoyable. Two of the three exhibits we saw (all not permanent) were great! A South Korean artist using black light and wire installations was interactive and exciting. The DreamWorks Animation exhibit was a tour de force for nostalgia. We expected to be there 1 hour but were there for 2+ hours.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

490490207.name: Great architecture and art
490490207.author: a TripAdvisor user
490490207.reviewBody: I spent a couple of hours at MARCO today and was impressed first by the architecture by Ricardo Legorreta, who was able to have light bounce around the open spaces in the most interesting ways, and the exhibitions which included the amazing works by Vik Muniz who among other things sketch one image on a grain of sand. Keep an eye out on the reflection pool at the centre of the gallery as is comes to life every 20 minutes or so and marvel over whether the big yellow shaft hanging over the heads of the information booth in the foyer will continue to hang on to the ceiling.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

476108814.name: Impressive insight to  DreamWorks\' creative process
476108814.author: a TripAdvisor user
476108814.reviewBody: My family and I really enjoyed seeing the depth and breadth of work that goes into the makings of many of my the modern blockbusters we\'ve enjoyed over the years - Shreck, How to train your dragon, Kung fu panda, etc. Truely worth while and very well set up!

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

468167935.name: Extraordinary museum
468167935.author: a TripAdvisor user
468167935.reviewBody: A beautiful contemporary building houses a large exhibition space which had two special exhibits when I was there in March 2017. Signs were in English and Spanish, it was all very well done and well presented.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

453703349.name: Excellent museum
453703349.author: a TripAdvisor user
453703349.reviewBody: If visiting Monterrey, you have to go to MARCO. Ir is in the heart of old Town (barrio antiguo) Ana next to the Cathedral.\nMy wife and I went to see their newest exhibition called "Lightopia" which is about  lighting and is applications through history.\nAfter our visit we strolled around and ended up in an awesome set of restaurants called Me muero de hambre which, as I was told, means i am starving to death. We enjoyed our day.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

446639001.name: World Class museum
446639001.author: a TripAdvisor user
446639001.reviewBody: It is always suggested to keep an eye on the exhibitions being displayed as well as the up coming ones. Its program is always changing and renewing.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

440753034.name: Worth a Visit!
440753034.author: a TripAdvisor user
440753034.reviewBody: Generally I\'m not a huge museum person. I prefer to be out and about in the city rather than inside isolated away. That is just my personality type (no judgement for those who love museums). We had achieved everything we wanted to do that day so we stopped in. I wasn\'t expecting to love it to be honest. I enjoy art but not a huge fan of the art that is just a chair in the middle of the room with nothing else. Or a bunch of yarn wadded up in a pile with nothing around it. I don\'t really get it. So I wasn\'t expecting to spend much time here. Well, I had a blast. Yes, there was the art that I described above but there was also some other amazing and fun things to look at. They had this awesome light exhibit going on that shows these beautiful lamps and moderns ways to use light. I can\'t explain it very well. Just know it was awesome. There was this awesome human sculpture artist who did life size human bodies. The attention to detail was unfathomable. These fake people were real. So needless to say- just stop in. It isn\'t very big so it won\'t take up much of your time. If I enjoyed it - you probably will too.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

439158699.name: Great in the country
439158699.author: a TripAdvisor user
439158699.reviewBody: The place itself feels quite old but what\'s inside is invaluable. Even more when all the exhibits are temporary which means that you can go and go again and always will find something new and amazing. \n\nThere are few museums like this in the country, we should visit and spread the good news about them to keep them running in perfect shape.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

434171999.name: Great exhibit
434171999.author: a TripAdvisor user
434171999.reviewBody:
For the most part, this was a good museum space. 
The architecture is modern and the location is central. On Wednesdays, admission is free.

We were lucky enough to visit during a Tomás Saraceno exhibit. Amazing!

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

432541895.name: Always interesting
432541895.author: a TripAdvisor user
432541895.reviewBody: This is a great museo.  The staff changes the exhibits every few months.  The museo is a beautiful space.  It always is interesting, and they are so happy to have foreign visitors. .

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

423701859.name: Wednesday free admission
423701859.author: a TripAdvisor user
423701859.reviewBody: Exhibitions are really interesting and the space is very modern. Major artists but not global giants. It is the best museum in Monterrey so far in my honest opinion. It has gift shop and souvenirs, and a good restaurant with buffet service. Wednesdays is free admission.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

415944593.name: A taste of high culture
415944593.author: a TripAdvisor user
415944593.reviewBody: This museum offers a wide variety of art forms that can take the participants to new levels of cultural experience. One can view works of contemporary artists who are becoming well known internationally, with audio guides to orient the viewer to the intentions of the artist. There is a very adequate restaurant for those who want to take their time to absorb all there is to see. \nThe modern architecture, open spaces and indirect lighting have been planned for a most enriching experience.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

401433570.name: In touch with the art
401433570.author: a TripAdvisor user
401433570.reviewBody: It is the Museum more important contemporary art in the North of Mexico, which is an important place to spend time surrounded by art. No matter if you are coming as a tourist or if you live in this city, constantly changing displays and all of them are good.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

391383015.name: "MARCO, great exhibitions"
391383015.author: a TripAdvisor user
391383015.reviewBody: MARCO, it\u00b4s a very nice museum by itself.  Design by Agust\u00edn Legorreta who was one of the most renown architects of Mexico.  They have many interesting exhibitions year round.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

378072577.name: Contemporary Art Museum
378072577.author: a TripAdvisor user
378072577.reviewBody: This Museum is free only on Wednesdays however considering I will not be in Monterrey on Wednesday it was disappointing that I could not tour the museum since i was visiting. I managed to see the main foyer of the gallery.\nThis museum is in the Downtown district of Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

358503019.name: Amazing modern architectural building
358503019.author: a TripAdvisor user
358503019.reviewBody: Located along the Microplaza, a great place to escape crowds and heat. Very strange and bizarre exhibition in the upstairs galleries when we we there March 2016. Gift shop and lunch facilities, beautiful restrooms. Very civilized, urbane, upscale, sophisticated kind of place.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

342964970.name: More than just a museum
342964970.author: a TripAdvisor user
342964970.reviewBody: It offers excellent contemporary exhibitions in a great environment, if fits your schedule you wont be disappointed to stop by, they also have different types of art classes you might be able to try.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

339293075.name: Big outside but small inside
339293075.author: a TripAdvisor user
339293075.reviewBody: We were impressed with an art exposition from Cuba. Also, there was a temporary exposition of Fashion photography from Vogue  The outdoor sculpture garden has a great view of the mountains, and 5 or 6 own pieces. they have a nice looking restaurant, but it was closed before 1 pm when we visited te museum.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

335529227.name: MARCA musuem of contemporary art
335529227.author: a TripAdvisor user
335529227.reviewBody: We visited MARCA on a holiday vacation to Monterrey. We spent about 2 hours and saw everything. The perspectives exhibit was interactive and interesting, and the major water installation was a hit with all three of us. While we are not art experts, we saw a variety of types of art, enjoy and interacted with them all. Prices in the shop, which had nice stuff, was significantly higher than in the stores nearby downtown.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

331722390.name: Interesting place to visit in the middle of the city
331722390.author: a TripAdvisor user
331722390.reviewBody: We have visited the MARCO several times when in downtown Monterrey. There are usually interesting exhibits and it is a nice way to spend a few hours. I especially enjoy when they have live music playing around the indoor reflecting pool. \nDon\'t miss the gift shop. It is full of fascinating trinkets at affordable prices.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

314074263.name: Good temporary expositions
314074263.author: a TripAdvisor user
314074263.reviewBody: It has very good temporary expositions, but sometimes they are very dull, you have to check in their website in advance to see if it is something you\'d like. It is free on Wednesdays

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

309915123.name: Fantastic Museum
309915123.author: a TripAdvisor user
309915123.reviewBody: Well curated museum. Really likes the permanent and the traveling exhibit. Good gift shop with lots of variety. This was best attraction in Monterrey.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

298783369.name: The Best Art Museum in Monterrey
298783369.author: a TripAdvisor user
298783369.reviewBody: MARCO is by far the best museum in the city. The building is nice, and the collection is worth a visit. They also host different temporary exhibitions that are very good. They have a good restaurant in the premises and are close to other downtown attractions.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

298461149.name: best museum in the city
298461149.author: a TripAdvisor user
298461149.reviewBody: The best museum in monterrey, has great exhibitions of contemporary art, nice restaurant, and art shop. free parking. on wednsdays is free admission.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

295296799.name: ART LOVERS!
295296799.author: a TripAdvisor user
295296799.reviewBody: If you like art this is it!, the best museum here in Monterrey to explore art, it has some really nice displays, different ones according to the season. You can not miss this one, is really close to the main hotels in down town!

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

294431745.name: Wonderful building worth seeing for it\'s own sake.
294431745.author: a TripAdvisor user
294431745.reviewBody: The building is the main attraction at this museum.  The permanent collection is small and the temporary exhibitions are really good but infrequently changed.  Nice shop and good cafe too.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

292792399.name: Stanley Kubrick exhibition
292792399.author: a TripAdvisor user
292792399.reviewBody: My wife and I HAD to see the Kubrick exhibition while it was in Monterrey and we weren\'t disappointed.  We\'re both Kubrick fans and loved the documents and notes from his films.  His early photographs were great too.  No complaints here!

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

289385028.name: Above Average Museum - Worth Checking Out
289385028.author: a TripAdvisor user
289385028.reviewBody: Small museum with only three exhibit spaces but they were well utilized. The highlight on my visit wa she Stanley Kubrick exhibit which included photographs, film footage, set design, and costumes from all his movies. The permanent collection is small but interesting. One of the better museums of its kind in Mexcio.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

288352937.name: saw a special exhibit dedicated to Stanley Kubrick
288352937.author: a TripAdvisor user
288352937.reviewBody: Nice art museum, small you only need two hours or so. but the presentation of the art pieces were well done.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

283150234.name: Great exhibition
283150234.author: a TripAdvisor user
283150234.reviewBody: For only 80 pesos I got to see three exhibitions, including the Kubrick one. The layout was good, honestly I didn\'t expect to see a nice contemporary art museum in Monterrey but this one was beyond my expectation

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

279534266.name: One of the best art museums
279534266.author: a TripAdvisor user
279534266.reviewBody: If you like art this is the best chance to go and enjoy of contemporary art in a space designed by Ricardo Legorreta, that is the best representation of mexican style with modern lines.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

274331082.name: Place to visit
274331082.author: a TripAdvisor user
274331082.reviewBody: Our hotel was near by and we walked to the museum. Very safe  btw 9am to 5pm. Found very historical pieces. Not much to say about it.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

273360668.name: Cultural experience
273360668.author: a TripAdvisor user
273360668.reviewBody: Located on the heart of the city, this museum is one fo the best of the region, and it houses quite an array of different exhibitions, the museum itself is a beautiful contemporary building, where weddings and events can also be held. the restaurant is quite good too. highly reccomend it! a fave amongst locals!

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

270644287.name: Nice temporary exhibits
270644287.author: a TripAdvisor user
270644287.reviewBody: When I went I got to see the Stank Kubrik exposition, it was very interesting but I know its not for everyone, either way it was a nice thing to do in the city.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

268534777.name: Favorite museum
268534777.author: a TripAdvisor user
268534777.reviewBody: This is my favorite museum since it opened. It always has great exhibits and pieces of art, all well arranged in the building.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

259982293.name: Very nice place.
259982293.author: a TripAdvisor user
259982293.reviewBody: This is another place that is highly recommended to visit in Monterrey.  Usually they have temporary showings that are very unique and cool, but the permanent collection is also very good.  And the place by itself is worth visiting.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

259872898.name: World-class museum
259872898.author: a TripAdvisor user
259872898.reviewBody: This Museum is housed in a breath-taking building by a renowned Mexican architect. Over the years it has gotten better and better, with spot-on curating and interesting exhibitions year-round. The last one I saw, an assortment of props, pictures, scripts, costumes, etc. by Stanley Kubrick was OUTSTANDING. Definitely a top favorite spot for culture.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

259316634.name: Surprisingly good
259316634.author: a TripAdvisor user
259316634.reviewBody: The location is great for seeing a view of the mountains and seeing some of the older buildings, but the museum itself is cool.\n\nThey really have some nice art.  Ordinarily, contemporary art is not my thing, but I enjoyed it and would visit again.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

257911841.name: If you love contemporary art...
257911841.author: a TripAdvisor user
257911841.reviewBody: This museum opened its doors in 1991 and with help of private benefactors brings contemporary art collections to this city. The architecture of the building is very mexican and modern.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

241339766.name: A bright spot in Monterrey
241339766.author: a TripAdvisor user
241339766.reviewBody:
If you've been to Monterrey, you'll already know that it's a dull, unattractive city, devoid of much of what makes a place livable (but with surprisingly good food.)

One bright spot is the Museo de Arte Contemporaneo, if only because the rest of the place is so ugly and boring. The architecture is nice, the interior is clean and welcoming. There's a gift shop worth a visit. Some nice areas to sit and reflect. 

My partner and I were there when much of the place was empty. There was a photography exhibit that wasn't my cup of tea, then some other exhibit I can't really describe. I took a picture of a small installation against a blue wall, but it turns out it was just some odd paint cans. Still pretty cool.

There's a big bronze bird outside.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

237918572.name: Beautiful architecture
237918572.author: a TripAdvisor user
237918572.reviewBody: The Museum of Contemporary Art is very very pretty. You will like this contemporary Mexican Architecture. It is a lively and allways active museum. It has different temporary exhibitions, changing constantly. We are glad to have a museum in the city that brings us this paintings, sculptures and photographs. I really recommend it. It has a big parcking lot, a nice shop and a good cafeteria.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

236634706.name: Nice!
236634706.author: a TripAdvisor user
236634706.reviewBody: This air conditioned museum has a wonderful variety of exhibitions, free music on Wednesdays, and is very affordable. It\'s centrally located and easy to get to using public transportation.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

227012812.name: Marco
227012812.author: a TripAdvisor user
227012812.reviewBody: Love it! Modern and unique. The architecture its amazing and flexible to display art properly and not in a crowded way. One of my favourite museums to visit over and over as the expositions keep changing. you have to keep and open mind, because yes, sometimes its a big weird contemporary art, but mostly its just awesome. If you need to go eat near and have no car, they offer a buffet (except Monday and Saturday) that its expensive, but its cool for something different and elegant. And Wednesday its free!

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

221465057.name: Worth a visit
221465057.author: a TripAdvisor user
221465057.reviewBody: MARCO\'s building is beautiful, and the colors you see when you walk in are striking. The collection and exhibits leave something to be desired .. but I recognize that I\'m not a fan of modern art. Still, it\'s worth a visit, not too expensive, air conditioned, a good way to surround yourself with art for an hour.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

219662571.name: Best museum in town
219662571.author: a TripAdvisor user
219662571.reviewBody: If you want to see contemporary art, this is the place. In the heart of the city MARCO offers you the best place. It has a nice coffee and gift shop, where you can find Mexican Art books and gifts. Do not miss it.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

206792883.name: Spectacular temporary exhibits
206792883.author: a TripAdvisor user
206792883.reviewBody: We were fortunate to visit the museum during two spectacular temporary exhibits.  The building is very well designed and accessible.  I will certainly return anytime I am in Monterrey.  The museum is free on Wednesdays.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

201340088.name: Nice Contemporary Art Museum
201340088.author: a TripAdvisor user
201340088.reviewBody: MARCO whics stands for contemporary art museum, is a nice modern place in the center of Monterrey. The exhibitions change every few months and you will have to take a look at their website to see if the current one is to your liking. It even has an excelent restaurant to complete your visit. \n\nThere are other museaums nearby (walking distance)  from there as well as ohtr place to visit and eat. If you are in the area don\'t miss Paseo Santa Luc\u00eda.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

201325530.name: Best art museum in northern Mexico
201325530.author: a TripAdvisor user
201325530.reviewBody: Sponsored by the private sector and run by a very knowledgable Board they bring the best expositions and international artists to Monterrey

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

194679512.name: A museum not to miss in Monterrey
194679512.author: a TripAdvisor user
194679512.reviewBody: This is simply the best art museum in Monterrey, and probably in Northern Mexico. It has an excellent permanent collection and will always have good temporary exhibits. If you happen to be in Monterrey and like art, MARCO is not to be missed.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

188168411.name: A "must-see" in town
188168411.author: a TripAdvisor user
188168411.reviewBody: For a really low fee, they give a great collection of all types of art... it is really worth it. make sure to wear comfortable shoes!!

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

169802761.name: World class museum
169802761.author: a TripAdvisor user
169802761.reviewBody: The Contemporary Art Museum ( MARCO) is an excellent option if you are visiting Monterrey. You may want to get there by registered taxi cabs or driven by locals, friends or family. The building itself as well as the exhibitions are world class. Tip: wednesdays are free.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

169490483.name: excellent exhibitions
169490483.author: a TripAdvisor user
169490483.reviewBody: well-presented exhibitions of modern art, sculpture and video presentations in a spacious and stylish building with explanations in Spanish and English. Current exhibitions vary but the ones we saw were excellent and worth 2 to 3 hours viewing, depending how long you want to spend in the various film shows. Free admission on Wednesdays so excellent value. Central location and easy to get to. If you only have time for one museum in Monterrey, go for this one!

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

151854090.name: Great gallery
151854090.author: a TripAdvisor user
151854090.reviewBody: Really enjoyed the gallery and exhibition...may have something to do with the fact it was all art to do with football (soccer). Can easily spend a few hours in there. Cheap enough. Definitely recommend.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

143145310.name: Interesting art.
143145310.author: a TripAdvisor user
143145310.reviewBody: There was a great exposition when I went. I really don\'t know what you are gonna get when you go, but it\'s definitely worth going!

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

135467687.name: Interesting museum
135467687.author: a TripAdvisor user
135467687.reviewBody: One of the most representative places in the city. Nice exhibitions and reasonable prices. They offer food in the restaurant, as well.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

134910947.name: First place to visit in Monterrey.
134910947.author: a TripAdvisor user
134910947.reviewBody:
The building itself is an interesting place worth visiting. A sample of northeastern architecture interpreted by the genius of architect Legorreta.

At the center a square with a fountain of water on a white floor, spacious, geometric figures typically framed by Mexican colors.

With several exhibition rooms, with different samples steadily, almost all of high quality.

The perfect place to appreciate contemporary art.

24256888.name: My fav. museum in Mty
24256888.author: a TripAdvisor user
24256888.reviewBody:
This museum is def. a must see for everyone who visits Mty. 

The beautiful architecture by Mexican artist Ricardo Legoreta and the 1 ton pigeon "La Paloma" from Juan Soriano are the firsts things you see in the Macroplaza. 

This museum has a top quality (if a bit pricey) buffet, who's menu changes everyday (the desserts are the best!). The museum also has an AWESOME store, which sells catalogues from the exhibitions, jewelry and artwork from local artists, books, and a whole bunch of interesting knicknacks. To access the store and the restaurant you don't have to pay an entrance fee. Wed. are free, so if you're on a budget you can still see the wonderful works of art. 

The exhibitions change every 4 months are so, so for people who visit Mty often, there is always something new to see. Check out MARCO's webpage, since they usually have jazz concerts, theater, or other activities (sometimes free) during the month. 

Sundays are family days, so anyone with a family can go and the kids will enjoy an activity at the end of the tour offered by the volunteers at the museum (the tour and the activities are included in the ticket price). 

IMPORTANT: Anyone can ask for a guided tour of the Museum. The Museum offers free personal tours in both English and Spanish. Call ahead and ask for one... or go that same that and see if anyone is available to give it to you (I would recommend calling first to make sure). After the tour, be sure to ask the person sitting in the Information Desl (the marble square in the middle of the main hall) what else to do or where to eat in Monterrey. 90% of the time there's someone that speaks English, and even if they don't speak your language they try their best to help you. Be sure to ask about any maps, activity calendars, or other things the Tourist Board leaves for them to give out.

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

16411916.name: Beautiful building and great exhibits
16411916.author: a TripAdvisor user
16411916.reviewBody: The building in which the museum is housed is a beautiful example of contemporary architecture.  The fountain on the bottom floor is a   great work or art and great place to sit and rest for a while.  Very tranquil.  There was an excellent exhibit on 20th Century female Mexican artists while we were there.  Very enjoyable.  We went on a Wednesday which is FREE!

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

1702342.name: Cool
1702342.author: a TripAdvisor user
1702342.reviewBody:
I recently visited the Marco and found it excellent both in terms of material and presentation. I was fortunate to see the Josef Koudelka (the Czech Photographer) exhibition and found it stunning. The retrospective exhibition was extensive and it seemed no space was wasted. Also clever was the juxtaposition of a video piece with the photos.

Also see and appreciate the 'water feature' on the ground floor.

This was my second visit and I was very pleased to see that almost all exhibits now have an English translation next to the Spanish comment. 
An improvement that in time could be made would be a comment on the actual piece of art as well as the history of the artist.

Overall though a must-see for any visitor to Monterrey

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

415088.name: Bravo MARCO!
415088.author: a TripAdvisor user
415088.reviewBody:
If you only have time to visit one museum in Monterrey, make it the MARCO!

This is a spacious, cavernous modern building located at the end of the Macroplaza next to the Cathedral. The museum showcases international contemporary art, with a decided emphasis on latin american artists (and not just Mexicans).

I'm not always a huge fan of modern art which usually strikes me as passionless, antiseptic, and talentless. MARCO certainly has its share of exhibits that fit that stereotype, but they also have a lot of truly excellent exhibitions, like their recent perspective on the great Mexican artists of the 20th century. Even though many of the works were lesser-known works of masters like Diego Rivera and David Siguieros, they were still works of amazing depth and experience -- pieces that reflect insight and passion. I overheard one patron saying that to understand the works of people like Jose Clemente Orozco you must travel to Guadalajara and see the real master-works. There is validity to that viewpoint, but the works that MARCO displayed were still outstanding representations of the artist's tremendous talent, and I was mighty glad to have had an opportunity to see so many wonderful works of the great masters in one exhibition hall.

Thank you MARCO! Your exhibition of Mexican Masters of the 20th Century was MAGNIFICENT!

address.streetAddress: Zuazua y Ocampo Zona Centro

344351.name: what i think about the MARCO museum
344351.author: a TripAdvisor user
344351.reviewBody: I am a mexican living in Monterrey, N.L. and I love that museum. When I first went to see it and saw how great it was, I couldn\'t help being proud of being a "regia". Today, the marco museum is the best museum in Latin America. It is a very lovely place with breathtaking architecture. It has beautiful art and one gets out of the place with a happy feeling and feeling a thousand times more cult than before. It is the best museum I\'ve ever been to and I love the place so much. When I visited it for the first time, there was an art exhibition of Juan Soriano (he is the one that made the pigeon in the entrance) and I learned to love art and to appreciate it. Really, it\'s worth visiting. It has a lot of programs for poor children and poor women in Monterrey and I think that\'s a very wonderful thing because Mexico needs more things like that. I think that the MARCO museum certainly is the best one in Latin America.\n
